All this time, she and the Association had thought of Leon as a barbarian king from the Middle Ages, with the power of faith thrown in for good measure.
But if he’s telling the truth, Leon is more than just a ruler. Nor was he a hardened knight or general.
He is the last bastion of the Lionheart Kingdom. And when he stepped forward, it meant that the final weapon would be deployed.
“Do you understand? The very fact that the Lionheart King himself has to step forward is a disgrace to the knights and means that the situation is serious.”
As he spoke, he gave a rare sigh.
“It looks like this king will have to do the heavy lifting once again on your pathetic, weak behalf. I miss the glory of this king’s Knights.”
It was an eerie foreshadowing as if something big was about to happen and he would have to step in.
“But we have an S-class Hunter here, the Golden Lion Guild, and a Wizard from the Magic Tower.”
There was only one opponent and even if I was a killing machine with a terrible record, they should be able to handle the raid with an S-rank hunter and a mage…
“I’ll admit that hunters are a bit more powerful than normal humans.”
Leon snorted, sneering at the superhumans of modern Earth.
“But they don’t know about war. The outskirts have been safe so far, I’m sure, having only fought three battles.”
“What? What’s that…….?”
“You call yourselves raiders. You’re supposed to recognize patterns in monsters and counter them. How ridiculous.”
Ha-ri felt uneasy at Leon’s words.
“The long-lived learn to adapt to circumstances. There’s no pattern to it, and I think that Yakt Spinner is a born warrior.”
And then, as if on cue, the proof begins.
-Kaaaaaahhhh!
-What, what, this!
-It’s the enemy! He’s attacking──!
Screams echoed eerily in the sandstorm as Yakt Spinner attacked the camp.

chapters.title: Chapter 20: Hunting the Spider (3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 20: Hunting the Spider (3)
The sandstorm that blew in from the outskirts of the city did more than just block the view.
The gusts of wind pounded the ground, shook the buildings, and drowned out most sound.
It was a perfect opportunity to ambush the invaders and Yakt Spinner made its way to the outskirts.
[Yappy. I’m done here.]
The Last Order, from the highest commanders was to kill all the unknowns that have invaded the city.
With no resupply, no repairs can be expected and support being non-existent the only way to win is with maximum efficiency and minimum damage.
The Yakt Spinner approached the Hunters’ camp slowly and cautiously, using the sandstorm as camouflage.
The Hunters were alert with their keen senses, but they were unable to overcome their limitations, and the Yakt Spinner had city-level backup.
Despite their inexperience, the Yakt Spinner analyzes the camp thoroughly and finds that there are no guards against machines.
It begins mapping in real time, with long-range scans and every single enemy number then it blithely sidesteps the flimsy perimeter and lets the sandy breeze wash over it, blending into the darkness and noise of the storm.
“Ugh….I can’t even see this.”
A puppet has wandered away from the camp and is alone in a remote area so the Yakt Spinner immediately runs the figure’s measurements.
The latest invaders were lightly built, but wore metal armor. Even more bizarrely, they come armed with bladed weapons, not guns or artillery.
They were only categorized as a level one threat but there was the potential to bring in allies.
When dealing with large groups, Yakt Spinner found it safer and less risky to attack them individually.
“Whoosh!”
Hunter, who was watching the perimeter through the windshield of the building’s outer wall, hadn’t noticed Yakt Spinner presence.
It moved its huge body made of steel in a creepily silent manner when──
“Dude, why are you peeing in there?”
“Huh, Jackson.”
Its crab-like body leaned back down.
The approaching Hunter, the entity called Jackson rubbed shoulders with him, pretending to be overly friendly.
“What, what, what’s going on?”
He was a member of the same Black Mamba mercenary organization, but not one to make such over-the-top gestures. Flustered, he says something, and Jackson shushes him.
“Shut up. Shut up. We need to get out of here quietly, unless you want to die…….”
He alerted his coworker about the threat in a voice barely audible in the sandstorm.
Having been warned by his companion, he took a step forward without even looking at his surroundings, but──
[I…have…to…dig…out…of…the…dragon.]
-Apply a noise filter to the speech file. Sentence reinterpretation complete. Play──
The voice buried in the sand was filtered out by the noise filter and analyzed into a clear voice file.
“They’re coming. Be quiet. We need to get out of here quietly, or we’ll be found…….”
-Pack!
The sound of a secondary joint moving and a whip cracking was lost in the sand.
* * * *
It wasn’t until the twelfth victim appeared that the Hunters realized that Yakt Spinner was attacking.
It was a grisly ambush on the outskirts of the camp, and the last of the Hunters to be cut down by the silent wire cutters was the one who didn’t die instantly.
“Off!!!”
-Kaaaaaah!
The Hunter who had his lower half cut off by the wire cutters swung an energized sword, but his struggle was meaningless as a large shadow fell over him.
“Oh, no.”
A pair of armored legs weighing over five tons each crushed the Hunter of the Black Mamba Mercenaries.
-Kwazik!
The Hunters, sensing the commotion, rushed forward to find their fellow Hunter disemboweled and Yakt Spinner glowing with an eerie light.
The joints, stuck together with chewy bits of meat, creak and squeak as if they haven’t been replaced and maintained in years and the sound sends chills down the spines of the hunters, as if it were the wailing of a victim’s soul stuck in a piece of meat.
“Yakt Spinner!”
The voice, muffled by the sandstorm, barely reached his kin but the Yakt Spinner attacked.
-Bang! Boom!
After a murderous barrage of 60 mm machine gun fire the heavily armored Hunters had their entire bodies bounced off, but the lightly armored Hunters were torn limb from limb.
The excessive violence takes its toll on the Hunters.
Even as the sandstorm’s dirt pounded the concrete, the sound of a shell’s impact imprinted itself in their minds as an eerie meat grinder.
“Cover! Cover!”
The words are barely audible, but none of these men are fools enough to stand idly by on the wide open plain and they hurriedly duck into the buildings to escape the machine gun fire that pierced the sandy wind.
The Yakt Spinner wide-angle lens calculated the Hunters’ paths and where the most Hunters were hiding, which buildings were deteriorating, how many rebars were holding up the concrete……and which ones would do the most damage if knocked down.
The Yakt Spinner railgun fired a round, generating an electromagnetic force for supersonic acceleration.
-Bam!
The projectiles from the 240mm railgun reached Mach 3 in an instant and a sonic boom blasts through the building.
-Bam!
Through five columns, to be exact, the building began to crumble as Yakt Spinner exquisitely destroyed the vulnerability of the building the Hunters were hiding in.
“Holy shit…!”
Their last words were buried with the crumbling concrete.
As Hunters with superhuman physical abilities, they wouldn’t be killed by being crushed by the building, but it was enough to incapacitate a dozen of them in an instant.
“What the fuck, what kind of monster…!”
They couldn’t leave the building because if they did, they’d immediately fall victim to machine gun fire.
Yakt Spinner had gotten over its fears and prepared to fire a second round at the huddled Hunters.
The powered-up railgun was about to bring another building down to pinpoint when-──
“Fuck you.”
Something slammed into Yakt Spinner with the sound of a shell being fired.
-Bam!
With a dizzying impact sound, Yakt Spinner joints collapsed.
For the first time since the attack, Yakt Spinner wide-angle lens finds its attacker: a gleaming golden iron clad figure wielding a massive hammer.
-Gee!
-Cooka-cooka-cooka-cooka-cooka!
A barrage of machine gun fire was shot but Golden Chul raises his shield to block as the sixty millimeter rounds pound into him without mercy.
-Kirik?
But Golden Chul shield was solid and it didn’t even crack under the baptism of fire.
“It’s a legendary shield! Do you think it’s going to be pierced by shells? Geum-soon!”
“I told you not to call me Geum-soon!”
Hwang Yeon-ha’s weapon is her fist and a unique grade armor that stretches out like a ferocious lion’s mane.
Like a rocket boost, it absorbed magic power and generated a thrust.
-Boom!
The fist, sparkling with golden magic, slammed into Yakt Spinner joints and its legs buckled under the impact, momentarily stumbling.
At that moment, a magic circle unfolded in the sky.
“Good job tying him up.”
Combat Mage Gil Tae-sung threw a thunderbolt at Yakt Spinner whose legs are bound by the Hwang siblings.
-Kwalung!
The thunderbolt flashes across the carapace’s armor, sending a tremendous charge through it.
The blow would be fatal to a machine so Yakt Spinner completes its self-diagnosis in 0.8 seconds and makes a decision.
[Emergency purge of overloaded wires. Radar system down.]
With the systems he’d relied on for navigation down, Yakt Spinner was forced to rely on his wide-angle lens to locate his enemies and that’s not good when you’re surrounded.
[Limited resources authorized. Activating RWR equipment in the city. Substitute target.]
In a city with crumbling infrastructure, it activates the electronics it’s been building for years.
Observation equipment hidden throughout the city mobilizes and becomes the eyes of Yakt Spinner.
[Threat level 3, prioritized for elimination.]
“Ugh, look at this guy!”
“He’s running! Chase him!”
Shaken by the brothers’ attacks, Yakt Spinner climbed the surrounding buildings to escape their pursuit.
The dashing, multi-purpose machine darted from building to building, aiming its 60mm cannon at specific targets.
Machine gun fire rained down on mage Gil Tae-sung but he was heavily protected by the Black Mamba mercenary hunters.
“Huh.”
Tae-sung shattered a bead-like tool against the hail of machine gun fire, and a transparent membrane unfolded.
-Koo-koo-koo-koo!
The hail of machine gun rounds distorted into impossible trajectories and landed in the wrong place.
“What, what…….?”
As the Black Mamba mercenaries escorting him stared at the station commander in disbelief, Gil Tae-sung smirked.
“It’s a magic tool engraved with a distorted force field enchantment developed to target Yakt Spinner. It’s absolutely impenetrable by firearms.”
The power of firearms comes from their rate of fire and accuracy. No matter how many dozens or hundreds of rounds are fired, they are useless if the point of impact is distorted.
It’s a disposable and expensive tool, but he was up against Yakt Spinner with a difficulty level of Red so he must be prepared for this──
[Hazard anomaly observed. Initiate maintenance operation.]
However, the opponent is an AI killing machine that has already faced three raids, and even observations outside the laws of physics are subject to calculation for it.
[Analysis complete. Strike points D15, S37, and F11.]
-Thump! Thump! Thud!
Darting from building to building, evading the Hunters’ pursuit, the short bursts of machine gun fire hit the distorted force field.
It lands in a completely wrong spot, a far cry from the usual ghostly impact point but the distorted shell bends with a snap and strikes the Black Mamba mercenary hunters in the temporal region.
“Kuck?!”
“What the hell!”
The trajectory of the bullet was completely unexpected but the distorted force field bent it into an improbable trajectory and hit the Hunters.
“No way!”
He analyzed it in such a short time? Is that even possible?
“Mage Gil Tae-sung, turn off the distortion force field, we can’t defend!”
Artillery fire poured in one after another. Not a conventional firefight, but sniping with precision shots, calculated by a city maintenance supercomputer that no human could ever hope to keep up with.
“Damn it! What are you all doing? Deal with him!”
Gil Tae-sung shouted urgently, and the Huang siblings and the Golden Lion Guild immediately tried to eliminate Yakt Spinner. But at that moment, Golden Chul saw something and shouted urgently.
“Stop!”
“……?”
Huang Yeon-ha and the rest of the Golden Lion Hunters stopped in their tracks at Golden Chul’s urgent words, and they realized why he said that.
‘Wire?’
‘He didn’t just run away.’
‘When did he do all of this?’
Yakt Spinner had left wires everywhere as he weaved in and out of buildings to escape the Huangs’ pursuit. It was as if the entire area was surrounded by a giant spider’s web.
For a few seconds, the Hunters were immobilized and Yakt Spinner railgun pointed at Gil Tae-Sung.
“Ah, no…!”
Just as the railgun bullets begin their supersonic velocity…Yakt Spinner rear view camera catches a strange object.
-Dag-dag-dag-dag!
“Huh?”
Everyone’s faces twist as four pure white legs stretched out.
The soft mane flutters like cotton candy as they follow the downy white fur. But the muscles packed throughout its body gave the creature an intensity that made it impossible to ignore. It was──
“……Horse?”
“”Horse?””
As everyone watches in awe, a stalwart Stallion emerges, his sturdy frame and magnificently decorated shining armor.
“Long time no see, old friend.”
Leon throws his arms around the neck of the fierce Stallion, and the ancient god willingly carries his ally on his back.
Stroking its glowing mane, Leon pointed his holy spear at Yakt Spinner and called out.
“Listen, warrior!”
It’s a ridiculous sight on the modern battlefield, but the thick, sour aura emanating from the spear and the horse makes the crowd’s jaws drop.
They cannot deny it with reason, but understand with instinct that this was something else.
“The bravery of charging forward single-handedly against a multitude of enemies is praised by the Lionheart King!”
He first praised the outstanding warrior.
“I grant you the honor of dueling with this Lionheart King. I grant you permission to challenge me, warrior!”
He gave him the right to apply for the duel.
Seeing this generous and merciful gesture from the Lionheart King, Huang Yeon-ha inadvertently spat out her true feelings.
“…………Is he an idiot?”
At this moment, no one could deny that they were all thinking that.

chapters.title: Chapter 21: Hunting the Spider (4)
chapters.content:
Chapter 21: Hunting the Spider (4)
“The bravery of charging forward single-handedly against a multitude of enemies is praised by the Lionheart King!”
“I grant you the honor of dueling with this Lionheart King. I grant you permission to challenge me, warrior!”
There is no need to interpret the meaning of the words and Yakt Spinner aimed his railgun at the horseman, who waited with stupid honesty.
The projectile aimed at Gil Tae-sung pulsed with super-electron velocity.
[Railgun acceleration timing set. Output 13%.]
It had no choice but to conserve the limited energy in its reserve cap and shoot as much as possible but it was enough for a human-sized opponent.
There is no ‘creature’ that can survive being shot in the face by this doomsday blaster. If there is, it’s either an otherworldly being or a being with the power of metamorphosis──
“Run, my best friend.”
────!!
The stallion responded willingly and its four legs pounded the ground like a storm, charging toward the enemy in front of it.
A knight on horseback charging, with his lance pointed reminded people of a scene from history.
The sight of a knight of old, clad in honor, glory, valor, and strength, charging down the road was a sight to behold. But these weapons are nothing more than relics of a bygone era.
What is the point charging on horseback when the profession of hunter has already pushed the limits of humans?
Heavily armored, lightly armored, and armed with super-fast guns. Do I even need to put the absurdity into words?
-Quang!
The supersonic cannon reaches unrecognizable speed.
This is the difference between mechanical and biological weapons. An overwhelming difference in firepower that… Leon must have been fully aware of it.
“A knight will not be defeated by a cowardly ranged weapon!”
The holy power flowing from Leon’s entire body formed a thin film in front of him.
-Quang!
The shots and the membrane collided and the supersonic cannon was surprisingly stopped by a thin membrane. No…it wasn’t just stopped. It bent and bounced off, as if forced by something.
“……?!”
For a moment, even Yakt Spinner high-performance AI stopped computing and logic had failed to explain what was happening in front of it.
Yakt Spinner saw the mage and recorded his pitiful attempts to block his guns with anomalous physics but it understood that the intangible energies of the ritual have physical effects. But not this one, this time is different.
It didn’t go through a process of clashing, blocking, and then penetrating or defending. It just bounced off. There was no process, just a result.
With the protection of the Holy Law arrow shield any ‘ranged attack’ is ‘deflected’ ‘once’ and ‘unconditionally’.
The Holy Laws are practiced by all Holy Knights as though it were their very breath.
The miracles of the Holy Knights, mankind’s most powerful super weapon were the laws that enforce the rules.
Shrugging off the railgun fire, the knight charged forward at an unbelievable speed.
In an instant, the knight was in front of Yakt Spinner, scattering the remnants of storm.
-Beep!
The machine judged that his weapon is an old-fashioned jousting lance, and while he’s fast, there’s a limit to the impact power of mass, no matter how much speed he gains.
Unlike the Hunters, who imbue their weapons with superhuman movement and a special energy known as “magic,” this spear contains no energy, it’s pure physics and penetrating power.
Threat level 0.
A threat it didn’t even need to respond to. At most, it will hit its leg and stop, and then── Figure out a reasonable response.
The machine’s rationality has made an irreversible choice.
-Thud!
The machine didn’t understand the situation if the sensor hadn’t recorded the “leg piercing” sound it detected and if the secondary camera hadn’t captured the pudding-like penetration of the joint’s heavy armor,
Yakt Spinner wouldn’t have even hypothesized that it might have been the man’s lance that went through its leg in an instant.
[Impossible. Impossible.]
The AI denied the hypothesis because the tough armor on his joints was not meant to be broken by the ridiculous, archaic practice of lance-charging.
The framework of “common sense” established by science and the laws of physics was inescapably a product of the old civilization.
-Bam!
“……??!”
Yakt Spinner wobbled, its joints creaking from the impact of the swung holy spear.
“Sturdy.”
[Information refinement. Reanalyzing.
Unable to analyze logic. Unable to understand physics.
Enemy threat level forcibly increased.
Threat Level 5.]
Yakt Spinner response to the forced threat assessment of the battle was to retreat.
Yakt Spinner takes a huge leap, risking the strain on its joints to face an enemy it would normally ignore or crush.
One of its legs is blown off, and another joint is crushed, but Yakt Spinner secondary joints are sufficiently distant to allow it to move.
Wire cutters swung like whips as the murderous whip that had cut countless Hunters in half swung toward Leon.
It was a supersonic wire whip that Hunters with superhuman vision wouldn’t even recognize. However, the Hunter’s vision was no match for Leon’s and he simply raised his spear and coiled the wire around it.
Yakt Spinner pulls on the coiled wire and naturally, a battle of strength is established between the two.
“A battle of strength with me. This is fun.”
Leon pulls the wire around the spear.
The secondary joints, which are normally used to clear minor obstacles and explosives, are unable to withstand the force of Leon’s pull.
-Boom!
Having lost his railgun and wire cutters, Yakt Spinner unleashes a frenzied barrage of machine gun fire.
Landing on the roof of a building, Yakt Spinner focuses all of its fire on Leon, but the Stallion quickly escapes the barrage with an astonishing sequence of moves.
Even though it was a move that wasn’t expected to hit, the maneuver still managed to widen the range between them.
Machine gun fire can only go so far and the goal was to keep Leon away from it, and it worked. Once again, it fired the railgun at…….
“────!!!”
The next moment, something ripped through the air, and it took 0.02 seconds before the camera sensors realized it was the spear Leon was holding.
The machine’s reaction was too late, and the penetrating power of the spear pierced Yakt Spinner left side and shattered the railgun fuselage.
With half of its sensors and its railgun destroyed, Yakt Spinner staggers as its drive joints are slow to calculate their movements. Meanwhile, the fire continues.
At this point, the only hope for retreat is to keep the enemy at bay.
To a human, the wound would have been instant death, and the creaking of the crushed joints was like a roar of rage or pain.
-Crunch, crunch, crunch!
Yakt Spinner disappeared into the darkness of the sandstorm, leaving behind the creaking mechanical sounds of a killing machine from a cheesy B-movie.
* * * *
With the sandstorm still raging outside, the Hunter’s Camp is deserted.
Yakt Spinner had attacked and killed many. It was the sense of urgency that brought the individualistic Hunters together.
“How many people are dead?”
“Seventeen that we can piece together. I didn’t count the ones crushed by the building.”
“That’s about thirty dead.”
A third of the Hunters in the Hunter camp had been killed in a single raid.
If Yakt Spinner hadn’t retreated, the damage would surely have been worse.
“Was it fortunate or unfortunate that the railgun was destroyed…….?”
The Hunters’ eyes fell on the man who had single-handedly defeated Yakt Spinner.
‘……Who is he?’
‘A Hunter that is not even recorded in the latest data.’
‘This guy…didn’t use magic or anything? Did he actually defeat that monster using only his physical abilities?’
There were many guesses, but nothing was certain, and no one could answer their questions.
What was certain was that this man was the only one with the power to single-handedly defeat Yakt Spinner.
“You are much stronger than I thought.”
Golden Chul was convinced by Leon’s display of power. This man is a survivor, and an incredibly powerful one at that.
‘Maybe he’s out of the norm.’
If he is, we need to be completely cooperative with him because once he’s established in Korea, the country will revolve around him.
“…….”
This was also true for Hwang Yeon-ha and Gil Tae-sung. If it wasn’t for him, the damage caused by Yakt Spinner would have been much greater.
Gil Tae-song, in particular, was getting impatient.
“If you don’t mind, why don’t you make a deal with us? As long as we get the Orb of Wisdom, we’ll give you our full support in the future──”
“You’re boring.”
With a single word, Leon shattered all possibilities.
“I expected you to be a spellcaster and a powerhouse, but in the end, you’re just a joke. The only one worthy of being a true knight is you.”
His gaze and expression were drained of even the slightest hint of interest, but his arrogance remained unwavering as he glanced at the hunters and mages.
“At least be qualified and know this king. It’s not easy to earn the right to face the Knight King…”
Maintaining his arrogant and dismissive demeanor to the end, he walks away. Only the bushy-haired swordswoman hurriedly followed him, bowing her head.
“Ah~ What a strange survivor.”
Golden Chul smiled bitterly in disbelief and Gil Tae-sung’s lips trembled with shame…….
“Shit… Stay the fuck away.”
Unexpectedly, Hwang Yeon-ha sent him a longing glance like a child.
* * * *
Yakt Spinner dragged his creaking joints as he entered the maintenance building.
“Guard the seal. Don’t let anyone get close.”
In all his years of serving the Supreme Order, he’d seen parts replaced as they wore out, but he’d never seen them smashed and crushed like this.
Yakt Spinner slowly dismantled the bolts that held the joints together in the way.
-Thud!
[Falling joints. No spare parts.]
Yakt Spinner diligently searches through the remaining armament and parts inventory in the repair shop.
Main armament unavailable. Five standard rounds, thirty-six homemade rounds, provisionally discarded.
Sub-armament 60 mm machine gun available. 657 rounds of ammunition. Need to make homemade ammunition.
Resupply wire cutters. Secondary joints diagnosed, damaged. Causes severe imbalance in weaponry.
Dispose of Secondary Arms.
Primary armor discarded.
Conclude that it is not possible to kill a Threat Level 5 with only a secondary weapon.
Threat Level 5, originally intended for enemy main battle tanks, attack helicopters, or Class 1 bio-weapons.
Yakt Spinner recognizes Leon as something beyond a Type 1 bio-weapon, a new entity from a hostile force that hasn’t appeared in nearly a millennium.
How to react to a new entity that is more agile than it, and capable of unknown destructive power?
The AI compared forces, ran battle simulations, identified effective tactics, and selected and executed the most likely winning options.
It outfitted itself with modular robotic arms from the garage and began tearing its body apart piece by piece.
No need for thick armor that can withstand the guns of a main battle tank. Peeling away.
No need for load-bearing legs. Remove two more of the six remaining legs. The remaining legs are also dismantled with minimal armor.
After removing the railgun’s remaining barrel, which had become obsolete as a weapon, and the dedicated battery for energy, the 100-ton multipurpose machine was down to 46 tons.
Consolidated the city’s collected remnants to replace ammo-limited firearms due to lack of constant supply.
Supplied with steel wires and equipped with additional robotic arms for maintenance, Yakt Spinner looked very different from the original catalog.
The legs had been stripped of armor to the point where they could only defend against rifle bullets and explosives,
The joints were skeletal, but sufficient to handle the reduced weight.
What the spider lost in firepower and defense, it gained in mobility.
The machine’s strict rationality had stripped it of everything unnecessary, preparing it to repel its foes.
And yet──
[Yappy. Thank you for protecting the city.]
In the old memory module, the undestroyed voice was still playing.

chapters.title: Chapter 22.1: Hunting the Spider (5)
chapters.content:
Chapter 22.1: Hunting the Spider (5)
As the sandstorm intensified, the Hunters cautiously moved from building to building, heading for the center of the city.
Despite Yakt Spinner terrible fighting prowess, the Hunters’ momentum was uneven.
Yakt Spinner had taken heavy damage and retreated. Its main armor and joints were undoubtedly shattered and the Hunters thought it would take a long time for it to repair itself.
Even with Leon’s refusal to cooperate, the attacks of S-class Hunter Golden Chul, semi-S-class Hwang Yeon-ha, and mage Gil Tae-sung were still effective.
Yakt Spinner was not invincible and the Hunters were confident.
“But will it be okay without that weird knight?”
“It’s not like we’re going to miss him.”
“No, but still… if he can overpower that monstrosity, isn’t he stronger than our guild leader?”
Even among the Hunters, Leon’s identity is a topic of conversation and the Hunters who had some experience in this area come to the same conclusion.
“Most likely a survivor, and survivors tend to be selfish.”
“Still, it’s not that bad, is it?”
“Where did he come from, anyway? I haven’t heard of any Survivors coming out of the Gate lately.”
The Hunters tried to piece together Leon’s comet-like appearance with what they knew but even they couldn’t remember anyone that resembled him.
The man was different and they instinctively sensed that he was an alien to this world.
“Wait.”
The Hunter in the lead halted the others with a wave of his hand and pointed a finger as if he’d found a dull metal.
“Two hundred and fifty meters ahead, on the roof. Machine guns out. That’s him.”
At his words, the Hunters behind him cautiously checked out the shape.
Its distinctive crab-like fuselage was exposed at an awkward angle to snipe with a rocket.
Luckily, there was a ten-story building across the street from Yakt Spinner with a good view. Sniping from up there would leave him helpless.
“Ranged dealers, make your way up to the building opposite. We’ll wait here. If he sees us, we’ll distract him and buy time.”
At his command, the Ranged Hunters headed to the building opposite. It would take them a while to get up the stairs, breathlessly and slowly.
“We found it.”
The hunter smiled and waited for the signal from his colleagues up the building.
One minute, three minutes, five minutes……but he didn’t move for fear of being spotted by Yakt Spinner, but no matter how long he waited, the signal didn’t come.
“What are these guys doing up here? Send someone up there and check it out.”
…………
He cautiously sends his colleague up, but there’s no sign for a long time and when the hunter notices something strange-──
“Huh?”
The hunter felt his vision swim and as his vision spun, he saw the familiar shape of a spider.
“Y-you?”
Something… different… much smaller… no, wait, if that was Yakt Spinner, then what the hell was the rooftop entity they had been watching all this time──
His gaze shot up into the air, his subtle vision catching a glimpse of the building’s rooftop.
A large carapace and there was also a ‘model’ of a crude machine gun on a wide armored plate that seemed to have been partially removed.
“Huh?”
By the time the man’s head hit the ground, dozens of whips had already been swung.
* * * *
Yakt Spinner lived up to its name and its groundbreaking lightweight maneuverability allowed it to climb across building facades wire cutters wielded by a multitude of robotic arms emitted a distinctive air-splitting sound that crushed their prey.
It slaughtered the Hunters with nothing but its wire cutters, moving deftly on its lightweight fuselage and flexible legs.
“Shoot! Hit it with something to make it stop!”
Someone shouted, almost in a panic and at the same time, a magic missile fired in the gale force winds of the sandstorm chased after Yakt Spinner.
-Kirik?
With a marvelous movement, Yakt Spinner stretched itself vertically and deftly inserted itself into the narrow gap between the building and the wall as two Magic Missiles slammed into the building’s exterior wall, unable to keep up with its precise dodge.
The three faster Magic Missiles realized they had lost their targets and turned vertically and the bolts of magic soar into the sky, straight for Yakt Spinner as it crawls through the gap in the building.
It can’t maneuver fast enough in such a tight spot so a muzzle spins and the magic missile explodes in midair.
The AI is perfectly capable of intercepting Magic Missiles and the Hunters who witnessed it gaped.
“Crazy… is that possible?”
“It’s not like it’s acrobatics or anything…….”
They couldn’t imagine it. How could they understand the strong artificial intelligence of a killing machine born only to fight?
As they stood in stunned silence, Yakt Spinner caught up to them in a flash.
“Shit! Take cover! Take cover!”
The robotic arms swung the wire cutters they held and the onslaught of Yakt Spinner, who had switched to wire as its primary weapon, had killed over two dozen Hunters so far.
The Hunters swallowed their screams and sprinted as even the wizard’s ranged support failed.
The horror of wanting to live and not wanting to die consumes them.
After a desperate run, the few surviving Hunters reach a cemetery, where they stumble over overgrown weeds and stone beaks.
“Kwak…!
Rolling on the ground with the momentum of his run, the Hunter gasped for breath and tried to crawl away.
-Screech! Screech!
But the four-legged Yakt Spinner was closing in, and the hunter despaired as he realized he couldn’t escape.
“Oh, no. Help me… Lord, I don’t want to die…….”
He used the shabby headstone next to him as a shield, begging for mercy. A mercy he doesn’t even believe in himself.
-Geek….
Yakt Spinner skidded to a halt in front of Hunter, machine guns trained on him.
The killing machine’s logic circuits, which had never let an intruder live before, made their judgment.
[Second Logic – Priority. Destroy intruders.]
[Third Logic – Priority. Destroy invaders.]
The machine guns open fire. No matter the weapon, Yakt Spinner can overwhelm the Hunters. But──
[Autonomous Judgment. Logic decision hacking. Sub-logic silence. Forced prioritization.]
The weapons are retracted and at that moment of pause with all those weapons retracted, a magical arrow rained down from the sky.
The magic arrow strikes Yakt Spinner.
“That’s it! I got it right!”
Yakt Spinner turns his wide-angle lens on the Hunters who attacked him. It’s an attack that can be easily dodged by maneuvering inside the cemetery. But…….
[Final decision. Prioritize. Protect citizens.]
It turned to the tombstone that the hunter hid behind and knew that fighting here would lead to inevitable losses so Yakt Spinner decided to retreat.
“Huh?”
Yakt Spinner ignores the hunter, who makes a stunned sound, and runs out of the cemetery. The hunter, who was being chased, couldn’t speak but was relieved to be alive.
“Yakt Spinner is getting away!”
“Chase!”
He hops from building to building on his four remaining legs, running as far away from the cemetery as he can. Yakt Spinner didn’t even fight back, not wanting to risk any losses.
[Yappy. Look, I made a crown out of flowers!]
The safety of the citizens was the most important thing to prioritize. Even if it was a citizen who was already dead.
* * * *
Yakt Spinner has returned to the repair shop once again.
He repaired the damage he took in battle, resupplied the broken wire, and reloaded his ammunition.
It hasn’t been easy maintaining my body in a shop that hasn’t even been a regular facility, but he’s been able to keep up.
[Protect the seal. Don’t let anyone get close.]
It was the last order in the machine’s chain of command but the AI’s sobering realization is that it was becoming impossible to fulfill that order.
If it stops this intrusion, what next? At some point, it will fail. Its time of fighting was coming to an end.
Replacing broken parts with homemade ammunition, wire, and parts made by melting down the city’s scrap metal, he connected to the remaining surveillance cameras around the city.
-Estimated enemy survivors: 49. Level 5 threat alive, Level 3 threat alive, multiple Level 1 threats. 35.7% chance of defeat.
-Combat continues.
Nothing changes and the machine merely fulfills its orders.
With a grunt of effort, the machine reaches its full capacity and-─
“Did you have fun with the minions?”
“…………!?”
The knight had been watching the scene from beginning to end.
* * * *

chapters.title: Chapter 22.2: Hunting the Spider (5)
chapters.content:
Chapter 22.2: Hunting the Spider (5)
Leon worships chivalry. Nay, he is chivalry incarnate.
He abhorred cowardly assaults and sought out fair fights. Of course, his opponents don’t always fight fair.
His many enemies harassed him with raids, plots, and all manner of sorcery. But this is no reason for him to forsake the virtues of knighthood.
He was the kind of man who would smash battlefield intrigue and shadowy sorcery from the front.
He was the embodiment of chivalry: broken, but unbreakable. That’s what made him strong.
It was for this reason that he waited for Yakt Spinner to finish its maintenance.
With very few exceptions, a knight’s honor is important, even if it’s a non-human being.
Leon had encountered many dimorphic races, some of them completely alien to humanity.
He was an Earthling, but he had lived in the world of dimorphs and xenomorphs for much longer than that.
Yakt Spinner inhumanly cold armor plates and structurally different joints were just part of its personality.
“For a robot, you’re majestic and powerful. It will be hard for those creatures out there to take you down.”
Before he could finish his sentence, a swinging wire slashed across Leon’s path. He ducked out of the way, but it struck a nerve with the Lionheart.
“Is it too much to ask for honor from a machine?”
Yakt Spinner eyes glowed red.
Armament check: 480 rounds of 60 mm machine guns.
Four wire cutters, two tons of last resort in the repair shop.
Supersonic whip after supersonic whip.
The Wire Cutters’ trajectories, their speeds, all calculated to keep them from tangling with each other and supersonic whips struck Leon from the ground, overhead, left, right, and center, with no way to dodge but Leon gripped his holy sword and parried the onslaught.
His opponent’s evasions were calculated, and the only attack that reached Leon was a wire cutter, which he deflected with his holy sword.
“………….”
The mixture of molten iron ore and hardened steel should have shattered under the whip of the supersonic wire cutters but the iron sword remained intact and even the common sense in the machine’s database couldn’t understand it.
Yakt Spinner used his four legs to disrupt Leon with even more agile moves than before.
It’s good if its opponent holds his ground like a heavy tank because immobile targets are just fodder for machine guns.
-Tut-tut-tut-tut-tut!
The machine gun opens fire and the first round misses as it should but Yakt Spinner analyzes the trajectory of the flying shells and makes adjustments before hitting Leon.
-Thud!
The concrete crumbles as it hits the ground, sending the figure soaring.
In the next moment, after the rising concrete blocked his view, Yakt Spinner condensed the hydraulic springs in his joints and leapt away.
-Quang!
A spear pierces through the spot where Yakt Spinner was just a moment ago. Yes, he expected it.
He analyzed the combat patterns of Threat Level 5 enough that he assumed every eventuality.
Spears appearing out of thin air, iron swords that don’t break at all, or shattering tank-grade armor with sheer force. It all defied common sense and logic, but the threat in front of him was real.
The sound of a door closing was caught by the noise filter and sounds don’t lie, even if they can’t be detected through debris.
Yakt Spinner slammed into Leon like an artillery shell as he ran against the wall but before he knew it, Leon mounted his summoned beast and retrieved his holy spear.
Yakt Spinner couldn’t understand how an organism can run that fast but he’s long since abandoned logic. The lightened Yakt Spinner darted between the maintenance buildings, blocking Leon’s approach.
“Stallion, he wants to play hide-and-seek with us.”
The fleeing Yakt Spinner and the horseman that gives chase, smashed through building walls and pillars with their bodies.
It’s a contradiction in terms, with Yakt Spinner guerrilla tactics using the terrain to his advantage and the horseman chasing him in a straight line, but Yakt Spinner isn’t just running away.
The wire cutter’s unexpected attack on the pursuing Leon was intimidating and deadly, but it was only buying time.
Leon calmly and skillfully deflects Yakt Spinner attacks while seemingly ignorant of its pursuit.
Yakt Spinner picks up the pace even more, thoroughly avoiding Leon’s approach but its joints are slowly wearing out.
Its structural limitations designed to deal with armored vehicles and slow infantry are being tested by a superhuman.
-Squeak!
The machine has been overworked beyond its carefully calculated capabilities and has collapsed from within.
How will the machine handle the absurdity of exhausting itself before the human did?
After a few minutes of chasing, the reversal was a calculated move.
With a large building pillar in front of it, it hooked its flimsy legs over the pole and grimly changed course.
“……Stallion!”
Yakt Spinner moved in an instant and slammed straight into the horseman.
Weighing over forty tons, even if it was lightened, it was not the kind of impact an organism could withstand.
“Not bad.”
But the Stallion held on, sliding smoothly as it was pushed back by the impact.
In the face of an impact too great for flesh and form to sustain, man and horse shake their heads lightly and gallop on again.
Nothing changed and Yakt Spinner took advantage of the distance and fired its remaining shells.
“──!”
Stallion dodges the fire with an amazing move and even with all the precious machine gun shells being fired, Stallion’s sprint doesn’t stop.
-Kugugung!
The hail of 60 mm shells chips away at the durability of the old building in real time as the walls, ceilings, and columns of the massive structure crumble like a sponge, spewing out huge chunks of stone.
Stallion leapt lightly toward the deadly boulders, and then began to climb, spurred on by the falling rocks.
The phantasmagoric beast, called a god, dodged the cascade of boulders and reached the ceiling in an instant.
────!!
As gravity pulls him back down, the camera lenses of Yakt Spinner and the eyes of the rider intersect.
Facing each other perpendicularly, they aimed their machine guns and lance at each other.
-68 rounds. All rounds fired.
“Glory be to the Lionheart…!”
Gravity-defying machine gun rounds rained down, and horsemen slammed vertically through the ceiling.
The ceiling, which had barely retained its shape despite the merciless misfires of the machine guns, completely collapsed under the impact of the white horse.
It was a charge like a white comet, a falling star pummeled by machine gun fire. But──
“……?!”
The glowing Stallion is unscathed since no physical attack can penetrate the Light Divine Beast, who has unleashed his divine power and is in sync with his rider.
-Boom!
A devastating blow of dense holy power slams into Yakt Spinner.
-Kwazizik!
Yakt Spinner is pierced and torn in half but Yakt Spinner robotic arms moved, even as it was thrown like a piece of trash from the massive impact.
With his opponent frozen in the aftermath of the impact and fall…it had 2.7 seconds to get his fuselage moving so it swung its four wire cutters.
The high-performance AI calculated the trajectory even as its body bounced around to kill the stationary enemy with certainty.
The trajectory determined that the sharp wire cutters swung from four directions would cut through the prey. This time, it was a must-kill.
“Excellent…!”
“……?!”
Yakt Spinner took a moment to review the camera malfunction as in a flash, the Stallion carrying Leon vanished into thin air, and he slammed into the ground.
The trajectory of the wire cutters had been calculated assuming a rider on horseback but when the target is less than half the size of the rider, the perfect calculation leads to a fatal miss!
Leon fired at it like a shell, hitting it right in the middle of its perfect trajectory. With the destructive power he’s shown so far, it’ll only take a moment to cut through the main computer.
[Yippee. What’s sealed in here should never leave.]
The AI finished its calculations in a split second.
A workshop built on top of a sealed facility, the last way to protect this place. If there is even a 0.01% chance, the machine will not stop acting.
-Initiate self-destruct sequence. Detonating all the explosives in the facility.
-Boom, boom, boom!
A large number of explosives planted in various parts of the repair shop explode in unison.

chapters.title: Chapter 23: Hunting the Spider (6)
chapters.content:
Chapter 23: Hunting the Spider (6)
4.7% success rate, that was the probability of Yakt Spinner being able to defeat the Special Entity named Leon.
That’s the odds for a fighter that’s lost its legs and wire cutters. In fact, that’s including the fact that it would self-destruct due to a battery surge.
However, there was a trick that boosted those odds to 93%.
Yakt Spinner had a large stockpile of explosives, about two tons that it had buried for use in the event of a final push, when it could no longer produce or maintain ammunition.
Though it was beyond the scope of his calculations that the final self-destruct target would be a single threat, Yakt Spinner would not hesitate to risk everything to fulfill his last order.
-Bang!!!
A boom echoed throughout the city as two tons of explosives went off at once, instantly burning away all the oxygen in the building.
The sturdy buildings shatter, the pressure of the explosion violently pushing the air out of the way and sending out a powerful shockwave.
All buildings within a two-kilometer radius of the explosion’s center are gone, and all buildings within 10 kilometers are crushed or cracked.
The shockwave extends outward for 20 kilometers, blowing Hunters who are resting from injuries to the ground.
Smoke from the explosion was sucked up as air once again filled the vacuum created by the crushing fire in the atmosphere.
Explosive smoke billowed upward as a huge hemispherical cloud of dust spread in all directions like a mushroom.
No one would survive that blast.
It was an obvious guess.
* * * *
Unit JS-10,253 was manufactured 1,038 years and twenty-two days ago.
Unlike its factory-built siblings, the intensely intelligent Yakt Spinner was built for the civilization’s final showdown.
The Yakt Spinners of the 112th Unmanned Armored Regiment, including their commander, 10,253, had only one order: never let the center of the city be unsealed.
Ensure that what is sealed in the heart of the city is never unsealed and do so by any means necessary but they were never given the chance to fulfill the order.
As they were being produced and transported from the factory, the enemy attacked, destroying the train and more than half of them before they could be put into service.
No. 10,253 would have been destroyed without a last-minute emergency start by the transporter.
“Protect the city! Go! Do your duty!”
The transporter was devoured the next moment.
Taking over the command module, 10,253 accessed the integrated network system. With the 37th’s remaining forces, it cleared the raiders and headed for the city.
The sky was filled with gray dust, and the ground shook from time to time from the explosions, hindering their ability to maneuver.
Near the top of the cliff, a comrade was buried with the collapsed earth.
The Red Menace attacked from all sides, at all times.
Surrounded by an endless stream of enemies and mechanically slaughtering them, a mushroom cloud rose.
He entered an emergency evasive maneuver, but was unable to prevent half of his teammates from being caught in the shockwave.
[JS-10,244 Unable to process. Contamination level 8, lethal to civilians.]
[JS-10,185 Core damaged. Level 14 radioactive material overflow.]
Most of them were contaminated and decontaminated late. They followed the logic and calculated the damage to the citizens if they entered the city and agreed.
[Contaminated entity to cease activity immediately. Commence self-destruct sequence.]
[Execute order from interim commander JS-10,253. Initiate self-destruct sequence after friendly units have departed.]
The late decontaminated units buried themselves in the ground and self-destructed.
The city they arrived in was under attack and 10,253 gave the order.
[Initiate fire support to friendly forces. Defend the city.]
Twelve machines entered the fray and were able to repel the enemy. They became the city’s heroes.
“Yakt Spinner! Yakt Spinner!”
The people cheered the killing machines that had saved them.
The story of the drone that sniped and killed the enemy leader in a desperate situation, and was willing to throw itself to save a citizen from the aftermath of an explosion, was a fable that inspired hope in the city.
They became a symbol of hope and knights of steel that protected the people.
The regrouped Yakt Spinners, under the command of their commander, defended the city.
They defended and defended and defended, until there was nothing left to defend when the final battle was over.
The defense system was only 3% operational and less than five citizens remained but most of them mortally wounded.
The chance of survival was 0% and the last inhabitants of the city would die.
“Yappy. This is it. Last order.”
The commander, roughly ignoring the blood throbbing in his bitten arm, gave his last order.
He explained why the city was being raided over and over again, what it was sealed and built upon.
And that the seal must never be broken,
“Guard the seal. Do not let anyone approach.”
– May future survivors not be as foolish as we were.
As they fell, one by one, the end came.
The city in the middle of the wilderness had only one drone left.
JS – 10,253 had done its duty faithfully.
Do not allow the seal to be broken.
Protect the seal. Protect the city.
Eliminate anything that approaches the city.
To conceal the sealed section, a maintenance shop was built on top of it, and explosives were placed to bury it in case of emergency.
Using the knowledge in the database, it repaired the city’s defenses, refurbished its body, and crafted supplies using auxiliary joints and facilities to replenish its railgun shells and ammunition.
It was lucky to have a mine near the city so it could make cheap black powder.
Prepare, prepare, prepare, prepare, for an enemy that could come at any moment.
That’s how it survived for a millennium.
In the aftermath of the explosion, the dust clears and the intruder walks through the wreckage, unharmed.
Holy Law <Protection of the Arrow Shield>
The absolute defense against ranged attacks neutralized even Yakt Spinner final self-destruct and it even protected the Yakt Spinner itself.
He swung his iron sword to break the seal on what was sealed ‘beneath the workshop’.
“This is what you were meant to protect.”
He poured cement to bury it, built a workshop over it to conceal it, and finally detonated an explosive to bury it.
Today, with no cipher left to unlock the protocols, the vault has been cut open with an iron sword.
What was revealed was a black sphere that seemed to condense endless darkness.
Black smoke billows from it, contaminating life with its overflowing residue. This is not a nuclear reactor or radioactivity. This is the thing that threatens the city, the thing that has poisoned the human world.
The Wisdom Orb.
This is the gate’s closing condition and the reason for Yakt Spinner millennial mission.
-Chirp! Chirp!
Yakt Spinner dragged its half-destroyed body, inching closer to Leon.
Forcing its severed joints to move, it wrapped its broken wire cutters around Leon’s ankle with its remaining secondary arm.
There was no power left to pull it. Even if it had any energy left to fight, it had a 0.00% chance of taking down a level 5 threat.
Knowing this, the machine lurched forward, intent on taking Leon down.
“Still trying to fight?”
Leon turns to face Yakt Spinner, holding the black sphere.
The camera eyes, now down to one, stared at the sphere from start to finish.
Leon closed his eyes as he watched the machine struggle to get the sphere out from underneath him and retrieve it.
“How long have you guarded this, how many years have you fought?”
As if empathizing with the years, the knight watched the machine before him wordlessly.
The time it had spent repairing itself, tearing itself apart, repairing itself again, replacing itself… its indomitable will deservedly rewarded.
“You have fulfilled your mission to the end.”
He sincerely lamented his inability to communicate with the machine before him. How could this honorable one not be called a knight?
“A knight of loyalty and a knight of faithfulness, your service is beyond measure, and all living things are indebted to you.”
Leon raised his holy sword as he knew that the sphere of evil could only be cut by it.
-Keeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!
The neatly sliced evil screamed in agony and vanished as the Holy Grail, the purifier of evil, absorbed it and finished it off.
……………
Yakt Spinner was silent.
What must the machine be thinking, witnessing the destruction of what it had kept sealed for so long?
Without a word, Leon conjured holy water from the Holy Grail.
Pouring the holy water, Leon humbly steps forward and drops to one knee in full reverence.
“Sir Yakt Spinner, I solemnly declare that your quest is complete.”
The seal was broken.
Never let out one of the things that destroyed the world. It was what powered Yakt Spinner for a thousand years.
Now it’s gone, and there’s no need to keep the seal.
The Last Order has been brought to an end after a thousand years.
-Chirp! Chirp…!
The last remaining camera eye blinked. As if it knew it was finally over, freed from its fate.
[Yappy, you are a hero to the city.]
[Yappi! Thank you for protecting the city!]
[Yappy!]
“May you rest in peace…….”
The voices that remained in the old, worn memory module came to an end.
* * * * *
[Quest cleared]
The Hunters scratched their heads at the sudden message.
Cleared? What? Does that mean they’ve defeated Yakt Spinner?
The Hunters, still reeling from Yakt Spinner guerrilla warfare, couldn’t believe it: the vicious killing machine had fallen?
But at the same time, they remembered the anachronistic knight who had stared down at them with a misguided, arrogant gaze.
Who else but him could have defeated the machine and completed the quest.
“He was a good man until the end.”
Golden Chul acknowledged him honestly. Although Yakt Spinner was an unfamiliar enemy, it was a formidable foe that even he, an S-class Hunter, couldn’t do much about.
If he could clear it alone against such a monster, the future of Korea would inevitably be centered around him.
“Let’s prepare to withdraw, everyone!”
He was encouraging his tired men when a man appeared in the distance.
“What is that?”
The man was carrying the wreckage of a massive piece of machinery… the remains of Yakt Spinner that must have weighed tens of tons.
“Ohhh…! Your Majesty!”
Gil Tae-sung, who had meanwhile acquired the proper manner of addressing Leon from Ha-ri, turned to him exaggeratedly.
“I was worried that the explosion might have damaged your jade body.”
“You’re full of flattery, spellcaster. What’s the matter with you?”
“Haha…….”
Tae-sung glanced at Leon, searching for something he should be holding. But he wasn’t holding any of those things so Tae-sung wondered.
“I… Your Majesty, do you happen to know where the Jewel of Wisdom is…….?”
“Destroyed.”
“What?”
At those words, Gil Tae-Sung and the Hunters stopped dead in their tracks.
Destroyed it? The thing that the Tower had spent tens of billions to get? Why?
“That, do you know what kind of object it is? The Wisdom Jewel… it’s… it’s a high-grade treasure!”
“What are you talking about, you lowly thing!”
Leon shouted at Gil Tae-sung to shut him up, but Gil Tae-sung and many other Hunters didn’t understand his behavior.
The condition for clearing the gate was the destruction or capture of the Wisdom Jewel. According to Gil Tae-sung, if it was a high-ranked treasure, it was something that the nation would do everything in its power to obtain.
“It is a vile thing that corrupts people. No good can come of it in human hands.”
“And for that reason alone, you have given up on it?”
“Only that reason?”
Leon’s eyes narrowed, and Gil Tae-Sung felt a chill run down his spine, overwhelmed by the look alone.
“Foolish things, don’t you realize that your paltry values will ultimately destroy the world?”
With that disdainful glance, Leon left and Ha-ri hurried after him.
-Your Majesty, do you want me to lift it? Uhm… I don’t think I can lift it all, but…….
-Don’t touch it. It is not for commoners to touch.
-Eh…….
That was the end of the raid on the Cheongju Gate.

chapters.title: Chapter 24: Hunting the Spider (7)
chapters.content:
Chapter 24: Hunting the Spider (7)
The top floor of the United States Tower is the home of the Lord of the Tower…the archmage Reynald Shelman, who is considered an S-class mage.
The Archmage, as he is known to the world, is a force to be reckoned with, even by the President of the United States is huddled in his chambers, begging for forgiveness.
“I apologize, Great One! I have not done what you commanded!”
The object of his prostrations was a gem that looked like a black mass.
Wisdom Orb, a unique grade of treasure obtained from the Red Gate of America. It looked at the mortal prostrate before it and spoke in a dreary voice.
[Foolish, stupid thing I taught you the truth and wisdom of Samra, and you let me down.]
“I apologize!”
Reynald begged for forgiveness, beating his head until it bled.
It was not the manner of one called the Archmage of the World, but addicted to the knowledge bestowed by the Wisdom Orb, Reynald worshiped it like a god.
“Uh, it was unavoidable. A survivor named Leon was an unexpected variable, even for us!”
[You defile my ears with your flimsy excuses, just a survivor named Leon…… what the fuck?]
“What?”
Reynald looked up with a puzzled expression at the sudden soreness in Wisdom Orb’s voice.
[Who did you just say?]
“I said Leon…”
[He must be the same person, right? Turn on the news… the news.]
The voice grew lighter and lighter. Was it an illusion that he was trembling as if he were frightened?
When Reynald turned on the news and saw the news of the capture of the Cheongju Gate, there was a blond youth in the spotlight.
[This is Leon Dragonia Lionheart]
[Kheeheehee!]
“Why is that bastard here? Why! Why?”
“Lord?”
The great voice that had always dazzled the Archmage with its sternness and seriousness was nowhere to be heard, and sounded terrified.
[I, I give up. I don’t. I won’t.]
In the next moment, the black aura in the orb scattered and it turned white as if something within it had completely disappeared.
“Master? Master?!”
Reynald repeatedly called out to the unresponsive orb, but it never spoke again.
* * * *
“You have destroyed the Wisdom Orb?”
Oh Kang-hyuk, the president of the Hunter’s Association, looked unhappy when Leon told him that he had destroyed the Wisdom Orb.
“Is that a complaint?”
“……No, because the condition for closing the dungeon was to destroy or obtain the Wisdom Orb. If Your Majesty has defeated the Mechanical Spider, then the handling of the Orb is also within Your Majesty’s power.”
Still, Leon recognized the hidden disappointment in the Association President’s expression. Yes, so be it, the ignorant are quick to see the gain in front of them.
“Don’t be sorry, it’s poison.”
“Poison… you mean?”
“It is the stuff of the demons.”
“The demons?!”
At the mention of the demons, Mr. Oh Kang-hyuk, the head of the Association, is stunned.
Demons, the immortal beings that emerged from the Demon Gate had always been responsible for causing nightmarish damage to humanity.
“The orb was created by the evil of wisdom and exploration to tempt humans. At first it grants the wielder what he desires, then it demands a price.”
The wizards of the Empire have fallen prey to this orb.
It didn’t take long for what was initially a curiosity to turn into an offer of eternal life, immortality, and demonization.
“The Emperor of the Empire fell for it and sacrificed millions of his citizens to it. You say it has been found elsewhere? You’d better hurry and destroy it.”
“I can’t believe…….”
A drop item at the gate hiding such a destructive purpose… The President of the Association was skeptical of Leon’s words, but was convinced that something terrible would happen if they were true.
“I will bring this to the attention of the U.S. government.”
“That would be a good idea, but… they may have already fallen under the demon’s spell.”
Leon did not overestimate the will of men in this age.
Weak men easily defeated by greed and easily seduced. Their ignorance of the divine is nothing compared to the subjects of his world.
They are sick, poor, weak, and greedy. That is why they need true faith and enlightenment all the more. They must be taught that God’s love is a grace extended to all.
“President, lead me to the place where he is laid to rest.”
“Yes, sir, he is in the basement of the Association.”
Leon followed the Association’s lead to one of the warehouses.
In the warehouse, where the byproducts of the Gate were usually stored, were the remains of the Mechanical Spider.
“Your Majesty, President!”
The Association’s employees bow, starting with the waiting Ha-ri as they were instructed to be as polite as they could to Leon.
“Do your work.”
Accepting their salute, Leon stood before the remains of the Mechanical Spider.
The wreckage of the Mechanical Spider was, to put it mildly, a mangled mess.
Its body, pierced, crushed, and shattered by Leon’s holy spear, had lost its power over the Hunters.
Now it is a pale shadow of its former glory, less than half its former size. No, it is literally nothing but rubble.
“What shall we… do with it?”
“As an honorable knight, you should bury it in the ground and pray that it will find its way to the feast of the gods.”
Suitable ground would be found in the Naju Plains, blessed by the goddess Demera.
“Rest in peace, faithful knight.”
The moment he blessed the Mechanical Spider, the Mechanical Spider moved.
“What?!”
Ha-ri’s voice rang out, drawing the attention of the president and his staff.
“What?!”
“The Mechanical Spider?”
“Ooh, it’s moving!”
The nightmare of the Cheongju Gate, the boss monster, which had defeated the raiders three times, moved with a weak creak, and the staff was stunned.
The only one who remained silent was Leon.
“Stop flailing!” Leon’s one word was a rallying cry and suddenly, they realized who was in front of them.
Yes, Leon, the man who defeated the Yakt Spinner, is in front of them. They swallowed hard and stared at the Yakt Spinner, relieved to see Leon’s presence.
“Hmm….”
Leon was equally puzzled by the situation.
-Chew… chew!
The Yakt Spinner grunted, as if it couldn’t handle its weight, and then began to dismantle its body with its overgrown robotic arms.
Undoing bolts, removing gloves, disassembling…reassembling itself.
Throughout the process, Leon sensed a familiar aura emanating from the Yakt Spinner.
“Holy…power.”
The holy water he’d used as a blessing on the Yakt Spinner had somehow worked on the Yakt Spinner.
The Yakt Spinner’s power source was shattered and unable to function properly, but with the blessing of the Holy Power, it performed a miracle.
Yakt Spinner finally disassembles and reassembles his body.
Shrunk to one-twentieth of its original size, the Yakt Spinner stared at Leon and Leon smiled, bowing his head in glee.
“I see…I wonder if you’ll be able to win the Goddess’ favor.”
Leon summoned the Holy Grail and generated holy water within it, which he poured into his holy sword.
The old, dirty sword gathered light as if it were its duty to make the lights of this world adorn it.
Leon’s old iron sword dazzles with divine radiance.
“Wow…….”
“What the…….”
Everyone marvels at the holy glow, a blessing in disguise.
He cuts through space with this holy sword of glory, bestowed upon him by the Goddess.
The Holy Grail, the holy water, and the energy of the holy sword all converge as the sword cuts through space, and a brilliant light dematerializes the space.
There…the pure white face of a man, or goddess, was revealed. Her snow-white hair dripping with cold energy, the goddess slowly opens her eyes to reveal precious gold.
“Aaah…….”
Leon didn’t need to say it; every human in the room knew that the woman of light was no human. She is something divine, something that no one in this world can match.
Everyone fell to their knees before her as they had no choice but to kneel as Leon kneeled on one knee.
“Arianna.”
[Lionheart… my first knight.]
Leon wanted to say more, but he realized the gravity of the situation and held up the Yakt Spinner as if to introduce it.
“This Sir Yakt Spinner is an honorable knight, a model for all knights. He is a knight worthy of Arianna’s consideration.”
The goddess looked at the strange knight Leon had introduced and her golden eyes pierced the machine’s red ones.
[This one has not fulfilled his quest. He has not proven his honor and given me glory.]
“As the first knight of the Goddess, I vouch for him. If not for my presence, he would be a great knight, capable of rivaling the glory of the Lionhearted King.”
[If my knight says so…there is nothing more to see.]
The goddess placed her absolute trust in Leon since as her knight, he gave her glory, honor, and finally victory on an impossible battlefield.
The gods of the pantheon hold him in high esteem, and how could they find fault with his words?
[But let’s get one thing straight.]
The goddess looked down at Yakt Spinner and even this inorganic piece of machinery had to humble itself before the Goddess.
“Will you, knight of otherworldly steel, enter into the ranks of my knight, the Lionhearted King, and praise light and sing of justice?”
-Kiruk?
The Yakt Spinner glanced around, not quite understanding the goddess’s words. He spoke in his own words.
“You are full of honor and knowledge, but your wisdom is still that of a child, so understand simply. Help my knight destroy evil, and you are my knight.”
The Yakt Spinner’s camera stares at Leon and he calmly synthesizes the situation, remembering Leon’s offer, the power he showed, and most of all, the theoretical impossibility of his reactivation.
Yakt Spinner quickly concluded.
-Crack, crack, crack!
He muttered something in machine language, but soon realized that it would not be understood, and once again searched for a language that would be understood in this world.
Hacking into the radio tower of a nearby satellite station is a simple matter for him.
-Check. The plan. Demonize. Attack. Good plan.
The answer was cut short, but neither Leon nor Arianna considered it rude, nor did they ask him to repeat it.
They were simply genuinely glad to have this honorable Holy Knight at their gates.
“Good. As long as you remain loyal to my first knight and support him, you will share his glory.”
The new Holy Knight Yakt Spinner 10,253 is hereby sworn to light and justice.

chapters.title: Chapter 25: Marketing (1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: Marketing (1)
Since Yakt Spinner’s resurrection, Leon has informed Ha-ri that he would like to make him a guild member of his guild.
“Then… I’ll have to go through the formalities and register separately! It’s… a bit complicated and will take some time.”
“Alright, go do your business.”
After dismissing Ha-ri, Leon walked down the empty hallway with Yakt Spinner and then──
“Kuluk…!”
-Kick!
Leon choked back the blood that was spitting out of his mouth.
[Are you okay, my knight?]
The feedback came immediately but Leon was relieved to see that the only people looking at him now were the Goddess and the Holy Knight.
“It’s okay.”
Arianna gritted her teeth at Leon’s words.
[After all, appointing a Holy Knight in a land that lacks faith is a bit much]
“It had to be done, don’t you think?”
In the dying world, it was fine because the overwhelming power of the land protected Leon but now the faith had spread to only a tiny minority.
Holy Knights are living saints, agents of the gods and it took a tremendous amount of power to elevate such beings. A drain that even Leon, with his lion’s heart, could not endure.
-Leon?
Leon smiled benevolently, reading the thoughts in the Yakt Spinner’s mind.
“It is not your fault. It is my fault for not being strong enough.”
[How is this your fault, your goddess is lacking]
“Divinity is not to be blamed in any case. Please withhold your words.”
At those words, Arianna was silenced. Their Knight of Glory was faithful, even in times like these. So much so that it was hard to believe he was an atheist who didn’t believe in gods.
[My knight, your goddess is always grateful for your devotion. However, the immorality of your goddess and the gods for not acting on your lack of faith has hurt you]
The goddess felt the need to hasten what was going on in the pantheon within his heart.
[Rest well, trust in your gods and wait]
“Arianna?”
With those words, Arianna returned to the Lionheart King’s Heart, where their pantheon had been evacuated, where she found the gods waiting for her.
* * * *
On the day that Lionheart King Leon turned 121 years old when the world was destroyed by evil and only one knight remained, Leon kept all the fallen Holy Knights alive and evacuated the pantheon into his heart.
To their shame, the gods took refuge in the saint’s body, and for 180 years they watched the Lionhearted King destroy the Evil Ones but the gods did not stand idly by. They bestowed upon him all the strength and power they could give.
They made their one remaining saint bear all the burdens thus all the gods of the pantheon owed Leon a debt they could not repay.
“What is his condition?”
Demera, the god of life and fertility, inquired.
“Not well, my knight has overdone it.”
The God of War and Flame was furious.
“What has become of King Lionheart, who once bore the glory of the gods in all their splendor?”
“Keep your head down, War. He fought for more than two hundred years for the gods, and he won.”
“I know and that is why my teeth are chattering!”
It was not the Lionheart King who was to blame.
He was disgracing himself, for he loved the Lionhearted King, Leon Dragonia, more than anyone else.
The Goddess of Light and Justice looked around at her brothers and sisters, who must harbor similar feelings, and spoke.
“The time has come to break our 180-year silence, my brothers and sisters. I can no longer watch my knight suffer.”
How could they support the Lionheart King and restore the glory of their Pantheon?
He shouldn’t be the only one to bear the burden. The gods themselves had to take an active role in the situation.
“My brothers and sisters, we must support our only saint.”
“No longer the only one.”
It was the God of Iron and Blacksmith who stepped forward. He was a muscular deity, conspicuously small and dwarfed by the others, but as strong as any of them.
The one the dwarves worshiped, their lord, Heto had just mentioned the newest saint.
“That child, Yakt Spinner, has become a new saint.”
“Hmph…A saint who doesn’t believe in divinity.”
“Are you complaining War?”
“Of course not! To become a saint, one must serve the divine and prove oneself worthy, and he’s not qualified for that!”
There were not a few deities who agreed with him, but there was only one reason for their silence.
“The Lionheart King has vouched for him. What could be greater?”
“Greater…!”
At that, War looked dumbfounded and there were murmurs of impatience around him.
“Justice, in your opinion, is Yakt Spinner good enough to be a Holy Knight?”
Arianna spoke up.
“As a pure being that has thwarted the plots of evil for millennia he may lack faith, but he is full of honor and loyalty, Iron.”
“Hmm…! Leon and Justice place too much emphasis on chivalry. Honor is not enough to win a war.”
War rumbled on, and he still seemed dissatisfied.
Arianna turned to Iron, knowing he would eventually honor the new Saint.
“Iron, there must be a reason you mentioned the Yakt Spinner. What are you thinking?”
Iron chuckled at Arianna’s question.
“One hundred and eighty years ago, we lost all the Holy Knights except one, the Grail Guardian, who burned himself to the ground as a vessel for the descent of the divine until the very end.”
“……I know this for a fact.”
“I learned of this world through the life of the only one of us to gain a believer.”
“Is that so?”
“I have seen the world through the eyes of my faithful, and I have discovered an interesting child.”
Demera, Goddess of Life and Fertility shared what she saw with the other gods.
[Brothers, this time we’re in the hot Naju Plains!]
It was a broadcaster. Mr. Park, a farmer who also streams on the Internet.
After experiencing the miracle of blessed rice, he traveled to the Naju Plain, which was said to be just as purified as the Hunan Plain.
“What is that?”
As some of the gods scratched their heads in confusion, Iron explained.
“On this world, the homeworld of the Lionhearted King, they’ve recently developed the medium of internet broadcasting, which is quite an effective way to spread news.”
“You mean to preach to them?”
“That’s right, show them miracles and demonstrate our divinity in action, but that’s not all, the entire world is tied together by a space called the Internet.”
At that, War questioned.
“But why didn’t King Lionheart think of this? He was an inhabitant of this world.”
Iron shook his head and spoke the unfortunate truth.
“It seems that when the Lionheart King died in this world, the Internet was still just beginning to develop dramatically.”
Iron then began to describe a concrete plan.
“We will promote faith in all corners of society with blessings that can be used immediately, including Life (Demera), and the means of promotion will be the internet and news.”
“But what about trial and error? Even Leon’s ambitious newspaper would have taken twenty years to get off the ground.”
“That’s where our new Holy Knight comes in.”
“”?????””
The gods stared in wonder.
* * * *
-Kiruk.
The resurrected Yakt Spinner calculatedly assessed his situation and what he needed to do next.
[Lack of maintenance. Need a centralized information processing unit.]
First of all, his computing power is significantly lower now that he has no backup from the city, and his main program is not running with any certainty but even he, a machine, has his doubts as to why he is able to move when he should be perfectly still.
Why is his computing power, which should be zero, at the level of a sub computer?
The A.I. has analyzed thousands and tens of thousands of cases, but it realizes that this is not a logical explanation. Above all──
[I am Heto, God of Iron and Blacksmithing, and from now on you are my spokesperson and I am your guardian]
A being spoke to him without any communication devices, and in “any language” he could understand since the beings called Hunters had invaded the city.
Phenomena that don’t exist in the program, that are physically impossible, are entered into the data and Yakt Spinner could only come up with words to organize them.
[Divine system at work. Anomaly A into the divine system. Set aside.]
The second problem arises when the machine is faced with a phenomenon it can only conclude, “I’ll just have to let this one slide.”
[Output 13%. Needs immediate repair.]
Since the body has been reduced to a hundredth of its size, the power output has dropped significantly.
Even at this size, the original 13% power output is ridiculous for the machine.
The destroyed body could not be repaired and he hacked into the domestic computer system to find a replacement, but most of the substances on the planet could not replace the original armor, and even if they could, the quantity was insufficient.
It was then that Iron spoke.
[See this, feel this, this is the ‘metal of the gods’ from which your body can be made]
-Bam!
It was invisible but palpable and he could calculate even though he had no data.
The anomaly he felt when I fought Leon, divine power. With this, he could manufacture his own body.
[What do you want me to do?]
With Iron laugh, a ‘revelation’ descended and the strong artificial intelligence quickly began to learn the necessary knowledge.
* * * * *
“Huh, Chief. Look at this!”
“What is it?”
“It’s a video, is this authorized?!”
Hunter Association Chief Kim Jin-soo’s eyes widened when he saw the video shown by his subordinate.
“Naju Plain? YouTubers?”
The video began by showing the vast rice fields of the Naju Plain.
[I’ll show you the benefits of our Manshinjeon Rice, a special crop that only grows in our Naju Plain.]
The narration begins with a voice that sounds too perfect to be a machine, a soothing voice that you can’t help but like.
[You ask, “What makes Manshinjeon rice so special?” This video will answer that question].
Flawless, ultra-high-definition video in 16K, with music that was never heard before.
[Manshinjeon farmers’ mornings start at 5 a.m. every day].
The flowing video is the work of a pro.
[The Manshinjeon farmers begin with a reverent prayer session with the temporary priest, Mr. Choi, and the farmers. Look at that. He’s still praying to Demera, the goddess of life and fertility]
The camera approaches the farmers as they pray toward the altar. Their faces are peaceful and unblemished, more like practicing monks than farmers.
[What makes the crops of the Pantheon of the Ten Thousand Gods so special?]
-The crops blessed by Demera make you healthy and cure diseases just by eating them. My wife had dementia, but now she’s fine!
– I was cured of a long-standing heart condition and can now run 100 meters in 6 seconds!
It’s all nonsense, but as the screen transitions the video shows a sick dog running around after eating rice, a dying cancer patient is cured, etc.
[All of this is possible for one reason: the Pantheon of Ten Thousand Gods served by His Majesty Leon Dragonia, Lionheart King of the Pantheon Guild].
-Demera!
-Hail, Lionheart!
-Long live the other gods of the pantheon!
“”…….””
Eventually, the video was viewed by the Association staff in the Hunter Division but they didn’t speak until a few seconds after the video ended.
“……Who made this?”
“…Isn’t it His Majesty Leon?”
“You think he’s a youtuber?”
“……Did one of the deputies make this?”
It was weird. Why would he make a video like this in the first place, let alone an overly high quality video?
Isn’t it a bad commercial? The comments were similar.
-What is this, a commercial?
-What a waste of talent.
-Isn’t he the survivor that’s hot these days? He captured Cheongju Gate.
-You’re a joke. Even though I’m a foreigner ignorant of the Internet, can I steal this?
-What’s more, it’s been translated into 104 languages. Did some crazy Payne make it?
It was a blatant , and the gods are being invoked.
Even the cheesy commercials they pay for on current affairs programs these days aren’t this blatant and illogical.
Eating rice cures cancer? A goddess blessed the land?
These are the kind of things that would be ridiculed as nonsense.
The problem is that everything was absolutely true.
Eating rice really does cure cancer, and there were Association employees who saw the goddess… and at the center of it all is the Lionheart King from the Otherworld.
In other words, this is Leon’s video.
“Leon, I need to see him right now.”
What was he thinking? As Kim Jin-soo prepared to go out, he called Han Ha-ri.
“What are you thinking?”
………
……
…
In Leon’s penthouse, Yakt Spinner pulled his USB-C converted prosthetic arm away from the laptop.
“Lord Yappy, are you done with my laptop?”
Yakt Spinner nodded as he returned Han Ha-ri’s laptop.
[Operation Marketing Phase One successful. Moving to Phase Two. Network hacking in progress.]

chapters.title: Chapter 26: Marketing (2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Marketing (2)
The Manshinjeon YouTuber channel has garnered quite a bit of attention on the internet.
It had ultra-high definition and impeccable professional workmanship but the only problem is that it contained the name of Leon, the survivor of the Cheongju Gate raid.
-There’s a lot of bullshit in this video.
-Eating rice will cure cancer? It doesn’t make any sense.
Of course, a mix of commercials and interviews didn’t make people believe in God.
And there was still no official certification from the Association so naturally people had to pass it off as funny.
“Your Majesty, we have to take the video down!”
Chief Kim Jin-soo saw the video and immediately came looking for Leon, who had confirmed with Ha-ri that he wasn’t in the penthouse, so he came all the way to the Naju Plains where the simple guild building had been erected.
“Chief, please have some barley tea.”
“Uh, thank you.”
He sipped the barley tea that Ha-ri offered and calmed his nerves.
“No, who posted that video in the first place?”
“Lord Spinner.”
“Lord Spinner?”
Kim Jin-soo’s gaze flicked to Yakt Spinner…Yappy…who was using a laptop in the corner.
That killing machine made that video? How the hell?
Leon’s thoughts were the same.
