Seeing this, Chief Kim Jin-soo had a puzzled look on his face. He couldn’t help but realize how reckless an order it was to charge into that horde of demons, but the cadets obeyed dutifully.
And most of all, Kim Jin-soo is stunned by the blinding barrage of system messages.
‘What are these enhancement traits, giving all the Hunters commander and higher buffs?’
Meanwhile, the trainees, marching steadfastly forward instead of fleeing, caught the eye of the demons and dozens of demons charged toward them.
“Ah, demon dogs!”
“Coming this way!”
Bloodhounds, commonly referred to as demon dogs, were human-sized demons and they lunged at the huddled masses of shields and arrows, breathlessly hoping for the best.
-Bang!
-Bang!
Chief Kim Jin-soo intuitively knew that the charge would break through the shields. But…….
“Block them!”
“Hold on!”
The trainees withstood the four-legged beast’s physical assault. Not just one or two outstanding ones, but all of them.
‘The Blood Hound’s charge that is too much for even a B-rank Hunter?’
Rank B tanks have unique skills that help them tank but these D-rank Hunters don’t have such a skill, and they’ve managed to block the Demon Hounds’ charge with their shields.
“Counterattack!”
At Leon’s command, the trainees stabbed their swords through the gaps in the shields and their swords easily pierced the demon dogs’ flesh.
-Keeeeeeek!
-Thud!
The leading Demon Hounds fell in a heap, but then another wave of demons arrived, they were Greatswords, wielding swords taller than a person.
“Block!”
The Hunters blocked the Demon Hounds’ charge, then Lesser demons charged the shield wall with frenzied strikes, but it held.
Leon raised his sword and shouted.
“‘harge!”
The cadets hurriedly raised their shields and charged forward, staying close to the Greatswords and giving the enemy no room to swing their greatswords.
“Push!”
-Thud!
After Four weeks of frantic practice the Hunters pushed the demons back with an instantaneous explosive push.
“Stab!”
From here on out, it was a mechanical repetition of motions: block, push, and stab. There was nothing quite like hand-to-hand combat in anti-infantry warfare.
As the rampaging demons were sliced and diced, a hulking demon emerged.
“Demon troll!”
“Demon troll!”
A medium-sized monster with a body the size of a house and a club that must have been two meters long appeared and the trainees’ pupils trembled as they realized that they were no match for it.
“Don’t back down! Stay in formation and hold your ground!”
Leon’s voice roused them. His presence was all they needed to ‘hold their ground’.
-Countering heavy objects. Sniping commenced.
It was then that a minimalist machine gun opened fire with a mechanical voice.
-Toadadadadadadadad!
A bullet fired from the fuselage of a Holy Knight is a holy attack in itself.
“Lord Yappy?!”
“Why is Lord Yappy here?”
Regardless of the Hunters’ reactions, the Demon Troll, which had been charging with terrifying momentum, slowed down in pain as Yappy’s holy machine gun round had shredded its knee.
“Kaaaaaaaah!”
But the troll didn’t stop its momentum and raised its club. Trolls are at least Class B…their mass even makes them Class A in terms of difficulty.
There’s no way D-rank Hunters would be able to stop a boss-level entity from coming out of that yellow gate──
“Ugh…!” Koo Dae-sung raised his shield. It protected his teammate’s right shoulder. The Hunters, whose ears were bleeding, naturally clustered their shields around Koo Dae-sung.
-Bang!
Koo Dae-sung and the other trainees felt their bodies being pushed backwards as the insurmountable difference in mass penetrated their defenses and shocked them.
‘Huh?’
But a common question flashed through the minds of the trainees who had blocked the troll’s blow.
‘This is lighter than His Majesty’s charge?’
The difference in strength must be four times.
In the past four weeks, they hadn’t blocked a single one of Leon’s charges and the slightest slip of his foot would send them soaring into the air.
[Strongest Charger]
Compared to him, a troll’s swing would make the trainees’ defense stagger!
“Good block!”
Meanwhile, Leon, who had already approached the troll’s back, swung his holy sword with a flick, and the troll’s head was sliced off as if it were tofu.
-Kiiii…!
-Kyaak…!
As the trolls, who had been their secret weapon, died in such a ridiculous manner, the momentum of the demons subsided. The defenders, on the other hand, gained momentum.
The demons, demoralized, took notice and began to retreat as the demon trolls had been ‘annihilated’.
-Kiui… dead.
-Troll… really dead.
For demons, death is not the end. They are immortal creatures who take on bodies and play in the material world.
When they died, they merely returned to the spirit realm, losing their material vessel.
The troll that had just died, however, had not gone through the process of disappearing into the spirit world. It was sucked into Leon’s Holy Grail and ‘vanished’.
“They’re backing off!”
“We won! We won!”
As they rejoiced in their survival, a rider approached Leon and the Hunters.
Apparently a commander or knight by the state of his armor, he first bows his head in thanks.
“Thank you, for coming to save our Spero Kingdom, warriors!”
The Hunters each checked their system windows at his words.
[The Spero Kingdom is being invaded by demons, defend the kingdom from the invasion of the demons]
Time remaining: 1 week
“Is this a quest…….?”
“Demons…do you mean Greater Demons?”
“It can’t be a Greater Demon, there’s no way a Greater Demon would come out of the Yellow Gate!”
The Hunters were confused, and some insisted on exiting the gate immediately. But…….
“What, the gate is gone?”
“What happened… is this a fluctuation gate?”
“No way!”
The Hunters’ faces hardened. The joy of victory was gone in an instant, replaced by despair.
“Quiet! Don’t be silly!”
Leon’s voice drifted over them. The Lionheart King’s aura, that lifts the morale of his soldiers by his mere presence, brought the half-collapsed Hunters to their feet.
“Lord Spinner, what brings you here?”
-Observations. A third party has entered.
Yappy displayed a hologram of his observations as a figure in robes, not Leon or the Hunters, used some sort of invisibility spell and was only visible in infrared.
“Is he up to something?”
-Lack of evidence.
“Is there anyone who can explain the current situation?”
Koo Dae-sung cautiously raised his hand.
“This is a fluctuation gate.”
“What is that?”
“It’s an anomaly in the gate…To put it simply, the difficulty of the gate is rising rapidly, and you can’t leave until you clear it.”
Leon looked at the gate, which had disappeared unlike the orc gate, and realized that the way out was blocked.
“Hmm…….”
Leon was surprised that something like this would happen to the cadets during their graduation exam.
Was it a coincidence? He didn’t know.
As Leon pondered, the Hunters’ complexions darkened in real time.
Normally, the gate was based on the difficulty of the pre-measurement, and it was difficult for the right group of Hunters to respond to the sudden increase in difficulty.
It’s safe to say that once a variable gate pops up, the Hunters inside are doomed.
They’re stuck in a gate with an infinitesimal survival rate.
‘Still…….’
Despite this, there is only one reason for them not to panic: the presence of the Lionheart King in front of them.
“Your Majesty, Your Majesty… do you have a plan?”
When the attention of the anxious Hunters was focused, Leon spoke with a calm expression to prevent them from despairing.
“We’ll attack. The quest said to defeat the Demon Lord.”
“Greater Demon…or maybe an Archdemon.”
“Hmph…! This Lionheart King has slaughtered two Archdemons and over thirty Greater Demons. Do you doubt this king’s strength?”
“Ooooo…….”
“Yes, Your Majesty has three demon-related traits alone!”
[Terror of Demonic Species]
[Demon Lord Slayer]
[Greatest Demon Slayer]
These were the only Demon-related Traits that were confirmed by the system message but the Hunters’ faces brightened with hope.
“…….”
Leon didn’t bother to mention that the battle was fought in his world, a world filled with divinity.
He didn’t tell them that in his current form, he was no match for a Demon Lord(Archdemon).
They could only lean on the hope that was in themselves since a knight must remain steadfast at all times.
* * * *
Meanwhile, Reynald Shelman, the mastermind behind the transformation of the Gwangju Gate into the Daemon Gate, watched as Leon repelled the demons.
“In one blow, a mid-level demon, a Demon Troll…….”
No matter how much the Hunters distracted it, decapitating such a tough troll with a single blow…Above all, the troll’s demise was a shocking sight.
Demons are immortal creatures, they live in the spirit realm, and their physical manifestations are merely shells.
They are more like remote-controlled drones, and their destruction doesn’t kill them. However, the Lionheart King’s sword forces the ‘death’ of the beings it has slain.
It travels up the mental link and forces ‘death’, meaning that the pilot of the drone dies when it is destroyed.
He could see why the Archdemon beyond the Wisdom Gem had fled in terror.
[Heh… Heh… Heh!]
“Great One?”
Even after witnessing such a terrifying existence, a dismal laughter could be heard coming from the Wisdom Gem.
[Weakened! Weakened! Lionheart, Leon Dragonia Lionheart, you’re just a man after all! Keeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!]
Weakened? Him?
The one who destroyed a Demon Troll that wasn’t even a normal troll with a single blow?
Apparently amused by Reynald’s questioning, the Wisdom Gem giggled and replied.
[Hee hee hee, if he had the strength of his prime, he would have annihilated about a thousand demons in a single strike, and if he had enough strength, he would have unsealed the Holy Sword]
“Holy sword… you mean?”
The sword emitted a brief but brilliant light when it slashed at the Demon Troll’s throat. Such power, and it hasn’t even been unsealed?
[Heh heh heh… Even such a strike, it’s only slightly stronger than a Holy Knight, so he’ll be defeated!]
As the Archdemon beyond the Wisdom Gem rejoiced, Reynald spoke cautiously.
“Great Existence…Then shall we perform a ritual for you to descend?”
[What?!]
The Wisdom Gem was puzzled.
[No! No matter how weak he is, he’s still the Lionheart King! He’s insane!]
You said he’s weakened…….
Reynald swallowed his complaint and asked.
“And what about the one…who’ll handle him?”
[Heeheehee…! The Demon Lord of this place.]
“The Demon Lord…….”
Reynald confirmed the existence of a Demon Lord.
“No way…There really is a Demon Lord?”
If there was such a thing, it was definitely a must-win. In the history of the Thirty Years War since the Cataclysm, the Demon Lord was a monster among monsters that had slaughtered countless S-class Hunters…
[The energy of the Gate is not enough for a Demon Lord to descend, but…there is an evil spirit here that has been appointed as a Lord.]
“Oh, oh…….”
Reynald swallowed hard at those words. Humans who serve demons often wish to become demons themselves at the end of their roles.
They aspire to the immortality of demons and ambition to become Archdemons themselves.
[Heh, heh, heh… there’s an existence here that those ugly, lustful demons have been working on for a hundred years…! That would be enough to kill the weakened Lionheart King!]
For that, Reynald needed to move around. He would use the fleeting hope of the Spero Kingdom to awaken the Demon Lord.

chapters.title: Chapter 39: The Kingdom in the Gate
chapters.content:
Chapter 39: The Kingdom in the Gate
Spero Kingdom, this peaceful, millennia-old kingdom has been plunged into a catastrophe.
The demons invaded and one city after another fell, leaving only the last royal castle, where the humans are fighting a losing battle.
“It’s a theme.”
“A theme?”
At a bar inside Spero Castle Koo Dae-sung said.
“Come to think of it, all the gates had their own scenery.”
“Yes, there are field hunting type gates like the Seoul Station Gate, and then there are dungeon type gates, and then there are NPC quest type gates like the Orc Gate.”
Leon has experienced four gates since coming to Earth.
The first was a dungeon-type gate in the Hunan Plains where after defeating the boss monster Dulahan, the gate closed.
The second was the Cheongju Gate. It was a cyberpunk-themed world where Yakt Spinner was trying to stop the unsealing of the Wisdom Gem.
Third was Samjeon Station Gate in Seoul where the theme was to help an orc tribe to become the leaders of the plains but Leon had slaughtered them all with his ignorant charge.
This fourth gate was similar to the orc-infested Three Realms gates they’d been through.
“This gate is a little different from the orc gate.”
Koo said, checking a system window that Leon couldn’t see.
“There is a condition attached to completing the quest.”
“Condition?”
“Yes, a time limit.”
[The Kingdom of Spero is being invaded by demons. Defend the kingdom from the invasion of demons]
Time limit: 1 week.
That’s right, the quest condition was to defend the kingdom for one week.
“In other words, we only need to ‘defend’ the kingdom for a week, and then the gate will be closed.”
“That’s strange…I’ve heard that the gate showed signs of a dungeon break phenomenon. After a certain period of time, it cracks and the monsters inside jump out?”
It’s not just monsters. The overflowing miasma inside will spill out, polluting the ground and making it uninhabitable.
The monsters inside the gates that are maintained without closing are constantly being cleaned.
“Yes, for a normal gate, that’s the way it should be. But these ‘specified quest gates’ can be closed as long as you clear the quest, even if you don’t clean the inside.”
That was the proof, backed up by the data humanity had accumulated since the Cataclysm.
Even fluctuation gates occurred from time to time, so Koo Dae-sung should not be wrong.
“Then… Did you say Chief Kim Jin-soo?”
Leon glanced at Kim Jin-soo, who was in the middle of his meal, never touching the food in front of him.
“Yes, Your Majesty!”
As an employee of the Association, he was originally brought in to witness the growth of the trainees and re-measure their ratings. And there was a condition.
“Originally, this king was not supposed to participate. However, given the urgency of the situation, will our ratings be altered by the presence of this king and Lord Spinner?”
“Ummm…….”
Originally, he was supposed to assess the abilities of the Hunters alone since Leon’s inclusion would make things too easy.
Chief Kim Jin-soo hadn’t expected the D-ranks to grow after only four weeks of training, but today’s battle made him reevaluate them.
They definitely grew. In just four weeks… with no unique skills, they were at least a C-rank… and thanks to Leon’s enhanced traits, they performed like B- rank tanks.
He didn’t know what they were eating, but their physical strength and physical abilities had increased dramatically.
“Hmm… I don’t think it’s a problem, I have that much discretion.”
“Oh…!”
With the approval of the Association staff, the Hunters’ spirits rose. However, he was still resolute in his determination when he told them that they would be evaluated based on their performance.
“One more thing.”
Leon’s words drew everyone’s attention.
“What do you think about quest conditions changing and hidden quest elements, as it happened in the Orc Gate, do you think there will be any such elements in this Gate?”
-Hmm…….
-A hidden quest…….
-Wouldn’t we have to do something as ridiculous as we did with Orcs?
They first saw hidden quests in the Orc gate since Leon’s actions, which destroyed the premise of the quest, changed the quest itself.
“It’s… possible, I suppose. Mr. Kim, have you ever heard of a similar case?”
“Uhm… It’s not like there aren’t any, because anything can happen in the Gates.”
Koo Dae-sung became uneasy.
“…Your Majesty, do you have any ideas…….?”
“I’m thinking of slaying the Demon Lord.”
“What…!?”
The meaning of his words was clear. While slaughtering all the demons that couldn’t be counted, they would also try to capture the Demon Lord that was responsible for the invasion.
This was even bigger than the Orc Gate. At least back then, they had Yappy, the guild’s weapon of mass destruction.
“Your Majesty, are you still willing to take such a dangerous path…….?”
“Don’t worry. I don’t intend to overwhelm you. Even this king knows better.”
The Hunters were relieved to hear that.
Leaving the walls of the castle and the army of the Kingdom of Spero behind to attack the demon with only 50 Hunters would be suicide.
“In honor of your victory, rest well today, for tomorrow you will have the burden of meeting the commander of this kingdom.”
“Yes, Your Majesty!”
Leon left the Hunters behind and went upstairs to the room the Kingdom Knight had prepared for him. There he summoned the Holy Grail and drained the energy of the Demon Troll he killed today.
The Holy Grail has the power to destroy evil and turn its energy into holy power. It’s one of the reasons Leon was able to slaughter over ten million demons in his world.
‘I didn’t think it could absorb the leader of the beasts.’
He absorbed one of Gokrok’s arms and used the energy to restore the Grail’s functionality.
The Daemon Trolls were not quite as powerful, but he was able to connect to the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods without difficulty.
[Leon, my first knight]
“Arianna.”
He couldn’t summon the gods, but he could talk to the gods of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods in his heart for a moment.
[Did you feel it?]
“Yes, this gate has an otherworldly energy.”
Leon had only felt the strange energy after the battle.
“I noticed it too late.”
[You, a living, flesh-and-blood being, would not have noticed it. It is an aura that blends into this world so naturally]
What it meant was simple.
There was an existence in this world that possessed such immense power that even the Lionheart King could feel it naturally.
“It should be the Demon Lord.”
[An existence with that much power would have a more intense aura. This is something…different]
Leon slaughtered two Demon Lords(Archdemons).
Together with the Grail Knights, he and the gods had succeeded in slaying the Demon Horde, whose power was so maddening.
Malus, Lord of Chaos and Dothraddon, Lord of Pleasure, each of these monsters could end a world.
Their mere presence makes the world tremble, bringing screams and despair.
If a Lord-level demon were at this gate, lesser Hunters would despair despite the aura of the Lionheart.
[My knight, the gods of the Pantheon have a message for you]
“Your knight listens.”
[Fle wishes to investigate this world. She must have sensed something]
“Fle herself?”
Leon recognized the divinity.
“She will need energy to descend.”
[Yeah, I don’t have to tell you the way, do I?]
Something more tangible is needed for a divine descent than simply possessing an incarnation, as in the case of Demera.
* * * *
The next morning, soldiers came to the inn where the Ten Thousand Gods Guild was staying.
“Lord Lionheart! Where is Lord Lionheart?”
Koo Dae-Sung, who had risen early in the morning, ran up the stairs to wake Leon.
“Your Majesty…! May your soldier see you──”
But Leon had already descended, fully dressed. Even though it was still early, his appearance had a cheerful glow.
“I must go to the palace.”
Koo Dae-Sung suddenly realized that Leon was indeed a different race from him.
“You must be Lord Lionheart?”
“Hmm, yes.”
Leon didn’t identify himself to the soldiers who came to him. After all, he was technically a knight.
“The Chancellor and the Captain-General wish to see you, sir. The carriage is ready, so let’s go to the palace.”
“Very well.”
It had been discussed yesterday, so Leon readily accepted.
Leon glanced back before climbing into the carriage.
“Lord Spinner, stand by. You’ll be in charge of the remaining trainees.”
-Yes.
“We’re also headed to the castle, and we can’t go without servants, so I’ll take three volunteers to serve as servants.”
After a moment of stunned silence, the Hunters, who knew from social experience that in times like this, they had to act quickly, stepped forward.
“Chief Kim Jin-soo!”
“Kim Do-han!”
“Koo Dae-sung!”
Others followed, but it was too late.
“Hmm, good. Open the door.”
Kim Jin-soo, who had a lot of work experience, rushed over and opened the carriage door.
He didn’t ask the common sense question, “Do I have to open the door for this royal personality?”
When they arrived at the royal palace, a servant bowed to them.
“Welcome, gentlemen. I’m Parco, chamberlain of the palace, and I’m here to escort you.”
As Parco led the way inside the palace, where all sorts of art and decorations were elegantly placed the hunters wondered if this was what it would be like to visit a royal palace in old Europe.
“Hmm, the owner of the palace must have great taste.”
“Hoo-hoo, you have good taste.”
Chamberlain Parco responded to Leon’s praise and explained the history of the palace so that the guests wouldn’t get bored.
“This palace, the Royal Palace of Spero, has a long history. It has hosted many queens, from the founding Queen Fiora to the current Queen Beatrice.”
-Queens.
-Queens from the beginning? It must be a matriarchal society.
-Shhh. Her Majesty is looking this way!
The three of them whispered to each other at the chamberlain’s words but Leon glared at them and spoke up in a firm voice.
“In what country is it proper for a commoner to pry into the affairs of royalty?”
“I apologize.”
Leon quickly apologized to the chamberlain.
“I’m sorry, my friend, they were never taught proper etiquette. The situation is urgent, so I’ve brought in people who don’t know their manners.”
“Hehe, it’s okay, you’re an outsider, so it’s to be expected.”
The chamberlain shrugged it off, but Leon stared at the three of them with a hard gaze and clicked his tongue as if to say, “Listen.”
“Tsk tsk… Even if you’re unlearned, there’s something to be said for noticing.”
The three of them had to keep their mouths shut until they reached the throne room.
When they arrived Leon was greeted by several bureaucrats.
Knights and officials stood on either side of a large carpet, with what appeared to be a throne at the end of the carpet covered by a tent.
A silhouette could barely be seen through the canopy, and it took the form of a slender woman.
“Lord Lionheart.”
Leon and his companions were well known in the castle for yesterday’s battle.
As a mysterious group that had performed heroically against a demonic army, if Leon hadn’t identified himself as a knight, people would have assumed they were a group of mercenaries.
“Hmph, you must be Sir Lionheart from the battle at the gates.”
The first to speak was a middle-aged man in colorful clothing with an impressive mustache.
“I am Duke Aquium, Lord Chancellor of the realm.”
Chancellor of the realm, needless to say, a man of the court. He was about to recite his proposal to make Leon a knight of the realm for leading them to victory in battle until Leon opened his mouth.
“I’ll start by greeting the queen.”
Leon made a beeline for the queen’s throne, but two men stood in his way: Duke Aquium and an elderly knight, presumably a general.
“How can an outsider, no matter how meritorious, come so close to your Majesty’s throne?”
The Chancellor’s words were echoed by the three men who had followed Leon.
“You have a point.”
“He could suddenly turn around and try to assassinate us.”
Leon was an otherworldly royal with a different sense of common sense from Earth, but he wasn’t a closed-minded person who denied what made sense. So he wasn’t offended by the chancellor’s refusal, but──
“I can’t stand it.”
“What?”
“Your Majesty, I am Leon Dragonia Lionheart, Lionheart King of the Lionheart Kingdom, and I will do what must be done, even if I know it is disrespectful.”
“No, what does he mean by that, Captain, and why don’t you get him out of here──”
At that moment, Leon grabbed the chancellor’s face.
“Now, wait…!”
This is some kind of déjà vu──
-Crack!
The Lionhearted King’s arms tightened, and the chancellor head snapped around as it rotated 1080 degrees and settled back down.
It was instant death.
“…….”
“…….”
It happened so fast, and it was so shocking, that it took the people a while to recover.
After three seconds of unresponsiveness, Leon ripped the arm of the chancellor from his limp body.
It was rare to see a man’s arm ripped off with pure evil.
‘What the hell?’
What did he not like this time?

chapters.title: Chapter 40: The Demon Slayer
chapters.content:
Chapter 40: The Demon Slayer
The chancellor’s head spun three times, it was instant death. Plus his arm was torn off.
“…….”
“…….”
The reactions are slow and in the face of an emergency that far exceeds their common sense, they freeze.
“What did you do…….?”
Someone said and at the same time, the soldiers pointed their spears.
“You!”
Leon remained calm in the face of the immediate danger. He didn’t stop at turning the chancellor’s head and ripping out his arm, but kicked him in the knee where he hadn’t yet fallen.
“You, you…!”
“How long are you going to hide your identity, filthy fiend, do you really think you can hide from this Lionheart King’s eyesight?”
The shivering corpse stirred, then peeled back its skin to reveal a hideous, haggard creature.
-Kiiiiii…!
After shedding its human skin, the creature’s head resembled a wart, and its scythe-like arms flailed about.
It was an arm that had been hastily regenerated thanks to Leon’s earlier removal.
“A demon?”
It was then that the dozens of soldiers and nobles who had gathered in the realm had shed their outer shells, revealing their hideous forms.
“Huh…!”
“Demons!”
The non-demons were horrified by the sudden appearance of the demons. If they were slow to react, they would be wiped out.
“Don’t flounder, you lowly things!”
The Lionhearted King’s furious yell was deafening to the soldiers and demons alike.
“Unite! Fight as one!”
At Leon’s words, the soldiers rushed to unite while the nobles and bureaucrats retreated behind him in a huff.
“Kieh-eh-eh-eh!”
A demon whose eardrums burst at the holy roar rushed forward, swinging a blade-like arm, but the blade was caught by Leon’s arm.
“Chiiii?”
The demon struggles with the unmoving arm but Leon pulls harder and harder, and the arm is ripped off in a pool of green blood.
“Keeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!”
The demon’s howl of agony didn’t last a second as the holy sword had decapitated it.
As Leon cut the demon’s throat in one swift motion, Chief Kim Jin-soo shouted.
“Raise your shield!”
Unlike Leon, who could summon his holy sword, they entered the throne room unarmed. Instead, they tried to pick up the dead soldier’s weapons and armor.
“Kie-e-e-e!”
It was then that a mantis demon attacked Team Leader Kim Do-han as he picked up a weapon but just as the sharp blade was about to cut into him, a flash of light pierced the demon’s throat.
“Thank…….”
It was not Leon who wielded the sword but an old man, the kingdom’s grand marshal, who wiped the blade clean of the demon’s green blood and barked out instructions.
“Demons have infiltrated the palace. Kill them all!”
Soldiers and knights joined in, and one by one, the demons were slain. But the demons didn’t just die.
-Kiiiieeeeeeeeeeeee!
-Kyaaaaaaaaaaah!
A dense mist of black energy rose from the demons’ corpses, clinging to their skin and disturbing their minds.
-Ew! Hmph?!
-Ahhhh! My head, my head hurts…!
The soldiers scream in pain.
Chief Kim Jin-soo and Team Leader Kim Do-han also held their heads, shivering while Koo Dae-sung was the only one holding on in a cold sweat.
“The power of corruption. So, the demons at this gate are its minions.”
The demons, on the other hand, were unable to breach Leon’s mental barrier. His powerful ego and absolute faith in the divine are beyond their reach.
“Let me show you the grace of God.”
Leon took out the Holy Grail and splashed the holy water into the air, clearing the fog as divine grace took hold, and the evil was driven away.
“Ugh…….”
“What the…….”
What the non-demons could barely see was Leon with a gloriously brilliant holy sword and grail.
In a room full of evil spirits, he shone with more layers than anyone else and some fell to their knees and shed tears at his noble presence.
“Greetings, Hero.”
“You are a hero…….”
As they worshiped, Leon moved toward the Queen, who remained silent amid the commotion.
“Stop.”
The Grand Marshal stopped him with his sword pointed at him but Leon did not blame him.
“I understand your loyalty, but in this time of emergency, you shouldn’t put royalty first.”
“Only the Queen can judge my loyalty.”
“You have a point. But…….”
Leon snapped his fingers at the cool blade of the sword pointed at him.
-Bang!
Leon flicked the blade, and the blade bent under the enormous impact, causing the Grand Marshal to tremble as well.
The power of Leon was truly beyond human and he spoke to the Grand Marshal as he grabbed his trembling hand.
“I ask no questions, I make no judgments. It is the queen’s job to decide, and you know it too.”
“Pfft… Her Majesty is in a daze and cannot make a judgment. She has entrusted that power to the Chancellor… and now that he is dead, I, the Grand Marshal, have full authority.”
“Hmm…….”
Leon stared for a moment at the Queen beyond the tent, who remained silent. However, he was soon convinced that she was not a Fallen (beings who turn into demons) and spoke to the Warlord.
“There is already an aura of the Fallen in this castle, and we will have to clean it up quickly.”
“Are you sure of that?”
“A king does not speak falsehoods.”
“…….”
The warlord thought for a moment, then spoke cautiously.
“What do you want?”
“Command of the soldiers and the right to execute rogue servants. I will deal with your incompetence.”
The Great Marshal turned to face the queen for a moment and since the silhouette of the queen leaned against the throne was unresponsive the decision rested with him.
“……How?”
“Gather all the men of this city in the square.”
* * * *
Koo Dae-sung and Kim Jin-soo were dumbfounded as they watched the kingdom’s troops bend to Leon’s instructions.
“NPCs…were they always this cooperative?”
“In a theme like this, the Hunters aren’t even more than soldiers…….”
Although they were called NPCs for convenience, their intelligence and autonomy were no different from those of modern Earthlings.
If anything, they were more authoritarian and wary of outsiders.
Soldiers, bureaucrats, and nobles bobbed and weaved at Leon’s command.
“There’s something different about the king after all…….”
Natural charisma, a noble spirit and unquestioned authority.
Leon was royalty by birth and would act the same way anywhere. He’s used to being in charge and leading people.
“I thought about it a lot when he was feeding us sugar water, but……we should stay in the Ten Thousand Gods Guild.”
Koo Dae-sung nodded at Team Leader Kim Do-han’s words.
While the Hunters were talking, a large number of citizens gathered in the square. Tens of thousands of the city’s citizens, young and old alike, had gathered together.
Leon stepped to the podium.
“I am Leon Dragonia Lionheart, Lionheart King of the Lionheart Kingdom, authorized by the Grand Marshal of the Spero Kingdom.”
The crowd roared as the foreign knight introduced himself but Leon spoke quickly.
“There are those among you who are demon-possessed and corrupted, and they plan to riot from inside to match the invasion from outside.”
The citizens were agitated and confused by his words.
“But there is no need to worry. This king is an agent of the gods who has slaughtered countless demons and has a way of identifying the Fallen.”
“What way?”
“I’ll let him show you.”
Leon gestured and the soldiers blocked off the square and began stacking wood as the citizens grew anxious.
“What the hell are they doing?!”
Leon was not deterred by the commoners’ words and he pointed his glowing holy sword at the oiled lumber.
“God of war and flame, rain down your fire upon your warriors.”
Sparks flew from the holy sword. It was brief, but it was enough to ignite the oiled wood.
The timbers stacked in a circle spread in shovelfuls, creating a prison that enclosed the entire square.
“Now, those who are not evil, those who are not corrupt, those who are not heretics, prove your purity by throwing yourself into the flames!”
“……?”
The citizens were momentarily stunned by Leon’s booming announcement, and they weren’t the only ones. Even the soldiers in the circle were dumbfounded by Leon’s command.
-Kaaaaaaaah…!
The flames roared and gained momentum as they consumed the fiercely burning wood.
“You’re crazy!”
“He’s trying to kill us all!”
It was a natural reaction and even Koo Dae-sung and Kim Jin-soo must have been wondering, “Is he crazy?” at that moment.
Leon didn’t let the commoners’ outcry go unanswered.
“Will you shut up, you fools!?”
Leon’s words effectively silenced them.
“Demons infect and deceive people with their malice. If necessary, I will kill all of you to stop the spread of evil.”
Of course, no one would kill an entire city to kill a lurking demon but Leon was saying that he was capable of doing so.
“Pass through the divine flame and prove your purity. It’s simple.”
“Crazy…….”
“A madman. The Great Marshal has brought a madman.”
I frighteningly agree.
Chief Kim swallowed hard.
“You always have to show the people in person. This king will have to do the hard work.”
Leon stormed down, grabbing the protesting citizen and the soldier blocking him by the scruff of the neck.
The two panicked, but Leon threw them into the flames.
-Crrrrrrrrrrr!
The screams of agony echoed horribly as it was burned alive.
“What?”
But there was someone walking out of the flames. It was a protesting citizen.
“What, you’re okay?”
“Then what was that scream?”
“Hey, look!”
The citizens’ eyes turned to the soldier who had been thrown.
A demon whose flesh had burned away, tearing at its shell and revealing its ugly true colors was there instead proving that the soldier was a Fallen.
“This sacred flame burns only evil beings. Give thanks to Petos, god of war and flame, and cross the flames chanting his name.”
With that realization, the citizens rushed through the flames.
One hesitated, but Leon approached him.
“Why aren’t you trying to walk through the fire?”
“What? It’s because…….”
“Are you a degenerate, a heretic, a sociopath, or do you wish to fall by the sword of this king?”
“Oh, no, I’m going right now!”
The citizen ran, panting and just then, a child approached Leon.
“Hehe, knight, I want you to buy flowers──”
Before he could finish his sentence, he was kicked and sent flying. The child’s body rolled across the ground again and again before bursting into flames.
“Your Majesty, what…!”
“Listen, you infiltrating evils! Your foul stench is too vibrant to disguise your purity.”
-Kie-E-E-E!
A miniature demon rising from the corpse of a child covered in blood and the small demon bared its hideous teeth──
A bolt from nowhere pierces the Small Demon’s forehead. Immediately, its evil energy is absorbed by Leon’s Holy Grail, which means it has been destroyed.
-Enemy defeated confirmed. Changing sniping point.
A minimalist spider knight moves between the buildings surrounding the square.
“I will punish you. I will tear your souls apart.”
Leon raises his sword, and from all sides, the Fallen tear off their shells and reveal their true colors. There were more than five hundred of them.
-Human bastards. How dare you speak without knowing……?
-You think you’re going to die a nice death──
“Demon themeEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE──────!!!!”
-My ears! My ears! My ears!
Only the eardrums of demons burst from the roar of the divine lion that it’s activated only when a living demigod is truly enraged.
The noise was indeed three hundred decibels, over a hundred times the threshold to be categorized as a shockwave and no longer noise!
Of course, it was only for demons.
Leon’s teeth grinded together as an uncontrollable rage bubbled up inside him. He feels insulted by the maggots, who have been ‘hostile’ to him for so long.
“Scum…maggots…parasitic on human emotions…!”
The gnashing of teeth and the raspy voice are divine as the bodies of the demons near him were being disintegrated in real time.
“You dare to infiltrate the gaps between humans, weave your way through the ranks, and stand before me. You dare to stare at the Lionheart King, for you are not worthy.”
Leon shuddered, unable to control the shiver that ran through his body.
“Parasites walking around on two legs pretending to be humans? Forming packs? Pretending to be soldiers? Do you think I will allow this? You will die, screaming in agony. Your cries and despair will echo to the heavens.”
-Crazy Asshole.
-…I think we got the wrong one.
The Fallen shuddered, sensing that something had gone terribly wrong.
“Scream more, scream more, for that is the only way you will please this King!”
The battle in the square was over in less than an hour while Reynald Shelman and the Wisdom Gem watched from afar.
“Looks like planting……Fallen doesn’t work, Great One.”
[Ahhh…that bastard…that murderous bastard…….]
Reynald heartily agreed with the words.

chapters.title: Chapter 41: Shut Up, You Demon
chapters.content:
Chapter 41: Shut Up, You Demon
The demons were easily dispatched.
The Demons of Corruption, who specialize in infiltration in the first place, have low combat capabilities. Add to that their inability to flee outside of the Divine Flame, and you have a one-sided hunt.
‘Still, it’s a huge number. If this many saboteurs were working from within…….’
Koo Dae-Sung realized that this quest itself had a ridiculous difficulty level.
With this many demons lurking inside, would they be able to deal with them even if an A-rank raiding party came?
Koo Dae-Sung didn’t think so.
“Of course…….”
Leon Dragonia Lionheart was a king from another world with a completely different common sense than modern Earth, a misguided royalty who has no intention of adapting to Earth, but rather forcing it to adapt to him.
But this man’s methods always get results.
What choice do we, the common folk, have but to trust this man, or better yet, bet on him?
This was something that even the Hunters themselves admitted, let alone the ancients.
After all, they had grown to the point where they were able to fight against a demonic army when they were only D-ranks. But──
“Team Leader Kim, isn’t that a little… wrong?”
“……Hmm.”
The Hunters shook their heads as they watched the tragedy unfold in the square.
* * * *
The demons inside the castle have been decimated but the citizens are in shock. They were horrified that there were Fallen among them, and terrified that someone next to them might be one.
Most of all, they feared the demons clad in human flesh.
“Pull them out!”
Leon felt the need to dilute their fears and as all the citizens watched, he hung one of the captured demons in the center of the square.
“Fear not, citizens of the Spero Kingdom. For as long as the Lionheart King exists, these demons cannot transgress against you.”
The citizens stared at the hanging demon but their gazes were still filled with more fear.
The hanging demon basked in the fear directed at him and let out a ghastly laugh.
“Hahahahaha… Don’t think this is the end. You will be doomed. The powers of corruption will turn you into──”
“Shut up, you demon!”
Leon’s blade slammed into the demon’s skull, crushing it.
Its skull collapsed, one of its eyeballs popped out, and its chin dropped to the ground, making it look ugly.
“Look at this ugly beast! These depraved powers are responsible for tempting you and causing you to fear! It is their fault that you are hungry, that you are sick, that there is discord in your family, that you fell this morning, that you are unable to marry, that you have lost money gambling!”
“Why is it my fault──?”
“Shut up, you demon!”
“Aaahhhhh!”
This time, the right ear was ripped out as the demon screamed and the citizens watched and questioned the appearance of such a demon.
-What, that demon is to blame for my mom’s illness?
-Is he to blame for my failed confession to Marilda?
-Was that asshole responsible for me losing money at the gambling house yesterday?!
“You bastard! Why is that my fault──?”
“Shut up, you demon!”
“Citizens striving for justice, demons are the ones who bring bad luck to your lives, for they are responsible for every misfortune in your lives, and your lack of knowledge of the right faith is also due to their interference.”
Ignorance is blamed on the demons. The demons were guilty, but they had no defense. If he opened his mouth, Leon’s violence would be unrelenting.
“But you have nothing to fear. For your sake, Petos, the god of war and flame, has sent down his sacred flame.”
Leon grasped the wood that was burning the plaza but the blazing flames didn’t scorch his skin in the slightest.
“There you are.”
“I, you mean me?”
“Yes, come out here.”
The young man is forced to step forward as Leon points at him and Leon hands him a piece of burning wood.
“Hold it.”
“Yes?”
“I won’t tell you twice.”
The young man hesitated, but remembered walking through these flames didn’t hurt unless you were a demon. Having experienced it once, he grasped the burning wood.
“Wow…….”
And as expected, the flames did not hurt the young man.
“Punish this demon with this. Until this demon meets the punishment he deserves.”
“Uh… that, that’s…….”
“You’re going to show mercy, are you actually sympathizing with the demon?”
“Oh, no, I’m saying that my father was killed by these demons too!”
“Then unleash your wrath, for the God of War delights in righteous indignation, and you have a duty to purge this vile beast!”
Gulping, the young man gripped the wood and stared at the demon. His legs trembled as the demon’s fierce eyes bore into him.
All you have to do is touch me with that thing. I’ll chase you to the ends of hell and kill you──!
Will you be a good boy and open your eyes!”
“What?!”
The demon’s teeth are knocked out by Leon’s fist, his skull is crushed, his eyeballs gouged out, his ears ripped off, and his teeth knocked out…it was almost comical.
“Hear me citizens! You have a right to punish this vile beast! Punish it! Make it suffer! Burn him alive!”
The burning wood was piled up; its sanctity was paled, but it would torment the demon all the more.
The young man beat the demon with burning wood and the demon bound by the ‘sacred wire’ was unable to resist.
“Kill the demon!”
“Kill the demon!”
The cheers of the citizens terrified the demon.
“You, you madmen, the curse of corruption is upon you──”
“Shut up, you demon!”
The demon tongue was ripped out of his mouth for his protest but the demon did not know that he was the luckiest demon alive because he was beaten to death by the citizens.
* * * *
In the dank, damp basement of the castle, demons were imprisoned.
Beltas, the demon of pleasure and depravity, shuddered at the screams echoing from the dank dungeons.
He had tortured and corrupted countless humans in his 34 years as a demon, but he never thought he would be in this position.
“Ugh… Uh, why can’t I get any strength in my hands?”
Beltas struggled to untie the ‘wires’ that bound his hands, but he could not move them.
-Oh!
The sound of iron legs pounding the stone floor grew closer.
-Crackle
The camera’s eyes stared at Beltas.
Although the minimalist size could be considered cute at first glance, Beltas knew better because the tiny little mechanical spider had slaughtered their kind.
“What, what!”
How does one corrupt a machine? It was a question Beltas could not answer for now.
Yappy said.
-Provide information.
“Ha! You think I’m going to listen to a mimic!”
He tried to sound amused, but the cold machine’s gaze only bore into him. Unnervingly so.
-No. 14. Uncooperative.
With those words, Yappy knocks on the iron gate, and armed soldiers open it and enter.
“Ha! Kill me if you must, for I will surely resurrect…what is that?”
Beltas face turned a deep shade of blue as he sensed an unusual aura coming from the water cistern the soldiers had brought with them.
The cistern was filled with diluted holy water from the Holy Grail.
-See Big Data. Reasonable conclusion.
Beltas swallowed the question that fluttered in his throat.
-The water knows the answer.
“What?”
In an instant, a wire was wrapped around Beltas neck. Yappy’s mechanical arm pulls on the coiled wire, and the demon’s face is plunged into the trough.
“Krrrrrrrrrrrrrr!!!”
Beltas screams in horror as his flesh melts away but rising bubbles replace his screams.
“Puhhh!”
Beltas face lifted as the wire around his neck gave way but his face melted into a hideous mess.
“You, you bastard, I am Beltas, the demon of pleasure and depravity, and you’ve done this to me-”
-Uncooperative.
“Uffu! Uffu! Ehhhhhhh!”
The bucket of diluted holy water was not enough to extinguish the demon. But the pain was certain.
“Kuheh!”
-Cooperative. A request to provide useful information under objective judgment.
“Now, wait.”
-Uncooperative.
“Help me.”
-Uncooperative.
-Crrrrrrrrrr!
“I’ll tell you, I’ll tell you anything, so please, no more holy water…!”
Only then did Yappy release his grip on the wire.
“That, but what should I say, I don’t know anything──”
-Uncooperative.
“Wait, I’ll talk. I’ll tell you whatever you want, whatever you want…… Stop, stop, please…….”
Beltas confessed everything he knew. How to corrupt humans, where, when, and how many mid-level demons were in place… everything he knew.
Yappy, who had been recording Beltas words without missing a single one, let out a cold mechanical sound.
-Prisoner number 14. Information text 30,564 characters. 9,104 characters short of the average text of prisoners one through thirteen, 39,667 characters.
“What? What’s that…….
-You could have divulged more information.
What the fuck?! You said average! And you know how much I said with text numbers!
-Calls into serious question the need for life support for prisoners.
“What do you want me to say?”
* * * * *
-Over. Synthesis of 32 informational texts. More than 89% similarity. Derived as reasonable truth.
Yappy’s report was indeed accurate and reasonable.
He tortured demons to get them to say anything, and then he found the information that matches each other.
The higher the match, the more accurate the information, which is then reported to Leon.
“Hmm, good to know. Good work, Lord Spinner.”
-Yup!
Leon was ready to use the organized information to kill the demons. He slaughtered hundreds of demons in the plaza, but those lesser demons won’t be enough for a divinity to descend.
He needs to kill at least five high-level demons before he can bring Goddess Fle down.
“Lord Spinner, what did you do with the demons once you had all the information?”
-Disposed of. Held at 127 decibels for 14 seconds. Very successful.
Yappy didn’t bother to mention that screams of agony resounded in the prison. He merely fulfilled the order, “Let them die in agony.”
-Square firing squad confirmed death. Peak 155 decibels. Citizens’ cheers 189 decibels.
Yappy played the demons’ screams.
-Keeeeeeeeeeeee!!!
-Keeeeeeeeeeeee!!!
“Hmm, the sound of justice done is always sweet to hear.”
With that, Leon entered the bedroom. Armed with this information, he would begin hunting the demons tomorrow morning.
For the past two hundred years, Leon has been on the trail of demons, hunting them down as they fled. He was a specialist in demon hunting.
None will escape the Lionheart King’s slaying.
‘My heart is racing.’
Leon lay in bed with his heart pounding. As he sniffed his pillow, he envisioned tomorrow’s brutal hunt for demons.
“Hmm…….”
His chest tightens, he can’t sleep and his hands and feet are shaking. It’s strange.
His heart is pounding, his head is boiling, and he feels like it’s about to explode.
‘Even while this king is asleep, the demons are breathing their foul breath on the world, aren’t they?’
At the thought of it, his anger soared.
-Your Majesty. Heart rate spiking. Dizzy spells. Chest pain. Difficulty breathing.
“Ugh…!”
Leon jerked to his feet. He couldn’t get back to sleep.
“Lord Spinner, I cannot bear the thought of these creatures living and breathing in the same world as me. What can I do about it?”
-Rapid Elimination.
“That’s a good idea, we should go out for the night!”
Leon feels no fatigue. The living demigod has infinite vitality, so he never tires, even after repeated battles.
It was the same with machines so Leon rushed out of the castle with Yappy.
It was the start of a brutal night for the demons.

chapters.title: Chapter 42: The Demon Lord of Wisdom is Scared of the Lion King
chapters.content:
Chapter 42: The Demon Lord of Wisdom is Scared of the Lion King
In the plains in front of Spero castle, a cacophony of depravity and pleasure raged.
Men with grotesque snouts whip and beat, tear flesh into pieces and roast it, and bathe captives in water made from molten gold.
It’s a grotesque scene of excess, of luxury, pleasure, and depravity turned malevolent, and it’s here that Reynald Shelman enters, clutching a Wisdom Orb.
-Human.
-Heh, humans, humans.
-Ah, humans, humans, humans!
The demons guessed his identity by the aura emanating from the Orb of Wisdom, and their fierce, feral gazes pierced Reynald.
“Hmph…Is everything all right, great one?”
[Don’t stare at those lowly whores for long, mortals are quickly corrupted]
“Yes!”
Reynald turned away from the scene of pleasure, unfurling the shields of his antimagic, as he had been told to do by the Wisdom Gem. But no demon would allow a follower of another demon to roam in the realm of pleasure and corruption.
-Thump! Thump! Thump!
Something rushed toward Reynald with a frenzied noise, but apart from the noise, a huge presence pressed down on him.
“How dare you bastards trespass on my pleasure grounds, have you lost your mind!?”
It was a grotesque giant, clutching a flesh-encrusted halberd in each of his eight arms, with tarnished golden chains at each of his six nipples that spoke.
The crown of moonlight on his head contains a malevolence that shakes the very soul of even Reynald, an S-class mage.
[Do not stare at the crown]
“Yes, yes…….”
The only thing keeping him alive is the magical energy flowing from the Wisdom Orb. The Orb of Wisdom stared at the eight-armed giant that filled the void beyond.
[Androzin, the Archdemon of Pleasure and Corruption]
As the Orb of Wisdom spoke to him he twisted the corners of his hideously torn mouth and said.
“Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh! A cunning goblin.”
Archdemon Androzin’s scornful gaze and voice were not lost on the Wisdom Gem.
[I’ll make you an offer you can’t refuse!]
“An offer? An offer, hahahahahaha!”
Androzin laughed a despicable laugh, a broad laugh that caused demons everywhere to giggle and join in.
“Know thy place, beast! Do you still think you’re our equal, that you, with your Lord and most of the Archdemons slain, can stand before this pleasure and depravity!”
Androzin remembered the ugliness of the demons of wisdom and inquiry, hunted down over two hundred years. Barely a few survived, while the rest were destroyed.
[You’ve been hunted down, too, and you’ve been smug about it…….]
“What?!”
Androzin was outraged by the words from the Wisdom Gem, but it was true.
[180 years ago, during the Great Advent, our lord was not the only one who was destroyed! The Lord of Pleasure was also destroyed!]
“You bastard!”
Androzin monstrous roar terrified the demons. He was so enraged that even the demons around him were targets of his anger.
One hundred and eighty years ago, the demons suffered a terrible loss and the five evils united in an unprecedented event.
Ruthless destruction, cruel indifference, disordered exploration, ugly lust, and devouring compulsion, these five vices invaded a world.
The result: terrible devastation. It was a catastrophe, with three Lord-level demons killed and ten million demons wiped out.
Many demons do not know what happened to the Demon Gate, as it was destroyed and there are no survivors.
Androzin knows only that the Lord of Pleasure died there, but not who killed him or how.
What Androzin has been doing here for a hundred years is the aftermath.
[I know what happened there, I’m a survivor of it!]
“Do you… know?”
[Your ignorance will not allow you to understand what happened there. You are beasts of desire, driven by animal instincts. I told you I would make you an offer you could not refuse!]
Androzin thought he’d been lured in by the unruly desk-bug but there are so few demons that left that world…the world of the Holy Law Users. Even those that knew were hiding it and using it to their advantage.
Just like the Demon Lord beyond the purgatory.
“Speak. I, Androzin, will cast him into the bottomless pit of depravity!”
[Kikit! Did you know I’m doing what the Supreme Archdemon told me to do?]
Androzin’s voice twisted sullenly at those words.
“It will soon be over. Eventually, mortal, the end is near.”
[Good! Then let me tell you, the commander of those who murdered the Lord of Pleasure is in this world!]
The Orb of Wisdom gave Androzin the information he needed and left the barracks with Reynald.
“Is that… all?”
[This is the most powerful move I can make here!]
Wisdom’s Gem was not sure of victory. Even though he was weakened, his opponent was a champion of reversals and a mistake could easily result in Androzin being killed.
[Seven to three. Androzin’s seven, he’s three]
“Well, if that’s the case… if I, an S-class mage, and the Great One intervene, isn’t it a must-win?”
[I’m not going?]
“…….”
Bastard. Reynald was fed up with the Wisdom Gem behavior.
[Don’t you dare try to intervene either, his holy law will annihilate any spirit body connected to you, even if it shatters the Holy Grail!]
“……I understand.”
Bystander, unconditionally hiding and cowering. Though it’s obvious that it’s thoroughly self-serving,
[Androzin may be a dumb beast compared to me, but he’s not stupid, and I’m sure he’ll summon his elite to deal with the Lionheart King!]
The Demons of Pleasure and Corruption are the most bizarre of the malignant, but they are not the most powerful in combat.
However, they are almost as numerous as the Demons of Lust and a large number means a large pool.
[He will soon summon the higher demons!]
This is the Halls of Corruption. It’s where the demons of pleasure and decadence have been working for a hundred years, ever since they lost their lord.
“Where do we go from here?”
They don’t plan to stop here. The Demons of Wisdom and Exploration are intelligent demons who specialize in magic.
They can strengthen other demons and grant them magical powers.
While the Demons of Pleasure and Corruption are weaker in combat, with the Wisdom Gem himself buffing them, they could easily defeat the Lionheart King along with the kingdom.
[First, check out the corpse harvesters who are having an orgy in the forests near the royal castle – those fresh corpse eaters are sure to be a force to be reckoned with!]
The corpse harvesters are vile demons who play with the corpses of their victims.
They are foul-smelling demons who wear their corpse parts as decorations whenever they collect them, but they are highly effective in combat as they scour the battlefield for fresh flesh.
If they were to be magically enhanced, they would be a formidable force, capable of taking on even the most elite of Lionheart Second Army Named Elites.
[Cough, wait, Lionheart, this gate will be your grave]
That’s when he found the barracks that housed the Corpse Harvesters. Reynald saw a Corpse Harvester, a mid-level demon, walking toward them.
“Is that a Corpse Harvester…….?”
It was a horrifying creature with a tentacle as a hand while the other held a club.
The subject was naked from head to toe but, dutifully concealing its nudity with a piece of a corpse.
They were psychopathic berserkers of the worst kind so Reynald tried to speak to him cautiously.
[Breathe!]
At the same time as the whispered words, something snaps around the Corpse Harvester’s neck and it cries out.
“Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!”
With a piercing scream, the corpse harvester rises and Reynald follows the direction he’s being dragged and sees a sight he can’t believe.
“Ugh…!”
There were spider webs everywhere in the forest.
-Agh…….
-Kill me…….
And the victims hanging from them, the corpse harvesters, caught in the webs, moaning in pain.
“Lord Spinner, did you take care of that?”
-Yes!
Reynald and the Wisdom Gem instinctively recognized the voices of the Holy Knights.
[Hey! Did you hide properly? Did you turn on your stealth?]
“Of course, it’s a top-notch stealth spell, completely invisible to the naked eye!”
[Anxious! Anxious! Anxious!]
The Wisdom Gem utilized its own magicka. At most, it used the magical energy it had accumulated from sacrifices to perform a perfect stealth magic.
-It is believed that there are still surviving individuals. The last one you captured was looking at something.
“After all that cleaning, it’s still here.”
What the hell is going on here? Reynald hadn’t heard any sounds until he came to this forest.
Surely a sweep of that many troops in a place like this would make some noise?
[The Holy Knight’s Holy Law of Silence, what nonsense, blocking even the sound of a warhorse’s galloping! He used the Holy Law of Silence to hunt down all the demons in the forest!]
‘That, is that possible?’
[I don’t know, but these bastards did it!]
The Holy Knight’s Holy Law was a treasure trove of absurdity.
Even among the demons of wisdom and exploration, who gathered all kinds of knowledge and magic, the Holy Knight’s code could not be interpreted as anything more than ‘absurd’.
“Hmm… That’s strange, I can sense an unpleasant aura…….”
It can’t be.
Wisdom Gem wanted to cry out.
The magic it had just cast was a perfect stealth spell, complete with subspace dimensional separation. Even with the disadvantage of being immobilized in one place, there was no way this could be detected!
“I think it’s around here…….”
Leon’s face flashes past Reynald’s and Reynald stares at him through bloodshot pupils, unable to swallow his saliva.
‘Please just go, just go, just go!’
“Hmph…….”
As suspicion deepens, suspicion turns to certainty and Reynald knew instinctively that if Leon turned his head and looked in their direction, he would definitely notice their presence.
As he watched Leon head slowly spin around, a cold sweat ran down his spine──
-Bam!
“What’s going on, Lord Spinner.”
-Target observed. Dealt with at point 4-B17.
“Looks like we have some more hunting to do today.”
Hearing Yappy’s report, Leon turned away.
The sound of the superhuman walking through the forest faded into the distance. It was five minutes after their disappearance that Reynald and the Wisdom Gem spoke up.
“Whoa, whoa, whoa…….”
[Dee, I almost lost it…….]
* * * *
Overnight, Leon had slaughtered more than 300 demons and all of them were elites.
He may have been running on fumes, but that didn’t mean he wasn’t strong.
“Demons of pleasure and depravity.”
Hypersexual perverts who sought not proper sexuality, but horribly twisted lusts.
Leon was disgusted when he realized that they were the demons at this gate.
All demons were unpleasant, bugs to be burned, but the ugly lust demons were especially unpleasant.
They corrupt humans and plunge them into a morass of pleasure and lust by any means necessary.
Some humans could not even resist the temptations of lesser demons.
They are responsible for the widespread corruption of the Empire and its neighboring kingdoms.
They are the weakest in combat, but the most dangerous. Leon knew all too well how the Fallen betrayed their own families.
‘Strange,’ he thought, ‘how come so many lustful demons have taken up residence at this gate?’
There were quite a few high ranking demons, and several that were considered elite among the Lust Demons. Naturally, there should also be Archdemons.
‘If a being of that caliber is in this gate, there must be a reason…….’
Leon wasn’t going to be patient with the question, he was going to look in the most suspicious places.
“You must be tired, but you’re not resting.”
A sweet voice rang in his ears and Leon’s eyes snapped open.
Demon Ranks:
-Lesser Demons/ Low-level demons
-Mid-level demons
-Greater Demons/ High-level demons
-Archdemons
-Demon Lord (Lord of Chaos is the title of a lord)

chapters.title: Chapter 43: The Queen and the Knight
chapters.content:
Chapter 43:
The Queen and the Knight
She was breathtaking.
Not even the black clothes on her body, her stern expression, and her dress could hide her ‘color’.
“Greetings, knight. May I call you Your Majesty Lionheart?”
She is a dangerous woman. Even the smile in her eyes and the delicate fingers covering her mouth exude a certain aura.
An innate temperament, a source of strife that colors her mere presence and a color that is a harbinger of corruption.
‘Beautiful.’
At first glance, her purple eyes, reflecting the moonlight, seem to hold an endless darkness that no light can penetrate.
A lesser man would have drowned in the depths of that abyss without even realizing it.
“I am the queen of this small kingdom, Beatrice Aligieri Spero.”
“Leon Dragonia Lionheart, ruler of the Lionheart Kingdom.”
Leon kissed the back of the woman’s hand respectfully, but wary.
‘How did I not notice?’
Is that even possible? Leon is not the kind of man to get cocky.
Even if he’s weakened from his prime, how could she fool his senses that kept countless assassins and demons at bay?
“Hoo-hoo, don’t be so vigilant, I just wanted to say hello to a benefactor of the kingdom.”
“This is not a good time for a lady to visit.”
The moonlight was still just past dawn. It was a knight’s virtue to rise early in the morning to train, but it was not a royal virtue, much less a lady’s.
“I am being watched.”
“Watched?”
Leon looked puzzled by Queen Beatrice’s words.
“Watched? By who?”
The queen smiled bitterly and named the forces holding her captive.
“The Great Marshal and his knights are watching me and keeping me confined.”
“The Great Marshal?”
Leon remembered the Great Marshal loyalty to the queen, and he didn’t seem the sort of man to commit such disloyalty.
But you never know what’s in a man’s heart. A loyal knight might covet a king’s wife, or a pious priest might amass a fortune.
“Your Majesty Lionheart, I have a favor to ask of you.”
The queen’s hand grasped Leon’s. It was a mere grasp, but it had a disturbing quality to it.
“I will hear and judge.”
“I want you to kill the grand marshal and his knights, and if you do, I will give you everything in the kingdom.”
“…….”
Leon did not accept the offer quickly. It was too suspicious.
The queen, not unaware of this, smiled and whispered.
“I want you to investigate the castle’s basement, where the grand marshal is hiding something.”
It was then that footsteps were heard in the hallways, and the castle was in an uproar. It was the sound of armor and military boots.
“Your Majesty Lionheart, I apologize for the late hour, but I will open the door!”
There was no waiting. It was the grand marshal and his knights who burst through the door.
“How impolite of you to barge into a royal bedchamber in military style!”
“……I recognize the rudeness, but the situation is urgent and we have no choice.”
The grand marshal apologized and paced the room. Queen Beatrice, who had stood before Leon only moments before, was nowhere to be seen.
“Hmm…….”
He sensed the aura in the room and knew in his gut that the Queen was here but he did not ask Leon if he had met her.
“I have met the Queen.”
“Is that so?”
“The queen of your country went out for a night walk, and you don’t ask.”
“Because that’s the kind of woman……she is.”
“Ha…!”
How could the knights let royalty go out for a night stroll? Even Leon has knights and guards wherever he goes.
“You leave royalty alone in this time when demons are on the loose?”
“……Demons don’t invade at night.”
“Bullshit.”
Since when do demons work day and night? There are hundreds of them hiding in the castle right now, disguised as humans.
“It’s almost as if you’re convinced.”
“…….”
The grand marshal turned to leave without answering but Leon’s words stopped him.
“The queen says you’re imprisoning her.”
At that, the grand marshal and his knights’ gazes sharpened.
“That is none of your business…….”
“Lord Burns, you’d better come clean about what you’re hiding.”
Ricardo Burns, the Grand Marshal of the Spero Kingdom turned away as if he didn’t need to answer.
Once they were gone, Leon stroked his chin.
“Suspicious.”
Both the queen and the Grand Marshal.
There was more to their behavior than just a defense quest against a demon army.
“In any case, do I need to investigate the basement to get to the bottom of this?”
But he wasn’t ready for that now. Leon had to face an army of demons that had begun to move with the dawn.
* * * *
An army of demons marches as the legions of ugly lust that corrupt all things living and fill them with pleasure advance.
-Transgress them. Cut off their heads and let them see their flesh mocked!
-Corrupt them, let them have an orgy in the square!
-Cut up the children and feed them to their parents! It will be a sight to behold!
Thousands, no tens of thousands of demons marched as the air changed before the march of malice that corrupted the living in the pursuit of primary pleasures.
“Androzin has spoken! He will give a hundred slaves to the first to cross the city walls!”
A naked soldier who embraced even pain as pleasure shouted as he swung his whip.
“Kee-hee-hee, let us corrupt the men.”
“Let’s pickle them with pleasure so they can’t think!”
“Corrupt them! Corrupt them! With pleasure──”
At that moment, the demon at the head of the line stopped, eager to tie up the humans with ropes as soon as possible, but then it saw something and shuddered.
“What is it, why aren’t you going faster?”
“You idiot! I’m not stuck behind you-”
The first row stops and so does the second row.
Row three, row four…… All the demons within sight of the city wall stop in shock.
-Kiyo-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh!
It was a scream.
No, the scream itself is familiar to the demons. The problem is the subject of the scream.
-KIEEEEEE……
The agonized cry sounded like the despair before death and the battlefield freezes at the grotesque and ghastly scream.
Those who are more accustomed to screams than anyone else, those who generate them, turn to their screaming compatriots.
At the end of their gaze there were Hunters, holding burning wood but demons were impaled in it.
“”?????””
What was that?
Was that torture for demons?
Demons are spirits, after all and when they die, they just go back to the Garden of Evil…
“False lives that know no death.”
On the ramparts, a cavalryman shines with a brilliant radiance in the light of dawn. His golden sword glistens as if absorbing the dawn’s light.
“Beasts like worms, driven only by primal needs.”
The golden sword decapitates the hanging demon, then the knight picks up the severed head and throws it.
The head rolled over two kilometers and landed in the middle of the demons.
A black soul leaked out of the decapitated demon, the soul that should have returned to its body now that it has lost its vessel──is sucked into the rider on the wall.
It didn’t take long for them to realize what this meant.
The immortal demons witnessed death.
They stare at the demonic butcher who has performed the impossible miracle.
“Listen, you filthy worms, I, Lionheart, on behalf of the Ten Thousand Gods, will teach your evil servants the value of a single life!”
Come, lowly things, your terror is here.
The demons who have made the material world their playground shriek in terror as the Lionheart King, the very terror of the demons, teaches them the value of life.
The fear of death spreads uncontrollably among the lower demons and even the mid-level demons.
They’re used to destruction, killing, and terror, but only as doers.
Demons are less accustomed to fear, as it is natural for them to return as spirit beings when they die.
The thought of dying never crosses their minds, so when they see death, they begin to self-destruct.
The Legion is broken as the immortal army crumbles at the sight of death.
“You, you fools, where are you running!”
“Stop! Don’t run!”
The higher-rank demons watched their subordinates crumble with ridiculous ease and tried to stop them. But there were too few mid-level demons to hold them back.
“Damn the Corpse Harvesters, if only they were here!”
“Where the hell did the Fallen go!”
The mid-level demons that Leon and Yappy had hunted so thoroughly during the night were the middle commanders of the army.
With them dying en masse in the middle of the night, there would be a shortage of mid-level officers to whip the lesser demons.
“You stupid things, get back here──”
-Bang!
A mid-level demon that was about to shout out was pierced in the torso by a javelin that flew in from somewhere and without even a chance to scream, the demon was torn up.
As he fell, gravity taking over, the last thing he saw was a lone rider charging toward him, wielding a holy sword.
“Glory to the Lionheart!”
Chasing the fleeing demons, a one-sided slaughter begins.
On the third day in the gate the demon butcher began his slaughter.
* * * *
They slaughtered over a thousand demons.
The hunters, including Koo Dae-sung and Kim Jin-soo, were skeptical that demons could die so easily.
“At the end… there was even one who killed himself.”
“And we can’t even use the Holy Law like His Majesty can…….”
The demons’ escape was a spectacle.
Either they didn’t realize they were fleeing, or they became an abomination, trampling over each other and fleeing in all directions to live on their own.
All the hunters did was shoot and kill the fallen demons one by one.
“These bastards… Your Majesty, is this their first time seeing you? What did they do on the first day?”
“Well… maybe they didn’t get the word out because they have a big army.”
Just then, Leon spoke behind the Hunters’ backs.
“That’s not true.”
“Your Majesty!”
The cruel Lionheart King, who had ordered the torture of the demons to be displayed in plain sight this morning, sneered at their behavior.
“They’re all selfish and uncoordinated, and only care about fulfilling their own desires, not the good of the group. They calculate what they can gain from what only they know.”
“Is that all there is to it?”
“Well, there are some things like that, but the only demon this king killed on the first day was a troll, so there must be some things they didn’t understand in the chaos of the battlefield.”
Koo Dae-Sung recalled the demons committing suicide to avoid being killed by their own hands and knew they would not rally easily.
“This is why you captured the demons alive?”
“That’s right. They do the cruelest things of all, and they have no tolerance for it. Scum maggots are scum maggots wherever they go.”
Leon added as he stomped on one of the demons the Hunters had captured.
“Capture them well and drag them away. Their screams will make a good symphony.”
The Hunters didn’t tell him that Leon was just an ignorant demon hater who wanted to see the demons suffer as much as possible.
Ah, so our Lionheart King had a deeper meaning!
“By the way, where did Lord Yappy go? I didn’t see him during the battle.”
“Lord Spinner is carrying out this king’s orders.”
“????”
The Hunters wondered about that, but chose not to ask.
‘Torturing demons?’
‘Biting and killing them.’
‘The word ‘uncooperative’ gives me the creeps.’
The captured demons shuddered.
“Help me! Help me, my lord!”
The demons did not look sympathetic. A few of the Hunters, who had been slightly expecting a demon of pleasure, slapped the demon on the back of the head to relieve their disappointment.
* * * *
Contrary to the Hunters’ expectations, Yappy’s destination was not the prison.
Yappy had taken advantage of the distraction of the battle to sneak into the depths of Spero castle.
“Huh? Didn’t something just pass by?”
“Didn’t you see it?”
Circling the ceiling upside down and not making a sound above a certain decibel, Yappy easily evaded the soldiers’ surveillance.
The occasional sharp-eyed knight glanced his way, but his camouflage was perfect. Yappy made his way to the depths of the tunnels, where he found a group of men.
“General Ricardo, I know you’re in command of a battle, but what are you doing here?”
It was Ricardo Burns, the kingdom grand marshal, and the knights who followed him.
“The outsiders will take care of that. The problem is the seal. I assume the seal is working well?”
The seal, a similar term that Yappy had heard for a thousand years.
It was the Yakt Spinner who had sealed the Gem of Wisdom, kept it hidden, and ensured that no one could breach it.
“Yes, but… no, no.”
The soldier shook his head pointlessly as he tried to say something but Ricardo looked past the soldier to check the seal.
The cover is lifted and the seal is revealed. Yappy’s wide-angle lens captured it clearly on camera. And──
-what?
It was a surprise, even to the super-intelligent Yakt Spinner.

chapters.title: Chapter 44: The Reality of the Kingdom
chapters.content:
Chapter 44:
The Reality of the Kingdom
The first battle was a great victory.
Leon, along with his Hunters and Kingdom troops, headed for the palace with over a hundred demons in their grasp.
“Crack!”
As the ropes were tied like a bundle of fish, the demons fell.
“Uh-oh, careful──.”
Koo Dae-sung was just about to pick up the demon when he saw that it had fallen and realized that the demon was a stunning beauty.
‘What? Just a moment ago──’
The ugly demon’s appearance was nowhere to be seen, and in front of him was a beauty who exuded a deadly charm.
“Mr. Hunter, if you let me go… I’ll do something nice for you.”
“Uh, uh, uh…….”
Koo Dae-sung was confused by the devil’s temptation.
Even though he knew that the being in front of him was a demon, he stretched out his hand as if he would fall for the temptation.
If he could hold such a beautiful woman once… it wouldn’t be a bad idea to risk his life──
[Aura of the Lion’s Heart: Legion Enhanced Pollution Resistance is activated]
He stretched out his hand towards the demon but the colorful beauty’s face disappeared, revealing a hideous one-eyed monster.
“Ah fuck!”
Startled, Koo Dae-sung punched the demon in the face.
The demon is dumbfounded by the punch.
“A mere mortal can resist my temptations?”
This is the demon temptation? I almost fell for it.
Koo Dae-sung gripped his fluttering heart, wary of the demon’s power.
‘What kind of bastard is this!”’
Leon approached on horseback from the front. His figure, mounted on Stallion, blocking out the sunlight, was very authoritative.
“What kind of bastard has been making a ruckus?”
“This bastard!”
With a quick change of demeanor, he pointed to the demon who had tempted him.
Leon’s gaze landed on the demon, and he spoke as if he had seen the whole picture in an instant.
“How dare you seduce my soldier with your filthy body?”
“Forgive me…!”
Leon’s military boot slammed into the demon’s shin and the demon’s leg snapped with a pop.
“Keeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!”
“You filthy, lowly thing, raise your voice!”
Leon tramples the demon while the Hunters and the other demons watching were appalled.
‘He’s even more evil than the demons…!’
‘Ugh, kill him……’
Leon watched as the demon was trampled to death before he got back on his horse.
‘I don’t even have enough energy.’
Leon felt the Grail’s energy sharpen as the demon’s soul was absorbed by it.
As the demons self-destructed, he hunted down a number of commanders. Some of them were high-level demons, and Leon had recovered enough power.
The citizens were waiting for Leon to return with his captured demons.
They welcomed him and his soldiers for their victory, but stared at the demons with fear.
“…….”
The war against demons is always like this. They seduce humans, even if they are lesser demons, and draw them into destruction and corruption.
The same goes for their ugly appearance. The war against them is never-ending, and only a select few are inspired by victory.
In the Lionheart Kingdom, they pray to God, but the ones here have no one to turn to so Leon raised both hands.
“Applaud.”
“????”
“What?”
The gazes of the citizens and Hunters alike are filled with questions. They’ve grown accustomed to Leon’s erratic behavior, but that’s not the point.
When he stops all the soldiers stop and everyone is silent as all eyes are focused on him.
“Applause! Give glory to the god of war and flame and sing the glory of this Lionheart!”
“”………….””
The crowd was silent for a moment but soon someone began to clap, and it spread like a wildfire.
The thunderous applause grew louder and louder, soaring to the heavens.
“Hang the demons and let the citizens kill them themselves. Let them savor the sweetness of their ugly souls being extinguished.”
“Yes!”
“… We have come in triumph, but no one has come to see us.”
Leon thought of the captains and knights who weren’t present and had many questions but just as he was questioning everything, he saw a red glow from the windows of the castle.
“It worked.”
Leon turned back to the castle.
* * * *
Upon receiving Yappy’s report, Leon hurried to the castle’s basement along with the Hunters.
“Stop! This area is not authorized for access──”
Leon didn’t wait for the soldier to stop him and kicked open the spear-barred door to the basement.
The door burst open with tremendous pressure and the soldiers had already been subdued.
“Your Majesty, is this okay?”
Chief Kim Jin-soo had never seen a gate attack like this before.
In essence, gating is all about clearing quests. You just need to clear the gate according to the system message that carefully explains the closing conditions.
During the quest, NPCs will also appear, so it’s important to make them your allies as much as possible but he never heard of a strategy where you just go out and turn everybody against you!
“……Give up. It’s easier if you give up.”
“No, that’s not…!”
The Hunters, who had already watched Leon’s shenanigans at the Orc Gate, were convinced.
“Now, wait! Look at these!”
Koo Dae-sung, who was following in the lead, pointed in astonishment.
Where the door to the basement had been smashed open, there was a huge cavity. An unnaturally huge cavity…….
“What the hell.”
“There’s a place like this in the basement of the castle?”
Expecting the worst, the Hunters followed Leon as he walked briskly down the hall, only to be stopped by two knights.
“King Lionheart, what insolence!”
“Stay back! We can’t go any further!”
Despite their pleas, Leon didn’t stop but simply drew his sword.
“The king’s word. Kneel.”
Instead, it was Yappy who took action as the steel wire of his secondary arm traveled beyond the speed of sound, capturing the knights.
Their hardened swords were instantly severed before the sacred steel wire.
“The swords…!”
“You!”
Yappy quickly surrounded the knights, and Leon pulled down the covers they were guarding.
“Huh…!”
“Wow…….”
Inside was a frighteningly beautiful woman, sleeping soundly, a work of art rather than a creature…no, a subject that seems to have been created by the devil.
Queen of the Spero Kingdom, Beatrice Aligieri Spero.
Even in her sleep, she is deadly beautiful, leading men to their doom.
“Alas…….”
“Beautiful…….”
Soldiers, dazzled by her inhuman beauty, turn to her, drooling.
Seeing the abnormal behavior Leon realizes they have been dazzled by an irresistible temptation.
“Resist! Do not be seduced by her power!”
Leon shouted, but the soldiers reached out to the queen, their minds unable to withstand the power even with the Lionheart Aura.
‘Should I blame them for their weakness…?‘
Leon thought and punched Chief Kim Jin-soo in the nape of the neck as he reached out.
After that, the Lionheart King himself had to do the laborious work. One by one, he stunned the soldiers, showing a disappointed expression.
