No matter how lenient he tried to be, he couldn’t help but compare them to his subjects.
“Off…!”
“Hmph?”
Leon, who was stunning the soldiers, saw Koo Dae-sung break out in a cold sweat, clutching his thighs in pain.
“Ho~”
Recognizing the deception, he stabbed himself to force himself to overcome it.
“Your Majesty…….”
“Take a deep breath. Inhale through your mouth and exhale slowly. Clear your mind.”
Leon sprinkled holy water on Koo Dae-sung’s thigh as he breathed slowly and deeply, the restorative power of the holy water regenerating his dagger wounds.
“Impressive. I didn’t think you’d be able to resist the Queen.”
Grand Marshal Ricardo and his knights walked slowly toward them, surrounding them.
“You owe me an explanation.”
“What explanation can I give to a man who is about to die?”
Koo Dae-sung was confused by the cold gaze of General Ricardo.
‘What? Is the General a Fallen?’
That would be strange. He and his knights had also passed through the divine flames in the square that day.
If they were Fallen, they wouldn’t be able to withstand the flames and reveal their true colors.
“Do you not plan to defend the kingdom? Without our help, you will not be able to withstand the invasion of the Evil Ones.”
“I don’t care, even without you.”
“Hmm.”
Leon’s calm demeanor didn’t falter in the face of the impending threat. Instead, he looked as cool as if he’d solved a puzzle.
“So, you guys. I see you’re not dazzled by the queen, are you?”
“……I’m used to it.”
“Of course you’re used to it. The queen’s powers are more of a curse than a birthright. I’ve seen one with such power before.”
‘The Lord of Pleasure.’
Leon remembered the ugly demon lord of lust he had slain with his own hands.
“One who seduces all that lives. One who is born to seduce. Demonic pleasures that lead men astray. This queen is such a creature.”
It was power beyond even Archdemons, a power no living thing can withstand. It was a difference of spirit, and that’s why countless Holy Knights have sacrificed themselves to defeat the Demon Lords.
“But it’s strange.”
“What…?”
“How is it that this king, who despises and loathes demons more than anyone else, senses no such aura from this queen…how is it that you are ‘fine’.”
Leon is a demon slayer who has fought demons for hundreds of years. There’s no way he wouldn’t recognize a malevolent aura.
Leon picks up the Holy Grail filled with holy water and atop the chalice was a black flower.
“Divinity of dreams and death, your guardian asks for your favor.”
A ritual that wasn’t full-fledged started but when the one doing it is a demigod, it’s a different story.
[I will gladly answer the call of the Lionheart King]
The violet woman smiles and reveals her spirit form. The divinity descended directly from the souls of countless demons, and its mere presence caused everything around it to freeze.
“Greetings, Fle, god of dreams and death.”
[Yes, Arianna’s knight. Master of the Lionheart]
“Lord of dreams, I have strengthened you as you wished.”
She had felt a sense of discomfort since Leon entered the gate and to find out what it was, Fle demanded to personally descend.
With the god of dreams and death summoned, it should be a simple matter to reveal the truth of this world.
The Goddess declared.
[Demons of Corruption, they have been at work, performing their rituals of corruption in endless dreams!]
The goddess pointed her finger at the captain and the knights.
[All dreams must end. Show your true selves!]
The truth of the world is revealed, centered on a beautiful finger.
The world is colored in an instant, like ink on drawing paper and the world, or rather, the dream, is shattered.
“Huh…!”
Seeing the transformation and the revealed reality, Koo Dae-sung swallowed hard.
The Grand Marshall and the knight of the Spero Kingdom who were once heroes, wielding their swords against evil showed their rotted flesh and gnarled with their bony forearms.
“De, Death Knight?!”
The undead knights who refused to die were revealed.

chapters.title: Chapter 45: The Death Knights
chapters.content:
Chapter 45: The Death Knights
The truth of the world shattered by the power of Fle, the god of dreams and death, was devastating.
The seemingly living inhabitants of the Gate were dead, and Grand Marshal Ricardo and his knights were Death Knights.
Witnessing the truth, Leon was exhilarated.
“Ha! I see why I didn’t notice, I see why I didn’t realize! The power to create the world itself!”
The gate itself had been a dream.
“That’s it…!”
Grand Marshal Ricardo and his knights awoke to their true selves in the shattered dream, and the creepy aura of the Death Knights was no longer hidden.
-Do not disturb the queen’s rest.
-Protect the queen.
The hostility of the Death Knights is directed at Leon, and he is puzzled by it, though he takes it all in stride.
“You are not a Fallen, soaked in malice, then…!”
Leon’s sword turns to the Queen because as the dream cleared, he felt the aura of corruption from her.
The visions of this gate must have originated from her.
But Leon’s blade is blocked by Ricardo Burns… the blade of a Death Knight. He deflects Leon’s blade away from the Queen.
-Eliminate hostiles.
Muzzles pointed at Ricardo but just then, a Death Knight bumps into Yappy.
“Lord Yappy?!”
Yappy is pushed back by the Death Knight’s charge but he swings a steel wire with his secondary arm.
Meanwhile, Ricardo’s blade slashes at Leon with a fierce intensity. The warlord strikes again and again, as if he will never tire.
His sword is worn with age and power, and its strength is more than A-grade. But it wasn’t enough to reach Leon.
-Boom!
Sword clashes with sword, and the struggle begins.
The warlord’s sword pulses with power, but Leon’s sword doesn’t show the slightest sign of being pushed back.
“A fine sword, no, a sword so well honed that even though you’re an undead I do not despise it.”
But he was no match for Leon. Leon is the pinnacle of those who have walked the path and Ricardo’s blade is pushed further and further away, until it finally digs into his shoulder.
“Get out of the way…!”
“General!”
With voices like boiling phlegm, the two knights parry Leon’s sword and Leon’s face lit up with anger at their intervention.
“How dare you betray the honor of knighthood and interfere in a one-on-one duel!”
Leon saw the pride in their swords. He felt the honor of knights who walked the path, and that made him even angrier.
“A scribe’s sword and a knight’s sword must be different!”
Leon’s words were not lost on Ricardo and the knights’ swords.
“Honor has long since been forsaken!”
“For…the Queen!”
The cries were unintelligible.
Were they not the ones who imprisoned her?
The queen herself had asked him to kill her knights.
Wait, kill her knights? Why would she make such a request?
Leon stared at the queen lying on the bed as he passed the knights.
For a queen who exuded an aura of blatant depravity and seduced creatures, she was still…….
‘Not an evil species?’
As the dream unfolded, the knights revealed their true colors but the queen still had vibrant skin and beautiful features unlike the demons of lust, who are ugly.
“What have you done, you bastards! What have you done to the queen?”
“We made a -deal- with the demons, King Lionheart.”
The Spero Kingdom, like Leon’s world, was being invaded by demons.
It was Beatrice, now Queen, who led the kingdom’s army against the onslaught of evil. However, she was unable to withstand the onslaught of demons, and the Archdemon of Pleasure, Androzin, reached out to her as she stood on the brink of destruction.
[Queen, I admire your courage. We’ll make a deal.]
[A deal…?]
[Embody the essence of corruption, and repeat the destruction of the kingdom for a hundred years. If you are not corrupted, I will spare you and your people]
Already facing destruction, the Queen of the Kingdom had no choice but to accept it, even if it was a demonic trap.
The war with the demons recurred every year.
At first, it was bearable.
Even if you were killed by the demons, you would be resurrected the next year and fight again. But they were up against the Archdemon of Pleasure. They humiliated and transgressed the people, the soldiers.
They corrupted them with endless pleasure and torture, breaking their minds.
Even the longest-lived soldier did not last more than three years.
[I… what have I done…….]
Realizing what she had done, Queen Beatrice sought a way out, but the devil’s traps were cunning and insidious. There were no loopholes in the deal she had already accepted.
She grew madder and madder.
By day she had to watch the demons slaughter her people, and by night the Fallen whispered to her.
[It’s because of you. You’re the reason they died]
[Be corrupt, embrace pleasure]
The sight of her kingdom falling and the essence of corruption planted in her body constantly tempted her.
After fifty years of this, when a loyal knight was finally unable to resist her temptations and infiltrated her bedchamber── Captain Ricardo Burns made a decision.
[Self-destruction]
Self-destruction was strictly forbidden in the world of Repetition. Androgen made no allowance for suicide, even when it was self-imposed or with the help of others.
[Those who commit suicide to evade the contract will become spirits wandering the Nine Realms forever! At the end of the hundred-year deal, you will become servants of the Fallen!]
Nevertheless, Ricardo Burns and the Thirty-seven Knights chose self-destruction.
Defend the Queen, and serve her. They knew that the oath they swore when they became knights of the realm could never be fulfilled while they were alive.
The queen’s charms did not work on those who had died and become Death Knights, and they sealed her away.
“Though even that seal was little more than a half-day ritual to put her to sleep.”
“…….”
Leon sighed as he listened to Ricardo’s story.
Their loyalty surprised even the Lionhearted King. But…….
“That is why the queen asked this king to kill you.”
To prevent her knights from becoming servants of the demons.
“The queen knows. She knows she won’t last.”
“No-! The Queen will endure-oh, five more years! Five more years! She will make it through!”
“How can a knight judge a monarch; your loyalty is admirable, but it is not loyalty!”
“Thou shalt not judge my loyalty!”
Ricardo’s sword struck with all his might but Leon parried it with one hand.
Leon stretches out his arms to him, empty-handed. He reaches out with the intention of tearing his head off, but is stopped by a stabbing sword.
Leon drops his arm and steps back. Behind him, two knights swing their swords sideways.
-Boom!
Leon stretches his holy sword back to block and kicks out at the charging Ricardo.
“You think you can stop me…! Even in a pincer attack!”
The power of this monster has been witnessed in battles against demons.
A monster that has reached superhuman status with its physical abilities alone, even without the Holy Law. A knight among knights. Knight of Knights.
“Forgive the disrespect!”
One of the Death Knights swung his sword wildly. A stance solely for added strength but was too crude for a knight to use.
Leon didn’t miss the opening. The blade of his holy sword stabbed straight for the Death Knight’s empty side, but──
-Bang!
The Death Knight’s shield blocked Leon’s blade and in the next moment, the Death Knight’s sword swung at Leon.
Leon barely manages to deflect it aside and a strand of golden hair is cut off.
‘He’s deliberately showing me a gap to make me attack!’
A bold move based on the assumption that his fellow knight would defend him.
Leon could feel the trust in that solidity.
The attacks continued and just when he thought he dodged the spear, he was tackled from behind.
The Death Knight throws his whole body to push Leon away, not giving him room to swing his sword, but giving his teammate a chance to attack.
Leon catches Death Knight with a right hook and throws him to the ground and as he raises his sword to deliver the decisive blow, a sharpened spear stabs him.
-Bang!
The sound of impact rang out like a cannon blast.
He barely managed to block the spear strike with my sword blade, but his trembling hands couldn’t absorb the impact.
‘Strong.’
If it were the Lionheart Kingdom, they would be able to walk the path of the Holy Knight to uphold the honor of the Goddess.
Each and every one of them must have been a knight of renown.
‘Perhaps their abilities have been diminished by becoming undead.’
Knights of this caliber are known for their refined swordsmanship. Becoming undead might have increased their physical strength, but it would have diminished their refinement.
“And yet…so capable…excellent!”
Ricardo Burns looked down at Leon from his position at the head of the knights.
“We are the knights of the Spero Kingdom. Throughout the centuries, we have grown stronger and united!”
For the defense of the Queen alone.
How can these loyal knights be called a bunch of wraiths?
“Well done, knights, you have done more than your share of honor and pride. But…….”
Leon returned his holy sword to the Grail and in his hand, he now held a large jousting lance.
“Before you is the history of the Three Hundred Years’ War of the Lionheart. Can you bear this weight?”
“What nonsense…….”
“Take this weight, and I will recognize you.”
Leon rode on Stallion as he distanced himself from the Death Knights.
“Chase!”
But the Death Knights have also summoned ghost horses. The ghostly horses roam the land, united in death with their masters, and pursue Stallion.
“Fast!”
But the ghost horses failed to catch up to Stallion. This horse, given to him by the Goddess of Light and Justice, is of a different bloodline.
The ghost horses could only stare in disbelief as the white horse closed the distance in an instant. And the moment the distance is closed, the rider’s head turns in the opposite direction. Any knight can recognize it.
-Charge…!
-Coming…!
A cavalryman’s strongest strike. Charging.
“Glory to the Lionheart…!”
The horses pound the ground and with their lances raised the knights charge in unison.
One knight and thirty-seven knights but in the moment of contact, the Death Knights realize their fate.
-Boom!
The first collision sent the leading knight flying along with his ghost horse.
The second clash did not diminish Stallion’s momentum in the slightest as the Death Knights were sent flying.
“Kwak?!”
The third row of Death Knights had only grazed the god horse, but they couldn’t hold on to their horses.
-Thwack!
Ricardo raised his sword straight up even as he rolled on the ground. He realized that his opponent’s charge was beyond common sense.
“No…!”
Ricardo looked around and saw that all of his fellow knights had fallen to the ground.
In this moment of shock, he was the only one who managed to pull himself out of the way and withstand the impact.
“With a single charge… you managed to dismantle the Queen’s Guard?!
Even his hardened skin quivered at the shock but Leon’s holy spear burrowed under Ricardo’s chin.
“Awake from your fleeting dream.”
“The Lionheart King…!”
Where did this monster come from, how could such a powerful being appear now?
“We-I…!”
He had not yet extinguished the flame of defiance. His loyalty to repeat his queen’s time and finally save her moved his body.
“If you can’t wake up from your dream in the end, then live forever in your delusions. Foolish knight.”
The spear was about to strike when Leon realized at once that a horde of demons was approaching, with an aura that could not be more sinister.
They were already gathering their forces and marching however Leon could have taken care of Ricardo first but he didn’t.
“Rise up, soldiers of the Lionheart! How long will you remain asleep?”
The voice rumbled through the halls and roused the stunned soldiers.

chapters.title: Chapter 46: God of War and Flame
chapters.content:
Chapter 46: God of War and Flame
The morning’s offensive was scheduled.
On the first day of the attack, Androzin flew into a rage when he heard that the demons had been defeated.
“What? They fled without a fight!”
It hadn’t occurred to him that the first day’s fighting would be enough to take the castle. According to the original story, the battle would continue for the next five days before the castle was finally destroyed.
But this was the first time they had fallen without even a pretense of a fight. In a hundred years, in 95 iterations of history, there had never been a more humiliating defeat.
“You cowards!”
Androzin’s eight arms danced, and dismembered bodies leapt up one after another.
-Keeeeeeeeeeeeee!
The demons decapitated by Androzin’s were not released into the spirit realm; their souls were absorbed by the blood-stained drums, screaming incessantly.
Androzin pitied the men who had died in the night.
They were specialized warriors, among the demons of lust, who took pleasure in pain.
By the end of the night, they were as good as dead. Leon’s surprise was to blame.
In all of history, he was the first madman to run out of the castle and hunt demons himself.
What could the madman possibly want so badly that he would abandon the safety of his castle to hunt demons?
Androzin didn’t know.
He didn’t realize that the all-night demon hunt was a stress reliever for Leon, who had a panic attack at the sight of demons.
Just as he was rebuking his men and trying to regroup-─
“What?”
Androzin’s eyes widened as the lush field, the forest, had instantly lost its life and died, though it had technically returned to ‘normal’.
This meant only one thing.
“The queen’s dream…broken?”
This world is a world of innate evil, a place that could corrupt any man or woman.
Repeating the dream, he transforms her into a lustful demon with the essence of corruption.
For him, endless despair was necessary, and the remaining five years were the final step to ensuring her submission.
A dream that was supposed to be broken only after her corruption was forcibly broken?
Something had happened and Androzin grew impatient.
“Damn it! The Queen is supposed to be reborn as the Lord of Pleasure!”
That was the order of the current Supreme Archdemon of Pleasure.
Androzin led his men and headed straight for the castle. There was little time to gather all the forces, but time was running out.
Reynald and the Wisdom Gen watched on and Reynald whispered softly.
“Shouldn’t you… go help?”
[I’m not going?]
You little shit.
Reynald swallowed hard.
* * * *
Leon, Koo Dae-Sung, and Yappy beat the sleepy Hunters out of their daze and headed out of the palace.
The Hunters are dumbfounded as they wake up to find the castle in ruins.
“What, what, what happened?”
“Apparently… we went underground and… what happened?”
Leon doesn’t elaborate on the Hunters’ questions. For now, it was more important to deal with this rapidly changing situation.
“Demons!”
“Demons have entered the castle!”
But the demons were already over the gates and swarming inside and the hunters couldn’t make sense of it.
“Damn it, where are the soldiers on the walls?”
“There are too many of them!”
Koo Dae-sung shouted to the confused Hunters.
“Raise your shields…!”
At the sound of his voice, the Hunters reacted instinctively.
Click, click, click, shields mechanically stacked. In an instant, the finished product was ready to greet the demons.
-Kill them!
-Destroy!
The demons of lust charged naked, their fighting strength not great. But lust demons are great in numbers.
The mass of the frontal assault alone exceeds a hundred.
“They’re big…!”
The Hunters withstand the crashing demons and plunge their swords through the gaps in the shields.
-Thud!
-Kick!
The lesser demons were easily defeated by the Hunters’ swords.
[Terror of the Demons]
[Greatest Demon Slayer]
[Demon Lord Slayer]
These three traits amplify the Hunters’ damage to demons. Their attacks take on an antagonistic quality, and demons around them are weakened.
Add to that the Lionheart aura and the Hunters’ defense became sturdy as long as the demons came from the front.
-Kiek!
They were coming from the side!
At the end of the defense row Chief Kim Jin-soo, holding his shield, felt hopeless as the demons came from all sides.
Being surrounded meant quick annihilation.
‘And yet, no one is moving!’
Even though he, a B-rank tanker of the Association, was getting nervous, how could these D-rank Hunters remain calm and steady?
The reason was the presence of the knights.
-Nonexistent. Weaponless.
Minimalist machine guns raining down and steel wires imbued with holy power were swung at speeds beyond recognition.
“Ki…?”
“Get?”
They didn’t know what had passed through their torso, but when they realized it, a neatly sliced section slid away.
Leon’s side was the worst. The demons pissed themselves just by glaring at him, their eardrums bursting at the sound of his rant.
Two Holy Knights covered both sides of the formation. The blows they unleashed were more powerful than all of the blades wielded by all the Hunters combined.
-Profit…!
-Demon Butcher…!
-Center, center, center!
The demons were driven back by the Hunters.
It was better to die in the dust and escape to the spirit realm than to be sliced to pieces by the Holy Knights on the left and right.
“It’s big…!”
“Why is it so heavy…!”
This increased the burden on the hunters and Chief Kim Jin-soo shouted.
“Protector Shield!”
Chief Kim’s unique skill, Protector’s Shield, a skill that temporarily increases the defense of the entire party by 20%.
Normally, it’s a skill that benefits only sub-tankers, but the Hunters here are supposed to be tanks.
Androzin shouted from the rear.
“Work, slaves, and revel in the pleasure of pain!”
Androzin’s crown glowed with a great dark light. The demons’ eyes twisted grotesquely as they were exposed to the crown’s light. The words… tasted… of deception.
“Kihihi…!”
“Kyahahahahaha!”
The demons screamed and charged. They threw themselves against the shields and didn’t care if their torso was pierced.
They throw themselves with glee, as if the pain has become pleasure.
He was overwhelmed and the shield was heavy, and he wanted to throw it away right now, but Koo Dae-Sung didn’t. The hunters did not move from their positions.
[A soldier’s virtue is to be good at only one thing: to block, and the knight will do the rest]
The king commanded them only one thing.
Stand your ground and keep the enemy at bay.
And the knights will crush them.
‘If we can only hold on…!’
‘The king will do something about it!’
The soldiers stare at their king’s back as he rides to victory, holding on.
“Let’s go, Stallion!”
‘His Majesty Lionheart will see this through, just like he always has.’
“Huh?”
Leon disappeared from the Hunters’ view as the endless black tide of demons had swallowed him whole.
All hope was lost as the black waves were all around him.
* * * *
Leon swung his holy sword wildly at the horde of evil before him.
Five demons screamed at the blow but others quickly took their place.
The demons show no sign of fear. Their bloodshot eyes are bloodshot and delirious.
It’s a trick the Archdemons of Pleasure have displayed time and time again. It transforms the pain of the horde into pleasure and turns them into pleasure-seeking maniacs.
Lust demons are weak in combat, but with buffs like this, they’re a nuisance.
‘Insufficient penetration.’
The enemy is too numerous and Androzin himself has come to lead the army. The final battle was supposed to be on the last day of the defense but it was brought forward by the queen’s shattered dream.
‘Can I do it?’
If only he had the Holy Knights…or at least an Order.
‘I can’t blame them for not being here.’
Leon had fought alone a war against evil that lasted 180 years. It was a matter of life and death for all demons and for Leon. But there was a difference between then and now.
Back then, he was in a land of divinity.
There was faith in the gods, holy power, and the support of all the gods, built up since the beginning of human history.
But now faith is lacking, and the only thing he has is his body.
The holy arts he practiced for so many years can only be used occasionally, and the holy sword and holy spear have lost their power.
Could he do it?
“No! It must be done!”
Leon’s sword emitted a brilliant light and layers of light cut through the demon.
For the sake of the soldiers who watched his back, for the sake of the gods to whom he would give glory and honor.
Even if he is alone, he must do it.
That is why he is the Lionheart King, the sole agent of the gods.
“For Lionheart–!!!”
It was then that a black, magical blade flew out but Leon’s holy sword deflected it; however the deflected blade slashed at Stallion’s throat.
“Stallion…!”
Leon falls to the ground as Stallion collapses from the blow. The Grail summoned rushed to repair his wounds, but they were not easily healed.
The knight’s fall was an opportunity for the minions and a wave of demons rushed toward Leon, intent on devouring him.
-Stone strike!
The masses collided and the moment of impact was dramatic but with a bang, the demons were bounced back by Ricardo Burns and the Death Knights.
“Warlord.”
“King Lionheart.”
Wraiths who cut their own throats in their glory days and are now wandering the netherworld. Royal Guards, loyal to the queen even in death, left her side and are here.
“Have you awakened from your dreams, knights?”
“Our loyalty to the Queen remains.”
“As it should be.”
“But…if we can make a difference…….”
Leon smirked.
He had long been a symbol of hope, even when the world was being destroyed by evil and even when the gods took refuge in his heart.
Even the Hunters and the Queen’s loyal knights.
“Then show me. Live up to the expectations.”
What he had always done against all odds.
“God of War and Flame, answer my call!”
A strong voice spoke, a divinity that needed no altar, no shrine, only the heat of valor to answer.
[Still, they are a liability, a flame that could crumble at any moment without you]
“Then I will stand before them forever, until the day they can stand up for themselves.”
Stallion fades away as it cries out in disgrace at being summoned back.
“Thank you, my ally. Rest now.”
Leon turned to look at the 38 knights protecting him, holding the demons at bay. In their midst, the Lionheart King shouted.
“I am Lionheart, the greatest rider of Petos, the god of war and flame!”
At the raspy cry, the demons writhe in pain, and the soldiers and knights recall Leon’s presence.
“War! Flame, thy greatest war horseman asks for the flame of war here and now…!”
Each syllable, each word, carries unbending honor and weight. The flames of war responded to that clarion call.
In an instant, the skin-searing heat and roar shook the battlefield with vibrations.
Demons, knights, hunters…all eyes turned to the center of the flames. In the midst of the divine flames, where demons are consumed by the mere touch, a divinity of a density far beyond common sense emerged.
It looked like a fire-breathing bull.
Unruly and ferocious, they are beyond human comprehension, outside the norm.
Leon climbed aboard a giant war chariot drawn by two such bulls and grabbed the reins.
“I, Leon Dragonia Lionheart, greet the Queen’s loyal knights!”
The thirty-eight Death Knights with swords and spears lined up behind the war chariot, backing away from the terrorized demons.
“You are the proud sword of the kingdom of Spero, the shield of the queen! Entrusted with the noble task of punishing the wicked. Knights of glory! Be the flame that purifies evil!”
The blazing flames of war burned into the blades of the Death Knights.
The flames that burned and purified the unholy recognized them as pure.
“Follow me.”
Leon aimed his spear and led the way like usual.
“We will be victorious.”

chapters.title: Chapter 47: Demon Slayer
chapters.content:
Chapter 47: Demon Slayer
The Death Knights… The Queen’s Guard have felt the changes that the flames of war have wrought.
Their eyes grew brilliantly clear and the hands that gripped their weapons were glued together, unable to be separated.
The soles of their feet felt surprisingly light on the earth.
How could they have been so clear, so pure, so warm, when they had been reincarnated as dead wraiths?
“Follow me.”
The leading Lionheart King aims his spear.
“Then we shall win.”
The chariot spurs to life as flame-breathing bulls pound the ground with their imposing four legs.
Ghost horses followed, but none could keep up with the bulls and the Lion King.
“Leading the way alone is dangerous!”
Spero Castle was filled with a horde of demons.
The bulls were certainly imposing, but even so, the moment they crashed into that black wave, it was like a light that would eventually be swallowed up.
The Death Knights and Ricardo Burns thought so, but──
Light cut through the darkness and the blackness, as inky as the sea, was melted by the flames.
The bulls’ formidable glares and strength make the spears of the demons retreat, and the flames they breathe burn before their eyes, reducing the blackness to black powder.
It was like an excavator unleashed from its speed limit and plowed full speed into a pack of rabbits.
The sight of the creatures trampled, burned, crushed, and torn to shreds was almost sympathetic.
The following Death Knights realized that the mere mass of demons in front of the war chariot was destined to be nothing more than a one-sided slaughter.
Even the loud carnage and demonic screams were now relegated to an unpleasant background soundtrack──
“You insolent bastard!”
Androzin shouted in anger, his crown dancing and glowing.
The Crown of Desire, the treasure of the Lord of Pleasure, grants the power to turn Androzin’s slaves into death-defying fanatics.
The Slaves of Pleasure rushed forward, frothing and bloodshot-eyes, under his power.
Riding monstrous reptilian beasts with sharp claws and wielding whips, they charge at Leon and the Death Knights, two hundred in number, in fact.
“Ha…!”
Leon laughs in disbelief at the things imitating horsemen charge and waving ferocious whips.
“Do you even know what a cavalryman is, you lowly things? A charge is meant to be made with a spear!”
Not a spear or a sword but a whip. Even if it were sonic weapons, how could they hold off a horde of spurred knights?
[【Mightiest Charge】 applies]
Needless to say, the demons of lust that get torn apart in the moment of clash.
Flesh rips and bursts, and torn demons splatter in all directions.
Androzin didn’t expect them to hold off that ferocious charge either. But…….
“What the hell, that one.”
They outnumbered the enemy by five to one but they were pierced without stopping them for even a moment.
He knew what the Death Knights were capable of. They were brilliant knights, but in the end, they could not overcome the limitations of numbers.
If anyone could have turned the tide, it was those bulls. No, it was the man at the front, leading the war chariot.
“Shoot! Sweep them away!”
The demons of lust raised their cannon-like energy weapons they had acquired earlier from the Demons of Wisdom and Exploration as a barrage of fire rained down on the enemy.
[Ranged Abomination applies to this unit]
Troop Immunity: Applies the Holy Law <Nullify Arrows> to units under your control.
{Death Knights (38) become subject to <Nullify Arrows>.}
The barrage of energy cannons failed to wound the Death Knights.
The Holy Knights’ extreme ranged aversion negates ranged attacks not only against themselves but also against their immediate troops.
The flip side of this is that the entire unit loses the ability to use ranged weapons, but that’s not necessary for a charging unit. Only a knight’s valor can shake the battlefield. There is no honor in cowardly ranged weapons!
“Glory to the Lionheart!”
[Mightiest Charge] is applied to the unit. [War Knight’s Protection] and [Fear of Evil] are combined.
Troop Upgrade: Increase Charge Bonus by 400%.
Troop Upgrade: Increase Charge Bonus by 120%.
Troop Upgrade: Increase Charge Bonus by 100%.
Troop Upgrade: Increase the Physical Resistance of your Assault Troops by 35%.
Weaken Enemy: Demon races have 80% less Charge Defense.
[Warbulls of Petos grants friendly Legions the trait: <Flaming Sword>]
[[Greatest Demon Slayer] applies reduced physical resistance, reduced holy law resistance, reduced melee defense, and automatic soul retrieval to all demons in a 1 km radius]
Over a thousand Demons of Pleasure and Corruption were swept away in an instant.
The demons disappeared like falling leaves in the face of an overwhelming breakthrough.
Androzin was dumbfounded by the horrific reality before him.
Only one person made the Death Knights so strong.
Even the Death Knights themselves were unbelievable, but what about Androzin?
“Bastard!”
Eight arms swung their halberds at Leon, who was closing in. The blows slam into the war chariot.
-Ooooooooooo…!
The two bulls roar as the rampaging bulls cut themselves free from the chariot, and one of them crashes right into Androzin’s shinbone.
The Divine Beast’s charge brought even the Archdemon to his knees as Androzin’s height of over five meters was instantly lowered.
‘Not good enough. Where did the Lionheart King go?’
Just then, a shadow fell over Androzin as the flame-encrusted holy spear rained down on him.
“Ugh…!”
Androzin narrowly avoids it and backing away, he cries out.
“Slaves, kill him!”
There are still thousands of demons around and if they come in waves, even the Lionhearted King won’t be able to withstand them.
“One minute!”
The Lionheart barks out his orders as the Death Knights sweep through the demons with flaming blades.
In the circle they create, Androzin and Leon stand face-to-face.
“Lionheart, are you the one who killed Dothraddon!”
“Dothraddon?”
Leon smirks as he summons his holy sword.
“That oversized, fatty.”
The flaming holy sword and lance are pointed at Androzin as Leon declares.
“That lowly pervert was torn limb from limb and your fate will be the same.”
“You…!”
Androzin threw his halberds with the ability to fly and chase enemies.
In response…Leon raised his spear.
“You rely on the power of magic, not your own strength, and that is why you are weak!”
Leon hurls the holy spear at the eight flying halberds.
While he despises ranged weapons, he does not discredit ranged attacks.
Weak conscripts and serfs can wield bows and cannons.
Knights, however, should not. A knight is disqualified if the wind generated by his sword is weaker than an arrow.
-Bang!
The thrown holy spear deflects the flying halberds. After deflecting three of the eight in all directions, the unabated momentum finally sliced off one of Androzin’s arms.
One of his arms was blown off, but Androzin didn’t have time to rage at the pain since a chill ran through his body, making him shiver.
The Knight charged through the five blades with his holy sword as layers upon layers of brilliant light glowed, ready to cut Androzin’s throat.
“Crave!”
Then, the crown Androzin wore glowed.
The Crown of Desire revealed the primal desires of Leon and all creatures everywhere.
“Oh, no-danger!”
“Lionheart!”
Only the non-living, the Death Knights, are not swept up in that longing but not the living Lionheart King.
The Crown of Desire has lulled even their greatest queen into sleep.
If the Lionheart King would be tempted even for one second he would die at the hands of the Archdemon.
As the dejected Death Knights hastily tugged at the reins, they saw the Lionheart King wielding his fiery holy sword.
“Kaaaahhh…!”
He leaped forward and slashed down, cutting Androzin from the tip of his shoulder to the center of his chest. It was a fatal wound.
“How, how…! How did you escape the illusion of craving?”
Androzin stumbles backwards, clutching his shoulder in pain and Leon gives him a mocking look.
“Even the Lord of Pleasure could not deceive me, so how can you deceive me!”
Every living thing has desires that it craves. How can a man not be tempted by them?
Only inscrutable emotion wells up in Androzin’s eyes as he looks at Leon.
“No, stop him, stop him, stop him!”
Androzin begins to fall backwards, panting. The queen has been corrupted, and now he must flee.
To die by the sword of a holy-law user would be true annihilation.
Androzin immediately opened the Demon Gate, hoping to buy himself some time to escape, but then──
“”Uhhhhhhhh!!!””
With a thunderous roar, two fiery bulls charged in front of Androzin.
“”Grrr…!””
Androzin falls to the ground and Leon holding the holy sword was in front of him.
“Die…!”
“Wait…!”
Androzin’s shout stops the holy sword in its tracks and he begins to babble incoherently.
“Coward!”
” Coward?”
“It was a duel, and a divine being intervened! You knights are supposed to believe in Justice!”
“Certainly… it’s not honorable for a third party to intervene in a one-on-one duel.”
“That, yes!”
“But.”
The holy sword shines brightly and Leon’s expression is determined.
“I have no honor to show you bastards, for this is not a duel, but a worm extermination!”
“Damn you, you racist-──!”
The holy sword struck down relentlessly, decapitating Androzin. At the same time, the magic of the Crown of Desire was broken, and what the demons of Lust witnessed was the decapitated Archdemon Androzin.
As his soul was absorbed into the Holy Grail, they watched in horror.
-Ah, Androzin is dead!
-We have to run!
-Where?
At that moment, the demons saw the Demon Gate that Androzin summoned to escape but at the exact same moment, Leon saw it too.
“Run! GAAAAAAA──!!”
The demons collapsed in an instant as they started running through the Demon Gate to save themselves.
After the merciless killing and slaughter, many demons survived and returned. It was a swift response.
………
……
…
“Great One, the plan has failed.”
[………….]
“Great One?”
[Ahh, this game is such a joke]
* * * *
Leon stopped his pursuit as he watched the demons hurl themselves into the Demon Gate, followed by the knights and hunters who had been slaughtering them in the chase.
“Stop the chase.”
Leon said calmly at the words of Ricardo Burns, the Death Knight.
“I had to leave an escape route open. If I destroyed the Demon Gate, you’d probably die.”
“Uh-why?”
At his question, Leon looked at the cadet Hunters, including Koo Dae-sung and Chief Kim Jin-soo, who seemed to be able to kill the remaining thousands of demons with ease.
“The soldier’s body is exhausted, so we have to stop. Excessive use of force would sacrifice the lesser ones.”
“Is that so?”
If it were Leon alone, he would have prioritized the destruction of the Demon Gate and begun the war against the demons.
But he was a commander and had many soldiers to be responsible for now.
In this battle, the trainees had done their job, and he couldn’t force them to do any more damage.
“All captains, report damage!”
One by one, the captains came forward at Leon’s shout, their faces grim despite the impossible victory they had achieved.
“Most of them are injured, but they are recovering thanks to the Holy Grail. But…….”
Koo Dae-Sung looked at the immobilized men on the shield. Their faces had become familiar over the past month.
“Six have fallen.”
“Hmm, so be it.”
Leon acted like it was no big deal but the response made Koo Dae-sung and the others feel sad.
“I will pray for them.”
As the Hunters looked on bitterly, Leon’s sword was held vertically in front of the bodies of the fallen.
“War and flame. Here your warriors died an honorable death.”
Leon drops to one knee. It was a knee he would never bend before the commoners. But for this moment, he is only a priest.
“May their souls be yours. If they have sinned in life, may they be washed away by the Great Fire, and in death may they be judged for their blazing courage, so that they may feast with the gods.”
Something transparent escaped from the bodies of the dead.
The souls of the dead Hunters were sucked into the Grail, just as the souls of the slain demons were sucked out.
However, this was not done to crush and extinguish the evil spirits, but as a pious act of welcoming them back.
After the Cataclysm, the religious world lost its power.
Everyone looked to the gods and blamed them for not answering in the face of this unexplained catastrophe.
Hunters are atheists who have made death and violence their lifelong companions. They don’t seek God, and they don’t rely on God.
But now there is a saint who performs miracles before their eyes.
There is a priest of the gods who shows them the way to salvation from the dreaded death.
“Gather the names and families of the fallen and report them to me, for their service will be rewarded by the Temple.”
How could that cold, aloof voice be so warm?
It was so different from the politicians who emphasized the loyalty and sacrifice of those who died only on the day of the ceremony.
……………
…………
………
……
…
[The gates to the paradise of the gods have been opened]
-Your soul is of low rank. You will not be allowed to enter Paradise.
-Your level of faith is low. You will not be allowed to enter Paradise.
-The level of glory you have given is too low. You will not be allowed to enter Paradise.
[Absolute effect: Blessed by the Lionheart King]
-Enter Paradise.

chapters.title: Chapter 48.1: Beatrice the Magician Queen
chapters.content:
Chapter 48.1: Beatrice the Magician Queen
Beatrice Aligieri Spero, magician-queen of the Kingdom of Spero, was a renowned saint.
Her kingdom has been prosperous and peaceful since its inception. It seemed like it would last forever.
Or so everyone thought until the invasion of demons began.
The black hordes, coming from the far west, were at first thought to be a pack of orcs but they were infamous and powerful.
Hordes of filthy lust from faraway realms have destroyed kingdoms in the blink of an eye.
The closer the black horde approached, the more the queen realized from the influx of refugees and eyewitness accounts that they were something out of the ordinary.
The momentum of the foul creatures would eventually reach the Spero Kingdom.
Of course, the honorable knights and loyal soldiers loyal to the Queen would meet the invasion as they should.
They fought back against the hordes of evil that crawled toward them and the army, led by the Magician Queen herself, gloried in victory after victory.
The refugees of the kingdom, who had been defeated over and over again, were hopeful as they watched the queen rally her troops to repel evil but it took less than thirty years for that hope to gradually crumble.
They are not a warlike group. They are weak, promiscuous and undisciplined, yet their morale is strangely high and they are strangely energetic.
They are a ragtag army of misfits, with no faith or cause, but only the pursuit of sordid pleasures, and they throw themselves fiercely into the fray.
It wasn’t until three years ago, when the Archdemon she’d defeated returned, unharmed, that she realized they could not die.
‘This war… was never meant to be won.’
They resurrect even when they die and they willingly throw themselves into the fray because they can’t die.
The population on this side is being steadily decimated but they keep coming.
No matter how many victories they win, no matter how many demons they slay, they always come back.
It was an unreasonable fight and the war went on endlessly.
Hundreds of soldiers, dragged from the crowded battlefields after repelling tens of thousands of demons, were corrupted by horrific torture and pleasure.
Demons wearing human skins infiltrated the royal castle, corrupting maidens into orgies.
Cults fill the streets, proclaiming that the pursuit of limitless pleasure is salvation.
The kingdom crumbled as knights of steel were corrupted, and soldiers defending their country pointed their spears at their families.
I can’t remember the beautiful, peaceful landscape of my homeland that I once saw.
I can’t remember the days when the streets were filled with people laughing and playing and looking forward to tomorrow…….
Doom was coming.
[Queen, make a deal with me]
The highest ranking Archdemon offered her a deal.
[If you accept the essence of corruption and survive for a hundred years, I will stop invading this world and return it to its original state.]
How could she believe him?
She didn’t even need to ask.
The kingdom had fallen, and all that remained was a castle. In the end, her people, her soldiers, her knights… all of them would be lost in the destruction.
The Archdemon’s offer was thoroughly in their favor, but Beatrice had no choice but to accept the demon bargain.
It was the only way to protect the people she loved.
* * * *
The demons’ traps were vicious.
They repeated the destruction of the kingdom for a year and when the kingdom is destroyed, it goes back to the beginning and repeats the process of destruction.
If it were only that, the people would have held on, the soldiers would have held on. But the demons of pleasure and corruption do not kill their subjects easily.
In their perverted halls of depravity, they humiliated and tortured them endlessly, subjecting them to the most horrific things a living creature could experience.
Not even death could save them and those who took their own lives became wraiths who roamed the netherworld endlessly.
In the end, they had only one choice, to corrupt themselves and join the forces of evil.
The whispers of corruption, with their promise of endless pleasure and immortality, dazzled the proud people.
Alas, I have failed.
The choices I made to save my kingdom have turned my people to evil.
The proud queen began to crumble.
As she watched her people fall again and again, she realized she would eventually fall.
It was no mere amusement that the Archdemon of Pleasure would go to such troublesome lengths to corrupt her.
It’s an innate vice that frightens even her, and its colors are corrupting even the most honorable of knights.
At this rate, even her knights will be corrupted by evil.
The queen hoped to save what remained of her knights. She had broken the pact and fallen, and in return, she hoped to save the few remaining knights.
“My queen, forgive our disloyalty.”
When one knight finally broke into the queen’s bedchamber, the Great Marshal sealed her underground, killing himself to become an incorruptible wraith.
“I…I made you this way.”
After decades of regret and exhaustion and a doomed destiny, forced to repeat itself, even though each knew the other’s end the queen wished this nightmare would end as soon as possible.
* * * *
[Hidden Quest: Save the Queen and the Kingdom]
Leon returned to the castle after killing Androzin but the castle of the Spero Kingdom is no longer filled with residents singing of hope.
“You mean everyone is already corrupted.”
“Yes-yes.”
Leon sighed sadly at Ricardo Burns’ affirmation.
He had seen so many fallen but the temptation of the demons is hard to resist for ordinary mortals and the prospect of a horrific death that would be repeated for a hundred years would only encourage corruption.
“There must have been people from the kingdom among the demons this king vanished.”
“…….”
“Pity them, but do not forgive them. There is only death for the fallen. This is immutable justice.”
The Death Knights did not respond to Leon’s heartless words but there was another question.
“What shall we…do with the dead?”
The Death Knights… the undead are unwelcome everywhere, and rightly so.
Undead who forsake the life they deserve and seek immortality are despicable.
If Leon cannot tolerate them…can they resist?
“That is not for this king to decide. First we must see the queen.”
Leon led the Death Knights to the subterranean chamber where the Queen was.
Queen Beatrice had been sealed to prevent the Corruption from advancing as far as possible but even that had failed.
Leon gazed down at the sleeping queen, breathing heavily.
“Fle, how is she?”
At his words, a divinity appeared, it was the goddess of dreams and death with hair of purple and violet.
[It’s a natural talent, one that those filthy malignants covet, and one that could have produced a truly terrifying demon lord]
It has been said that she can sway a nation by her looks and demeanor alone.
[The essence of corruption has been planted, and the evil has been amplified. The corruption is already more than halfway complete]
“But she was not corrupted; she had the vice of lust, and desired the death of the knights.”
Not because she hated the knights who imprisoned her, but to save their souls. To protect each other, both the queen and the knights did what they least wanted to do.
What royal or knight would not be moved by this loyalty?
[Leon, mark this maiden with my sigil, for if she can accept my ritual, she will radiate a divinity that will drive away the essence of corruption]
“I will gladly accept, for she is a ‘king’ who deserves it.”
Leon felt a sense of sympathy for the queen.
He, too, had spent two hundred years fighting demons and knew better than anyone how sweet its temptations and whispers can be.
Leon touched the queen’s body, and divinity flowed through him.
From the Pantheon within the Lionheart, he felt the goddess of dreams and death enter her.
The next moment, the queen’s eyes opened, revealing purple pupils.
“You have awakened from your dream, Queen Beatrice.”
[You have cleared the Hidden Quest]
-All participants’ ’Corruption Resistance’ is strengthened.
-You have obtained the Crown of Desire.
-You’ve obtained the Blade of Longing.
* * * *

chapters.title: Chapter 48.2: Beatrice the Magician Queen
chapters.content:
Chapter 48.2: Beatrice the Magician Queen
* * * *
The battle was over.
Androzin, the Archdemon of Pleasure, has been destroyed, countless demons have been slaughtered, and most of the demons have fled through the Demon Gate.
Leon’s side took a hit, too.
Six of his Hunters were killed in action. For over a month, the Hunters were depressed at the loss of their comrades-in-arms, but were relieved to read the message that their souls had made it to Paradise.
‘So even if we die… we’ll go to heaven?’
‘Wow… loyalty.’
Leon and his gods don’t hide in the clouds. They actively announce their existence and invite faith.
You shouldn’t try to trade with the gods, but that’s something they can do on their own to help their followers.
Even machines, dead wraiths, and unbelievers get a free pass if they have the Lionheart King’s endorsement.
“Your Majesty, the loot is coming.”
Chief Kim Jin-soo and the Hunters are professional hunters. Naturally, once they cleared the gate, they took the loot.
“Is this the crown and sword that the demon used?”
The crown and sword were tainted with evil, so they needed to destroy them immediately──
-Bam!
Yakt Spinner approached, his eight legs pounding the ground, and he began to wire up the beak.
“Is this your favorite?”
-Heavy metal. Useful.
“But it is tainted with evil. The blade is supposed to trap souls.”
Leon understood the nature of the blade Androzin had left behind.
A soul-trapping blade made to punish even demons. The souls of countless demons are imprisoned within that blade.
-Geeeeeeeeeeee!
-Forgive, forgive…!
-I curse you. I curse.
Just being in its vicinity erodes one’s spirit.
Hunters who actually touched it would have been tainted if not for the restoration of the Grail.
-I can handle it.
“Hmm…….”
It was none other than Holy Knight Yappy so Leon nodded and gave him permission to handle it.
And──
[Lionheart].
Fle, the God of Dreams and Death, appeared in front of them.
“Huh?”
The Hunters froze at the sudden appearance of the goddess but Leon shouted.
“On your knees, you lowly things!”
“Aye-aye!”
The Death Knights dropped to their knees and the Hunters fell to their knees as well.
Only Lionheart stood tall before the Goddess, because he could.
“Speak, Goddess.”
[Show me the crown that you have won by slaying the bastard]
“I am afraid it is a cheap object, and I fear it will stain your eyes.”
[It is all right.]
Leon held up the crown of longing and the Goddess examined it carefully.
“A crown of unusual inherent power. I was going to break it when I regained my strength.”
[I am not unaware of your intentions, but why don’t you leave this crown to me?]
Fle smiles as Leon tilts his head in question.
[This crown, you may not remember, is the one common to the Archdemons of Pleasure, whose heads you cut off]
“Is that so?”
To Leon, it was only a sinful morsel. When he cut the throats of worms, what did it matter to him what they wore on their heads?
[Those ugly demons of lust dazzle the uninitiated with meaningless visions and this crown contains such power. Perhaps I can extract something from it]
“It was an extravagant object to be destroyed anyway. I’d be happy to give it to you, if that’s what you want.”
Leon handed it over to Fle without much ado.
[Thank you, and you have done well this time. The whole Pantheon rejoices and is grateful for your glory and honor. War, say hello.]
[Greetings.]
It was then that a man who looked like he was on fire, a male god, whose searing gaze is frighteningly intense, descended beside Fle.
It was Petos, the god of war and flame.
The Hunters and Death Knights felt their very existence crushed by the appearance of this fierce deity next to Fle.
“Ugh, ugh, ugh…….”
“Ugh…!”
For the criminals, the presence of a divinity is as much pressure as a spirit body.
What about the Lionheart King that can stand tall under such pressure?
“Dream and War, I have one request.”
[It’s been a long time since I’ve seen your face, and you’re asking me out of the blue]
“I apologize.”
[What is it?]
Leon glanced at the Death Knights and saw the Queen still sleeping among them.
“I beg you, accept their souls.”
The gods did not listen in vain to the Lionhearted King’s request.
[They have broken the cycle of life and death.]
[You are too rigid, War. The power of death is mine so it’s none of your business.]
[What kind of god authorizes the undead?]
[That’s right.]
The Goddess of Dream and Death looked at the Death Knights. By nature, she should not tolerate their existence.
[The knights who defied Death are beings I should punish, for they are outside the cycle of death]
“Please…forgive me.”
At that moment, the queen opened her eyes with difficulty. She was barely holding on to her sanity amidst the essence of corruption raging within her body and the divinity of Fle trying to drive it away.
“Your Majesty…!”
The Death Knights knelt before the Queen. These loyal knights were concerned for their queen’s well-being, even in this moment when their fate was being decided and Beatrice could not turn away from this noble spirit.
“Alien divinity…the queen of a lowly nation asks you at the risk of her life…….”
The loyal knights have defended her for 95 years so the Queen would bend any pride for the peace of her knights.
[Hmm…….]
Fleur was torn between the plight of the queen, the knights and Leon’s request.
The undead are a blasphemy against death, and to allow them into Paradise is blasphemy itself.
[Loyal knights of the queen, no one in the pantheon can admit your souls to Paradise]
“……Yes.”
Ricardo Burns and the other Death Knights had already made up their minds. They want only one thing, the Queen’s safety.
[But. your merits cover your faults, your integrity impresses the gods, and above all, the Lionheart King has pleaded for your souls to me]
Fle proposed an alternative.
[I cannot admit you to Paradise, but I will give you a chance at reincarnation, a chance to cleanse your tainted souls and be reborn anew]
It was a mechanism for souls who were unworthy of paradise.
Even sinners have the opportunity to purify their souls and be reborn but the deeper the sin, the more often it is lost in the purification process.
But the sins of the Death Knights are not heavy, and they could endure.
[But, Queen and knights, the Underworld of your realm is not functioning properly due to the lack of divinity in the land]
For now, the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods and all things related to it were being run solely by Leon’s Lionheart.
But reincarnation can only function when there is enough faith in the land.
[Queen, become my priestess, and help the Lionheart King spread the faith across the land, for it is the only way to bring rest to the souls of your knights]
Beatrice bowed her head willingly.
* * * *
“Then, Your Majesty, we will go through the formalities with Her Majesty Queen Beatrice.”
In the aftermath of the Fluctuation Gate, the Hunter’s Association rallied all the Hunters they could muster and prepared for the Dungeon Break.
That lasted a week when Leon finally cleared the gate and returned home.
“Wow…….”
“Another survivor after the Yakt Spinner.”
“Pretty…….”
It’s not often that a survivor returns from the Fluctuation Gate.
Association president Oh Kang-hyuk registered Beatrice as a survivor at Leon’s request and also expressed his condolences to the deceased Hunters.
“We express our sincere condolences to the hunters for their sacrifice.”
Six Hunters died and under normal circumstances, Leon’s graduation ceremony would have been a colossal failure.
“But this was a fluctuation gate that became a red gate and an Archdemon was present so it’s a miracle you made it out with this much damage.”
“I’m sure Lord Spinner has the details, but I also need to meet with the families of the warriors.”
“In person?”
“They were one of this king’s few soldiers. It’s the least I can do.”
“You can’t do that………It could end badly.”
Mourning the dead is always emotional and the president of the Association worried that the families of the fallen might try to get back at Leon.
“It’s not that I don’t understand the wives, parents and children of the dead but they will be relieved to hear this king’s story.”
These were souls that Leon had personally blessed and guided, and they would be relieved to know how they would be treated in the paradise of the departed.
Those who have lost loved ones will be cared for by Leon’s Guild, which is the Lionheart Kingdom’s way of honoring the fallen.
“Release the video and summon more Hunters. The Evil Ones will eventually invade your world, and we will need soldiers and knights for that day.”
“…….”
Association President Oh Kang-hyuk has already seen the video of what happened inside the gate.
The Demons of Pleasure and Corruption have been seen in Mexico and other places in South America.
The city they corrupted in that poorly governed South American country was eventually nuked.
Oh Kang-hyuk had seen the deeds of those filthy, lustful demons time and time again on record.
“Your Majesty, your power is optimal for dealing with demons, isn’t it?”
“Yes.”
“Then…….”
Oh Kang Hyuk told him about the upcoming Association-wide schedule, and Leon gladly accepted.
At the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods compound in the Naju Plains.
The events of the Fluctuation Gate and the cadets’ graduation ceremony were not yet finalized, but Leon had an urgent need for ‘help’.
The people of this world could not help, only the strength of faith, built up to this point, could get him there.
Leon closes his eyes and allows himself to fall into a coma.
In his spiritual state, he sees a purple goddess staring at him.
[Try to take my hand]
Touching the glorified jade body of a deity is a familiar experience for the Lionheart King. Drawn to the goddess, he turns to his heart.
The temple of all the gods is enshrined in the Lionheart, the only one item that generates its own holy power.
It was a place granted to Leon alone among mortals since the dawn of the Age of Gods: Paradise of the Gods.
There were those who waited for him before the magnificent shrine.
“Welcome, Your Majesty.”
There was a woman with long brown hair and a cotton robe but she had a divine radiance about her that could not have come from a mere mortal.
“Anak.”
“The servant of a lesser god meets the agent of the gods.”
Leon stared at the multitude of people behind the kneeling saint’s back.
Each and every one of them a servant of the gods who had reached the pinnacle of their mortal existence and deserved to dine with the gods in the Great Hall.
Ancient Lionheart Kings, Great Holy Knights, sages of the forest and champions of the gods.
“”Welcome, greatest Grail Keeper.””
It was a paradise created by the gods for mortals and in the center of that temple, the heroes and believers bowed before him.

chapters.title: Chapter 49: Paradise of the Gods
chapters.content:
Chapter 49: Paradise of the Gods
“Anak, it’s been a while. Is paradise comfortable?”
“Thanks to your Majesty’s protection.”
Anak Prothesia, High Priestess of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods, stood with Leon until the final battle, when she fell at the hands of demons 180 years ago but she was not alone.
“Lord Gildus, Sir Antoine, you’re all good.”
Gildus the Holy Knight, Belton the legendary ogre slayer, and──
“Your Majesty.”
“Emperor.”
Argent Majesty Lionheart, Leon’s ancestral Lionheart King.
Such legendary heroes stood before Leon.
Unlike those who lived and died in ordinary lives, they lived lives of honor and glory and went to be with the gods.
This was their paradise. Heaven and hell in earthly terms.
The afterlife, which, according to the Book of Ten Thousand Gods, is divided into a resting place and a place of soul purification.
“New souls must have come here, have you heard any rumors?”
Leon asked, referring to the dead trainees at the gate and Argent Lionheart said.
“The first new souls in 180 years. Rest assured, they are welcome.”
‘Indeed.’
Normally, entering the afterlife is a taboo for the living. But for Leon, who represents the gods of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods, it was permitted.
“Ordinarily, I would greet the gods of the Temple of the Ten Thousand Gods and seek to resolve this dispute, but the situation is urgent. I must borrow the wisdom of the ancestors.”
“I will give you my friend Petelion.”
The horse offered by the Ancestral Lionheart King of Argent was a stately, muscular black horse. The only difference was that it had wings.
Petelion, a celestial horse that only a few of the Lionheart Kings had ever handled, had died fighting a Demon Lord alongside the Argent Lionheart King.
Leon rides him and floats into the vastness of the sky.
In this paradise of the honored, the steeds that served them in life also live on.
As he rides across the open meadows, many knights’ steeds recognize the king’s and bow their heads.
Perhaps someday he and Stallion will ride through this place.
‘No, not now, not without leaving a legacy.’
Leon sees this paradise as the last bastion of the gods, a community of shared destiny. As such, he allowed himself many of the taboos imposed on mortals.
“Over there, Lord Petelion.”
-Purrrr!
Understanding Leon’s words, the pegasus landed in the middle of the forest at the mouth of Paradise and the dark forest shook as he landed.
“Lion…Heart.”
“The rightful Archduke of Dragonia.”
“Lord of the Sacred Objects.”
The voices echoed throughout the forest, and one need not look far to see that the dense giants around them were all Sages.
“I apologize for trespassing on your territory, Sages of the Forest.”
“To you…….”
“To the Lion King.”
“All living things… are indebted.”
“Even the gods.”
“You need not be polite. The forest always welcomes you.”
“Honorable, descendant of a dragon slayer.”
“Heir to the lion’s heart.”
“For what purpose?”
“To visit- the paradise.”
Leon was pleased with their reception and mouthed the name of a sage.
“I wish to meet the youngest sage among you, my friend Gunnar.”
The forest moved and one of the sleeping giants stirred, revealing its features through the rough bark.
These forest spirits, called Tree Men, are the awakened selves of the oldest trees.
“Leon. My old friend.”
Gunnar the Tree Giant was Leon’s traveling companion from his days as an acolyte, and a comrade-in-arms in the Last War.
He bent down to his roots, over fifteen meters tall, and locked eyes with Leon.
“What brings you to me?”
“I need your seedlings.”
“Hooo…….”
Tree men who have risen through the ranks to become Sages of the Forest are given the opportunity to plant a “tree”.
“You did not plant a seedling before you were laid to rest in the arms of Paradise so you must plant a seedling of your own.”
“Is it…urgent?”
“This world, Earth, this king’s home world, is being invaded by evil species. This expedition has shown me that their plot has reached alarming proportions.”
Leon remembered the Daemon Gate in Queen Beatrice’s Spero kingdom.
A gate tampered with by someone and a kingdom where the demons of pleasure ran amok meant one thing.
“They have sensed my presence and have begun to play tricks on me. They must have infiltrated this world as well.”
“Just like the Empire….”
What makes demons so terrifying is not their strength, nor their infinite resurrection. It’s that they corrupt humans, rotting them from the inside out.
Their ghostly movements had to be stopped, at least where Leon was active.
“You’re the only one alive who can take these things from the Underworld, and that’s good. I can trust you with it.”
Gunnar gladly handed Leon his seedling. The tiny seedling, barely ten centimeters tall, looked fragile, as if it could snap in the wind.
“The moment you plant this, you’ll attract the attention of the evil ones. It’ll be dangerous.”
“I’m prepared for that.”
Accepting the seedling, he hurried back to the temple. This was the world of the dead and no good could come for the living to linger among them.
“It has been a pleasure to see you, my old friend.”
Gunnar’s voice echoed through the forest.
* * * *
Leon was about to return with Gunnar seedlings.
“Lord Leon.”
“Sir Gratas.”
Holy Knight Gratas, the Giant Slayer, is a Holy Knight two generations older than Leon and a friend of Leon’s mentor, Sir Gordic.
He is also the author of the Holy Knights’ army training manual.
But that was not all. Saint Anak and the 13th Lionheart king, Argent Majesty Lionheart also came to him.
“What can I do for you all?”
Leon asked, and Argent spoke for them.
“After much discussion, I have decided to give you something you need right now. In this world, there are limits to holy power, so there are limits to what you can do.”
King Argent Lionheart placed a set of reins in Leon’s hands.
“This is…….”
“The reins of a master trainer who can control even illusory beasts. When I died, I entrusted them to you, and you buried them with me.”
“Hmmm…….”
Leon knew the value of this treasure, which is why he wanted the Lionheart King to hold the reins as he rode through the paradise of the gods.
For no soul can take possession of a treasure once it has passed into his possession.
“My turn.”
Holy Knight Gratas approached and handed Leon a book.
“What is this?”
“I have heard that you are training your soldiers from scratch. As King Lionheart, I imagine it must be frustrating to not have the elite of a proud kingdom.”
The book Gratas handed him was no ordinary book. It was carefully woven from leather, and reeked of holy power.
“It’s one of my lifetime’s worth of training tips, and I hope it helps.”
“How to Catch a Giant with a Serf…? Isn’t it a training manual from the legend of Lord Gratas, something so valuable?”
“Hehe, no big deal.”
“Indeed, a book compiled by the legendary Holy Knight is a holy relic in its own right. I was skeptical since it was only a story, but are you saying that you really captured a giant with serfs?”
“Three hundred of the five hundred died.”
“Who cares about the lives of serfs?”
Rather, it was the effective use of those barbarian bums that was the achievement.
As he held the gifts from King Argent Lionheart and Gratas, he was approached by Saint Anak.
“I will give you my necklace.”
The symbol of the Lionheart Kingdom is a necklace shape of a crossed sword and Leon knew its value better than anyone.
“The holy relics of saints are treasures that can only be passed on through saints. How can I receive this?”
“Who would argue with the Acting High Priestess of the All-Seeing Eye? It will protect you before the Holy Sword’s restoration.”
Leon hesitated for a moment before accepting her gift. Tradition requires flexibility in times of crisis.
Anak holy object would only be used once, but it would be of great help at a critical time.
“Thank you, everyone. I will put your gifts to good use.”
And with that, Leon returned from the paradise of the gods to the realm of the living, carrying a seedling, a holy book, and a treasure.
* * * *
When Leon opened his eyes, the first thing he saw was the items in his hand.
The holy book of Lord Gratas, Grail Knight, the reins of the 13th Lionheart King, Argent, the holy relic of Anak, Saint of Light and Justice, and finally, the seedling of the sage Gunnar.
The other treasures were precious but Leon needed to find a place to plant the Seedling of Gunnar as soon as possible.
‘The President of the Association will send new trainees. I will train them and finish a minimum unit.’
Recruiting more soldiers is not the only issue. If soldiers are support, knights are the mainstay. The Association president has presented a great opportunity, but Leon didn’t have enough knights right now.
‘For him…….’
Leon turned from his seat and headed for a room in the Ten Thousand Gods compound. He knocked on the door, a rare practice for him, and waited for the other party to respond.
“I am King Lionheart, will you allow me to visit?”
There was no answer, just the door opening of its own accord, waiting for him to enter.
Leon would have gladly walked through this door. But he didn’t.
“You won’t come in?”
“Because you won’t let me.”
This is how Leon shows respect. You don’t go into the bedroom of royalty uninvited.
“You’re a proper gentleman, come in.”
Leon crossed the threshold of the queen’s bedroom. And…he notices that the air in the room has changed.
Just breathing in the air made him dizzy, it was a power of corruption that seduced the rational…nay, the living. Although not as much as before, still, a man would have her at the drop of a hat.
“Queen Beatrice, I apologize for keeping you here in such humble quarters.”
“It’s nothing for an exiled queen, Your Majesty Lionheart, and I hope you’ll just…forgive my rudeness.”
Every gesture was deadly.
Indeed, the next Lord of Pleasure was an ill-fated talent, not that she can help it.
“The divinity within you is suppressing the essence of corruption… but not completely. For the time being, we must balance it.”
“Divine power…Your Majesty does indeed possess much power.”
“The gods love me and a king as beloved as I am can do many things.”
Beatrice smiled at his unquestioning assurance and he handed her some wine. It was a tribute from the Association, but Leon was not much of a drinker.
“Is this a farewell drink for the knights?”
“Because it’s all I can do.”
Beatrice stared at the crimson liquid in her goblet with a weary gaze.
“Couldn’t your majesty have had them as vassals?”
The Death Knights may be ghosts, but they are not without power.
If Leon hadn’t sanctified their souls on the spot-no, if he’d made the knights his servants on the condition of sanctification-who could have refused, the Queen or the Death Knights?
In all the wars of history, each Grail Knight ascended, one by one, as they were destroyed by evil ones.
Leon could have done it but he didn’t.
“To use the dead is an affront to them. How could I dishonor them and take advantage of their ghosts?”
“Even if the end is destruction?”
“Then I will ascend with honor.”
What an old-fashioned, upstanding man.
Beatrice knew the difference between this alien Lion King and herself.
The Lion King refused to compromise even in the face of destruction and demanded justice.
The victor is not the wise one, but the one who stays true to his convictions, is the difference between her and himself.
“You’ve been in this world for two days. Have you adjusted?”
“I think I’ll need more time. This is…different from my world.”
Back on Earth, Beatrice was eagerly guided and introduced by the Association staff and realized that it was a very different world.
The internet, cars, airplanes…all of these things are shocking to her. Leon was an inhabitant of a world not unlike her own.
“You don’t have to adapt.”
“Why?”
“We are proud and follow our own laws. A king must enforce his rule wherever he goes. The lawless ones simply follow the king’s path.”
“The mindset of an invader?”
“Not quite. To benefit the people through righteous teaching, it is the enlightenment of the Lionheart King.”
Beatrice smiled bitterly at the man’s shamelessly enormous confidence. Well, at least he could handle the insanity of fighting demons for hundreds of years.
“I’m guessing demons aren’t the only thing you’re up against.”
“Indeed. This king has a noble quest from the Gods of Heaven and Earth.”
Leon patted his chest and addressed the queen.
“Therefore, I ask you, Magician Queen of the Spero Kingdom, to join me in this king’s cause.”
Beatrice knew that Leon had triumphed over the demons in the end, so much so that they feared him.
“I am indebted to you, and how can I not repay you?”
Beatrice covered her chest and bowed respectfully. It was the least she could do for the benefactor who had saved her and her knights.
“But there is one thing.”
The queen’s violet eyes glowed darkly.
“Teach me the power to destroy the Archdemons of Pleasure.”
The Queen has lost her kingdom.
History has repeated itself for a hundred years, and all but the most loyal knights have fallen.
The queen of a ruined kingdom was unable to fulfill her duty to protect it and her only remaining duty is to seek revenge.
Knowing her intentions, Leon gladly accepted the offer.
“I’ll do anything to kill those filthy parasites, and it thrills me to see their souls extinguished by the holy arts they fear.”
“……Uh-oh.”
Indeed, the Holy Law, the only way to destroy a demon, was what Beatrice coveted.
“In my kingdom, demons are executed by boiling them in a cauldron. They keep coming back to life, so it makes sense to traumatize them.”
“Wise, for they are selfish and filthy. Have you ever driven an awl under a demon’s nail? That’s when they scream the loudest.”
“I’ve skinned them and rolled them in a field of nails.”
“Hahaha, that’s very creative.”
The two deepen their conversation.
“Hahahahaha……!”
“Hoo hoo hoo hoo…….”
The demonic butchers’ laughter spreads, merry and eerie.

chapters.title: Chapter 50: Lord Yappy’s Big Data
chapters.content:
Chapter 50: Lord Yappy’s Big Data
Ha-ri starts her mornings early.
She wakes up at the crack of dawn, does a light workout, and eats a fried egg with ketchup.
Her morning routine is pretty conscientious for a modern person. Ha-ri hasn’t seen anyone get up earlier than her since her orphanage days.
“Ah, Your Majesty, have you had a good morning?”
“Yeah.”
But Leon’s mornings were much earlier than Ha-ri’s. Never one to go to bed early, he was up before the morning chickens crowed.
He rises and swings his sword mechanically. Although he never breaks a sweat in battle, what kind of intense training does he have to do to break a sweat?
“You’re an early riser, I see.”
“Morning, Your Grace.”
A ghostly woman in a black dress, her face hidden by a veil.
“Have a seat, Queen.”
Leon offers her a seat and the two casually sit down on a bench in the training center.
“Make us a cup of tea.”
“Yikes!”
Ha-ri blushed and prepared a teacup for both of them.
“Your Majesty, would you like green tea or barley tea?”
“Hmm, my queen. Black tea would be proper, but these people don’t know how to make tea.”
“As long as it’s hot, she’s fine.”
“I’ve been neglecting, but I’ll have to hire a maid after all. Han Ha-ri.”
“Ah, yes!”
Leon said, gracefully drinking the barley tea Ha-ri offered.
“You may attend to Queen Beatrice for now. I don’t care about your luggage, but I want you to dress and behave appropriately for the queen.”
“Ha… yes.”
“It is not necessary for you to go to such lengths.”
“No. Royalty must be properly attended to and cared for.”
“Then… Did you say you were Miss Ha-ri?”
The queen’s veiled gaze turned to Ha-ri.
“Ah, yes!”
“I sense an intense aura of fire coming from you, and if you don’t mind, I’d like to take a look.”
Did she recognize her unique skill?
The queen’s unexpected suggestion caught Leon off guard.
“Very well, then, draw your sword. You’ve been carrying the load, and you deserve it.”
Leon hands over the sword, as if she’s honored to be taught by king Lionheart himself.
Ha-ri hesitantly took the sword.
“Where did your swordsmanship come from?”
“I learned it from my master at the Academy. I’ve heard that he was a promising swordsman before the Cataclysm.”
“Show me your swordsmanship. I’ll take a look.”
“Yes!”
Ha-ri gripped the wooden sword and stood as Leon instructed.
As a recent graduate of the Hunter Academy, she hadn’t had much training and what she had learned was basic swordsmanship so there was a gap in her skills compared to the arcane skills that the Ten Guilds kept hidden.
Rejecting the offers of the Ten Guilds in the draft, Ha-ri had to develop her own swordsmanship on her own.
Ha-ri swings the sword as she imagines a swift, loud blow that slices through space.
Ha-ri was a prodigy…the youngest Rank A Hunter but Leon looked at her sword swing and said nonchalantly.
“It’s a big move.”
“……Yes.”
It was fast, but that’s all. A fast sword that relied on physical ability has many gaps and a large range.
“That’s assuming you use your abilities.”
“Well, yes, sir. You recognized it right away, didn’t you?”
“Because I saw it when you fought that honorable knight at the Hunan Gate.”
Leon remembered fighting the Dulahan.
“Watch this king closely. Swords are meant to be swung hard, but in short bursts.”
Leon takes up the sword himself, assumes a top stance and strikes down with a light, quick slash.
It seems light and simple at first, but the movements are small and unassuming. He had such skill that even the queen admired it. And then──
-Kwazik! Kwazik!
Sharp sword winds scraped the floor and cut through the outer walls. It was a terrifying sword wind that would tear the entire training center apart with just a little more force.
“It’s easy enough, try to imitate it by swinging the sword ten thousand times a day.”
“Ugh…….”
“And then there’s the Blessing of Fire, which requires you to swing the sword with all your might to maximize its power. Demonstrate it once more by using it.”
Ha-ri’s unique skill, Blessing of Fire, gave her heat resistance and the ability to convert magic into fire.
It requires a medium, and in the hustle and bustle of battle, it’s most efficient to use a sword as a medium to ignite the fire and swing it with full force.
When combined with her own unique skill, Blessing of Fire, Ha-ri’s swordplay was quite colorful and convincing.
“Beatrice, what do you think?”
“Her use of fire is immature.”
The queen stood up and drew her sword. It was a sword from the royal family of Spero.
“The only way to use fire with swordsmanship is to imbue the sword with fire magic.”
The queen snapped her fingers, and fire leapt from her sword. It was a fire created by magic.
“Fire is a fragile power,” she said, “it must be compressed, not scattered.”
Beatrice’s words were true, and the fire in her sword was compressed to the limit.
Unlike Ha-ri’s fire, which quickly scatters around the sword, hers clings to the blade, unbroken.
Her movements as she demonstrated with the fire sword were as beautiful as if she were dancing, causing Ha-ri to let out an involuntary gasp of admiration. Just then──
“Releasing the compressed fire is a deadly move. Just like this stab──”
The sword soared towards the sky and in the next instant, a fiercely spinning flame shot out like a cannonball, tearing a hole in the clouds.
“Eh…….”
A hole in the sky…Ha-ri stared dumbfounded at the sky above her.
“Compressed fire doesn’t leave flesh behind, you just have to compress it to a high enough temperature to turn it into ash, easy, right?”
“…….”
Not easy.
Ha-ri had been taught by some of the greatest minds in the world, but the words of geniuses were hard to understand.
* * * *
The new cadets have arrived.
The Association has announced the achievements of Leon’s first class of cadets and promoted them all at once.
-Really, all those Ten Thousand Year D-ranks just got promoted to C-rank?
(TL Note: They’re mocking the hunters who were stuck to D-rank for a long time)
