Ha-ri said she had something for him, and they arrived at a Gate where staff from the Hunter’s Association was waiting for them.
“Welcome, Your Majesty.”
The Hunter’s assault team, including Chief Kim Jin-soo, stood heavily armed, waiting for Leon.
“What a surprise.”
“Yes! Actually, we’ve gathered here as a reward for your Majesty from the Association, in support of Deputy Han Ha-ri, who organized this event!”
“Hmm?”
Organized? What does that even mean? Leon didn’t know much about it, since Ha-ri had brought him here as a surprise.
To be honest, he’d only come because he thought it wouldn’t be a sham if Yappy cooperated as well…….
“Let’s enter the gate!”
Ha-ri walked through the gate, which opened onto a vast forest.
“What is this place?”
“This is a training gate managed by the Association.”
The Association maintains several gates for training and business purposes.
Like the gate at Seoul Station, there were several gates that were not only used to test Hunters’ ratings, but also to train their own raiding teams.
One of them was reserved for Leon.
“I’m going to introduce you to the gate now, “she said, “The characteristic of this gate is an area called Suhae, where various flora, fauna and monsters appear.”
Since the gate is only green, there are no dangerous monsters. The Association also visits it for adaptation training, and most importantly, herbs that only grow here are regenerated.
“One point for small animals, three points for medium ones, and ten points for the occasional orc!”
“Hmm…In short, hunting.”
“Yep. It’s a recurring gate that regenerates over time anyway, so don’t worry about it, just hunt as long as you want!”
Leon knew why Ha-ri had brought him here. It was a hunt.
“I was only guessing, but I thought hunting might be in vogue where your Majesty lives.”
“So you’ve set up a hunting ground for this king?”
How could she think such a thing?
Leon knew what Ha-ri’s intentions were. He hid it well, but his gloomy demeanor must have shown in the child’s eyes. Then again, the goddess had told him to rest.
“Hunting…hunting…….”
As Ha-ri suspected, hunting is a favorite pastime of knights and nobles in the Lionheart Kingdom but it has been 200 years since he last hunted.
They refine their bodies, win the competition in style, and offer their victories to the gods.
It’s a noble virtue to enjoy the thrill of the hunt, even if the countless wars against demons have left them little time for it.
“They’re hunters, aren’t they? They’re carrying instruments.”
The heavily armed hunters would enter the field with these loud instruments to herd and drive their prey.
Yes, a hunt must have a leader to make it fun.
Leon smirked and turned to Ha-ri.
“Did you say there are orcs?”
“Yes! That’s why we’re all fully armed!”
“Let’s go.”
Leon spurred his horse into a gallop, and the Association hunters began to cackle loudly.
* * * *
The Clawed Tribe are forest orcs who live in the forest and lead a peaceful, hunter-gatherer lifestyle.
They worship the forest gods, offering sacrifices to them and claiming to be the stewards of the forest.
-Aaahhhh!
A scream echoes through the dense forest as a rumbling laugh bursts from him.
“Kahahaha! You damned big axes, you dare to hunt on our territory? As we haven’t had enough game lately, one of your biceps would be enough for a meal!”
“Skin their faces first, we need to sacrifice their skulls to the gods!”
They are hunting the same tribe of orcs since they’ve recently been engaged in a bloody war of attrition with other orc tribes over territory in the forest.
The Forest Orcs, who are few in number, could have chosen to coexist with each other, but they choose to fight.
There is no coexistence between them, only battle and killing to enforce their wishes.
-Dag-dag-dag-dag!
“Hmm? What’s that sound?”
“It’s the sound of a boar running and a rather large…….”
The moment the Clawed Tribe Orc hunters craned their heads in the direction of the sound, a huge presence burst out.
“Huh?”
A white steed and a spear with delicate and exquisite engravings that couldn’t be compared to the crude things of the forest, it was──
-Eh!
It pierced the Forest Orc’s heart.
-What!
-Intruder!
Screams erupted from the orcs as a knight appeared from nowhere and hunted them down.
“Hahahahahaha! I guess there’s something to be said for hunting instead of fighting.”
“Who are you, you!”
“Human! How dare you kill a member of our tribe?”
“Kill him!”
The Forest Orcs charged, but their opponent was a Grail Guardian, the pinnacle of Holy Knights and the orcs, no more than forty in all, were swept aside.
“Run!”
“Monster! Run!”
The orcs tried to flee into the forest, realizing the battle was one-sided. As long as he was alone and using melee weapons, he wouldn’t be able to hunt down the entire tribe after all.
-Snap!
“Thud!”
A fleeing orc fell to the ground as an arrow pierced his neck.
“Barzah, what?!”
One after another, the orcs fell to the ground, their thick hides able to withstand most of the arrows, but the skill of the bowman was too much for them, and they fell to the ground.
With only a few of the tribal orcs able to escape into the forest, Leon dismounted.
“If you’ve hunted, you should take the mark.”
Leon pulled out a molar from a decapitated orc and put it in his pocket. The pouch was already full of orc molars.
“Mmmm…….”
Ha-ri, who had followed him to the carnage, dismounted and smiled awkwardly.
“You’re a good archer, aren’t you?”
As Ha-ri remembers, Leon is a notorious range hater in the Association, which is why she didn’t bring a bow and arrow for this hunt.
However, after Leon wiped out the first group of orcs, he took the orc hunter’s bow and arrow and used it to hunt the orcs. And for a man who despises ranged weapons, he shot surprisingly well with the bow.
“You’re mistaken. Just because you’re a knight doesn’t mean you can’t use ranged weapons.”
“Is that… true?”
“Hunting is a nobleman’s virtue and pastime, how can it be done only with spears and swords?”
Knights, especially those who travel a lot, must provide for themselves in the wilderness so they had no choice but to become masters of hunting, and of course they shot bows and arrows.
“The bow is a weak weapon for killing monsters, but it’s good enough for killing prey.”
“You… have a point, but this… you’re a really good marksman.”
Leon chuckled at Ha-ri’s honest admiration.
“This king was famous for being the greatest tournament champion of all time, but he was also the second-best hunter of his time, and he won the occasional hunting contest.”
“Your Majesty was the second, so the first was another Holy Knight?”
“Hmm, it is ambiguous to call him a Holy Knight. He was favored by the Moon and the Goddess of the Hunt, but he was more of a hunter than a knight.”
Leon remembered a memory from the past. When the kingdom was still at peace, before the demons invaded.
The kingdom’s greatest knights and nobles had traveled to a tournament to showcase their prowess.
“The High Priestess of the Moon and the Hunt was a saint, and her bow was like a meteor, which, when drawn to its fullest, would have cleared a mountain ridge.”
“…”
It was an outrageous thing to say but Ha-ri knew well what those favored by the gods were capable of.
Splitting a giant bear over fifty meters long or wiping out hundreds of demons in a single strike. And it was clear from the Jeju Island Gate that someone with this much power was classified as a ‘Holy Knight’, not even a peak level.
“But… did you really have to hunt only orcs like this?”
“I apologize for that. But how can we hunt rabbits when there are bears in the forest, and if we want to win first place in the tournament, we have to go after the big game.”
He looked at the orcs like they were his prey and Ha-ri smiled bitterly.
“There’s the chieftain’s corpse, and judging by the witchcraft, he must have some good stuff.”
“Ah, indeed. It’s a shaman’s totem. It’s not a common drop.”
“Sell it and give it to one of the employees who acted as a peddler.”
“Eh? What, you don’t mind? It’s a pretty good one, it’ll cost around 100 million.”
“It’ll be a small price to pay for all those people who came here on their off days.”
“Ugh!”
Ha-ri coughed at the bluntness of the expression since she just asked the Association for a gate to serve as a hunting ground for Leon, nothing more.
The mobilization of workers in the middle of their workday was a mandate from higher ups in the Association to look good for Leon.
It’s easy to mobilize subordinates anywhere and for their organization to look good to Leon, but it’s a sin to have salaried workers sweating and struggling at the gate.
“By the way, the footprints of the fleeing orcs lead here.”
“More hunting? According to the mapped information, you’ve crushed a bunch of orcs…….”
“Yes. The beasts pollute the forest with their breath, and I cannot allow that to continue. Orcs must be slain, even if they are fake.”
“Hah…….”
Leon handed the orc’s bow and quiver to Ha-ri, who sighed.
“You’re going to have to be good at everything if you want to be a knight. Today, practice your bow.”
“Uhm…I’ve only used a bow in the academy, on the aptitude test.”
Ha-ri feels awkward about her lack of skill but Leon patted her on the shoulder and laughed.
“I can teach you the basics.”
“Is that so?”
Ha-ri smiled weakly at Leon’s words.
“I’m glad you’re feeling better, though.”
“…….”
Anyone who sat on a throne would receive offerings of jesters and treasures to have his mood checked.
It was a routine that he remembers always treating mechanically but Ha-ri did this purely to cheer himself up. There was no aspiration or desire in it.
“Well, that’s nice.”
“What, I didn’t hear you right?”
“I want you to kill at least three orcs, and if you don’t, I’ll show you the old ways.”
“Old ways?! I haven’t shot that bow many times, lord!”
Leon reined in his horse and Ha-ri hurried after him.
* * * *
A few days later, Ha-ri strolled the grounds of the Ten Thousand Gods Guild, smiling from ear to ear.
After that day’s hunt, Leon was in good spirits and Ha-ri’s plan had been quite successful.
“Deputy.”
“Ah, Chief!”
On her way to the warehouse to pick up her training wooden sword, Ha-ri spotted Chief Kim Jin-soo, an employee of the Association.
“What are you doing here, I thought you went to collect the harvested rice from the rice warehouse.”
“My tractor broke down. I came to pick up some supplies.”
“It breaks down often. Is it because it’s an old machine?”
“Well, it hasn’t been taken out since the Naju plains were contaminated with miasma, so it must be poorly maintained.”
“If this is the case, wouldn’t it be better to use horses or cows like in the old days?” Ha-ri blurted out her thoughts.
“……might be right.”
“What?”
“No, when the king blesses them, they’re almost like new horses, right? I heard that the horses we bought from Jeju Island ran much better than before after the blessing ceremony.”
Indeed. The horses purchased at the Jeju Gate were reinforced with the Sun King’s reins and the gap between the two became so huge that even one horse is enough to take over the world horse racing market.
“It’s made them a little unruly too…”
“Well, the hunters are superhuman, so I guess that balances out.”
They arrived at the warehouse, chatting away. Every time Ha-ri stopped here, she cleared her mind and said a prayer.
This is where the hammer left by the Grail Knight, Sir Georgic, is stored.
“Holy Fire…….”
“According to the doctrine of the Ten Thousand Gods, wouldn’t your Buddhist and Christian prayers be blasphemy?”
Kim Jin-soo draws a holy symbol and scolds Ha-ri. The two opened the warehouse door and──
“……?”
“Huh?”
There was no sign of Sir Georgic’s hammer anywhere in the warehouse.

chapters.title: Chapter 67: Georgic Hammer
chapters.content:
Chapter 67: Georgic Hammer
The Ten Thousand Gods Guild (I’ll shorten it to TTG Guild) headquarters is located in the middle of a wide valley surrounded by five mountains.
It’s not too far from the city, but it’s not easy to access either. Sometimes golfers who use the nearby golf course see it.
Until recently, it was contaminated by miasma and some roads were blocked.
Recently, the Shrine of the Goddess of Life and Abundance was built and the TTG Guild headquarters moved in, so some hunters and related people visited.
But lately, the TTG Guild headquarters has become quite a hot place. Mostly thanks to hunters and tourists who watch them.
“Yes, number 59! Mr. Han Jin-soo, an A-class hunter from the Matrix Guild!”
At the entrance of the headquarters a burly man walks up from the front of the line.
Han Jin-soo, famous for being an iron wall tanker, had muscles and was over 2m tall.
Ha-ri swallowed her saliva as she saw the huge Han Jin-soo casting a shadow and carefully handed him the microphone.
“Mr. Han Jin-soo! How do you feel as a challenger?”
“What do you mean how do I feel? Can I really take this hammer if I lift it?”
Han Jin-soo’s eyes were on the big one-handed hammer. All the challengers looked at it with greedy eyes and tourists were filming it, wondering if it would succeed this time.
If he’s such a powerful hunter, he might be able to lift that hammer that looks a bit heavy…
No, but no hunter has been able to lift that hammer so far. It was because the hammer was so heavy that even the self-proclaimed hunters couldn’t lift it.
But Han Jin-soo overlapped his palms on the handle of the hammer and grinned.
‘I have a unique skill <Weight Conversion>. No weight is a problem for me!’
As soon as he activated his unique skill, Han Jin-soo tried to lift the hammer lightly. But…
“Huh?”
It doesn’t budge. Even though he reduced the weight of the hammer to almost 0 kg with weight conversion, the hammer didn’t move as if it was stuck to the ground.
“If you can’t do it, move on quickly. There are a lot of people waiting.”
“No, not yet!”
Han Jin-soo now pulled the hammer with all his strength. He squeezed out all his strength from his feet to his milk-drinking strength.
But in the end, the hammer didn’t budge at all, and neither did anyone else.
This whole situation goes back to a week ago.
“Your Majesty! Your Majesty! It’s a big deal!”
On his way to have lunch with Beatrice, Ha-ri ran up with Kim Jin-soo.
“Tsk, don’t be rude. How can a maid act so lightly.”
“That’s sexist… Anyway! It’s a big deal!”
“What’s going on?”
When Leon asked with a faint sigh, Ha-ri quickly reported the situation.
“Georgic hammer disappeared from the warehouse!”
“The hammer is gone?”
“Yes! I went in with Mr. Kim Jin-soo today and it suddenly disappeared… It must have been stolen!”
“That can’t be.”
“Uh… But it really disappeared?”
“That hammer can’t be held by anyone who isn’t qualified. If it disappeared, it wasn’t theft by necessity, but something the hammer decided for itself.”
“…”
Does that make sense?
Ha-ri swallowed the question that was about to come out of her mouth.
Yeah, whatever this person says, it makes sense. Even if not, there’s no need to get scolded by picking a fight.
“I feel the energy close by. Let’s go that way.”
Leon took the lead and Ha-ri and the Queen followed.
Surprisingly, the hammer that had disappeared was in the middle of the TTG Guild building.
“What is this?”
“I don’t know, it doesn’t budge.”
“Who brought it here?”
The hammer in the middle of the training ground attracted the attention of the trainees and cadets.
It’s inevitable that it would catch your eye even if you don’t like it when it’s there.
“What is the intention of this?”
Leon stared at the holy hammer stuck in the ground. The hammer that didn’t budge even when the cadets grabbed it was easily lifted up by Leon’s hand.
But that was only for a moment. The hammer moved by itself as if drawn by a magnet and soon escaped from Leon’s hand and stuck back to the ground.
“Oh my~ It’s a hammer with a strong self-expression.”
“…It seems to have something it wishes for.”
Ha-ri chuckled at Leon’s guess.
“Does the hammer have a will?”
“Sometimes they do if they are holy relics. Especially if they have been with a saint for a long time, they become temperamental.”
Holy relics are objects that have been touched by a saint and blessed by him. Especially the weapons of the Holy Knights have both blessing (holy) and star energy (star).
The holy relics exposed to the most high-dimensional energy in the world sometimes have their own will. It can be called egoization.
“However, I didn’t feel such a will when I fought with Georgic.”
Leon remembered Georgic declaration before handing over this hammer.
「I swear allegiance to the Lionheart King and receive Demera’s recognition! Through this hammer, you will inherit Georgic power!!」
It was an oath he made with his soul. It is no exaggeration to say that this hammer contains the will of a Holy Knight.
That is, the hammer wants to fulfill Georgic oath.
“I see. You want me to find you a master.”
Leon snickered and threw the hammer behind him.
“Leave it alone. And let the Association know.”
“What should I tell them?”
“Whoever holds the hammer, I’ll give them this hammer no matter who they are.”
Leon’s declaration was immediately conveyed to the Association through Ha-ri.
[Is it a reward item for clearing the gate?]
“It’s a little different.”
[Wait. I’ll send an appraiser first.]
The appraiser sent by the Association examined the immovable hammer and screamed in less than 10 seconds.
“Waaaaaah! What is this!!”
“Why, why are you like that?!”
The employee sent as an appraiser, Lee Chan-soo, trembled as if he couldn’t believe what he saw.
“Eh, epic…!”
“Epic?!” After the Great Cataclysm, items were classified into normal, rare, unique and legendary.
Basically, fine products made by blacksmiths called master craftsmen are unique. Legendary items are made with countless resources and painstaking efforts.
Legendary items are usually made by a fate-like luck of one in ten million.
The probability is so astronomical that usually legendary items are dropped items from gates.
But there were items called ‘epic’ in 30 years of history.
The Heavenly Demon’s Breaking Heaven Sword, the owner of the Ten Thousand Mountains of the Continent.
The staff of the founder of the World Magic Tower and the Twelve Rings that are said to open up heaven and earth.
The heart of the Frost Queen who is still swallowing and expanding Siberia.
The wandering magic sword that wanders around the world after the Black Gate London incident.
The criterion for classifying epic items is simple.
This item has such a powerful force that it can shake the situation of the battlefield. There was no gate capture that failed with epic items mobilized so far.
Epic items were extraordinary items that overturned common sense, so much so that national efforts were added when epic items appeared.
And now such an epic item was in front of Lee Chan-soo.
“Are you, really? Do you really just give it to me if I just hold it? Is that really true?”
“Uh, um … yes. That will … be?”
Ha-ri, who couldn’t even imagine that the hammer in front of her was an epic item, blinked her eyes and wondered if she should get confirmation from Leon right now──
“That’s right. Whoever holds that hammer will be the owner of the hammer.”
“Your Majesty, this hammer is worth a lot. Look at this!”
Lee Chan-soo organized the ability table he had organized.
[Georgic One-Handed Hammer]
◆ Grade: Epic
◆ Details
It is a sacred hammer (聖槌) blessed by Georgic, the Holy Knight of Demera, the goddess of life and abundance.
Core of Faith: Receive divine power directly from Demera.
Perfect Vitality: You don’t get tired.
Goddess’s Blessing: Defense increases by 400% while standing on the ground. Recovery increases by 300%. Defense 200%, recovery 150% are applied to all subordinate legions.
Saintization: Implement holy laws according to faith and divine power.
Emotionless: Georgic’s──────
Emotionless: Existence of────────
“Huhuk…….”
Ha-ri glanced at him and made a strange tongue sound. This is because she had never seen such absurd abilities but Leon’s choice did not change.
This news was soon made public through the Association──
[The first in Korea and the third epic item in Asia revealed at TTG Guild headquarters. Anyone can take it.]
The reason why so many challengers flocked was because of this.
****
“Heheh, is this the place?”
“Let’s see the epic item!”
The first to visit the headquarters after Georgic hammer was featured was a small and medium-sized hunter guild nearby.
A shocking condition that anyone can take as long as they can carry it.
The hunters who were greedy for the epic item put everything aside and entered TTG Guild.
The moment they tried to enter the TTG Guild headquarters──
-Squeak
They came face to face with the Yacht Spinner guarding the entrance
“Ya, Yacht Spinner?!”
The nightmare of Cheongju Gate and the killing machine, who annihilated numerous attack teams, is a survivor as famous as Leon.
Even if its size has shrunk now, they can’t help but panic when there is a killing machine estimated to be S-class or higher in front of them.
“What, what?”
-Hammer challenger?
“That’s right.”
-Welcome.
“Tha, thank you.”
The hunters were awkward by the softer response than expected from this killing machine and tried to enter the headquarters.
But at that moment, a fierce wire whip slammed down in front of them with a bang!
“Why, why why?!”
-Entrance fee.
“Huh?”
-Entrance fee.
When repeated twice, the hunters also understood Yappy words.
“No, what entrance fee do you mean…….?”
“I didn’t hear that…….”
-Decided today.
Yappy mechanical legs lifted slightly and pointed to a big sign.
[Sanctuary Entrance Fee Hunter: 5 million won. Civilian: 500,000 won.]
“Expensive…….”
“No, why are we 5 million won when civilians are 500,000 won!”
-Civilian viewing. Hunter challenge. Additional cost of managing relics.
They couldn’t turn back here either. In fact, considering the value of an epic item, 5 million won was nothing, so the hunters opened their wallets reluctantly.
“……Is five-star pay possible?”
-Account transfer is possible.
After paying the expensive entrance fee and entering, the hunters met Han Ha-ri who was waiting.
“Welcome, hunters! I’m Han Ha-ri, the deputy of the management department 3 of the Korean Hunter Association!”
Ha-ri, dressed in a cool outfit, greeted the hunters with a bright smile. They were impressed by the fact that last year’s rookie came to meet them, but they also wanted to see the relic as soon as possible.
“Where is Georgic hammer? I want to see the real thing quickly.”
“Hey! Be careful with your expression!”
“Huh?”
Ha-ri pointed out with a fuss as the hunter looked puzzled.
“It’s ‘sir’ Georgic. You have to use honorifics when you call the names of noble people here!”
“???”
It’s an item.
But when in Rome, do as the Romans do. It was a well-known fact that Leon, the knight king of the otherworld, had a crazy personality.
The hunters coughed and corrected their names.
“I want to challenge ‘sir’ Georgic hammer…”
“Before that! Let’s go to the altar and pray first!”
“…What?”
The place they followed Ha-ri’s incomprehensible guide was the altar of the TTG Guild, which was separately arranged in the TTG Guild office building.
There are altars of Demera, the goddess of life and abundance, who is the object of faith for farmers, and altars of TTG Guild gods separately.
The altar is not so grand, and it looks like a temporary altar until a proper temple is built.
-Squeak
“It’s here again.”
Yappy showed up. The mechanical spider that went back and forth between the altars stood in front of the hunters who had been ripped off by 5 million won each.
-Bow down. Bow down to the gods of the TTG Guild.
“Uh, um…”
The hunters glanced at Yappy and reluctantly bowed down. They wondered if they had to bow down to each god’s altar, but it seemed to be enough once.
-Will you pay tribute?
“No, what do you want me to pay again…?”
-You don’t have to.
It seemed like Yappy would force them to pay something, but he answered coolly and the hunters hesitated for a moment and refused to pay tribute.
Some of them were Christians and even refused to bow down at the altar.
The place they barely entered was the closed and moved old training ground site. As soon as they entered there, the hunters felt an unknown energy wrap around them.
“Oh, oh…”
“What is this? What is this energy…?”
It was a warm and soft energy. It made their whole body feel alive, their mind clear, and their vision clear.
They quickly realized what caused this mysterious experience.
“It’s the energy flowing from the hammer…”
“Just by being there, this energy flows out…”
“It’s an epic item after all…!”
The hunters who were exposed to the hammer’s energy felt that it was worth 5 million won just for this.
“Here! This hammer is ‘sir’ Georgic hammer! Would you like to try it first, hunter Kim Ho-yeol?”
The hunter who was called by Ha-ri swallowed his saliva and approached the hammer. He was a Christian and a devout believer who refused to bow down at the altar just before.
“Then I’ll try it──”
It was the moment he grabbed the hammer.
-Zap!
“Aargh!!”
Kim Ho-yeol was bounced off by the energy generated from the hammer handle.
“Wha, what!”
“Energy from the hammer?!”
The hunters supported Kim Ho-yeol who bounced off and looked at the energy swirling from the hammer. The fierce growling energy was evidence that the hammer rejected Kim Ho-yeol.
“The hammer does such things?”
“Oh, I forgot to warn you. If you are not qualified…it rejects you like that.”
“Disqualified? You should have told me that earlier!”
The hunters asked her, but Ha-ri had nothing to say.
“There is no… standard. It’s just up to the hammer.”
What do you want me to do about it when the hammer does that?
“Damn! I’ll try it this time!”
The one who stepped forward was a giant hunter. Tanker-type hunters are big, but he was among the muscular ones. And as he wore heavy armor and a shield, he was confident in his strength.
Fortunately, the hammer did not bounce him off like the previous hunter. He, an atheist, grabbed the handle of the hammer and tried to lift it up in one breath.
“Krrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!!”
But the hammer did not budge at all. It was too heavy, as if thousands of tons of iron were compressed.
“Kraah! Damn it!”
After that, several hunters challenged. There were some who bounced off completely, but most of them passed until they grabbed the handle. But that was it. No one could move the hammer even 1mm.
As the fallen hunters gasped and sweated, Yapppy approached.
“What, what?”
-Will you pay tribute?
Why do you want me to pay tribute again? The hunters frowned, but one hunter’s eyes sparkled.
“The relic of God… Yeah, that’s it!”
The hunter approached Yapppy and paid about 10 million won in tribute by bank transfer. And he grabbed the hammer and──
-Creak!
The hammer that didn’t budge at all moved 0.05mm…for a very short moment.
“Huh?”
“What?”
“He just moved… He couldn’t move it at all before…”
Did he move because he paid tribute?
Everyone’s eyes turned to Yappy.
-TTG altar temple construction tribute received.
Everyone took out bundles of money.
Yappy analyzed the activation of the commercial area of various religious sites by big data through a series of processes.
-The hammer makes money.
“‘Sir’ Yappy, is this really okay? Isn’t this blasphemy?”
Ha-ri asked with a worried expression, but Yappy calmly answered.
-Questioning my efficient asset management skills with the intellectual abilities of insignificant organic matter? You just have to do as I plan.
Ha-ri read the plans that Yappy printed out in an instant.
“…Providing health promotion seats with exposure to the sacred power of the hammer?”
-Attracting general visitors. Activating the surrounding commercial area.
“Providing blessed crops to visitors and forcing tribute…”
-‘Voluntary’ tribute.
“Using hunters as labor under the pretext of faith promotion?!”
-Labor activity with physical training. Efficient.
“How are you going to pay them?”
-Why pay trainees? Provide meals, sleeping places, cooking, and necessities.
“No, ‘sir’ Yappy…There is a noble law called labor law in the world…”
-Trainees registered as interns. Interns can be paid below minimum wage.
“I’ve never seen you pay even a little money?!”
-‘Voluntary donation’ recovered. If you don’t like it, leave.
“Cruel…”
The plan of Yappy, the financial manager of TTG Guild, was just beginning.

chapters.title: Chapter 68: Perfect Calculations, Fateful Victories
chapters.content:
Chapter 68: Perfect Calculations, Fateful Victories
It was not only the hunters who came to the TTG Guild headquarters to see the hammer.
“This is the TTG Guild headquarters.”
“Oh my, really? The one that’s famous for rice and a new religion these days?”
“Of course. My cousin ate their rice and cured her cancer.”
TTG Guild, which had already built a good image with blessed crops and YouTube, was becoming a temple of that kind of religion that people knew.
There was no formal religious activity yet, but this time it was different.
The hammer of Georgic, which was revealed to have been obtained from the gate, was a relic itself and had the power of earth and abundance.
A powerful relic was no different from a saint. This was what the trainees under Leon’s command felt, as they gradually became healthier and more muscular, and their bodies improved overall after the hammer came in.
The occasion was when Kim Do-han, the team leader who had entrusted his dementia mother to a nurse, brought her over for a while due to the remodeling of the nursing facility.
When a soldier asked if he could bring his sick mother for a while, Leon kindly allowed him, and Kim Do-han gratefully brought her to the TTG Guild headquarters for a while. And then──
“Oh my, Do-han!”
“Huh, mom! Do you recognize me?!”
She recovered from dementia.
“Oh my son! You’ve been through a lot because of mom.”
“Sniff… Sob sob sob…!”
Kim Do-han, who had seen his mother suffer from dementia for over five years, prostrated himself in front of the relic.
This story, Yappy filmed it from beginning to end.
[K-TTG Guild headquarters where a dementia patient’s eyes opened]
-Stop lying even if it’s bullshit. (This comment has been deleted)
-No, what kind of bullshit is this──(This comment has been deleted)
-This could be true. Our uncle who had terminal cancer got better after eating TTG Guild rice that we got with difficulty. (Like 3,565)
-What is this? The number of likes is over 5,000 in no time
-I went to the golf course and saw the TTG Guild headquarters from afar, and the wi-fi connected automatically? But it was over 1km away, how did it work?
It was a hard-to-believe story, but with the video and the story of blessed rice spreading, visitors flocked with the thought that it would be worth believing.
Yappy initially rejected them.
-NO. Only TTG believers can visit except challengers.
“Oh, no… I came all this way and you have to let me in once…
-Trespassing on private property. Advised to withdraw.
The machine blocked them without an inch of gap. And then, as if he had been waiting for it, Han Ha-ri appeared.
“Excuse me, sir Yappy.”
-Kiruk?
“Aren’t these people actually here to worship at TTG headquarters?”
“Huh? No, what are you talking about…?”
“Wait, just stay still.”
The visitor kept quiet at Yappy’s restraint but Ha-ri clapped her hands and said.
“There are many gods in the TTG Pantheon. How about getting to know them while making small donations, praying… and seeing the relics?”
-Makes sense.
Yappy nodded at Ha-ri’s words and moved the camera eye. The visitors realized it then.
“Well, then! I was thinking of making a donation!”
“Let’s see, here, is this enough?”
One visitor handed over a blue bill. Yappy looked at it and threw it away.
-Lack of faith.
“…”
The visitors had to deposit hundreds of thousands of won before they could enter.
“Is this right? No, what kind of religious worship is this that forces you to donate and doesn’t accept less than 500,000 won?”
“This is totally a cult──”
-Zap!
A creepy wire line grazed the visitors’ clothes.
-Don’t swear. I understand Korean.
“…Yes.”
The visitors met a villager who worked as a servant in front of the temporary altar of the TTG.
“Oh my, hello. Did you come to worship at the altar?”
“Uh, um… yes?”
“New believers are always welcome. Would you like to see the guide of the Ten Thousand Gods made by our village?”
“There’s such a thing?”
“Of course.”
The first thing the villager handed over was the spirit and teachings of Demera, the goddess of life and abundance.
The spirit of life and abundance.
Make an image of the goddess with the first harvested crop and offer it to the altar. Don’t pee in the field. Fertilizer is fine. Set up a scarecrow and put on a hat and clothes. Sing when you harvest. A song with gratitude for the goddess is better. Don’t starve yourself even if you’re busy. …
…
The most important 0th.
※Frostbitten die.
“Good words.”
“What is frostbitten die…?”
It was somewhat unfamiliar, but still, it was mostly good words written because it was a religious guide.
The visitors went through the altar worship, singing praises to Leon Dragonia Lionheart, shouting “Devil die”, buying souvenirs (made by Yappy), and finally entered the training ground where the relic was enshrined.
“What is this, why is it in such a place if the relic is enshrined…”
As soon as they entered the training ground, they saw the relic.
A huge one-handed hammer was standing proudly in the middle of the barren training ground and the energy flowing from its noble existence made them feel refreshed and energized as their mind became clear.
“Huh? Huh?!”
“What, what’s wrong?”
“Oh, no…my, my eyes.”
“Your eyes what?”
It was a young man wearing glasses. He had such bad eyesight that he received a 4th grade rating and went to public service.
But now, as his vision became strangely blurry and he took off his glasses, a world he had never seen before unfolded.
The modern people wear glasses more and more because of smartphones but the moment he perceived the world clearly with his bare eyes the young man shed tears.
“Oh God… thank you──”
-Zap!
“Long live Arianna! Thank you for curing my eyes!!!”
Another young man became a believer of the Ten Thousand Gods.
-There is an envelope for donations for the expansion of the altar facilities. Prove your faith.
“Uh, uh, then! I have 200,000 won right now…will that be okay?”
He had escaped from being a visually impaired person recognized by the state and was willing to give up his liver and gallbladder right now.
-That’s fine. Faith is not proven by the size of the offering.
“Oh, sir Yappy…you are a Holy Knight of the God of Iron and Blacksmithing…”
The young man, who had handed over a 10,000 won bill at the entrance and got cut off, prostrated himself in front of Yappy and bowed.
And so──
Patients from all over the place who came with the thought that it would be worth it and those who experienced miracles with the combination of relics and blessed crops became believers.
With these people gathering the TTG headquarters became a hot place where even foreigners came from Naju, where there was no time to find a tourist spot.
“Sir Yappy! Starbucks wants to enter here!”
-Show me the amount of donation and decide.
“Sir Yappy! Cherry Co., a training facility development company for hunters, said they would build a training facility for us in exchange for advertising! Our TTG Guild is modernizing too!
-Tell them to donate first.
“Oh my! The governor said he would deliver a plaque of appreciation! He also wants to consult on blessed crops!
-Tell him I’ll meet him if he promises budget support.
Yakt Spinner, a strong artificial intelligence killing machine and a Holy Knight of Heto, the God of Iron and Blacksmithing of TTG Guild ruthlessly secured money and goods under the premise of securing funds and expanding his reputation.
What did he do with the budget he secured like this?
“Wow…Sir Yappy, what is this?”
-High-strength forging facility.
What was in front of Ha-ri was a huge metallurgical facility located in the corner of TTG Guild headquarters and it had a design that seemed more futuristic than modern.
“Sir Yappy…is this really a blacksmith shop?”
-The lowest level forging facility in my database. This is the limit with the earth’s poor metallurgy level.
“Well… it still looks amazing though?”
-That’s because you have an organic level brain.
“That’s mean!”
Ha-ri made a pouty sound, but still sent a hopeful look as she saw an impressive level of blacksmith shop in front of her.
“Uh, Sir Yappy is a Holy Knight of the God of Iron and Blacksmithing, right?”
-That’s right.
“Then, can you make my sword here too?”
-Impossible.
“Heeeng… I guess so.”
Ha-ri was technically an outsider. She should be grateful enough to receive TTG Guild knight benefits as an Association member. But Yappy’s refusal was not for that reason.
-This forging facility is not complete. Additional facilities are needed for Adamantite polishing.
“Oh, is that so?”
-To do that, more money is needed.
Yappy said that and went into the forging facility.
The building size was about two-story building level, but the entrance was only big enough for Yappy to barely fit in, so there was no way to know what was going on inside.
-Minimum forging protocol initiated. Seed money secured. Analyzing international situations.
Yappy accessed the global stock exchange via self-developed wireless internet sharing wifi-100Gbps installed at TTG Guild headquarters.
The global stock market has been hit by a major disaster recently.
From some point on, someone who joined in on stocks that soared due to price manipulation operations messed up their selling timing and quietly made profits and left.
The so-called righteous stock thief.
The identity of this whale of the stock market, who was not caught at all and even evaluated as a ghost or a group, was none other than Yappy.
Yappy hacked into the world network and mercilessly trampled on corrupt politicians, media, and businessmen who intervened for price manipulation, and manipulated information to his advantage.
He messed up their selling timing, buying timing, and dumped large amounts of stocks that rose due to operations and got out.
-You bastard! Why! Why are there so many opposite articles at this time!
-You son of a bitch, can’t you do it right? How much money did I give you for that little news manipulation!
-What? Wait! A blackout at this timing? No! Cell phones too? Satellite communication is jammed too? This is nonsense!
This phenomenon, which happened all over the world, also attracted attention from the financial sector. The pattern was too similar.
No matter how different the methods were, the price manipulation forces suffered terrible damage and someone who caught the selling timing made a decent profit and got out.
Is this possible?
Why would a force that can hack into the world network and jam satellite communications bother with price manipulation forces?
Yappy collected enough data and accumulated experience and now planned to move on to bigger profits.
The financial item that Yappy was eyeing was food.
The food situation of the 21st century humanity was not good at all.
First of all, there are too many places contaminated by miasma. At the beginning of the Cataclysm, the Western powers and East Asia dealt with it exemplarily.
They closed the gate, encouraged hunters to grow large guilds, and built a system that could cope with red gates as well as variables like black gates.
The downside was that they were swayed by large guilds, but anyway, it was exemplary in terms of security.
But poor Eastern European countries, rigid Middle East Asia, and backward countries that had no time to nurture hunters experienced dungeon breaks that burst out of nowhere.
What’s the problem with dungeon breaks? First of all, there is human damage caused by monsters.
But that’s ultimately a secondary problem. The problem is that the land is contaminated by miasma.
As you can see from the case of Hunan Plain and Naju Plain, land contaminated by miasma is a huge problem that threatens survival. Of course, the value of the land is infinitely close to zero.
Yappy bought this contaminated land. The first target was Beida Huang Grain Field in Heilong People’s Republic in northern East Asia.
20 years ago, after the Shanghai Incident, one of the 50 independent factions that were torn apart, this place’s miasma contamination was serious.
Almost half of the land was contaminated and he bought some of it to spread the faith of Demera, the goddess of life and abundance, and started purification work.
Large-scale purification and immediate food production at Leon’s level were impossible, but still, thanks to prayers and accumulating faith, the contaminated land recovered greatly.
Now all he had to do was harvest the food and it would turn into a grain field worth a fortune with “blessed rice, corn, barley” and so on.
The expected profit is a whopping tens of millions of dollars. And if he thinks about the tax that the farmers will pay, he can get closer to the amount he aimed for.
-Calculation of grain market impact in progress. Error range confirmed.
This is just the beginning. The global food market will be shaken by this country as a start, and people will eventually take it for granted that blessed crops will come up on their table.
Of course, only farmers who serve Demera, the goddess of life and abundance, can grow these blessed crops, so in fact, TTG Guild will dominate the world’s food.
The only uncertainty in this grand plan is the neighboring country of that region…
The machine thought that the possibility of invasion in Beida Huang region was low when looking at the complex situation of East Asia’s ‘53 countries’.
The world history changed greatly after the Cataclysm. Inter-state wars became meaningless waste of national power, and more importantly, these numerous countries were overwhelmed by dealing with their own gates.
It won’t be a problem in the end. There is no way it will be a problem. There were once those who shouted for unification of China, but that’s an old story now.
The factions who broke away from the central government of the great country and established their own kingdoms did not feel the need to expand their kingdom unnecessarily.
The neighboring country of Heilong People’s Republic, Gilim Republic, is also busy blocking gates.
A human leader with common sense would have no reason to do excessive use of force here.
Logical calculation based on big data and fateful victory. This was the only conclusion Yappy came up with.
A perfect zero-sum game? High risk high return? That kind of thing is meaningless number play in front of a strong artificial intelligence.
My land will rise. It will definitely rise. It has to rise.
Three days later.
[Gilim Republic coup d’etat.]
-Sir, sir Yappy! This is Huang, the head of the department! Food prices! Food prices are plummeting! There are rumors that orc armies are heading to the grain fields!
-Kiruk?
[Coup d’etat by orc soldiers. Blatant invasion declaration to Heilong People’s Republic grain fields for food security.]
-This is news that the company’s profitability will plummet! The loss rate has already exceeded 30 billion won! If this goes on, we’ll go bankrupt!
-Kiruk?
[UN criticism letter issued. Shocking statement by Lin Xiang Kazak, who led the coup d’etat, ‘Orcs decide everything by war’.]
[Detroit city mayor publicly supports orcs.]
[Orc discrimination violates political correctness. Those who have power must reflect and understand them.]
[Great confusion in the world food market. Will Beida Huang grain fields fall into orc hands?]
[Rising Comet Divine Private Equity’s sudden war causes quarterly returns to plummet!]
-The bank came. It’s a seizure warning. You have to pay 14 billion won in interest this month.
-Ki, kiruk?
Are they going to take this?

chapters.title: Chapter 69: Yappy Private Equity
chapters.content:
Chapter 69: Yappy Private Equity
Yacht spinner, the nightmare of Cheongju Gate and an emotionless killing machine.
He is the final boss and survivor of the Red Gate, and currently the first Holy Knight and financial manager of TTG Guild, the de facto brain.
Yappy work is complex and plentiful.
Management and surveillance of trainees. Expansion of facilities needed for the headquarters. Infrastructure construction and legal, administrative management.
He is a tireless machine and a strong artificial intelligence, and he does all this perfectly, but Yappy most important missions are TTG Guild publicity and financial management.
The former is hacking the central system of YouTube and SNS, and perfectly manipulating public opinion and media control.
It has already been promoted worldwide, and among those who are interested in it, he finds suitable talents by collecting personal information, financial status, and kinship without missing.
He has a perfect grasp of the believers who will be the pilot cases of the TTG Guild.
The latter is financial management. This was easier than the former.
Yappy is already a big fish in the stock market. Under the principle of becoming a righteous thief, he disrupts the stock market and robs the absolute majority of the operation forces.
The collapse of successive operation forces has become a big news topic overseas, and it has been reported that there is a strange phenomenon in the stock market where self-purification is suddenly taking place.
A virtuous cycle stock market where good companies are evaluated at their proper value and bad companies are undervalued. It was thanks to Yappy who was smashing the operation forces in real time.
Yappy, who did these two tasks perfectly, wanted to move on to the next step: a profit-making faith system that combines the former and latter tasks.
Show off TTG Guild miracle and increase believers, seize the food market and maximize profits. The influence on the world food market is a bonus.
The plan was perfect.
Logically, rationally, even looking at international public opinion.
The grain field of Heilong People’s Republic, where Yappy invested, is a stable country as if there is no external threat.
Unless there is a ‘coup’ in the next country or a war ‘declared’ in the next country.
-Yaya, there was a war upstairs.
-Upstairs? North Korea?
-They’ve been ruined for a long time. More upstairs.
-Does Russia have any room to start a war?
Even though Leon was the owner of TTG Guild headquarters, they had basic infrastructure such as internet and TV.
Thanks to the 100-gigabit internet designed by Yappy everyone knew about the hot war news on the news.
“Sir Yappy did you hear that there was a war upstairs? It doesn’t matter much to us, but it seems that the government side is very busy.”
-…
Yappy was watching over the trainees’ sword training. To be precise, he was recording the number and time of mechanical repetitions such as cutting 10,000 times, blocking 10,000 times, swinging 10,000 times, etc.
He had been doing this for a week already, so he wondered if he was used to it or not. Ha-ri repeated upper cuts while chatting with Yappy who didn’t have any sense.
“But it’s a big deal. I heard that Heilong People’s Republic’s grain field imports food from our country. Rice is no problem, but they seem to import quite a lot of other crops.”
-…
“The UN and the US are warning and sanctioning them, but they are orcs anyway. Long-term war is inevitable──”
-Inadequate action. Delete from record 1,397 times. Do it again.
“Huh?”
Ha-ri was struck by lightning out of nowhere, but Yappy was merciless to this insensitive organic matter.
“Whew… I’m so tired today.”
Ha-ri whined tiredly as Yappy approached her.
“Hic! Sir Yappy, I did my quota today?!”
Yapipy kindly poured her a drink himself and recommended it to Ha-ri who was startled.
-Drink. Hydration required.
“Oh, um… yes, thank you.”
Ha-ri awkwardly accepted it. It was awkward because Yappy had never been so kind before.
Yappy smiled with an emoticon on his hologram and said,
“Wha-, why are you so scary?”
-This is only for Ha-ri.
“Only for me?”
-I have my own hedge fund in operation. It is an asset management group that is growing smoothly.
It’s true. Yappy’s hedge fund has been operating for two months now and has hired a suitable asset manager to run it. Its return rate had already reached the highest level in Korea.
Of course. He didn’t mention that he had fallen into hell for three days recently.
-I plan to implement financial welfare for TTG Guild employees.
Yappy devoured all the books related to psychological warfare. People don’t persuade them to invest, they beg them to let them in.
-I will manage your assets for you as a special employee welfare. Join today.
He said that and distributed the membership form. Ha-ri stared at Yappy with trembling eyes.
“Are you investing?”
-I’m going to ‘manage’ your assets.
“Sir Yappy, do you also do stocks? Wow~ You’re so smart.”
Ha-ri, who lived with a wall built with finance and investment, looked at Yappy with curious eyes.
-Han Ha-ri. Considering your poor financial situation, you need a professional asset manager.
“Po-, poor? No, no? I’ve saved quite a bit for my age?!”
Yappy hit her with a fact.
-Only 15% of the average financial situation of A-class hunters. Even if the activity period is short, it is an abnormal situation. The problem is donating your meager salary and gate clear bonus.
“Well, that… I’m donating to the orphanage where I grew up after deducting living expenses…”
-Donation behavior, moral. But you need financial expansion for more donations.
“I don’t really need it──ouch!”
Yappy hit the back of her hand with a non-lethal wire as he kept counting seconds.
-Giving up on life by being lazy about financial studies in a modern society closely related to finances. I will fill your lack of knowledge. Be grateful.
“Uh… Then two million won…”
-20 million won.
“That’s all my savings?!”
-I’ll give you ten times back. Take out the deposit for the semi-basement in Seoul.
“Ah…”
Ha-ri reluctantly deposited money into Yappy’s account, thinking that the machine wouldn’t lie.
Yappy, who received Ha-ri’s money, made an additional suggestion as planned.
-Han Ha-ri is now a ‘silver’ member. I raised it one more level from bronze.
“Silver member?”
-Bronze members guarantee 100%, silver members guarantee 200% profit. Do you want to upgrade?
“Well, that’s good?”
-If you sign up five more members, I will upgrade you to a gold member. Then 300% profit.
“Re-, really?”
Han Ha-ri, 20 years old, a social freshman who was just thrown into society.
She was so naive that he couldn’t even think that this was a typical method of multi-level marketing.
“Soo-ho, sister found a good place to invest──”
“Oh, Ha-ri. ──”
Ha-ri was kind. Anyone who knows her does not doubt her goodwill. So…
“Wow, diamond member! Then 500% profit guaranteed?”
-Congratulations. If you pay more money, I’ll raise you to diamond 3-star member.
“Then if I take out the rent money…!
Ha-ri was a great multi-level employee.
-Choi Young-gam High. Are you interested in investing for retirement? The villagers too──
And this movement spread all over the place centered on TTG Guild. It was only a matter of time before the number of members soared.
And a week later.
“We came from the district court. It’s an asset seizure warning.”
The bailiff came with a red sticker.
****
[Bankruptcy crisis for TTG Guild!]
[Reckless asset management. Is it a failed investment by Yappy!]
[A survivor with a shabby appearance. Will the survivor’s success story collapse like this?]
“…”
Leon read the newspaper and stared at Yappy and the TTG Guild staff in front of him.
In front of everyone, Yappy was lonely as if he was on trial.
“What happened? Summarize it.”
A seizure warning came from the local court. It was because they failed to pay the interest on the loan borrowed in the name of TTG Guild.
That wasn’t all. Most of the TTG Guild staff, including Ha-ri invested, but the private equity fund they invested in plummeted.
-I’ll explain.
Yappy began to recite his recent actions logically and clearly.
He established a private equity fund for the expansion and fund-raising of TTG Guild. He borrowed bank loans as much as possible in the name of the guild and increased the investment funds by attracting staff.
The amount of money he invested in the Heilong People’s Republic Fund and Farm, which was shattered by the invasion of Gilim Republic.
“Yappy, you bastard… That money is 86 million won, my entire fortune… I even gave you my deposit money…”
Ha-ri sobbed with a sad face and the other staff was the same.
“Damn it…! My money! It was my wife’s savings that I scraped together!”
From Kim Jin-soo, a dispatched employee of the Association…
“Ha, haha… My five-year fixed deposit that I saved to buy medicine…”
The soldiers, including Koo Dae-sung, a first-generation trainee.
“I put up land as collateral…”
Even local farmers.
The amount was a whopping 800 billion won!!
The victims were not only these. People who invested in Yappy’s TTG Guild private equity fund made a fuss outside the gate, and Leon listened to their stories for a while.
“Lord Spinner, how much is the loss?”
-At this point, it is 878 billion 54 million 34 thousand won. Increasing by 49 million 85 thousand 3 thousand 655 won per hour. Loss rate about 72%
“Huh…?!”
Ha-ri was shocked by the debt that transcended common sense. Leon also asked with curiosity about the large scale.
“There is no such amount of money in this temple?”
-Borrowed with collateral.
“Collateral?”
-Naju Plain rice field 130,000 hectares. Rice harvested this year. TTG Guild office building. Georgic’s hammer.
In short, it meant that he had poured out all the money that could be used by TTG Guild, not only the money of the investors who were harmed. If he goes bankrupt, Leon will also end up on the street.
Yappy made an excuse.
-The fund will recover. This time is just a temporary liquidity crisis. It is ignorant and impatient to rejoice or grieve over minor chart changes. The Beta Huang Grain Belt is the lifeline of East Asia. The international community cannot leave such a grain belt alone──
“No, Russia just declared support for the Republic? It’s falling in real time?”
-That can’t be… true. It’s an irrational conclusion. There is no reason to risk international sanctions. The disadvantages are much greater than the benefits. That can’t be──Putin bastard.
“”…“”
The victims lost their words at Yappy’s confident and even shameless claim.
In short, it was like an asset manager who lost more than 70% of his investment amount saying that it would go up and puffing up his chest.
“Ah! Give me back my money!”
“Damn it, let’s take something!”
Inevitably, TTG Guild staff ignored their second priority and investors who invested in private equity funds went crazy.
“Hey, hey! Let’s take that pillar!”
“Search for something! There must be something!”
“Empty out the rice warehouse! That’s all money!”
The investors who tried to save even a penny stopped when they found the blade of Archdemon Androzin, stored in the warehouse.
This legendary item made of Adamantite was Yappy’s precious research material.
-Stop, human. Don’t take that…! It’s my property!
It was then. When an investor tried to reach Georgic’s hammer at last──
“Stop floundering, you wretched things!!”
-Kuk?!
-Huh!
Leon’s roar stopped everyone in this place.
Everyone stopped with a tingling fear, and Leon waited until they calmed down enough.
Leon said.
“Lord Spinner.”
-Your Majesty…
Spinner also approached him with a low posture, sensing Leon’s anger in his voice.
“I believe you can solve this situation with your intelligence. How long can you solve it?”
-I will solve it by tomorrow.
Tomorrow? How? How can he solve the loss of hundreds of billions by tomorrow?
“Good. Then I’ll leave it to you.”
But the victims couldn’t answer anything to Leon’s faith.
They also thought that this situation could not be reversed by ordinary ideas.
Eventually, they had to rely on an external force, but who could clean up this mess except Yappy, the culprit of this whole situation?
“I guarantee your debt in the name of the Lion King. You guys just go back and do your work.”
The investors had a lot to say. But no one could stand up to Leon’s roar.
More than anything, it was clear that even if they applied for seizure now, they wouldn’t be able to get even half of the amount they invested.
A day. Will a miracle happen that everything will be solved within that time?
Yappy went into the workshop for a while and didn’t come out. And four hours later──
[Emergency injection. Safety test ignored.]
[Integrated armed platform MK.1 with special external skeleton launched.]
A weapon that changed the history of human warfare was launched from TTG Guild office building.
[Operation code: Fund resurrection]
For a very annoying reason.
The war was started by the invasion of the orc dictator who seized power and Hunters from various countries were also mobilized in this war.
Hundreds of hunters, tens of thousands of soldiers along with orc immigrants from various countries were involved.
No matter how much the continent was torn apart and collapsed after the Great Cataclysm, the continent was a continent. The number of troops mobilized was not ordinary.
And modern warfare is advanced network warfare.
Killing each other with guns and knives on the battlefield is not the whole of war.
Electronic warfare in various countries is also an important battle to paralyze the enemy’s network or disrupt the GPS information of missiles.
The information soldiers of Gilim Republic, the invader, also executed electronic warfare using all means they could for two weeks after the outbreak of war.
“Hoo… Damn it, what kind of hardship is this because of those damn orcs.”
“This is a war without any justification…”
Many survivors came over from another world after the Great Cataclysm. Among them were humans, but there were also many heterogeneous races.
Martial artists from the martial arts world, elves, dwarves, orcs and other heterogeneous races from the fantasy world.
Even recently, mechanical tanks from the future world came.
Among them, orcs are still a headache for modern times.
At first, they competed to receive immigration in various countries to mobilize their excellent combat power for gate conquest, but problems soon arose.
They were too violent and tried to solve everything with violence. They ate food at a restaurant and tried to kill and loot the restaurant owner, and they asked for a duel to take away the house they liked.
And what are those bastards doing so hard to breed? The population grew quickly, and after five years they were as strong as ordinary hunters.
So Africa was full of orcs, and orc coups happened frequently in Southeast Asia.
But then an orc coup happened in Gilim Republic and they tried to support their breeding population by waging war on their neighboring countries.
How can a war be justified with such a bullshit reason?
If Russia had not supported them and opposed the dispatch of peacekeeping forces from the UN, trying to contain the US and the Western world, they would have been suppressed long ago.
But in the end, the one with the sword is the master, and the information soldiers of the Republic of Gilim had to invade the Heilong People’s Republic, which was once their brother.
“Damn, let’s hope the war ends soon.”
“How did our Han people end up like this…”
But it might be better than the socialist country D, where a necromancer became the head of state, with such resignation, he was tapping on the keyboard at that time──
-BEEP BEEP!
The alarm sounded throughout the computer room. The information soldiers of the Republic of Gilim screamed in horror.
“Wha, what? The headquarters information room hacked?! The third firewall was breached? It’s been less than 3 seconds since we caught it!
“Si, sir! The fifth firewall was broken through!”
“What kind of bullshit is that?”
Like other continental countries, the Republic of Gilim was also a military faction country that inherited the legacy of a former superpower.
They still had supercomputers and information assets that were active in protecting their national information network, and the system built by IT talents was solid.
Above all, the security capability of the military information command was not at the world’s best level, but it was not at a level that Heilong People’s Republic could handle.
But all those firewalls were breached in less than 5 seconds?
“GPS system disabled! Traffic Safety Agency down!”
“The tactical radio network collapsed! It seems that military satellites have also been taken over!”
“It’s not just the military radio network. Civilian networks too… This is crazy! The bank system is down too?”
What the hell is going on? The colonel who commanded the information command shouted urgently.
“Did those Yankees set off an EMP or something?! There was no nuclear missile in orbit!”
No, even if they detonated a nuclear missile with EMP from space orbit, would this be possible? Besides, there were more than one or two computer downs that could not be explained by EMP.
As everyone watched helplessly at all the disasters unfolding before their eyes, the same phrase began to appear on their screens.
“Wha, what is this?”
“The culprit…”
The phrase that appeared on their screens was──
「I came to end this war.」

chapters.title: Chapter 70: The God of Electronic Warfare
chapters.content:
Chapter 70: The God of Electronic Warfare
There was a huge country on the continent. No, the continent itself was a country.
It was a bit exaggerated and pretentious, but it boasted that it had ten thousand years of history.
It had some mishaps, but it still predicted explosive growth with its overwhelming size and population. A sleeping lion.
But the lion was slaughtered without waking up.
The Great Cataclysm, the worst disaster of mankind that announced the morning of the 21st century hit the country as gates sprouted up from all directions.
At that time, there was no system for hunters who could oppose the gates.
Most countries could not cope with the gates and lost many lands to dungeon contamination, and their cities were destroyed by monsters that came out of dungeon breaks.
It could have survived somehow with its advantages since the country had a lot of people and a lot of land.
What if some people die, what if some land is contaminated?
The population of one billion became 500 million in just one year, but there were hundreds of thousands of warriors who were loyal to death.
The communist party leaders at the time were not incompetent.
Surprisingly, they did their best for their country in this natural disaster. But──
The country was too big, too wide, and too huge.
The gates pouring out from all sides, the rigid response peculiar to dictatorship, the check on the sky warriors who suddenly gained power and exerted an undeniable influence, and the refusal of local military factions to withdraw their power revealed the corruption and decay of the country and the population continued to decrease, the land was contaminated, and food was scarce.
In the fall of 2012 the appearance of the second black gate, Shanghai Gate, and the emergence of the Archdemon Skazakaria and the epic item Wandering Demon Sword evaporated 15 million people in Shanghai.
The country began to collapse with this terrible damage as a start and local military factions rebelled against the weakened central government.
As usual in the history of the country, ambitious military factions proclaimed themselves kings.
So today in 2034 the country was torn apart into more than 50 small countries.
Here in the north-easternmost part of East Asia there are two countries from the former continental country that has been torn apart into 53 pieces.
A land of misfortune where more than half of it was contaminated by dungeon breaks, but it is adjacent to Russia and has abundant grain fields in Heilong People’s Republic and Jilin Republic, which accepted a lot of orc immigrants and lost soldiers, sky warriors and hunters while blocking monster waves.
Both countries were once huge countries, but until yesterday they were just ordinary continental countries without much presence among the other 50 states.
But that was until yesterday.
The two countries were mentioned one after another in overseas topics around the world and became the hottest countries in the world.
“Kraaam~”
Orc Private Liu of Jilin Republic Army is a typical orc immigrant.
He is exactly an immigrant of 16 generations, but since orcs become adults at two years old and start breeding, generation distinction is meaningless.
“Boss, where are all the enemies?”
Orc People’s Army soldiers approached Private Liu and they seemed to be itching to fight right away.
“The guys next door are boring! We came to fight them, but they ran away with their tails between their legs!”
“Human bastards are weak. They don’t know anything about the honor of warriors.”
Next door, that is, until two days ago they were the Heilong People’s Army who stood together on the southern border, but orcs don’t remember such old pasts.
All they know is that Rynshang Kazak, a legend among legends of orcs, became Jilin’s great chief. And if you want to eat a lot of food, you have to kill all those humans on that ridge.
The Jilin Republic, which lacked power due to continuous wars and gate raids, was destroyed by orc immigrants they accepted but the irony was that this was not orc business at all.
If they were normal civilized people, they would have negotiated and traded, but orcs solved problems in a very orc way.
“They say there’s a lot of food next door!”
“Let’s kill them all and take their food!”
Why bother trading when you can kill and take? They were different races from the beginning, so there was no reason to discuss common sense.
“I can finally eat human stew.”
“I wish humans would show up soon!”
The orc army advanced toward Heilong People’s Republic without hesitation and in front of their powerful combat power, Heilong soldiers and citizens who were fed up ran away long ago.
They tried to enter the city with the intention of looting even an empty city. And then── something fell from the sky.
-Gwoooooooo…!
It was a 10m tungsten rod that fell at Mach 25.
“God’s rod was hacked?”
US Secretary of Defense Julius doubted his ears.
It was natural.
He heard that the secret weapon of his country, the satellite weapon ‘God’s Rod’, suddenly started to operate.
God’s Rod, a cold war thing that drops super-heavy projectiles from artificial satellites and causes nuclear weapon-level destruction.
Originally, it should have been scrapped long ago, but it was made to snipe the ‘Archdemon-class’ entity that caused dungeon breaks after the Great Cataclysm.
Of course, both the satellite and the projectile were much stronger than the original plan, and it was a hidden weapon that was literally made with the money of the 21st century America.
Such a weapon suddenly started to operate.
“What is this, how did this happen! Who issued the activation permit for the G-1 satellite!”
Only three people in the United States have the ‘password key’ to activate God’s Rod.
One is the US president. It’s like a symbol, just like a nuclear bag.
The other two are the Secretary of Defense and the Commander of the US Special Hunter Department.
And one of them, Julius Secretary of Defense, never approved this operation. Of course, neither did the president or the hunter commander.
“Was it hacked…?”
The soldiers at the command raised their hands at Julius’ question.
“The password key changes every minute. The combination pattern is over 100 million. It takes 13 years to calculate even with the world’s best supercomputer!”
Then who on earth activated God’s Rod?
“Damn, we have to stop it somehow! Is there no way to stop it at the activation stage?”
“No, impossible! The password pattern has been strengthened! The estimated pattern is over 10 billion!”
“What kind of fantasy is that?!” How is that possible?
Meanwhile, God’s Rod was preparing to operate and finished firing preparations.
“G-1 target specified! Jilin Republic…? It is! Jilin Republic?!”
“What, what nonsense? Why are they targeting them?!”
It’s an area that has been bothering the United States lately.
The coup d’etat was caused by orc soldiers and the sudden war with neighboring Heilong People’s Republic.
Normally, they would think that they should send UN troops or US troops to end the situation, but Russia suddenly intervened and blocked it.
The Heilong People’s Republic attacked the Jilin Republic first. That was the reason.
Of course it was nonsense and obvious.
If the orc army occupied Heilong People’s Republic, they would claim to be liberators of Heilong and take over Heilong grain fields next.
The United States had no intention of getting involved in protecting the remnants of a country that had already been torn apart as much as possible.
The UN also only issued a moderate criticism statement, and had no will to actively stop this war.
The northern part of the Korean Peninsula was a can of worms to begin with.
There’s no reason to bother with the Russian-backed Jilin. But──
“Damn! If God’s rod hits Jilin like this, the Russkies will jump around!”
It was an impossible thing for the United States to attack another country with nuclear weapons without a declaration of war. Even if Russia whines, it would be a bit of a hassle.
Julius Secretary of Defense made a decision.
“Fire a ballistic missile at G-1.”
“…”
No one questioned the order to destroy their own $10 billion military asset.
The soldiers in the control room silently instructed the nearest ballistic missile launch site to fire, and──
“Sir… The base is not responding.”
“What do you mean?”
It was literal. For some reason, none of the missile bases or naval fleets in the United States connected to the Pentagon responded.
‘Could it be, communication was blocked?’
How?
Regardless of the question, time went by.
“Tell the communication room to order by Morse code or something! Use analog or whatever!”
“The communication room is not responding either! Phone, internet are all down!”
“What nonsense is that?”
As if someone expected this? No. It’s too clever timing for that. As if someone next to him heard his command and dealt with it in real time.
‘It can’t be! That’s impossible!’
It can’t be. Even if all the hackers in the world unite and hack the Pentagon, it’s impossible. Secretary of Defense Julius shivered in fear in his confusion as someone in the control room shouted.
“5M65 NATO codename Grizzly confirmed to be activated!”
“…Why?”
The code name that the controller just shouted is a ruby high-output laser satellite weapon that is only activated by Russia’s dungeon break final operation protocol.
18 years ago, it was a collection of Russian military technology that sniped the army of the Frost Queen in Siberia.
It uses astronomical amounts of ruby just to operate once, and it has only operated three times in 18 years. Why did that activate now?
“Grizzly lens moving! Coordinate specified… Jilin Republic border area… What’s there that──Orc army advancing to Heilong?”
Only then did Julius Secretary of Defense realize what intention this situation had.
He didn’t know, but someone wanted to destroy the Jilin Republic and the orcs.
“Launch countdown begins! Ready to operate simultaneously with Grizzly!”
“Crazy…”
Who?
How? For what?
“5! 4! 3! 2! 1──Launched!”
The device of destruction operates.
As soon as it operated, it hit all orc armies in the Jilin Republic.
God’s rod and codename Grizzly the shot one after another annihilated the orc army in an instant.
Surprisingly, they showed accuracy that exceeded the performance of the two satellite weapons, rather upgraded, and only sniped orc armies persistently.
If there was even one civilian or humanoid other than the orcs nearby, they wouldn’t even try to bombard at all.
When this whole situation was almost over, emergency announcement videos from the White House and Kremlin were released on the Internet.
[We, the United States of America, do not tolerate the actions of the Jilin Republic Army that break peace, and fired twelve God’s rods for the protection of the Heilong People’s Republic.]
On one side was the face of the US president──
[Russia does not tolerate provocations from bad neighboring countries. We will not spare any cooperation for peace. We cooperated with the United States to specify coordinates and only against the coup army──]
On the other side, the Russian president announced his position.
And when communication was restored and Secretary of Defense Julius confirmed these videos, he shivered in fear.
“Deepfake…”
The deepfake video that could only be called perfect was blocked from being deleted.
Currently, SNS and media outlets are flooded with economic news announcing US-Russia joint attacks on the Jilin Republic coup army.
They were perfectly fooled.
Secretary of Defense Julius felt fear in front of a great hacker who could manipulate the information network of the United States and Russia in this 21st century.
Above all, what should he call an electronic war god who has near-omnipotent electronic warfare capabilities in modern times where everything runs on electronic devices and networks are developed?
“Deus…”
Deus ex Machina.
It was a machine device worthy of calling itself a god.
“Why… Did this happen?”
In Jilin Republic Presidential Office, orc chief Rynshang Kazak, who cut off the neck of the former president and took his seat, looked at the coup army that was annihilated in an instant with a blank expression.
He was a veteran of three generations of orc immigrants who conquered gates with his powerful combat power and became a power broker of the Jilin Republic. It was natural for him to kill the weakling who ordered him.
He got the big boss position, and all that was left was to start endless wars as an orc boss.
But…
Communication was blocked and all electronic systems operated by using weak human bones were completely down.
Even the encrypted communication of each unit that delivered news in analog only reported the annihilation of the unit.
“Boss, what do we do?”
“Are we fucked?”
The subordinate orc officers wanted an answer with an anxious look, but Rynshang Kazak had no answer.
“First, let’s take care of the remaining guys and take the money and run. Let’s go to the grassland and have some kids and start over.”
Orc’s fertility is terrifying and they can give birth anywhere, like popping out babies.
If you ‘work’ for five years, they can quickly grow in size, and with this much power, they will be welcomed anywhere for gate raids.
That’s how bad the situation on the continent was, and it was a country that even had to borrow orc hands.
But the machine knight who watched all this did not tolerate it.
-Kwang!
Something broke through the wall of the office and as the orcs witnessed the intruder their pupils widened.
“What, what is that!”
It was a steel armor in the shape of a human.
If you modify a medieval crude knight armor into a futuristic one, would this futuristic yet old-fashioned design come out?
The unpainted ‘Adamantite’ exoskeleton armor looked like it had been hastily pieced together and soldered together somewhere.
<Special Exoskeleton Integrated Armament Platform Mk.1>
As much as it looks like a peculiar knight armor, the weapons attached to the whole body are ferocious.
[Target target confirmed. Non-human species-orc confirmed.]
Deus ex Machina.
The armored platform of the machine holy knight who came down from the sky aimed at the culprit of this whole situation.
[Give me back my funds.]

chapters.title: Chapter 71: Who owns the hammer?
chapters.content:
Chapter 71: Who owns the hammer?
Suddenly attacked by Yappy’s integrated weapon platform Mk.1, Rynshang didn’t take it seriously and raised his axe.
“I don’t know who you are, but you dare to challenge this orc warlord Rynshang Kazak──”
[Assassination mode activated.]
Machine gun bullets rained down on the orcs around Rynshang’s office.
The orcs generals were engulfed by the firestorm of the ultra-high-speed machine gun that fired 6,000 rounds per minute. But only one orc officer of the lowest rank was hit by the firestorm.
At that moment, the orcs who came to the office with their weapons raised their shields to block the machine gun bullets.
“Die, you bastard!”
One of the orc officers aimed a large shotgun. It was a 17-type high-power buckshot gun developed for orc infantry. It was the most preferred weapon by the orcs who were fascinated by the hot firepower of the shotgun.
-Kwak!
The buckshot showered Mk.1 but the shotgun’s firepower couldn’t even scratch Mk.1.
“Guns don’t work! Bring out your axes!”
The reason why the migration of orcs was strongly encouraged was because they were a combat race that attacked the gate with their axes.
The orc generals who wielded house-sized axes rushed at Mk.1 in unison.
[Special-modified ultra-high-mass 12-gauge buckshot x2 SET]
The set gun was a 35-type high-power buckshot gun secretly smuggled through domestic violent organizations for orc generals. It was a high-mass high-power bullet that was modified to the extreme.
It was fired at two orc officers who approached.
“Kuk?!”
The orc officers were torn to pieces by dozens of steel balls.
Modern equipment was effective for orcs and hunters, unlike the monsters in the gate. Not to mention the special bullets that were handmade by the God of Iron and Blacksmith along with Yappy.
“Die!”
But the orcs who didn’t care about their comrades’ deaths took advantage of the gap and swung their axes.
-Kang!
A clear sound of metal clashing was heard but the orc officers looked puzzled.
They were among the strongest of the orcs, being officers, their axes were unique weapons and their swinging power was comparable to A-rank hunters or higher. Even if they tried to block it with a shield, the shield would crumble…
[Organic aesthetics cannot distinguish Adamantite.]
It was an exoskeleton coated with Adamantite, which was melted from the blades of the Archdemon Androzin but that wasn’t all.
The exoskeleton that made up Mk1 was filled with only the highest-grade rare minerals. Its strength was unique-level defense, even excluding the Adamantite parts.
It wasn’t a defense that could be broken by an orc who had a slightly better weapon.
“You bastard…?!”
At that moment, Mk.1’s palm grabbed the orc’s face. The orc struggled to break free, but he didn’t budge.
‘Wha, what kind of power…!’
There have been many combat robots that could replace hunters.
But none of them were commercialized, because there were phenomena where mechanical devices broke down inside the gate, and more importantly, it was almost impossible to implement a power that could surpass human-sized combat machines, hunters.
To be precise, it was possible to implement a low-rank hunter level, but it was better to hire one more hunter or hire orcs than to make such a super robot.
But Yappy’s Mk.1 surpassed the limits of modern military technology by far.
Yappy’s small nuclear reactor produced spare batteries that could move a tank and he put five such batteries in it.
With that power, he had no choice but to hold on to the orc.
He blew off the orc’s head with a 12-gauge shotgun and stared at Rynshang Kazak, the only remaining orc officer.
“Not bad. The guys you just killed were confirmed to be generals.”
Rynshang Kazak raised his axe at Yappy who killed his subordinates.
Yappy fired a 12-gauge shotgun right away, but he blocked it with a large axe blade.
“WHAAAAAAAAAA──!!”
With a loud roar, Rynshang Kazak charged but Yappy made a mistake in trusting his Adamantite armor and facing his charge head-on.
-Kwaaang!
With a loud noise, Mk.1’s body was pushed back. And that wasn’t all. The left arm coated with Adamantite broke and bent under Rynshang’s axe strike.
[…Same material used.]
“That’s right! This axe is also made of pure Adamantite! Even drakes couldn’t withstand this axe strike!”
Rynshang was an orc soldier of an immigrant tribe who rose to be an officer right under his enemy.
