The rank of an orc was determined solely by their achievements and specialties in the gate. In other words──
[Estimated rank S.]
He was not a mere coup dictator, but a hunter of S rank.
[Firepower insufficient.]
He hastily completed the weapon, so it was lacking in armament.
Originally, in addition to the special-modified 12-gauge shotgun, he should have equipped a special-reactive machine gun or an ultra-accelerated extra-class railgun for the target species.
Originally, this exoskeleton suit was a platform for operating an integrated weapon system to replace Yappy’s reduced body and he wouldn’t have even deployed if he hadn’t been rushed to intervene by the investors’ enthusiasm.
Then there was only one way left: close combat.
[Unauthorized prototype combat system activated.]
Yappy manipulated Mk.1’s body as the two thick legs split in half and turned into four.
The thick steel plate on the back turned into a huge sword and it looked like a knight with four legs. Half-human, half-demon…No, rather than that, it was closer to a spider, the spider knight that was expected to be the final result.
[Project Yacht Spinner. Prototype bayonet specification activated.]
“Kahaha! You know something! Yeah, let’s fight like warriors!”
Rynshang laughed heartily and ran at him with his axe while Mk1 faced him head-on.
The axe and sword collided, sparks flew, and the friction of metal and metal splashed.
“Hmm…! Not bad!”
They were evenly matched in strength. But the sword started to lose its edge. The difference in material composition as a weapon was too great.
[Thrust activated. Activity limit 3 minutes 20 seconds.]
“Huh?!”
The thrusters on Mk.1’s four legs and arms began to spray high-temperature energy. It was an overuse of output that anticipated the melting of its own battery.
He had no choice but to be pushed back by the self-destructive over-output, even if he was Rynshang.
Rynshang, who was pushed back by force, hit the wall and broke the building wall one after another.
“Kahaha! Not bad! But…!”
Rynshang twisted his body slightly, brushed off Mk.1 and swung his axe hard. He was an orc warlord who had rolled on the battlefield for a long time and avoided a head-on collision skillfully.
-Kwaduk!
One arm flew off with a skillful axe strike and Rynshang read his victory.
“Die!”
Mk.1, who lost one arm, swung his sword, but he easily knocked it off and penetrated into the center. Rynshang smashed Yappy’s remaining arm with his axe strike and trampled on him.
“You’re clumsy and slower than the monsters in the gate!”
As Rynshang raised his axe, a hidden auxiliary arm aimed a 12-gauge shotgun at him. But at that moment, a huge shock wave erupted from Rynshang’s military boots that trampled on Mk.1.
-Kung!
The powerful shock wave shattered Mk.1 and smashed the auxiliary arm and shotgun as well. Rynshang laughed.
“Do you think you can face me, who has the blessing of the war god Helkan, with this piece of scrap metal?”
It’s over now. The last struggle failed for Mk.1, and he mercilessly struck his chest with his axe, avoiding the Adamantite skeleton. And as Mk.1 shattered──
[Budget, time shortage. Field test failed.]
Mk.1’s chest opened and a bright light appeared inside. Rynshang tried to strike it with his axe, but he couldn’t move.
“What?”
Rynshang noticed the wires that tied his arms. As soon as his chest opened, wires shot out from inside and tied Rynshang’s arms.
[Good field data obtained. With this, big data is closer to perfection.]
“What nonsense are you──!”
At that moment, Yappy’s secondary arm swung the wire.
The spider web swept past Rynshang in the blink of an eye. Rynshang saw the moment that made his neck tremble in real time.
This was the end of Rynshang Kazak, an ambitious orc dictator who had taken over the Jilin Republic in a coup and waged war against its neighbors.
After slaying Rynshang Kazak, Yappy pushed past the rushing orcs and grabbed the axe Rynshang had left behind with his tiny secondary arm.
[Checked for Adamantite, will retrieve]
Binding the axe with wire and loading it into the half-destroyed Mk.1, Yappy left the command center.
* * * *
[The coup d’etat in the Jilin Republic that shook the world has come to an end. The newly established Jilin Republic government apologized and negotiated for peace──]
[The food crisis that was triggered by the invasion of the Jilin People’s Republic has returned to normal. At the same time, blessed crops were discovered in the BeidaHuang Grain Field, and the market price──]
The orc troops that were advancing to the Heilong People’s Republic were annihilated, and the core forces of the coup d’etat, including Rynshang Kazak, were assassinated, and the war ended.
“Wow~ I’m so relieved. The war is completely over.”
Ha-ri was relieved by the fact that the war was over. She thought it was hopeless, but it seemed that there was no law that said people had to die.
“Oh, then Yappy’s hedge fund will recover, right? Let’s see, what? The, the return rate?!”
Ha-ri almost dropped her phone in shock when she saw the return rate announced by Yappy’s hedge fund.
The good news that started to appear in the news at the same time as the end of the war, the spread of Demera’s goddess worship and miasma purification in the BeidaHuang Grain Field.
Although it was small, blessed crops began to spread, and the food price soared to the sky.
The return rate that was soaring in real time was about 800% more than before the crash. In other words, Ha-ri earned more than 600 million won in profit excluding fees.
“Wow, wow! It’s amazing, Yappy!”
-Kiruk
Yappy spoke to Ha-ri in a somewhat arrogant tone.
-You ignorant ants. Do you know what liquid assets and real economy are?
Yappy’s hedge fund, which seemed to be doomed to fail, recorded a minimum of 1,200% return rate and soared to heaven, and Yappy immediately distributed the profits to investors and cut off investment.
-You foolish organic beings who doubted me. You can no longer trade with me.
“Oh, oh my, Yappy! We were wrong!”
“Please have mercy on us, who are ignorant and foolish!”
For a while, there were more investors who begged him to invest again than customers who came to see the hammer at TTG Guild headquarters, but Yappy ignored them.
And then he broke another piece of good news and achieved a high return rate.
-Will you support TTG Guild Foundation?
They made a historic worst unfair deal by donating nineteen trillion won of hedge fund returns to TTG Guild Foundation, and they were able to become investors again.
-12% of the target amount reached.
But it was still far away. The final plan that Heto, the God of Iron and Blacksmithing, and his Holy Knight Yappy were planning was still far away.
The Jilin coup d’etat left two legends.
The emergence of a legendary hacker Deus Ex Machina who hacked and paralyzed the US and Russian defense departments as well as using deepfake to disable the Jilin Republic.
And the dramatic revival and legendary profit surge of a hedge fund that seemed to collapse due to the war crisis.
Of course, both of them were Yakt Spinner himself.
One day after a series of events came to an end, Leon began to sort out the evaluation sheets of the knight trainees who had completed their basic training for about a month.
The academy trainees had their own characteristics, but they repeated only basic training for a month: swordsmanship, shieldsmanship and spearmanship.
Their riding skills were not enough to become cavalrymen, but at least they wouldn’t fall off while running.
‘I need to connect them with the gods soon.’
Originally, they would have had to go through a process of faith after receiving education as an apprentice priest or a knight.
‘There is no time.’
Who knows when those villains will interfere again? Although it is still at the stage of speculation about the identity of the gate, it is clear that demons are involved.
As the Gods said they would exceptionally simplify the process, their guidance would be somewhat influenced.
‘Han Ha-ri.’
She is one of the young ones who has both talents and she was born with fire energy and attracted attention from God of War and Fire.
She has a good and pure nature. Leon also paid attention to her.
‘Han Soo-ho.’
He has a cautious personality but has a strong will when needed. He has an excellent talent for protecting others as his name suggests.
He is second to none in swordsmanship but his shieldsmanship is also remarkable and he fulfilled one of the virtues of a knight.
His unique skill is also defense enhancement so he might be compatible with Goddess of Life and Abundance. If he holds Georgic’s hammer──
“Hmph.”
There is no choice. It is up to the hammer to choose its owner. Whether he has the qualifications to be recognized by the sacred object or not is another matter.
He might not see his successor for the rest of his life but Leon thought he could do that.
‘Kim Jae-hyuk.’
He is a boy who uses a spear as his main weapon but he is a surprisingly stable type apart from his fierce spearmanship.
He also looked through the profiles of other knight trainees and saw a girl.
‘Chen So-yeon, was it?’
She is the granddaughter of the strongest swordsman in this country and one of the few talents who silently completed the basic training for a month.
She has a surprisingly stubborn and orthodox personality so she is suitable for the knight’s subject. But…
‘Greed…Is it.’
The next successor of the best guild in the country came to TTG Guild just to join. There is no naive thought that she was fascinated by the power of the gods. Most of the trainees were like that, but she looked impatient.
Leon recalled a familiar face from her appearance.
“She looks like him…”
He was reminded of someone who was cold and blunt──
「You killed him, Your Majesty. You are the greatest king in Lionheart history.」
“Hoo…”
Leon sighed dryly and made a bitter expression.
“It’s too late.”
He turned his eyes to work as if trying to forget his thoughts, and it was right then.
“Hmm?!
Leon’s senses captured all movements within 30 km in all directions.
What he has been paying attention to lately is Georgic’s hammer, the sacred object that emits powerful sacred power just by existing and who it will choose as its owner.
And just now the sacred object showed some movement.
Leon hurriedly ran out to the training ground where the hammer was. And there──
“This is… unexpected.”
Very slightly. It was so vague that it was hard to say that he moved it, but compared to the previous challengers, it was incomparable.
‘The hammer itself’ judged the suitable person. He saw Leon and rambled.
“Yo, Your Majesty! No, that is…It was break time, so I just tried it once…!”
The one who moved the hammer a little bit. He was──

chapters.title: Chapter 72: New Trainee
chapters.content:
Chapter 72: New Trainee
Early in the morning, when tractors usually come and go, there are four-legged beasts running on the ground without hesitation.
-Clack clack!
Farmer Choi Young-gam greeted them with a smile at the sound of the rough breathing and loud hoofbeats of the horses.
“Oh, Your Majesty. You’re full of energy this morning.”
Leon stopped in front of Choi Young-gam, who took off his hat and bowed slightly.
“Old man Choi, you’re working hard early in the morning.”
“I came to catch some bugs. Do you want to have a drink with the students?”
“It’s riding training.”
“I see.”
Choi Young-gam, a priest of Demera, the goddess of life and abundance, was happy to see the temple growing day by day.
He felt helpless when he saw his land rotting without bending his waist, but now he was so happy.
All this happened after he came here. Choi Young-gam bowed his head again with gratitude toward Leon, who started to run again.
The scarecrow he hung behind him seemed to bow with him.
Leon, who ran with more than 44 students and horses early in the morning, started to teach the students at a nearby open space.
“There are many skills in riding, but the most important thing is to become friends with your horse. The ones you can rely on in the battlefield are your comrades next to you, and your horse is your closest comrade.”
Kim Jae-hyuk raised his hand at Leon’s words.
“Your Majesty, how can we be friends with horses that don’t understand human language?”
“That’s a reasonable question. The scholars of the empire said that they were the masters of beasts, not friends.”
Leon made Stallion walk slowly and looked around at the students and horses who were staring at him.
“Horses are smarter than you think. But at the same time, they are also very timid.”
Stallion stopped in front of Kim Jae-hyuk’s horse as he walked slowly. Then Kim Jae-hyuk’s horse did something unexpected.
“Uh, uh?”
Kim Jae-hyuk’s horse lowered its neck softly. Not only that, it bent its legs and lay down in front of Leon and Stallion, as if bowing.
“Why is this guy doing this?”
Leon said to everyone in front of Kim Jae-hyuk, who was confused.
“Stallion is a being that can be called the king of horses. Kim Jae-hyuk’s horse obeyed Stallion’s authority and lowered itself.”
It was natural. Stallion was a divine beast, and its existence was at the top of the hierarchy among horses.
The horses of the students would all obey Stallion’s authority.
“However, you have to be close enough to reverse this hierarchy with your horse. It must be willing to challenge spears and swords for the rider on its back.”
Leon gestured and Stallion snorted. Then Kim Jae-hyuk’s horse stood up stiffly.
“Horses are timid, but they will gladly charge at beasts if they are with their riders. Why do you think that is?”
Chen So-yeon raised her hand.
“Is it because they trust their riders?”
“That’s right. Whether it’s a beast or a densely packed infantry with spears and swords, the horse throws itself into it because it believes that its rider on its back will solve it.”
Build such a trust relationship, a relationship that can entrust your life on the battlefield.
“From today on, you will ride your horse for two hours every day and spend time with it. You also have to learn how to wield a lance while riding.”
“Your Majesty, does that mean you’re taking two hours off our daily training?”
It was Kim Jae-hyuk’s question. Leon hit him hard.
“Fool! Why do you reduce training when you can just sleep two hours less? When I was a knight, I didn’t sleep for two hours a day!”
There he goes again. Back in my day~.
If someone else had said it, they would have laughed it off as yeah, sure~. But they had to admit it when Leon said it.
They had been in the army for a month, but they had never seen Leon lie.
“And there will be a new student added.”
“Yes?”
“At this time?”
The students tilted their heads at Leon’s words. All those who could come from the academy had already come. They were those who gave up the draft offer from the guilds and came here.
In other words, those who did not come here had already finished their salary negotiations with other guilds.
If they want to tear up their contracts and come to TTG Guild now, they would have to pay a huge penalty.
“This person will train with you from now on and challenge the knight’s title in the future.”
Thump thump, a rider came from over the ridge toward them.
The horse walked on the ground as it pleased, and the rider swayed and tried to calm the horse somehow.
Unlike the young students who quickly became familiar and moved their bodies, he had a sad expression that showed his age.
He walked for a long time and finally bowed awkwardly in front of Leon and the students.
“TTG Guild first generation recruit Koo Dae-sung. I look forward to working with you.”
The man’s expression looked insecure.
TTG Guild first generation recruit Koo Dae-sung looked at the second generation recruits who were approaching their graduation ceremony and felt nostalgic.
They were like that a month ago. Their rank, which they thought would be D forever, rose to C and they could clearly feel their growth.
Above all, the moment they cleared the orange gate with the help of a knight, which was considered impossible to attack, was a joyous one.
Of course, the gate that Koo Dae-sung and the generation recruits cleared was not an ordinary gate, but a variable gate with demons in it.
Koo Dae-sung looked back on his situation.
He was a modern man with no qualifications and a high school diploma. In his twenties, when it was natural to have a lot of specs, he had a card called awakened.
Awakened. Hunter. The superhumans of this era.
But Koo Dae-sung had no talent. The title of perennial D rank was humiliating even among hunters.
Hunters his age usually advance to C rank. Even if they don’t have a unique skill, they can at least go out to orange gates.
On the other hand, Koo Dae-sung couldn’t even access the orange gate as a porter.
Koo Dae-sung had a goal while moving from one rented room to another. A goal he wanted to achieve.
S-rank hunters. The heroes who live a brilliant and cool life. The real heroes who receive people’s praise and clear the gates.
It’s something that perennial D-rank hunter Koo Dae-sung can’t even dream of. But──
‘If I follow his teachings, can’t I become stronger?’
Koo Dae-sung’s life has been going well lately.
He met a survivor from another world by chance. Thanks to him, his rank went up and he was able to get the precious orc warrior’s heart potion.
He became strong enough to lift tons of iron easily, fight one-on-one with orcs, and do things that were impossible for him before.
He didn’t deny that meeting Leon was a great fortune. He could also make enough money here.
But he wasn’t satisfied with this situation.
He became stronger by consuming the orc warrior’s heart and the blessed crops. But that was it.
His growth stopped without increasing, and he couldn’t guarantee that something like the orc warrior’s heart would happen again.
Being a perennial D-rank and becoming a C-rank doesn’t make him that much stronger and he felt that when he saw the academy students.
The students that Leon brought as knight candidates had dazzling talents.
It was like heaven to Koo Dae-sung, even if Leon was dissatisfied but they were B-rank at that age…
They had unique skills and could easily do things which were impossible for Koo Dae-sung.
Such dazzling, fantastical talents.
The world they live in is too different. Unlike Koo Dae-sung, who decided to enlist to try to raise his rank once, they wanted to become knights from the beginning and their growth rate was incomparable to him.
He was envious and wanted to become a knight like them.
As Leon said, unlike soldiers who only have to do one thing well, they are superhumans who can do anything.
‘O Goddess Arianna. O God Petos. Thank you again today.’
Koo Dae-sung thanked the two gods first and suddenly remembered the goddess of life and abundance that the farmers worshiped.
The one who purifies the land contaminated by miasma and feeds the believers with blessed crops. There is no hierarchy among the gods, but is there anyone more important than this in the world at this point?
The farmers are so grateful to Demera and offer a tenth of their crops to the altar for a reason.
‘Is it a disrespectful thought?’
To appreciate Goddess Demera more than others.
Koo Dae-sung thanked Demera separately and went back to his dormitory. He passed by the training ground where a solemn aura was emanating and suddenly remembered the thing inside.
“There was a hammer, right?”
The hammer of the Holy Knight Georgic was said to be an epic item with tremendous power because it was a relic itself.
There were many challengers, but Koo Dae-sung never thought of lifting the hammer.
He knew his place.
He dreamed high, but he was pessimistic about his place. He thought it wouldn’t even budge anyway.
“Is there no one…?”
He didn’t even look at the hammer because he didn’t want to be humiliated. Koo Dae-sung realized that there was no one around and sneaked up to the hammer.
“Wow…”
The appearance of the hammer was really solemn and noble.
It felt like the impurities were washed away just by looking at it, and the hammer stuck firmly to the ground.
The head of the hammer, of course, and even the handle was beautifully engraved with patterns.
“What if I try it once…”
Koo Dae-sung touched the handle of the hammer. He lifted the hammer with all his strength from the beginning, but──
Squeak!
The hammer twitched. Only enough to feel a little bit of air.
“Ugh…!”
Koo Dae-sung let go of his hand and the sound of the hammer hitting the ground was loud.
“Huh…! Is it still not working?”
Well, I know my place… Koo Dae-sung was about to turn around in disappointment when it happened.
“This is… quite surprising.”
It was Leon’s voice.
After the Great Change in 2002, countless gates appeared on Earth.
They each have their own concept and rank, but among them, there are some that are priority targets for subjugation.
The first priority is high-rank gates.
The higher the rank, the higher the risk of dungeon break, so it’s a matter of course.
The second is gates that open in wastelands.
After the Great Change, humanity lost as many wastelands as its population.
Nothing can grow in land contaminated by miasma, and people can’t live there either, so it’s natural to stop contamination itself.
But among all these threats, there is an exception that becomes a top priority for clearing as soon as it is observed.
In this case, the government takes the lead and issues a ‘conscription order’ to forcibly mobilize hunters.
The US and Japan have already notified that they will dispatch attack teams. The problem is not that.
“Why now…”
Oh Kang-hyuk, chairman of the Association, sighed at the repeated reports and identical observation information. The observation equipment was too accurate to be mistaken, even with cross-verification from neighboring countries.
“Dragon Palace… It’s practically confirmed.”
Sea gate AKA Dragon Palace.
Gate appearances are usually observed on land. Naturally, people expected gates to only appear on land, and they didn’t care about the sea at all when there were no satellites to observe gates after the Great Change.
But 25 years ago, the world’s first sea gate appeared in Tokyo Bay.
The Tokyo Bay gate, which was left alone until dungeon break occurred, not only annihilated Tokyo Bay but also contaminated the entire coast and turned marine life into monsters.
It was the worst gate disaster in history, and Japan had to waste 15 years to end this disaster.
That’s why Dragon Palace gate is a priority for neighboring countries to cooperate and attack together in an international situation where national self-interest prevails.
He had already received reports from America and Japan that they would dispatch attack teams. The problem wasn’t that either.
“Every year… there’s a storm warning. This year seems especially strong, but that’s not the problem.”
Oh Kang-hyuk turned on the news. The weather information that was broadcasted as an emergency bulletin on public broadcasting.
[Yes, I’m now in front of Ulleungdo Island. Typhoon Nabi, which was expected to move to the Pacific Ocean, suddenly changed its course and is moving slowly toward Ulleungdo Island.]
[Nabi, which is expected to be the biggest typhoon of the year, is surpassing the record of Cicada in 2003 with a speed of 64.5m per second, and serious damage is expected for the residents of Ulleungdo Island.]
A storm warning that happens every year seemed especially strong this year, but that wasn’t the problem.
The direction of the Dragon Palace gate and the typhoon overlapped.
“Gather the hunters. Urgently! And…”
Oh Kang-hyuk added.
“Contact Leon, the Lionheart King of TTG Guild, as a top priority.”
Oh Kang-hyuk instinctively felt that Leon, the mysterious king who performs miracles and receives the love of the gods, was the only solution.

chapters.title: Chapter 73: This Is Discrimination
chapters.content:
Chapter 73: This Is Discrimination
July, when the hot summer begins, at the TTG Guild headquarters, the second graduation ceremony is being prepared.
“Your Majesty, have you arrived?”
The ones preparing for the graduation ceremony are Queen Beatrice and Yappy. They were in charge of the whole process of the graduation ceremony for the second batch of recruits.
“Did you come back late last night? Did you finish the test raid well?”
“Yes, it was Orc Gate. The second batch of recruits also passed the test brilliantly. But…”
“But?”
Beatrice whispered in Leon’s ear with a slightly awkward expression.
“Sir Yappy was quite ruthless in dealing with the orcs. Some of the recruits were scared.”
“Hmm… I see. But, it’s not a problem. If it’s not inefficient enough to discuss, isn’t it natural to be angry at the beasts?”
“That makes sense.”
Beatrice compared the orcs to demons and immediately agreed.
“We decided to simplify the graduation ceremony and leave the progress to Sir Yappy.”
“Wouldn’t it be okay for you to do it?”
“If I do it, the trainees will… be in a difficult situation.”
Beatrice smiled bitterly behind the veil and Leon nodded silently.
She certainly had a charm that contained the essence of corruption, and she could seduce people with just her breath.
Even if she covered her face with a veil, if she encouraged the soldiers from a close distance, their will would be broken.
“Lord Spinner will do well.”
A week ago, he said that some kind of war fund or something had collapsed due to the war, but it seems that he has recovered since he didn’t hear about it again.
Leon had also been a resident of this Earth, but he lived in a time that was far from finance. The financial crisis he remembered was the IMF at best. Do I need to say more?
Leon looked at Yappy, who was pinning badges on the second batch of recruits at the graduation ceremony, and shrugged his shoulders.
“I guess Lord Spinner is more adapted to Earth than me.”
“Your Majesty, wouldn’t you have adapted less than me?”
“Why do you say that? I came here two months earlier than you.”
Beatrice smiled and showed him a rollable smartphone. It was the latest rollable smartphone. He couldn’t even adapt to a touch-type smartphone and made Ha-ri hold his phone for him so he had no choice but to envy Beatrice.
“You seem to have adapted quickly. I’m relieved. You’re better than me.”
“How can I be better than you when you’re trying to adapt yourself to Earth?”
Leon took the rollable smartphone from Beatrice and shook his head, wondering how he could use this thing to surf the internet and watch videos.
“What about Lord Spinner?”
“He said it was too primitive a communication tool and hacked into the communication station.”
“…I wonder if this is compatible with justice.”
He also made an illegal modification of the Wi-Fi amplifier installed in the TTG Guild headquarters. It seemed that it was quite rumored among tourists.
“By the way, what happened to ‘that guy’?”
“He’s still being silent but he’s holding on pretty well. It’s thanks to the remaining power of the evil god.”
“If you need it, I’ll help you. How can he stand it if you peel off his face?”
Beatrice shook her head politely and refused.
“I can’t ask such a thing from an honorable knight so I’ll do the dirty work since I’m surprisingly good at it but I promise you that I will obtain valuable information from that thing.”
The Queen of Magic did not bother to say how creepy the process would be.
“It’s a shame that I can’t watch it.”
She laughed sinisterly and Leon also laughed as if answering.
The laughter of the two sounded so wicked that it was scary to see.
The Dragon Palace appeared.
Unlike the gates on land, when a dungeon break occurs in the sea, it is almost impossible to solve.
No matter how powerful a hunter is, he has activity restrictions in the sea.
And if you think about marine life contaminated by miasma, it’s hard to solve the aftermath of a dungeon break.
That’s why the Hunter Association has the right to urgently conscript powerful hunters when a sea gate is confirmed.
“Have you arrived, Hunter Lee Yong-wan?”
“It’s been a long time, Chairman.”
Lee Yong-wan, guild master of Phoenix Guild, came to Hunter Association with his vice guild master Ha Yuri after receiving conscription order.
“Hunter Ha Yuri also came.”
“Hello.”
Ha Yuri bowed her head as she looked around with a mask on.
“But I don’t see anyone else?”
Chairman Oh Gang-hyuk shrugged at Yong-wan’s question.
“This time, East Sea Gate will receive support from the United States. Therefore, other guilds will remain as reserve raiders in case of anything.”
Lee Yong-wan’s mouth twisted at the chairman’s words.
“Do we have to be the first conscription target? There are many other great guilds.”
“It’s hard to find a guild as great as Phoenix Guild.”
“The aftermath of Jeju Island Gate is still there.”
“It’s been almost a month, so I believe you’ve recovered. Hehehe.”
‘Damn bastard.’
Lee Yong-wan realized the chairman’s intention. This is a penalty for the mischief he made at the Hunan Plain Gate.
He was the most active in the tax exemption bill for large guilds, and he took action. It was fair to say that it was a warning to everyone.
‘Now you’re coming on strong.’
Iron Oh Gang-hyuk was a first-generation hunter who had once been a powerhouse on par with the Divine Sword Guild’s Berserker and the Blue Star Guild’s Infinite Sword, but had become the oldest and weakest member of the faction.
He is a civil servant who has to struggle in front of the 10 guilds that have grown too much.
That’s why he came out so strong against Phoenix Guild, one of the 10 guilds.
“Maybe you won’t send us alone. Will you show us your trump card?”
“Trump card? He is not someone who can be evaluated by someone like me.”
‘That’s right.’
If it was his previous self, he would have thought that the chairman had made a secret deal with Leon or brought him into his power but he saw the arrogance of the Holy Knights at Jeju Island Gate.
Georgic, Leon…The saints who claim that they have been chosen by God are not those who obey the orders of humans.
“Ugh~”
“Well, it’s your own fault, isn’t it?”
Ha Yuri said as she sighed and sat down. Yong-wan looked at her with displeasure, but Yuri just shrugged her shoulders.
And while the two were waiting in the waiting room, one of the staff members ran over and reported.
“Chairman, he’s coming.”
“Hmm…! I see.”
At that, Chairman Oh Gang-hyuk checked if his suit and tie were out of place and even took out a hair comb to fix his hair.
‘What?’
Anyone would think he was going on a blind date. What’s all this fuss about? Yong-wan thought so while the chairman looked at him with a glance.
“What, what is it?”
“Hunter Lee Yong-wan, if you don’t mind, can you fix your clothes a little?”
“…Why?”
“Because it would be rude to him who will visit soon.”
“Huh?”
What is this bastard talking about…Yong-wan’s expression became weird. Then, as the door opened with a clatter, a blond handsome man came in with the guidance of an employee while Kim Jin-soo and Han Ha-ri followed him like attendants.
Chairman Oh Gang-hyuk ran up to him in a hurry.
“Thank you for your visit, Your Majesty.”
Leon Dragonia Lionheart. He looked down at Chairman Oh Gang-hyuk who bowed his waist and said arrogantly.
“If you make me move my royal body, you should have a reason worthy of it.”
“Of course. I am very grateful that you have moved your heavy footsteps.”
Leon accepted the chairman’s sincere greeting and sat down naturally in the seat of honor. He heard a sound from beside him as he got up. It was Ha Yuri.
“Why are you getting up?”
“I thought I should?”
Yong-wan frowned as he saw Ha Yuri get up as soon as Leon arrived. It wasn’t just Yuri. The chairman also didn’t sit down and stood next to Leon.
The only one sitting in this place was Yong-wan.
-Aren’t you getting up?
Everyone’s eyes were on Yong-wan. No, why, what? Is that guy a king here as well as the other world?
-Really not getting up?
Yong-wan couldn’t stand for 10 seconds and got up. Only after he got up did Leon open his mouth.
“Report.”
He treated him thoroughly like a subordinate, which was amazing, but no one was able to tackle it.
“Yes, Your Majesty. Last night at around 11 o’clock we discovered the appearance of a gate on the east coast.”
The chairman personally showed the data and pointed to the map of the east coast.
“It’s 8 km south of Ulleungdo, completely inside the sea and borders Japan’s maritime territory.”
And this is cross-information observed by Japan’s maritime force and the US fleet that there is a gate in the sea.
“If it’s in the sea, just go out to sea and raid it. You made me move my royal body because you couldn’t even take care of my garden.”
“I’m sorry, Your Majesty. I’m ashamed, but raiding the gate is secondary to reaching the gate.”
The chairman added weather information.
“A typhoon is approaching. Unfortunately, it is scheduled to pass through the direction where the gate is located and it’s such a strong typhoon that we can barely approach it with a warship.”
“What about waiting for the typhoon to pass?”
“Time is tight. Unlike other gates, Dragon Palace Gate… The gate that appears in the sea is difficult to raid and requires quick resolution.”
But it takes four days for the typhoon to pass. This is an unbearable risk.
If the first raid team fails, there may be a dungeon break before sending the second raid team due to the tight time.
And a dungeon break that occurs in the sea will lead to a disaster, so it must be raided quickly and perfectly.
“You know that you are betting on the prestige of the nation. But, you seem to think of me as a gardener of this country, like Cheongju or Jeju Island.”
“Never…! How can I take you lightly?”
“Then what is it? Even if this small land has its own heroes, why do you look for me first?”
Of course, Oh Gang-hyuk could have conscripted other hunters before Leon.
In the case of Dragon Palace Gate, the Association has the right to force conscription, so it would be possible to mobilize domestic strongest guilds such as Blue Star Guild or Divine Sword Guild’s Guild.
Of course, whether these guilds would comply or not is a separate issue.
Yong-wan was looking forward to how the chairman would persuade this difficult guy.
“Your Majesty, this is an opportunity to elevate the honor of Lionheart! Please give us your heroic order!”
Leon didn’t hate the chairman’s honey-coated tongue and laughed softly and opened his mouth.
“Well, okay. But, moving my royal body is heavy. You should prepare a proper tribute.”
“Do you have anything you want?”
Chairman Oh Gang-hyuk glanced at Leon. If this survivor wants something, he will support it if possible, but it is also important to figure out what he wants.
“The king doesn’t count coins. Discuss the details with Lord Spinner.”
“Hmm…”
He naturally handed over a blank check.
Oh Gang-hyuk smiled bitterly and thought it wasn’t easy.
Leon’s participation in the East Sea Gate raid was decided.
He had raided numerous gates, but this was his first time in a special situation like Dragon Palace Gate.
Raid teams were dispatched from each country of Korea, Japan, and the United States, and even warships were mobilized.
Only a limited number of people could enter from each guild, so Leon carefully selected participants.
“This raid will be carried out on a small scale due to the nature of the gate. From now on, those who are called will come out in order.”
The first one to be called was Yacht Spinner, who showed versatile responses in any situation. He was the top priority.
Next were Han Soo-ho and Kim Jae-hyuk. They were knight candidates, so it was natural that they were called.
Then came names of the trainees including Koo Dae-sung, a new trainee. There were ten knight trainees in total and twenty soldiers were also called.
“Huh?”
The ones who questioned first were Ha-ri and So-yeon.
“Um… Your Majesty. Among those you called, there isn’t a single ‘woman’?”
Is it gender discrimination? Aww~ Ha-ri knew that Leon looked like a discriminatory person but he really wasn’t.
Even if there was a distinction between women and men, who would make such a distinction in the organization of a raiding party like this──
“If you put a woman on a boat, it will sink.”
“???”
It was a very discriminatory reason.

chapters.title: Chapter 74
chapters.content:
Chapter 74
It has been 14 hours since the Dragon Palace Gate was discovered. The Hunter Association quickly prepared for the attack on the Dragon Palace Gate.
The attack on the Dragon Palace Gate is a national emergency. The Hunter Association received a swift order from the top, and warships were mobilized to attack the gate in the middle of the sea.
In Gyeongsangdo Donghae Port 1st Fleet Helicopter Landing Zone the Black Hawk helicopters of the Korean military landed with their rotor blades spinning fiercely.
The people who got off there were not soldiers, but a group of civilians.
“You can get off, Your Majesty.”
The first to get off were Kim Jin-soo, a chief of the Hunter Association, and Han Ha-ri, an agent. The two respectfully escorted Leon.
After that, Lee Yong-wan and the hunters of the Firebird Guild, and the members of TTG Guild came down one by one.
“It’s a good vehicle. I should have a few of them. It’s even better because it can carry horses.”
‘Helicopters? No way…’
“The chairman says we can give you some. Would six be enough? We’re sorry we didn’t tell you in advance.”
‘You’re giving them away?!’
Lee Yong-wan was stunned by Kim Jin-soo’s words that he would give away hundreds of millions of won worth of military helicopters.
‘It’s not Kim Jin-soo’s decision. It’s an order from the top.’
There was no way a mere head of department had the authority to move helicopters.
Seeing how the chairman handled it, it was obvious that Oh Kang-hyuk, the chairman of the Association, had told Leon to take whatever he wanted.
“Your Majesty, this model is a bit old-fashioned. There’s a new model that’s just arrived in our country. It’s called Surion… It’s nothing, but if you could take a commemorative photo and say a few words when you receive it──”
‘What?’
“That’s fine. I like foreign ones better. The big Chinook or something. It can carry horses, so it’s perfect.”
“Yes…”
Ha-ri patted Kim Jin-soo’s shoulder, who looked gloomy.
The TTG Guild and the Firebird Guild headed straight to the 1st Fleet Command. There, hundreds of people, including commanders, captains, sergeants and soldiers, lined up in advance as if they had received a prior notice.
“Salute! Welcome to the 1st Fleet Command of the Republic of Korea Navy!”
“We are honored to meet Leon Dragonia Lionheart!”
-Bam bam bam~ Bam bam bam! Bam bam bam~!
A loud welcome and congratulations. No matter how much hunters were treated as half-heroes in modern Earth, there was a distinction between civilians and military.
Unless it was a continent torn apart by 50 countries or a hunter dictatorship, there was no such hospitality in a sane developed country.
“Hmm, are you the commander of this base?”
“Yes! I am Choi Jae-sung, the commander of the 1st Fleet!”
Commander Choi did not make any rudeness in front of Leon thanks to his thorough prior warning. But he was not so polite just because of the order.
“It is an honor to meet you, Your Majesty! My granddaughter was cured of leukemia after eating Goddess Demera crops. I would like to convey my gratitude.”
Choi Jae-sung’s granddaughter was a terminally ill patient who had been waiting for her death for a long time due to leukemia.
But after eating the blessed crops and seeing his granddaughter cured of leukemia, he cried and worshiped God for the first time.
“I see. If you are grateful for receiving Her grace, you are also my brother. Always be thankful and worship Her.”
“It is an honor!”
It had been three months since Leon came to Earth and his influence was spreading throughout this country.
“Then before we brief you on this operation, let me introduce you to the allied forces who will fight with us.”
Choi took the visiting hunters to a joint gymnasium. It was one of the few places in the somewhat small Donghae Port facility that could accommodate hundreds of people.
There were foreigners of various colors waiting for TTG and Firebird there.
“Are they from the US attack team?”
Choi nodded at Lee Yong-wan’s question.
“Yes, they flew straight with the Navy Air Force transport plane. It’s strange.”
It was strange, as Choi said.
The Dragon Palace Gate was a gate that occurred in the East Sea. The adjacent countries involved in this sea were Korea and Japan.
No matter how much Korea was a military ally of the US, did they have to send an attack team? It’s not like Korea and Japan were short of hunter resources.
“The Navy team came from Sasebo and they seem to be taking it quite seriously.”
The US participation was still incomprehensible, but they had to let it go. Anyway, if the Korea-US-Japan joint attack team sends two S-class each, there will be no shortage of power.
A tall blonde-haired man approached the Korean hunters.
He had blond hair and blue eyes like Leon, but his atmosphere was closer to a scholar than a noble young man.
“Huh?”
“Reynold Sherman?!”
The Korean hunters who recognized him were surprised. Wasn’t he the US Magic Tower Master?
Why did such a big shot come to Korea?
Reynold Sherman smiled at the reaction towards him and he confidently introduced himself.
“Nice to meet you, Korea hunters. I am Reynold Sherman, the Magic Tower Master who was invited for this gate attack──”
The introduction was cut off as Reynold pupils trembled and his gaze was directed at a blond-haired man.
“FUC—“
* * * *
[Go to Korea right now!]
US Magic Tower Branch Top Floor. The Wisdom Jewel, which was carefully placed in the office of the Magic Tower Master, suddenly said that.
“Korea…what are you talking about?”
[Yes! There’s something you have to do there! You can’t do it alone, so I’ll go with you!]
“…”
Reynold was fascinated by the knowledge that the Wisdom Jewel bestowed on him, but he hesitated to answer the words to go to Korea.
It was because he had already been there once and met a ‘terrifying existence’.
“That… Leon──”
[You bastard! Don’t say that name with your mouth! Damn it! I need to clean my ears!]
Leon had become the one whose name should not be spoken in front of him.
‘Why are you freaking out…?’
Why do you want me to go to Korea? Isn’t it inconsistent with your words and actions?
As if reading his question, the Wisdom Jewel spoke as if to reassure him.
[Don’t worry. I’ll tell you how to make an artifact that can completely hide the demon magic. If you have the ingredients, you can make it too.]
“Is that so?”
Does that mean he can escape from the detection of the Lion King?
“What do I need to make it?”
[Unicorn horn, phoenix feather, dragon claw fragment──]
Unicorn horn price 3.4 billion. Phoenix feather price 2.1 billion. Dragon claw fragment no stock. And there were plenty of other items of unique, legendary grade materials.
“…Great Being?”
[What?]
“These are not items that can be obtained right away…”
[Then there’s no choice. It’s a bit inferior, but if you have this, you can easily make it!]
The Wisdom Jewel, as a holder of great knowledge, came up with a solution on the spot. Seeing this, he could say that he was more competent than the previous demon in charge of the Wisdom Jewel.
“That’s definitely something I can get from the Magic Tower’s warehouse right away! You’re amazing, Great Being!”
[But it’s inferior, so it’s not very durable. But well… No matter how small Korea is, you won’t necessarily meet him if you go there.]
“That’s right. It’s not like Leon is the only hunter in Korea.”
[Kyakyakyak! I was born with bad luck!]
The two smart villains’ reasoning was too rational. It’s not like Leon is the only hunter in Korea and that the chances of meeting him right away are slim.
But sometimes──
“Be polite, spellcaster.”
There is also an existence that is the irrational itself.
[Ouch-shit!]
* * * *
Reynold and the Wisdom Jewel who met Leon trembled at this irrational misfortune. Reynold quickly asked the Wisdom Jewel for advice.
‘What, what do we do, Great Being! He’s right in front of us! Right in front of us?!’
[Calm, calm, calm down! If he was in a bad mood, he would have cut your neck off without hesitation! He hasn’t noticed us yet!]
That’s right, it was because of the artifact that the Wisdom Jewel had prepared in advance. He didn’t think he would meet him in Korea, but it was a ring-shaped artifact that hid his magic as a minimum insurance.
‘As expected of the Archdemon of Wisdom! I trusted you!’
It was then. When Reynold was fiddling with his lifeline, the magic ring, he felt the ring wearing away.
‘Great Being!!!’
‘Calm down! It’s being worn out by his holy power!!’
Reynold couldn’t tell the Wisdom Jewel, who was screaming, to calm down first. It was inevitable that his only lifeline was wearing away in real time.
[We, we have to back off! Get away quickly! Get away from his holy power!]
Reynold showed his greatest wit and pretended to be calm.
“I’m glad to meet you, Your Majesty. Your reputation is high even in faraway countries. I wanted to meet you.”
Reynold tried to offer a handshake, but hesitated for fear of being exposed if he touched his skin.
‘Damn it! This will make him suspicious!’
Reynold glanced at Leon with an uneasy look, but he smiled rather satisfied.
“You know your place well, spellcaster.”
Where did he hit such a satisfying point?
Leon passed him and headed to his place, while Reynold barely calmed down his trembling gums.
‘Let’s run away. I believe the Great Being will agree too!’
[No, no… This is important. We have to do it…]
Mother fucker! Why did such a low-level devil get attached to the Wisdom Jewel!
Reynold had no choice but to listen to the briefing quietly while cursing.
Ha-ri diligently organized the information she received from the briefing as an Association employee.
She couldn’t participate in this attack team, so she wanted to give them as much help as possible.
“Ugh… His Majesty also said… Women should never board a ship…”
Commander Choi admired Leon, but he had a puzzled expression on his face when he said that women would bring bad luck if they boarded a ship.
He tried hard to say ‘It’s because he’s from medieval times… It’s a cultural difference…’.
The Kwanggaeto Daewang ship that will be used for this operation had no female crew members from the beginning.
The navy had to get the maximum efficiency out of the limited space, so they couldn’t afford to prepare separate bathrooms and bedrooms for women soldiers.
“Emergency food and… combat food that can be cooked without fire…”
She was heading to the supply warehouse of Donghae Port to get this and that when she saw a hunter carrying a large backpack in front of the supply warehouse guarded by navy guards.
“Huh? Hunter Koo Dae-sung?”
“Agent Han?”
Ha-ri met Dae-sung and wondered.
“Why are you carrying luggage? This is something we should do…”
“No, no. I have to do this kind of chore.”
Dae-sung’s words were not incomprehensible. It was customary for Man-at-Arms (soldiers) to do chores in the TTG Guild but Dae-sung’s position was different now.
“Hunter, you’re now a knight trainee. His Majesty wouldn’t have asked you to do chores.”
“I’m not worthy of that…”
Dae-sung shrugged his shoulders and made an awkward expression.
He had trained with them for a few days after joining the trainees, but Dae-sung felt out of place among them.
He was weak and old compared to other trainees and they couldn’t understand why a soldier like him was chosen as a knight trainee.
“It’s just that I got lucky and got a chance to lift the hammer.”
Dae-sung knew that he lifted the hammer the highest but that was because the hammer was revealed not long ago.
There were quite a few hunters who succeeded in moving the hammer slightly, which showed that there were many with potential on Earth.
He just happened to have an opportunity to lift the hammer earlier.
“Hunter Koo Dae-sung, it was His Majesty who made you a trainee.”
“That’s true, but?”
“Then don’t you think His Majesty would think after hearing your worries?”
Ha-ri put down her backpack and pretended to be stern and snorted, then started imitating someone’s voice.
“How dare you doubt this king’s will, you wretched thing? What right do you have to question the goddess’s will? You should just train as you are told!”
“Uh, um… Agent Han. There…”
“Stay still! His Majesty would also say. [That’s not good~ You’re too comfortable so you have so many thoughts. From now on, add four hours of training! I mean. I trained without sleeping!]”
Ha-ri, who was snorting at Dae-sung, noticed that he was silently looking over her shoulder.
“…”
“…”
After a moment of silence Ha-ri couldn’t stop her pupils from trembling and opened her lips.
“Is he behind me?”
Nod.
And then a cold voice from behind.
“I’ve never seen such a rude thing. A lowly thing that speculates and imitates this king’s will?”
“Eek…! I’m sorry! Please kill me!!”
Ha-ri fell flat on her face and Leon looked down at her coldly.
‘This is bad!’
Why did he have to be behind me when I was imitating him!
She trembled at the scolding that would come from Leon, but soon heard a voice.
“Tsk tsk, how did such a thing get his grace?”
“Yes?”
She didn’t understand what he meant and slightly lifted her head.
“Han Ha-ri.”
“Yes, yes!”
“Glorious news. One of the gods is interested in you.”
“Yes?”
Ha-ri remembered what Leon had said once. When the training of the knight trainees was over, the gods would choose each of them.
The first step to becoming a Realm Knight was connecting with a god and that was what Leon was talking about now.
“Which god?”
The goddess of light and justice, Arianna?
The god of war and fire, Petos?
Ha-ri hoped that whoever it was, it matched her personality well. But the name of the god that came out of Leon’s mouth was completely unexpected.
“The holy god of the sea and waves, Poma, wants to make you his priestess.”
“…Yes?”
“You’ll have to join this expedition too.”
Leon put his hand on Ha-ri’s shoulder and looked at her with a pitying eye but she couldn’t understand the meaning of his gaze.

chapters.title: Chapter 75: Han Ha-ri, Goddess of the Sea and Waves
chapters.content:
Chapter 75: Han Ha-ri, Goddess
of the Sea and Waves
After confirming the East Sea Gate the departure was decided.
The flagship of the Korean First Fleet, Gwanggaeto the Great, and the Aegis destroyer Arleigh Burke-class dispatched from the US Seventh Fleet were ready to sail together.
“Hmm … it’s a pretty big ship.”
Leon looked at the East Sea, which was about to sail soon, from the stern of Gwanggaeto the Great.
The scenery was surprisingly clear and clean for a typhoon approaching. It must be the calm before the storm.
He was enjoying the sea view and calming his mind, when there was a slight noise around him.
“Load everything including the rations! Load as many spare weapons as possible! What do the hunters from the US say?”
“They’re doing their own thing. Should we switch the radio to a shared channel?”
“What for? It’s useless once we enter the gate anyway.”
Lee Yong-wan and the Phoenix Guild hunters were busy moving. Indeed, they were professional. They were mostly low-level hunters and academy students who were about to graduate.
On the other hand, they were pros of gate raiding. They claimed to be one of the top 10 guilds in Korea. It would be rude to compare them with Leon or Yappy, who were out of standard Holy Knights.
“I’ll contact Manager Park, so you guys do your own thing.”
Lee Yong-wan finished his instructions and came out to the stern. Then he ran into Leon and stopped.
“You’re quite good at leading the charge.”
“… Well, I’ve been rolling in this field for over 10 years.”
He still looked young, but he had 10 years of experience. Leon recalled his first impression of him.
“Have you stopped that dirty trick?”
“Dirty? … It’s a legitimate business activity. Your Majesty of the Middle Ages wouldn’t understand.”
Yeah, I don’t know.
Leon died normally and was reborn.
The country where he was born as a child of a great noble was an honorable country, a righteous country, and a country that was cared for by the gods.
There, Leon could do right. He performed justice, kept his faith, and lived.
Sometimes he destroyed a messy neighboring country, sometimes he exterminated dirty beasts, and sometimes he buried barbarians.
But, all his actions were only for the light and justice.
“You guys pursue money and only care about wealth and influence.”
“Isn’t that what powerful people always do? Your Majesty is not much different.”
Lee Yong-wan knew that this world’s Lionheart King was using his power and divine miracles to expand his influence.
He had already brought a revolution to the domestic food market and made the Hunter Association his puppet.
Then what’s the difference between TTG Guild and them? They just use more sophisticated methods.
“No, they’re different. You guys and beasts are different from Lionheart.”
“…”
Leon shrugged off his eyes toward him.
“Food and wealth are ultimately for making people rich. If you have infinite wealth, what does it mean to monopolize it alone?”
“What does it mean if there is a medicine that can cure any disease but it is not bestowed on patients?”
“It’s useless to pile up gold and jewels in a loveless world.”
“…”
Lee Yong-wan looked at this man who was like a sage and unconsciously thought of a man. His name was mentioned right away.
“What did you see from Sir Georgic?”
“Suddenly?”
“Not only Sir Georgic but also his knights. What did you feel from the soldiers of the kingdom?”
“…”
Yong-wan recalled what happened at Jeju Island Gate.
He saw their courage and was saved by their sacrifice but that’s not because they were transcendent strongmen.
They fought against the immensely powerful beast gods, against the endless army of beasts for one reason.
“Justice. You must follow justice only. It is the first phrase taught by Goddess Arianna.”
“How childish is justice …”
“Childish. Yeah, it would look like that to those who look at the world cynically and live calculatingly.”
Justice is childish.
Good deeds are losing money.
Such notions existed in his kingdom as well.
The humanists of the empire did so, and the wise magicians scoffed at it.
“My boy, anyone can laugh and be cynical.”
“Justice is childish, good deeds are not profitable, and living purely is foolish.”
“But those who live unjustly cannot get anything.”
“Those who live evilly may be wise but cannot be brave.”
“Those who are not pure cannot love.”
Leon gave this unjust man unusually much advice.
Georgic and his knights gave up their lives for their beliefs and they had to realize it.
Their sacrifice, their bravery and justice were valuable.
“Prove it. Whether you guys deserved what the glorious knights and loyal soldiers saved.”
If not, I’ll punish you.
At Leon’s cold declaration, Lee Yong-wan swallowed his saliva and tensed up.
And he also secretly …
-Buuuuuuung!
It was then. On the deck, the sailors retrieved the ropes connected to the land, and the loud horn sound began to ring.
The ladder connected to the land was removed, the Korean flag was hung, and the tugboats adjusted the direction of the warship.
Gwanggaeto the Great, was ready to leave the port by cutting through the water and the US Navy’s Arleigh Burke-class Aegis ship followed suit.
“Finally leaving.”
“You hit the scheduled time exactly.”
The lecture time naturally ended. But it wasn’t such a bad time for Lee Yong-wan either.
He himself also deeply engraved their attitude of living with justice and goodness in his heart.
“Your Majesty, if you don’t mind, can I repay you for what I owe you before … Huh?”
It was then that on the deck of Gwanggaeto the Great a strange cry was heard.
-Aisha! Aisha!
“TTG Guild?”
Students and soldiers carry something long on their shoulders and cross the deck to the stern. Someone was hanging on the pillar they were carrying.
-Hey, this is something wrong! You said I was a goddess! This treatment is wrong!
“Han Ha-ri…?”
What are they doing? At Yong-wan’s gaze, Leon explained with a satisfied expression.
“It’s a law that brings impurity if you bring a woman on board. But there is a way to make up for it.”
Are you saying that you hang people on the masthead and offer them to the gods?
“Why do you look at it like that? Thanks to the sacrifice of the goddess chosen by the god of the sea and waves, other women were able to board.”
He was proud.
This man who committed a heinous crime had no shame in his actions.
This is … justice?
Ha-ri wondered if she should be happy or not when she heard that she was chosen as a goddess by Poma, the God of the Sea and Waves.
“Well … thanks to that, I was able to participate in the raid too …”
It wasn’t such a bad thing, but …
“Han Ha-ri, there is something you have to do for me.”
“What is it?”
“Originally, it is a law that brings impurity if you bring a woman on board. The storm rises, the rainstorm hits, and the sea monsters attack.”
Isn’t that too prejudiced? Ha-ri gave up that question early.
“But there is a way to make up for it. Rather, the ship sails smoothly, the sea becomes calm, and guarantees a safe voyage. Can you do it?”
“Yes, just tell me! I can do anything!”
Ha-ri should have asked at least what that method was at this time.
Could she have dared to imagine that he would hang her on the masthead and offer them as goddess?
-Hey, this is something wrong! You said I was a goddess! This treatment is wrong!
Ha-ri protested this injustice while her whole body was tied to a pole and fixed, but the students and soldiers who moved Ha-ri thought differently.
“Senior … I’m sorry. Everyone is comfortable if only senior suffers.”
“Junior Jae-hyuk? You, you! Soo-ho! My brother Soo-ho!”
“Sister…I’m sorry. My opinion…doesn’t count.”
“Traitor! Juniors! Hunters! Someone! Someone with reason should stop this!”
““Aisha! Aisha!””
“Are you all listening?!”
As he said, Gwanggaeto the Great was sailing. And … soon witnessed the typhoon shaking beyond.
“Typhoon approaching ahead! It’s a butterfly! 64.5m per second!!”
The sailors were also busy.
The East Sea Gate, which was their target, was in line with the direct course of the typhoon. Of course, they had to prepare for a collision with the typhoon.
Of course, Ha-ri was left alone tied to the masthead during this process.
“Kyaahhh! Save meee! Save me!!”
There was thunder and lightning in the dark clouds.
Are you really going to enter that hellish cave of that monster face-to-face? That too with me hanging?
“Save meeeeee!!”
“Shut up!”
“Your Majesty?!”
There was a voice, and Leon was sitting calmly on a fishing chair. He even set up a fishing rod.
“Be quiet, the fish will all run away.”
“Fishing? Are you fishing now?!”
Fishing calmly while hanging people on the masthead and offering them as goddesses? Ha-ri was stunned.
“Because of you, the fish seem to have run away.”
“Well, there’s no fish in front of this big warship!”
“I can catch them all. When I was the guardian of my port city Rangkul, I fished while riding a whale.”
It sounded like a lie, but it was credible because it was Leon so Ha-ri asked with an anxious look.
“So, are you really going to hang me like this and head to the typhoon? It’s not too late now!”
Ha-ri was terrified by the approaching typhoon. If the masthead that hung her broke in the typhoon, it would be a matter of course that she would take the Styx River Express.
“Your Majesty! Do you have any way? There is a way like magic or something, right?! I trust you, Your Majesty! I trust you!”
Did Ha-ri’s desperate prayer reach him? There was a reaction from Leon’s fishing rod.
“Hmm, it’s quite sturdy!”
Leon pulled the fishing rod. Even in this situation, he was a pro and caught a fish in one breath, and a big one came dangling at the end.
“Lieutenant Colonel Choi. Get ready.”
“Yes, yes, Your Majesty …!”
Then the sailors rushed in and quickly set up something.
When he was about to sail long distances, he put a fish that was killed on the spot on something that served as an altar as an offering table.
“You are the gracious lord of the sea. Appear before these villains who dare step on your territory.”
Then something amazing happened. The ship that was shaking with all kinds of abnormal weather and waves became calm, and the seawater began to take shape while shaking.
It looked like a giant shark but it was too artificial to talk about the mystery of nature. Everyone felt it.
That is ‘god’.
[Oh~ Lionheart. My beloved lighthouse. The protector of my temple Rangkul.]
“Poma. The god of the sea and waves.”
Leon bowed one knee and greeted him satisfactorily. He looked at the typhoon approaching from the East Sea and beyond and sighed regretfully.
[It’s a very despicable sea. It has no dignity. As Petos said, I feel that there is no divinity in this land.]
The water droplet in the shape of a shark looked down at the warship that he could swallow in one bite.
[What is the reason for not having sails on board? And these guys and those guys don’t realize the grace of the sea!]
“It can’t be helped because they haven’t received the teachings of the sea yet. Please take care of them and comfort them.”
[No! I have no reason to comfort those who are not even my believers! Only fear and respect will bring grace as well!]
At Poma’s scolding, the sailors fell into fear.
They didn’t know why he was angry, but just facing his anger made them tremble.
In front of his whimsy, they were no different from sand grains swallowed by waves.
“…”
Leon received many favors from many gods, but not all gods were comfortable opponents.
Poma was especially fickle and eccentric among them. He never showed his anger at him, but he often made unreasonable demands on other believers.
“By the way, how did you choose that kid as a goddess?”
[Hahahaha …]
Poma let out a deep laugh and looked at Ha-ri who was shaking while hanging on the masthead.
[I barely persuaded Petos, but it was worth it. This kid has a natural vessel to accept God.]
“Hmm?”
[Of course not as much as you. You are out of standard that can contain all the divinity.]
“I felt that my luck was mixed, but I really did.”
[This is a blessing. How do you see it as misfortune?]
“God’s attention can be poison to the unbelievers who lack faith.”
[I believe that my lighthouse will solve it gradually.]
At that, Leon sighed and leaned back on his fishing chair.
[Han Ha-ri, my new goddess.]
“Me, me?”
[I will give you the blessing of water and the power to control the waves. Accept this gladly and spread my spirit and teachings widely.]
“Oh, yes, yes …! Just let me go!”
Poma shouted.
[As long as there is a sacrifice of my goddess, no wave can invade that ship!]
“…Yes?”
Ha-ri shook her head, but Poma smiled and gave her a trial.
[Your sacrifice will ignite the flame of life.]
As he said that, the huge water droplet collapsed. Like a soap bubble once.
“…End?”
When Ha-ri was at a loss, someone shouted.
“Typhoon approaching ahead! Wave height 10m!!”
At that, the sailors and hunters evacuated to the inside of the deck at once, leaving Ha-ri alone.
“…”
Are you really leaving me alone? Are you leaving me like this?
She met eyes with her academy juniors who only peeked out their faces from beyond the railing.
-Be strong.
-Sister, cheer up.
-Senior, fighting!
-Show your strength as the top student of the Korean Hunter Academy!
Ha-ri only heard some cheers and had to face the approaching waves.
-Kwaaaaaaah!!

chapters.title: Chapter 76: East Sea Gate
chapters.content:
Chapter 76: East Sea Gate
-Kwarrung! Bang bang!
The loud thunder, the high waves and the rainstorm hit together but Ha-ri was not so strong-hearted that she wouldn’t be bothered by this situation.
“Kyaahhh! Up! Up!”
The rainstorm hit and Ha-ri couldn’t open her eyes.
“Save meeeeee…!”
What happens if the waves hit like this? If lightning strikes? Doesn’t lightning usually hit the lightning rod first?
Leon’s voice was heard in her ears, which were covered by anxiety and typhoon noise.
“Hehe, you lack faith. But, it seems that Poma likes you, so he forgives some of your disbelief.”
“Don’t forgive me! Please, let me down!”
“Calm down. Entrust your body to the sea. Then the endless nature will embrace you.”
“Your, Your Majesty! I am …!”
I want to live right now!
The words she was about to spit out were blocked by the rainstorm.
“Calm down. We are in the middle of a typhoon right now. But then, isn’t it strange? Why doesn’t a single wave hit you.”
“Huh?”
At that, Ha-ri slowly opened her eyes and blinked them at the sight that unfolded.
“The waves are …”
The fierce whirlwind that hit from afar, the huge waves that did not invade the ship at all.
“Poma is calming the waves with the power of the sea through the goddess of the masthead.”
“Is that true?”
That’s such a deep meaning. I thought it was because he was a racist.
“Ah!”
Snap! The rope came loose as Ha-ri broke the knot because she was shaking and struggling.
“Ack!”
Ha-ri fell on the deck, grabbed her sore butt and made a sour expression. And right at that moment──
-Kwarrung! Bang bang!
-Kwaaaaaaah!
-Kwaaaaaaah!
As Ha-ri fell from the masthead the ship began to shake and even a dull person would know that this change was due to Ha-ri falling.
-…
-…
Everyone’s eyes turned to Ha-ri.
-Not going?
Ha-ri twisted his face in tears.
“You can tie me again…”
In the end, Ha-ri hung on the masthead again with Leon’s help and the waves calmed down.
-Kwaaaaaa!
The waves hit the Arleigh Burke ship along with thunder strikes.
“Kee … Great being. The ship will flip over at this rate!”
[It’s a mess!]
It was too much to break through this typhoon and head to the gate. But there was no choice.
To quickly close the gate, he had to leave at the same time as the Korean attack team that left first.
“Damn, why do those bastards look fine?”
“Holy shit! Those crazy Koreans. They hung people!”
The US Navy sailors looked incredulously at Gwanggaeto the Great, who was sailing without shaking even in this storm.
The Wisdom Jewel shouted.
[Tell the captain to chase that ship’s tail right now!]
“What?”
[If you don’t want to see the ship sink, do as I say!]
Reynald listened to the wisdom jewel and ordered the captain to chase after Kwanggaeto.
Even though he was an admiral of an Aegis ship in the U.S. Navy, he couldn’t oppose Reynald, and the ship stabilized surprisingly well as he chased after Kwanggaeto.
“My God…what is this…….?”
[He’s using the power of the god of the sea and waves! Ships protected by that god reap bountiful catches and don’t sink in stormy seas!]
“I see…”
Reynald swallowed his next words.
“Well, with this kind of cruising in this typhoon, we should be there in no time.”
[Remember, what you have to do is very important!]
The ships sailed through the typhoon and arrived at their target coordinates, where they heard the message.
[Here is Arleigh Burke and we have unfortunate news. It seems that the Murasame-class Haejae who sailed from Sasebo has been overturned by a storm and is being rescued.]
Haejae failed to break through the typhoon and sank. In other words, it meant that one-third of the power had evaporated before the raid started.
[This is Gwanggaeto the Great. We will proceed with the operation. We will enter the gate from now on and board the attack team on a boat.]
The two ships boarded hunters on rubber boats and their goal was the gate towering in the middle of the vast sea.
“We are now entering the gate.”
The black boats rowed in unison toward the gate and light wrapped them up.
My arm hurts.
Kwaa, kwaa~ The water rushing in wet my clothes.
“Hmm …”
Ha-ri licked her mouth, which kept flicking with water … The saltiness of the sea hits her taste buds.
“Eek! Salty!”
Ha-ri got up in a hurry and shook off the sand that stuck wetly and opened her eyes that had been submerged and saw a red sunset over the horizon.
‘What, half a day has passed?’
Ha-ri grabbed her head with a throbbing headache and recalled her memory before fainting.
“As soon as I entered the gate, a whirlwind …”
The rubber boats of Korea and America that entered were all overturned and swept away.
Ha-ri’s complexion turned pale.
“Where are they all?”
Ha-ri looked at the other hunters lying on the sandy beach. Most of them were familiar faces.
“Soo-ho! Wake up!”
“Hmm …”
“Sister?”
As Ha-ri shook him, he gradually opened his eyes. The students and soldiers were here but there were more people who were not visible.
‘Where is His Majesty? Where is Yappy? Where did the American hunters go ?!’
Ha-ri hurriedly asked the people around her.
[Calm down. Everyone will be safe.]
“Who!”
She was startled by a voice and turned around, but all she saw were fallen students.
“Ghost?”
[Here.]
She cautiously approached where the voice was heard but there was only one small turtle.
[Here.]
“Tu, turtle?”
The turtle, which was small enough to be placed on Ha-ri’s shoulder, looked at her with a blank expression and Ha-ri asked cautiously.
“Are you … Poma?”
[Yes, my goddess. I sent my avatar for your salvation.]
“Avatar…?”
Ha-ri had seen the avatars of the beast gods at the Jeju Island gate.
A huge iron monkey. That beast god was truly a giant worthy of being called a god, but the god of the sea and waves in front of her was…
“Small.”
[Oh, this! You can’t even bow down when you see the divine body, let alone!]
Ha-ri was stunned by the small turtle’s anger, and didn’t know whether to be afraid or not.
“By the way, you said everyone would be safe, do you know what happened?”
[As soon as you entered here, I pushed them to land safely with the power of the waves. I couldn’t stop them from scattering, though.]
Ha-ri marveled at Poma’s power that protected everyone from dying there.
“Wow, you’re amazing.”
[But it’s inconvenient to move with this body. Put me on your shoulder.]
“Uh, yes …”
Ha-ri put Poma’s avatar on her shoulder. The small turtle yawned and pushed his head into his shell.
“Poma?”
[…]
No response. Ha-ri didn’t bother to wake Poma, wondering if she was sleepy, and…….
-Dadak dadak!
A strange sound of footsteps was coming from the inside of the island and Ha-ri, who witnessed it, shouted with a pale face.
“Everyone get up! Get up quickly! Monsters!”
Huge crab-shaped monsters that reached 1.6m rushed in with their huge claws clanging.
“Uh, why now when I’m out of my mind …!”
Ha-ri immediately took a stance and drew her sword. Not everyone who was shipwrecked had woken up yet so she needed to buy some time.
-Tadak!
Sparks flew from Ha-ri’s sword. She intended to block the monsters with her maximum firepower, a unique skill called Fire Blessing, but …
“Huh?”
Something impure got into the flow of magic that she squeezed out of her body.
-Splash!
A stream of water poured over the flames and the fire went out.
“Huh?”
What’s wrong with this? Poma looked at Ha-ri’s bewildered face and said.
[The goddess who … receives the blessing of … the sea and … the waves … why does she need … fire …]
“Huh?”
What does that mean?
She couldn’t use her fire magic anymore because of the blessing she received from Poma.
“I can’t use fire?! Oh, no! Give it back! I don’t want to be Poma’s goddess!”
[No. I don’t intend to give it back….]
Ha-ri’s scream echoed widely on the sandy beach.
The US attack team was also swept away by the whirlwind that occurred as soon as they entered the gate.
“Phew … It was bad luck to have this at the entrance.”
[But thanks to that, we got away from that monstrosity.]
While Reynold and Wisdom Jewel voice were relieved, the US hunters who were part of the attack team approached.
“Thirty-eight people confirmed, sir.”
Minitman, ranked 8th in Maverick, a super-large guild representing North America. He was a 2m tall giant S-class hunter picked by Reynold for this job.
“Do you have any idea how many people are left?”
“This is my first time doing this but I’m sure they’re holding their own.”
“And the ‘natives’?”
“There’s been a commotion, so they’ll be approaching. Oh, there they are.”
-Dadak dadak!
-Dadak dadak!
As Minitman said, giant crab-shaped monsters were pouring out of the forest but the Maverick guild members quickly took up combat positions considering they were stranded on an island.
“It’s time to work, bastards. Let’s clean up quickly and start constructing the base.”
Reynold didn’t have to bother them and under Minitman command, the Maverick guild members slaughtered monsters like killing machines.
“Then build a base and rest. I’ll go inside the island for a while.”
“Do you need an escort?”
“I’m fine.”
Reynold left the Maverick guild members on the coast and headed inland.
He is a powerful magician representing North America. He is not a weakling who will die in such a gate without a hunter’s escort.
In fact, some crab monsters attacked him in the middle, but they died by Reynold magic.
“Wake up.”
Reynold poured evil magic into the monsters. Then they wriggled as they became undead and got up.
“Guide me to the statue.”
The crab monsters took the lead at Reynold’s words and because the island was quite small, he was able to get to where he wanted in no time.
“This is …”
[It’s the statue I was looking for. You have to find more of these!]
The statue Reynold found was a huge statue with an alien shape.
An artifact that feels like something that would come out when excavating ancient civilizations ruins.
An ordinary person would have sensed traces of civilization here, but Reynold sensed a tremendous power from the statue.
“Then──”
At the moment Reynold reached out to the statue──
“Wait …!”
A voice that stopped him echoed.
* * * *
Yappy, which had been swept away by the whirlwind, could barely function due to the seawater that entered his body.
Although Yappy is an ultra-high-performance, multi-role vehicle, it was not designed to be used in the sea, so it was not saltwater-treated.
However, thanks to the waterproofing of critical components and a self-diagnostic program that triggered when the system went down and decontaminated it, he was able to get it back up and running quickly.
-What?
The first thing Yakt Spinner sees after booting up is a bunch of monsters.
-Yuck! Yuck, yuck, yuck!
-Squeak!
When Yappy opens his eyes, he sees a group of claws pacing back and forth in a cheerful manner, their paws raised high in the air, rejoicing in his every move.
-What?
He couldn’t tell at first but Yappy realized he was being held in a primitive cocoon nest, piled high.
He must have been rescued by these crabs.
-Ugh!
Yappy scratched his head and spoke up, and the crabs cheered.
-Squeak, squeak, squeak!
-Giggle!

chapters.title: Chapter 77: Drifting
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: Drifting
“Wait …!”
Reynold turned his gaze toward the voice that stopped him.
There, the two S-class hunters of the Phoenix Guild and the attack team members were lined up.
“Mr. Lee Yong-wan, Ms. Ha Yuri. You are safe.”
Reynold stopped his hand reaching for the statue.
“Do you know what you are touching?”
Reynold licked his tongue as he saw the Phoenix Guild, who had come from the other side.
‘I didn’t expect them to come so soon. They’re quick to judge.’
[As long as it’s not him. But where is that bastard?]
Wisdom Jewel’s vigilance against Leon was almost obsessive-compulsive.
On the other hand, Reynold calmly spoke about the statue.
“You must have received a quest too, right? This statue, didn’t it tell you to break it?”
[Explore the island and destroy the ‘Rakshar the Great Statue’. 0/3]
-Destroyed Rakshar Statue: 0
The quest they received after entering this gate. Of course they checked it right away.
“…”
But Lee Yong-wan had recently doubted the ‘quest’ given by the gate and system.
In the previous Jeju Island gate the quest was to ‘stop the massacre and defeat the majestic Georgic’.
But when he looked back, Georgic was not a target to be defeated.
‘I haven’t shared this information yet …’
There is something behind the quest given by the gate. At least it’s not something to be taken for granted.
“Let’s put it aside for now. It’s not clear if this is the statue that came out in the quest.”
“…What do you mean?”
Reynold’s eyes narrowed. Lee Yong-wan, who faced his gaze, was uncomfortable, but he was not comparable to Leon or Georgic.
“If this is not the statue in the quest, there may be some trap if you destroy it. Don’t you have to make sure what ‘Rakshar’ is first?”
“…”
Reynold remained silent.
‘That’s not an unreasonable thing to say.’
[Back off for a moment. You alone will have a hard time dealing with all of these guys.]
Reynold agreed with Wisdom Jewel’s voice and showed a business smile.
“Then let’s go together to the beach for now. There are Maverick guild members there.”
Reynold decided to wait for an opportunity.
“Huah …! I finally finished everything!”
“Sister, you worked hard.”
Ha-ri and the TTG Guild students who repelled the crab monsters gathered on the beach.
“Soo-ho, is anyone hurt?”
“I’m fine, sister.”
Ha-ri comforted her academy juniors who were checking their bodies and approached Kim Do-han and the soldiers. There was also Koo Dae-sung who was taking care of them.
“Hunter Park Dae-sik! Hunter Koo Dae-sung! Are there any injuries?”
“I’m fine, Miss Han.”
Park Dae-sik, a first-generation man-at-arms, smiled kindly and waved his hand. On the other hand, Koo Dae-Sung had a serious expression on his face.
“Hunter Koo?”
“…It’s cut off.”
“Huh? What?”
“His Majesty’s aura has been cut off.”
“Ah …”
Leon had various passive buffs such as Lionheart’s Aura and War Knight’s Blessing to his subordinates.
Those buffs increased their power by at least one level and up to two levels and made D-class hunters barely compete with orcs.
“That’s a big deal. I’ve seen a lot of His Majesty’s buffs …”
The guild members naturally looked at the islands that were faintly visible in the distance.
“Do you think His Majesty is on one of those islands?”
“It doesn’t look that far away …
At that remark, Koo Dae-Sung shook his head vigorously.
“I have suggested it to His Majesty and tried it before to see how far does His Majesty’s aura reach.”
The buffs were applied to the corps members at a reasonable distance. But there was definitely a limit to that distance.
“The widest range of buffs was up to 30 km but none of us are currently receiving that buff.”
“So what does that mean?”
“His Majesty … There is a possibility that he is not on any of those islands.”
Not even on those islands? There are no more islands around here. Then where is he?
“What if His Majesty …?”
He cautiously uttered a word. But everyone waved their hands and shook their heads.
“His Majesty would never…”
Naturally denying the atmosphere, only Ha-ri had a serious expression on her face.
[Ha-ri, the connection with the Lionheart King has been cut off.]
“…”
Ha-ri kept her mouth shut and did not show any reaction. She was worried that her anxiety would spread to others.
“First of all … let’s gather and talk. We also need to check who is gathered.”
So they gathered in one place for the time being, students and trainees. They called each other’s names and counted the number of people.
“I don’t see Kim Do-han.”
“I can’t see Jae-hyuk.”
There were dropouts from both students and soldiers. And…
-Hi everyone, I’m Michael.
“Oh~ the girl who was hanging on the boat. Why did you do such a crazy thing?”
About 10 hunters of the US Maverick Guild, who were dispatched as a joint attack team, were also present.
“Oh, right. You are from the US.”
Ha-ri distinguished them by their appearance rather than the language they used.
After the Great Change, awakeners and system windows appeared. And that overturned the language barrier between the awakeners.
Similarly, survivors also spoke the same language as Earthlings so communication with the Maverick guild members was not difficult.
“Hello, I’m Maverick Guild callsign Mistral. What’s your name, pretty girl?”
“Uh, um … I’m Ha-ri Han. Mist … Mistral?!”
Ha-ri’s eyes widened as she heard the man in front of her introduced himself as Mistral. He was a famous S-class hunter ranked 6th in the Maverick Guild.
“Really Mistral? That Allen Taylor?!”
“Why bother with a callsign if you call me by my real name?”
“Oops! I’m sorry.”
