She bowed her head and the students who sent their longing eyes to the world-famous S-class hunter.
“I didn’t know you were on the attack team.”
“Wasn’t there any information sharing? Well, we left in a hurry without having time to properly brief. But is your guild master not there?”
“His Majesty is absent …”
“Well, there won’t be any big deal. There will be some people swept away by the waves.”
“That’s not it.”
At Ha-ri’s assertion, Allen looked puzzled.
“The sea god gave us his blessing. There will be no one killed by the waves.”
As if he was confident, the turtle on Ha-ri’s shoulder stuck out his head.
“And … if His Majesty wanted to find us, he would have found us long ago.”
“That’s right, sister. His Majesty has Pegasus.”
“So are we left alone to do whatever we want? He is a person who trains us hard anyway …”
“???”
Allen made a strange expression as he heard Ha-ri and TTG Guild members’ conversation about their guild leader.
Sea god? The legendary divine beast with wings? It’s too frivolous to joke about.
“Anyway, what we have to do on this island is simple.”
Allen’s gaze turned to the air, towards the system window that anyone who is a hunter has.
This system window, which tells the purpose of the gate as soon as they enter the gate, tells them what quest they had to perform.
[Explore the island and destroy the ‘Rakshar the Great Statue’. 0/3]
-Destroyed Rakshar Statue: 0
In other words, does it mean that the dungeon will be closed if three statues are destroyed?
But Ha-ri and TTG Guild students who had already experienced Jeju Gate had different thoughts.
“Let’s explore the island first and postpone destroying the statue for a while.”
“Yeah, I don’t think it’s a good idea to destroy it blindly. Let’s figure out the gate first.”
“I agree.”
“Hmm?”
Allen frowned at the reaction of the TTG Guild members.
Hunters only need to follow the closing conditions of the dungeon gate. It’s enough to quickly close it after getting all the resources you can get in it.
But the reaction of the TTG Guild was different from that of an ordinary guild.
“Well … I guess it’s okay to do it while looking for the statue.”
But right then──
[The first wave begins.]
“Huh?”
“Wave?”
The system window warned them.
“Kraken? It’s a sea monster!”
A huge monster arrived on the sandy beach riding the waves and behind it, countless monsters showed up together.
“It starts with an A-class field boss. It’s tough.”
TTG Guild and Maverick Guild raised their weapons toward the flock of krakens that were advancing by swinging their huge tentacles.
In the abyss of the endless sea, the deep sea where even sunlight cannot reach, there is a luminescent body on the bottom of the sea that emits a brilliant light.
It creates space and air by pushing away even the huge pressure of the deep sea.
It was a safe zone for terrestrial creatures in the middle of the sea and the being who created this impossible miracle opened his eyes.
“It’s troublesome.”
Leon, who opened his eyes, stared at the deep-sea fish that were flocking from all sides.
Attracted by the intense light, things like lantern fish show interest, and giant snakes like deep-sea fish that are hundreds of meters long show their hundreds of teeth.
In nature, predators and prey would not look so peacefully in one place, but all these deep-sea fish were looking only at him.
Not only that. This deep sea was not just the bottom of the sea.
Ruins of buildings that maintain their shape even under the huge pressure of the deep sea and traces of civilization showed that this place was evidence of a ruined world.
“Hmm …”
When the boat capsized, Poma’s power was temporarily cut off.
To be precise, his power decreased in the sea, which was not his territory.
Who can temporarily block God’s power and pull him in the deep sea?
The only ones capable of such a thing are beings who have the same divinity or demons of a completely different nature.
“Show yourself, evil thing.”
Kugugugung!! The sea moves at Leon’s rebuke. No, it looked like that.
The bottom of the abyss splits and reveals a huge presence. The movement alone makes the whole sea roar and.
The fierce teeth with jaws, the deep-sea fish boasting a length of hundreds of meters, and even whales that seem to be bigger than anything else in the world are instinctively afraid and cannot move.
The land where Leon stands itself is its palm, so how can such a huge being be called a creature?
[Lionheart…The hound of gods. Descendant of Dragon Slayer. The one who killed the most demons.]
A deep voice spreads through the water. What appeared was only one of hundreds of tentacles but even that one tentacle was bigger than the biggest creature in this sea.
[The knight among knights. The king among kings. The guardian of a kingdom that once had brilliant glory appeared in front of me after losing his army and having his power weakened.]
“Do you know me?”
[Who among demons doesn’t know the Lionheart King? You are famous among us.]
The lowly approaching tentacles were too big and big is itself a huge violence. The being in front of him is the most unreasonable violence in this world.
[Many heroes have visited this place, but there was no hero who could defeat me. Are you different?]
The tentacles looked straight at Leon as if they had eyes on each one.
“You filthy bastard dare to insult me. Don’t you really know that there is a heaven above heaven among you?”
The huge tentacle grabbed a whale and squeezed it as it was.
Paddeuk! A whale spitting out its intestines died miserably and fell to the ground. The impact was so heavy that it reached Leon.
[But I thank you, Lionheart.]
“What?”
[Thanks to you defeating Malus, I also have a chance.]
“Malus …”
‘Malus, Demon Lord of Chaos. Is he related to that bastard?’
[I spent an idle time here for five hundred years. But that’s over now. It’s time to end this long sleep.]
Dozens of tentacles reveal their grandeur and stretch out in all directions as giant deep-sea fish that can’t even think of escaping are caught by those tentacles and torn and swallowed.
From where the huge tentacle brought the prey, a voice that caused waves faced Leon.
[I was bored of eating fish for five hundred years. I wonder what the knight of the gods tastes like.]
‘Archdemon…no, more than that.’
Leon faced the evil that looked down on him.

chapters.title: Chapter 78: Poma, God of the Sea
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: Poma, God of the Sea
A huge tentacle swings.
-Kaak!
“I’ll block it!”
Koo Dae-sung’s shield blocked the swinging octopus paw, and it bounced back, unable to hold on.
“Kraak!”
Koo Dae-sung rolled on the ground.
‘Without the buff … I’m much weaker than before!’
It felt like his arm bone was crushed. It would be difficult to continue the battle without the healing function of the Holy Grail.
‘I barely managed to block a blow…….’
Meanwhile, Ha-ri penetrated the gap between the monsters that landed.
“Ha!”
Ha-ri jumps in. Fortunately, Ha-ri’s sword flashed in the gap he dug in.
-Kwak!
The sword that swung at the head only severed the leg that was trying to hit her. After landing, Ha-ri dodged the blow and cursed her luck.
‘If only I could use my skills!’
Ha-ri backed away and shouted at Poma, who was sticking out his head on her shoulder.
“Poma! I’m supposed to be a priestess, but why don’t I have any super tsunami skills or something?”
[Did you read too many novels?]
“Yikes! You’re the most novel-like!”
“Sister, avoid it!”
When I turned around, the merman that came with the Kraken was holding out a sharp trident.
“Huh?!”
Dangerous. She was so focused on Kraken that she didn’t notice. In a hurry to block the trident with her arm, something flashed and pierced the merman.
“Be careful, pretty girl.”
It was Allen. He and the Maverick guild members swept away the monsters that landed and came to help with the Kraken.
“Are you flirting with women, boss?”
“A man does that everywhere.”
“Well. Oriental kids look too young, so I’m a little hesitant.”
The Maverick guild members were relaxed even against an A-class field boss. Usually, boss-level large monsters are bigger and more difficult than their measured grades, but …
“It’s not bad for an A-class?”
“It’s the first wave. Make sure you manage your condition properly and don’t overextend yourself.”
The huge field boss was helpless in front of Allen and the Maverick guild members.
“…They’re strong.”
“Yeah. They’re America’s best hunter guild.”
TTG Guild had more than thirty guild members, but Maverick achieved overwhelming results with only ten or so.
It was natural since each of them was an A-class hunter, and their leader was Allen Taylor, one of America’s best hunters and an S-class hunter.
“Let’s clean up the rest! There’s not much left!”
Their power was so overwhelming that the battle itself was easy.
[The first wave is over.]
“Hoo~ the wave is over.”
The battle ended without much trouble. Although they had a hard time because of the field boss, their power was overwhelming.
[Well, it’s not a bad level.]
Poma, did not leave Ha-ri’s shoulder even during the battle and Ha-ri found Poma annoying.
“Poma! If it weren’t for your divine power, I could have fought much better!”
[Hehehe, my priestess, why do you blame your shortcomings on God?]
“Eek … I used to be a fire swordsman.”
Ha-ri felt that it was a loss that she could not use her fire blessing because of Poma’s divine power.
She was a promising A-class candidate in her own right, and this was why she couldn’t use her power in the wave.
A hunter’s unique skill is his characteristic and innate talent itself.
Ha-ri had the ability to manipulate fire, which was a powerful advantage over other hunters.
“If I have water powers in the first place, shouldn’t I be able to do something like freeze or Ice spear! Why is it that when I channel my powers, water gets mixed in with them and puts out the fire?”
[I said I am a god of sea and waves. You should look for a god of ice or something like that.]
“Do they exist?”
[There is a goddess of winter, but there is no god of ice.]
“Well … That’s true.”
Ha-ri felt uneasy that she could not use her own power right now. It’s natural to be anxious because the blessing she’s been using since childhood has been neutralized.
[My child. Don’t be obsessed with a handful of power. There is infinity in front of you, how can you not realize it?]
“…”
Ha-ri could not understand Poma’s words. To be honest, she just wanted to ask why he didn’t tell her.
But Poma, who spoke in metaphors and analogies, felt like a sage. Why is that? Something like a recluse master who teaches the protagonist in a movie.
In fact, there might be some hidden truth and reason, right?
But that expectation was soon broken.
Statue search and repeated wave defense. Allen of the Maverick Guild decided to do both of them in a textbook way.
First, he formed a team to search for the statue by breaking through the crab monsters on the island,
Second, he built barricades and camp facilities on the coast to prepare for a long-term battle.
Crab monsters didn’t usually come to the beach, so it was easier to hold on to the beach and face only one side.
This work was done quickly. The academy teaches how to build a base and survival common sense at the gate where you don’t know what will happen.
The Maverick guild members who had experienced everything and the TTG guild members who had received enough training quickly built a base and took a break.
-Kyak!
-Oh, don’t throw it! Don’t throw it──Oof!
-Don’t go too deep into the sea!
Even though they didn’t have swimsuits or facilities, these kids could play with water anyway.
“Hoo~ Do you want some water, Poma?”
Ha-ri, who dried her wet clothes and sat on the sand, took out a water bottle filled with an emergency backpack and poured water on the turtle’s mouth.
[Kra~ The water tastes good.]
Poma placed his sunglasses on the turtle’s head and laid his belly down. The turtle’s gaze focused on the energetic Academy cadets.
[Hoo~ The scent of flesh and the lively appearance of virgins are always good to see.]
“Uh …”
Ha-ri’s face distorted at Poma’s comment.
[My priestess. Don’t you want to play in there?]
“I don’t really like water play. The sun is hot, and my skin is sticky.”
[Hehehe, every young woman has a freshness that is different from others. Enjoy your youth, virgin. How can you sit huddled like a basement dweller with that sturdy flesh?]
“You are … like a typical bad boss.”
To be honest, if he wasn’t a god, she would have said something.
[What~ After all, young men and women are like blooming flowers, so they can spread their reproductive instincts indiscriminately at this time. In that respect, I agreed with that war guy.]
‘…Old-fashioned god.’
Ha-ri thought of Leon, who was the most old-fashioned type she could think of, and wondered if he was influenced by the gods.
“Oh. Then Poma.”
[What is it?]
“Why did you hang me on the mast as a sacrifice? I mean, thanks to that, I didn’t get capsized by the waves and sailed safely.”
It was a pure question.
[That? It’s a kind of sacrificial ritual.]
“Sacrificial … ritual?”
[In the old days, there were people who were overly loyal to us without us asking. A typical example is human sacrifice.]
Poma said that he used to send down his own spirit directly when he saw people throwing virgins into his palace for him in any sea in the world.
[What’s the use of throwing it into any sea? At first I took them to my palace and made them brides, but there were too many of them.]
So he agreed to hang virgins on the mast.
Ha-ri wondered if this was something to agree on.
“Just tell them not to do it?”
[I can’t do that. After all, offering to God is itself a lump of faithful faith. They pay their dues because they respect and fear God. Miracles bestowed without compensation only lead to laziness and sloth.]
“I guess … but why …”
[The flesh of virgins is always good to see, isn’t it?]
“…Pervert.”
[What did you say?]
“Oh, nothing!”
Poma peeked out of his sunglasses.
[If you are my goddess, remember my commandments, for they are now yours to teach and preach.]
What kind of teaching will Poma give?
Ha-ri recalled the commandments of Demera, the goddess of life and abundance.
Aren’t the words of the gods always good words across cultures? I think it wouldn’t hurt to learn.
The God of the Sea and Waves
Release the first fish you catch into the sea. Only throw the net to the right. Do not throw garbage into the sea. Do not have sex on the boat. Especially between men. …
…
The one who catches the biggest fish on the first day of the first voyage will have good luck until he reaches land. The one who catches the smallest fish on the first day of the first voyage can be ridiculed. Even if he is the captain. …
…
Do not take women on board. Misfortune will come. A virgin with bare skin is fine. The more skin is exposed, the better. [Did you hear that well? From now on, either don’t take women on board, or save a virgin and hang her on a mast. Then I will bless that boat.]
“…”
Ha-ri looked down at Poma with a rude and timid gaze for a long time, swallowing many words she wanted to say.
‘He’s a complete pervert…’
Poma yawned and enjoyed the warm sunlight and hot sand bath. He ignored Ha-ri’s gaze lightly.
[The third wave has ended.]
-Kiruk!
-Kikiruk!
The Kikiruk tribe cheered and exclaimed as the third wave ended. They dedicated this glory to Yappy.
It has been 36 hours since he drifted.
Yappy blocked the wave that flocked to the island with the Kikiruk tribe on the island where he drifted.
According to Yappy’s judgment, the waves continue to hit periodically. And those wave monsters are blocked by the natives, the Kikiruk tribe.
The wave renewal time is 12 hours. In this regular invasion, many Kikiruk tribes also died.
-Kikiruk tribe population count. Abnormal breeding speed and growth speed.
Nevertheless, they were able to block the wave because of their innate mass breeding power and abnormal growth speed.
Any creature needs nutrients and skeletal formation time for growth but Kikiruk tribes grow and breed at an abnormal rate.
“Brother Yappy. Brother Yappy!”
It was then that Kim Jae-hyuk, a trainee knight of TTG Guild, who broke through the Kikiruk tribe, ran towards Yappy. He was rescued by Yappy’s instructions after being found drifting on the beach.
-What is it? Kim Jae-hyuk.
“Rakshar statues have not been destroyed yet.”
Yappy is a survivor. Survivors have an advantage that there is no language limit, but unlike Awakeners, they cannot see system windows.
Jae-hyuk played a role in delivering information from that system, and Yappy inferred a lot from it.
-Rakshar statue. Abnormal magic density phenomenon. It may have affected Kikiruk’s abnormal growth.
“Do you mean we have to protect Rakshar statues?”
-That’s right.
What if all the statues are destroyed?
Yappy and Jae-hyuk thought of the worst case scenario from there.
“If we keep defending like this, will it work?”
-Impossible.
“Huh? Brother Yappy swept them all away.”
-The difficulty increases sharply as the wave stage rises. With current power, high possibility of strategic defeat from 5th wave.
Yappy is a Holy Knight. Of course, he’s not at full power, but at least it’s ranked third in combat power in TTG Guild.
He’s power is comparable to an average S-rank, but he can’t guarantee victory?
“The others will be better off than us…”
Of course, there are advantages here too. It’s that Kikiruks move as Yappy commands them.
Kikiruks saw Yappy as a savior who came to save them.
-Kikiruk! (Hooray!)
-Kiruk! Kikiruk! (Praise the savior!)
Kikiruks are completely under Yappy’s command. And they were a more sophisticated tribal society than he thought.
-Power reinforcement is needed. Even if it’s primitive cold weapons, you need to equip them.
“Cold weapons… That’s right, brother Yappy. I found something interesting.”
-Kiruk?
Following Jae-hyuk’s guidance and escorted by Kikiruks, they arrived inside the island. It was hidden inside a waterfall.
Yappy witnessed an amazing sight as he passed through what looked like a cave.
It was a trace of urban civilization.
-The width of the road, the skeleton of the building, and the direction of the formed culture match the physical characteristics of Kikiruk.
“That’s right. It was a developed civilization, but…”
Why are Kikiruks now forming a primitive society?
-Kikiruk’s intellectual ability is not lacking compared to humans. They have superior intelligence and more social empathy skills than dolphins. They have all the conditions necessary for civilization formation.
Then there must be a reason why they have fallen like this and can’t even use their ancestors’ heritage.
Yappy saw an old blacksmith shop and asked the Kikiruks.
-Kiruk! Kikikiruk! (Is there a place where something similar to this mineral is gathered?)
Kikiruks answered.
-Kirukkiruk!
The answer didn’t need to be translated and Yappy immediately gave instructions.
“Brother Yappy? I can’t understand what you’re saying, can you translate it?”
He couldn’t understand what they were saying.
-Simple.
“Wow, brother. What kind of amazing trick?”
Yappy confidently rolled his camera eye and declared.
-I will raise the level of civilization in this world.

chapters.title: Chapter 79: Advancing at Mach Speed
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Advancing at Mach Speed
The wave is already the fourth. It’s been two days since they drifted into the gate.
During that time, Ha-ri tried to awaken her power while fighting the waves on the beach.
Normally, she would have been more diligent than anyone else in searching for statues or something, but she had a desperate reason.
“Ah! Ah!”
She hit the water with her bare feet and tried to squeeze a handful of seawater but the water soon collapsed and the squeezed seawater scattered in her hand.
Poma shook his head at Ha-ri’s meaningless struggle.
[If you want to play with water, take off your clothes and do it. Make it look good.]
“Yuck…! Don’t harass me when I’m trying to awaken somehow!”
[I don’t know where your attempt to awaken the power of the sea and waves is.]
Ha-ri pouted her lips and sat down on the wet sand floor at Poma’s question.
“I learned that you can be closer to Goddess Arianna of Light and Justice by repeating righteous actions or raising honor.”
[It’s a fitting teaching for her. It’s boring.]
“Goddess Demera of Life and Abundance was grateful to the land by farming, and God Petos of War and Fire was victory and flame of will? Something like that.”
The gods teach the proper teachings and how to perform them according to their respective domains.
Surprisingly, the previous gods were simple in terms of difficulty rather than teaching.
“Since Poma is the god of sea and waves? I thought it might have something to do with the sea.”
[I don’t think it has anything to do with water.]
“Yuck…! Then why don’t you tell me? Should I go out to sea and catch some fish?”
[It’s more like offering me fish that you catch. But how are you going to catch fish without a boat, a net, or a fishing rod?]
“Uh…”
Ha-ri wondered why this bright turtle god didn’t give her any power.
“His Majesty Leon…you said we had to save him … Shouldn’t we hurry in that case?”
[That’s right. He is trapped in the sea, not on land. The fact that he hasn’t come out by himself means he’s in a rather difficult situation.]
“Then why don’t you hurry up and awaken me so I can find His Majesty?”
[That’s right.]
Then why? Ha-ri couldn’t understand this god of sea and waves.
[Ha-ri, my goddess. It’s easy for you to practice the code of the sea and waves and build your faith.]
[Every day, pray as a fisherman, throw a net, harvest fish, and thank me, pray for the source of life.]
[The sea is an infinite source of life. You can build faith by just being grateful for it.]
Should I make a raft or something? As Ha-ri was worried, Poma said kindly.
[But, Ha-ri. Young goddess. How do you mistake the way of believers and priests? Are you arrogant enough to think that the enlightenment of soldiers and knights is the same?]
Realize and practice. Only that way can you realize the way of faith.
“…”
Ha-ri had mixed feelings. Just tell me what to do instead of talking so much.
She wanted something like skills or systems that gave results without any process.
“Hmm… I’ll try harder.”
But what can I do? Ha-ri just tried hard to awaken the power given to her as Poma told her.
“Sister! Sister!”
And then, he saw Soo-ho running fiercely towards the beach.
“What’s wrong?”
“The Maverick Guild found a statue!”
There were nine hours until the next wave so Ha-ri immediately followed Soo-ho.
The interior of the island is full of crab monsters, making it a challenge just to advance but Reynold’s island was on the smaller side, so the distance to the statue was not very far.
The mission Reynold received from Wisdom Jewel was to destroy all the statues.
He should have destroyed this statue on the first day and proceeded to the next island…
‘You’re still guarding it. You’re more stubborn than I thought.’
[Why are they doing things they weren’t told to do?]
The Phoenix Guild thoroughly investigated the statue and its surroundings. As if they doubted the quest itself that said destroy Rakshar statue.
That was beyond Wisdom Jewel and Reynold’s expectations.
Usually hunters who receive quests try only according to those quests, not digging into the intentions or truth of quests.
The sweet fruits they get while clearing quests, rewards are chased by hunters, but now Lee Yong-wan and Phoenix Guild’s movements were clearly different.
‘Should I destroy it secretly at night?’
[There is no need to arouse unnecessary suspicion, and we have a reason.]
Reynold quickly understood what Wisdom Jewel meant by reason.
“Hey, Korean guys. Don’t you think we should destroy the statue soon? I think we’ve waited long enough.”
The Maverick Guild members agreed with the judgment of the Phoenix Guild.
Whether it’s really ‘Rakshar statue’ as the quest says, or if there’s anything else around it.
“When I was trying to capture the gate in Mexico City, I made a mistake and fell into a trap.”
“It’s not a bad choice to do a thorough investigation rather than blindly destroying it.”
They blocked the wave while investigating the island for three days, and came to a conclusion.
“There was nothing to be found on the island except for those crab monsters and traces of civilization.”
“There is only one statue. One per island according to the quest. It seems right to destroy Rakshar statue.”
“Is there any reason to wait?”
Maverick Guild drew a reasonable conclusion based on their research.
Lee Yong-wan and Ha Yuri had nothing to say against it.
“Hmm…”
“I can’t help it. I don’t see any other way.”
Almost as soon as he agreed, the Maverick Guild’s S-class Hunter Minuteman pounded on the statue with a fist the size of his head.
“This thing is pretty hard.”
But that was all. The S-ranked Hunter was serious, and the statue was destroyed shortly thereafter, at which point the quest window updated.
[The ‘Great Rakshar’s Stone Statue’ has been destroyed].
1/3 of the statue destroyed
“So destroying this statue was the right answer.”
The Maverick Guild’s members had a positive response to the quest update. However, Lee Yong-wan and Ha-Yuri still had a nagging feeling.
“I wonder if this is it.”
“It can’t be helped, I don’t see any other way.”
-Kiruk!
-Kiruk! Kiruk!
That’s when it happened. The moment they destroyed the statue, crab monsters came bubbling out from everywhere as if they were enraged by the destruction of the statue.
“They’re going crazy all of a sudden.”
“Kill them!”
But the crab monsters were no match for them. Even though their numbers were huge, they were fighting against three S-class Hunters.
The hunters calmly slaughtered the crab monsters and the battle continued for a long time.
“Whew… Damn, there are so many.”
“We also found and destroyed the nest, so they won’t come anymore.”
“Lee Yong-wan, it’s wave time.”
“Already? It took longer than I thought.”
It’s time for the sixth wave. But even though it was 12 o’clock, there was no wave warning on the island.
“There’s no wave?”
“It was the right answer to destroy the statue.”
They destroyed the statue and the waves stopped. No wonder they were so confident that their actions were correct.
“Then let’s attack the rest of the islands!”
The Phoenix and Maverick guilds split up and agreed to attack the islands.
After four days they were lucky to recover the rubber boats that had drifted away.
Lee Yong-wan parted with the Maverick guild and headed for the island, and he was able to reach the second island soon by entrusting himself to the calm waves.
“Everyone, unload the supplies and build a camp first! We have to respond to the monster wave right away!”
The Phoenix guild quickly built a camp and started installing obstacles to deal with the wave as soon as they landed.
When it was about halfway done, the hunters who had gone out for reconnaissance returned.
“Guild leader! There’s something you need to see!”
A guild member who urgently looked for Lee Yong-wan.
“What is it?”
“Well, there are traces of battle!”
“If hunters were swept away here, it’s natural──”
“No, it’s not that kind of trace! You have to see it!”
“???”
Lee Yong-wan felt puzzled by the guild member who was pale blue and followed him to another sandy beach that was a little distance from where they landed.
“This, this is…!”
Lee Yong-wan’s eyes widened when he saw it.
It was a trace of war.
More precisely, a war between the landing force and the defenders.
If that was all, he would have thought it was a trace of hunters fighting with wave monsters but that wasn’t it.
“…Cannons?”
The scars of the monsters were not traces of being cut by cold weapons such as swords or spears.
They were mangled corpses, as if they’d been decimated by a powerful firepower.
It would be roughly like this if you watched the gruesome scene of a war documentary.
“We have to go back quickly. This island is different. We have to prepare!”
-Kiruk!
It was then that a lot of eyes that made him feel cold and Lee Yong-wan hurriedly aimed his bow at the island.
-Kiruk kiruk!
-Kikik!
The crab monsters he had seen on the island were staring at him, their inexhaustible gazes fixed on him.
If that was all, Lee Yong-wan, an S-class hunter, wouldn’t have much to worry about. These crab monsters were only numerous, not very strong monsters. But──
Armor that fits perfectly along the thick shoulder blade bone and a line that looks like some kind of electric device connected to it.
What was more surprising was that it wasn’t just that. The crab monsters all had something big and long on their backs. It looked like… ‘cannon’.
“A cannon?”
“They are armed with firearms! How come only on this island?!”
No, calm down. The island they were attacking wasn’t full of primitive monsters like the previous one.
But how can they use cannons only here? There is no way that there is such a gap in civilization. Surely that’s decoration──
-Bang!
The cannonball shot past Lee Yong-wan and sank into the sea.
-Kwang!
The shell exploded and raised a fountain of water as Lee Yong-wan clenched his teeth as he got hit by the rising fountain of water.
“It’s real…”
There are hundreds of those cannons. It’s too much difference to start a battle rashly.
Hesitant Lee Yong-wan came up with some crab monsters carrying something on their shoulders. It looked like a big basket.
-Kiruk kiruk!
-Kikik!
-Kikiruk!
The crab monsters bowing in reverence to the tribal chief-like existence decorated with flowers and wood ornaments from ancient times. It was… really an unexpected person… no, machine.
“Yacht Spinner?!”
Yacht Spinner, the killing machine of Cheongju Gate, who received the reverence of crab monsters and came riding on a basket, was undoubtedly TTG Holy Knight Yacht Spinner.
“Bow down to Brother Yappy, our Kikiruk tribe’s boss!”
Behind him, wringing his hands and chanting, was the unmistakable Kim Jae-hyuk, a knight cadet of the TTG Guild.
-Surrender, organic beings. You have no chance of winning.
“”…“”
Yong-wan Lee put down his weapon with a pale face after seeing them.
Firebird Guild suppression complete.

chapters.title: Chapter 80: Demon Archduke Rakshar (1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 80: Demon Archduke Rakshar (1)
[‘The statue of the great Rakshar’ has been destroyed.]
[Destroyed statues 1/3]
The first statue was destroyed and it was reported to all the hunters.
“It looks like they destroyed the statue on another island, sis.”
“Hmm…”
The statue discovered on the island where Ha-ri was located was found in a neglected place where bushes grew.
There were crab monsters resisting, but they were nothing more than fallen leaves in front of the power of the Maverick Guild.
“Let’s destroy it soon. We only have to destroy one more.”
The opinions of the Maverick Guild members were very reasonable. It was natural to clear the quest of the gate in order to close the gate.
But the TTG Guild members, who had seen the duality of the gate several times, doubted that this time would be different.
“Sis, do we have to destroy it?”
Soo-ho cautiously asked Ha-ri for her opinion. Now that Leon or and were not there, Ha-ri was the biggest decision maker.
“Sis?”
But there was no answer. Soo-ho turned his head toward Ha-ri, who was silent, and found that her face was pale.
“Sis, what’s wrong? You don’t look good.”
“No… no.”
Ha-ri couldn’t understand why everyone around her was peaceful. Surely they were looking at the same thing, so why didn’t they notice?
The terrible energy that the statue is suppressing.
“We… can’t destroy this. If we destroy it… something terrible will happen!”
“Sis?”
“Han Ha-ri?”
The Maverick Guild members, as well as the TTG Guild members, reacted with curiosity to Ha-ri’s intense reaction since they can’t feel the energy that the statue is suppressing.
“I, I, I know I’m saying something really weird, but this can’t be, this can’t be, there’s… something in here!”
She couldn’t tell what it was, or why she was the only one who could feel it. She could only wonder if something had changed in her since she had become a goddess of Poma.
“What are you talking about?”
“There’s something, there’s something! The statue is holding something back! You can’t touch this! Please tell them Poma!”
Ha-ri realized she couldn’t convince her on his own, so she turned to the gods. As much as she felt it, he must have felt it too.
[…….]
“Poma?”
But there was no sound of Poma’s voice.
Ha-ri tried to shake Poma, who was on her shoulder, but he remained stiff and unmoving, like something frozen in place.
“Ugh…….”
Ha-ri stood in front of the statue as if to protect the statue from everyone.
“Miss Ha-ri, what are you doing?”
The Maverick Guild members’ expressions hardened. No matter how they looked at it, Ha-ri’s reaction was not normal.
“This… can’t be touched, no one. Never…!”
Ha-ri’s declaration of intent puts Allen in a bind since he’s a hunter on assignment from the United States.
The U.S. government, concerned about the security of the Pacific, has asked him to do one thing: to close the East Sea Gate as soon as possible and eliminate the security threat.
He needs to complete the quest, and Ha-ri’s actions are getting in the way. But Ha-ri’s status is too subtle to dismiss and force her.
She is not a guild member of the TTG Guild. She’s an employee of the Korean Hunter Association.
That means she’s a government employee, and as a foreign Hunter, it’s a burden to harm a government employee of another country.
“Ms. Ha-ri, isn’t this a little out of line?”
Well, she had a point so Allen decided to take his time convincing Ha-ri. After all, raiders and soldiers in foreign countries have their own rules.
“Oh, I know, I know, I know, I’m so weird!”
Ha-ri couldn’t back down with a smile or a cry but Koo Dae-sung stepped forward to help her.
“I’m Koo Dae-sung, a member of the Ten Thousand Gods Guild. Actually, Deputy Han has a point.”
“Mr. Koo?”
The TTG Guild students looked at Koo Dae-sung, who raised his hand and stepped forward, with curious eyes. But he started to speak somewhat shamelessly.
“Actually, Deputy Han has a unique skill related to foresight. It’s more like intuition than perfect foresight, but it’s pretty accurate.”
“…!”
At that word, Ha-ri opened her eyes wide and looked at Koo Dae-sung.
‘I don’t have that ability?!’
‘…Please catch on.’
‘Ah!’
Allen asked with a suspicious look.
“Han Ha-ri, is that true?”
It was a chance. She hesitated for a moment, but Ha-ri responded to Koo Dae-sung’s ad-lib.
“It’s true! This is a pretty high-ranked unique skill! It’s not accurate, but something like intuition? Future foresight? That kind of feeling! Thanks to this, I survived several times!”
When foresight skills were mentioned, the Maverick Guild members also became cautious.
There were occasionally hunters who had skills related to foresight in reality.
They prevented great disasters and this was officially confirmed.
Just now, foresight skill holders from all over the world are predicting the ‘Wandering Demon Sword’ route and evacuating citizens. The number of lives saved by this will exceed hundreds of millions.
“I’ve never heard of a foresight ability in Korea…”
“She, she got her unique skill last year! She was our academy senior until last year!”
“That’s right. Senior Ha-ri, getting a prophecy skill was quite famous in our academy!”
“They said there was a lot of trouble with other guilds scouting.”
The TTG Guild students who caught on to Ha-ri and Koo Dae-sung’s play responded.
As the TTG Guild members responded one by one, Allen couldn’t just force them to destroy the statue.
He was a hunter who knew the situation and a gentleman.
“Okay, but I can’t wait long. The wave gets stronger as it repeats, and there is a limit to stopping it.”
He would wait. That was the last compromise Allen could make.
And so began a strange standoff──
“What? Why haven’t you destroyed the statue yet?”
Minuteman and Maverick Guild members who had destroyed the statue arrived and said so.
‘It’s a strange situation.’
[Damn, it’s annoying.]
Reynold arrived at the second island and stared at the TTG Guild members who were in a standoff over the statue.
He knew the situation. A guild member named Han Ha-ri blocked the destruction of the statue with a unique skill as an excuse, and Allen decided to stop destroying it because he thought it made sense.
“A unique skill. It’s a tricky situation.”
Minuteman, who had the same authority as Allen, also became cautious when the unique skill was mentioned.
[Following the system too closely is also a problem!]
Modern humans blindly trusted the system and the awakened ones. They didn’t even know who created the system window, they just thought it was the salvation of humanity and didn’t doubt it.
It was natural. So far, the system has been the reason why humans have survived. There were those who doubted the system and its intentions, but they were very few of them.
That’s why everyone became cautious when Ha-ri mentioned her foresight skill. The Demon of Wisdom had to prepare a means to break it.
[We must hurry, it’s not like she can keep him bound forever!]
‘Since she’s claiming to be a unique skill, it must be destroyed.’
[Then the method is simple.]
There is the Demon of Wisdom and America’s leading archmage so it was a simple matter to expose the lie that Ha-ri came up with on the spot.
“Han Ha-ri.”
“Yes…Master of Magic Tower.”
“Can I do a unique skill appraisal?”
“What?”
[A system is a collection of information, after all. Figuring it out is no big deal!]
The Wisdom Jewel produced a skill appraisal on the spot from trivial items. It was a skill that surprised even Reynold.
“Sk, skill appraisal?”
“Yes, it’s nothing. It’s just to understand the skill and how the conclusion was derived. You won’t refuse unless what you said was ‘false’, right?”
“Ah…”
Because Reynold’s smiling face, and the Maverick guild members who were annoyed by the delay Ha-ri couldn’t refuse Reynold’s request.
Of course──
“This damn! She tricked us!”
“Why did you do this, Miss Ha-ri …?”
The lie was soon exposed and there was no such thing as an intuition-like skill from the beginning.
[‘The Statue of the Great Rakshar’ has been destroyed.]
Destroyed statues 2/3
-Kurururung!
Around Rakshar the light of the huge statue went out. In other words, it means that the island’s statue was broken.
“…”
Leon opened his eyes and stared at Rakshar. In the deep sea, he seemed to smile with a twisted smile.
[It’s my victory, Lionheart.]
“There’s still one left.”
[You are overconfident in your subordinates, Lionheart. Now there is only one left so I will now escape from this disgusting prison.]
The last of the seals that held him back glowed, and a giant chain seized Rakshar’s tentacles.
Rakshar moved his huge body to get out of the chain. Just by doing that, the traces of civilization were shattered and shook the continent.
When he finally couldn’t get out of the last chain, Rakshar raised his pincers.
-Kwadeuk
Rakshar cut off his tentacles and got out of the chain. Even though he cut off his own feet, Rakshar didn’t flinch and tried to soar toward the light.
-Kiiiiiiiiing!
It was then that around Rakshar the city that sealed him, ‘81’ statues that seemed to have stopped functioning, spewed out huge heat rays at Rakshar all at once.
Each one is comparable to a great magic…Final weapons that burn at the molecular level but even with their indiscriminate attacks, Rakshar calmly bit his lips.
His remaining tentacles wrapped around and threw and broke the statues.
The city could not hold Rakshar’s ankles.
When even the last obstacle failed to stop him, Rakshar pushed the ground and soared above the water surface.
-Kuwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa────!!
Rakshar soared and nothing could stop him.
Giant deep-sea fish were died with their guts exposed by just brushing them, and the fish that couldn’t even think of running away died in groups.
The moment he finally showed his appearance above the water surface, the system recognized him.
[Demon Archduke of Chaos Rakshar has awakened.]
[His existence crushes everything alive.]
【 Aura of Chaos 】
◆Effect
: Weakness, Chaos, Creepy, Confusion, Tetanus, Scream, Fear, Confusion, Despair, Physical Decay, Mental Contamination, Soul Erosion────
【 Legendary Demon 】
◆Effect
: Unrecognizable.
【 Demon Archduke Rakshar 】
◆Effect
: Unrecognizable.
Traits continue to show up in message windows as Demon Archduke Rakshar affects everything alive in this gate just by coming up above the water surface.
Archduke of Chaos Rakshar declared for the first time in hundreds of years after coming up above the water surface.
[I am Rakshar…!]
Rakshar roar echoed throughout the sea as deep-sea fish trembled in fear and fish suffocated. Everything alive was afraid of his roar.
The sea, stirred by him, rose in tidal waves, and the shockwaves rose to the clouds.
-I am chaos that distorts your norms!
-I am despair that stops your beating heart!
-I am a scream that crushes your hopes.
Submit.
Kneel before this evil that you cannot resist!!
The world heard it and no one even thought of confronting this evil.
“…”
Leon had no choice but to stare at Rakshar leaving with his huge body.
“Not yet. Not yet.”
There is a prerequisite for his last move.
“Han Ha-ri, you foolish child, I’ll bet on you.”
Leon builds up his strength since this was not the time to act.

chapters.title: Chapter 81: Demon Archduke Rakshar (2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 81: Demon Archduke Rakshar (2)
Rakshar moved.
Its massive body brought the ocean to its knees just by stepping out of the depths.
The mere act of walking unleashed a tidal wave, churning the sea.
Fish rose to the surface in droves across the vast expanse of water. Choked fish wash up with the waves, becoming waves of corpses.
“What, what is that?”
They noticed the change almost at the same time.
A terrifyingly dense wave of magic power was coming from the sea. Even if dozens of great spells were released in quick succession, the air wouldn’t be this heavy.
All living creatures, not only those with systems, trembled in fear, realizing the evil that shook this world.
They all sensed his presence even though they couldn’t see it in front of their eyes.
“What’s going on? Abrams! Identify it right now!”
“Ah, yes.”
Abrams hurriedly moved his gaze to the sandy beach as Allen reacted nervously despite his gentlemanly personality.
Possessing the unique skill of clairvoyance, he looks out over the sea and sees it.
“What is that… That, that…….”
The shape of a mutant can be seen from far away even from within the island. If you look at the dozens of tentacles, it seems like a mollusk, but the carapace that covers the whole body is sturdy and smooth like a helmet bug.
But decisively, seeing his hideous head and pincers that seemed to cut both ends of the island, he could only think of it as a demon of another world.
It was a terrible and overwhelming, literally gigantic monster that he could not imagine how it evolved.
He didn’t know, but Abrams and his eyes met.
‘Did our eyes meet? At this distance?’
It’s coming, looking straight at him. Was he targeted? Glared at? As if staring at prey…
[Chaos Pollution is inflicted.]
“Ah, uh…”
The island vibrates with the giant’s breath.
Is this real?
“Ah, ah, hee, heehee…….”
“Abrams? What are you doing!”
Allen put his hand on Abrams’ shoulder. But Abrams pushed his arm away with bloodshot eyes.
“I’m going to die, I’m going to die, I’m going to die. You have to die!”
At that moment, Abrams’ bow was aimed at Allen. The moment he pulled and shot the bowstring, he reflexively swung his spear and cut off both arms. It was minimal suppression.
“Wh, what are you doing…!”
Allen reacted reflexively to Abrams’ sudden behavior, but was confused by his colleague’s rampage.
No one would know that Abrams’ attempt to kill Allen was born out of pure goodwill more than anyone else.
“End, it’s over… It’s all over. End, end──”
“Get a hold of yourself!”
Abrams kept banging his head on the floor as if trying to escape from something scary. His mind was filled with chaos.
“Bo, boss… there…….”
It was then. The huge presence that narrowed down the distance and could barely be seen with clairvoyance approached in an instant.
Allen realized its identity through the system window.
“Oh, archduke ? Archduke ?!”
A demon of a scale never seen before.
The most powerful demon humanity had ever faced was the Archdemon.
They were horrified by the appearance of evil itself because they couldn’t even imagine that there was a more powerful existence than that.
Also──
【 Aura of Chaos 】
An overwhelming aura that crushes existence.
All living things knelt down without being able to resist an aura that was completely different from when they carried Leon’s blessing.
Even Leon had a limit to his aura distance but Rakshar’s aura was a terrible pressure that crushed the whole world.
“Oh, no. No way. We can’t beat that.”
Despair rises in the hunters’ eyes. They were trembling so much that they couldn’t even think of running away.
They don’t understand.
Why? Why were those things targeting Earth?
No, why did human civilization survive when there were such things in the first place…….
Eventually.
Until Rakshar stood before them no one could move a single step.
-Kraaaaa──
No one’s breathing can be heard. Only the breath of the archduke flowing sinisterly on the island can be heard by them.
[Kr, kr, kr──]
He roared loudly enough to make their ears burst but Rakshar didn’t care and continued his roar.
[Submit.]
It was his first ‘civilized conversation’. At the same time…
Thud!
And all the creatures knelt down.
There was no hesitation. There is no fool who does not know how foolish it is to oppose an invincible being.
They couldn’t control their teeth trembling, their arms and legs twitching, and their lower body that seemed to wet themselves at any moment.
The only thing that came to mind was to beg for mercy from the other party through submission.
-Kkakakaka──
Rakshar was pleased with the submission of the humble ones. He stared at one creature who did not kneel.
“Ah…….”
Ha-ri felt his ‘gaze’.
She shouldn’t have been seen by such a giant creature , but she felt his gaze.
[There’s an unpleasant smell.]
Ha-ri wanted to wake up the god who was sleeping on her shoulder but she had a hunch that if he tried that, she would be stepped on and killed by that huge thing.
-Kukakakaka──!
A loud rumble spreads and all living things have knelt down. They shed tears and could not resist.
Even the S-class hunter Allen Taylor, who was called the strongest of humanity, lost his will after seeing Rakshar.
The same was true for S-class hunter Minuteman and the rest of the A-class Maverick attack team and they had a different black aura rising from them.
In the end, only Ha-ri could stand on her own two legs in front of that magnificent being.
She didn’t know it, but in Leon’s absence, she was the only one who had the protection of the gods and Rakshar knew this, too.
Rakshar could handle Ha-ri himself. He could beat her to death with his giant tentacles, or grab her and swallow her in one bite. But savoring the delicacy was not his priority. Rakshar’s attention was on an old grudge match.
-Tsk, tsk, tsk!
Those who dared to seal him away and keep him in those shackles for so long. They should be the first to suffer his wrath.
Rakshar’s gaze traveled to the island where the remaining statue lay. He moves, and a tidal wave rises, washing over the Hunters.
* * * *
The tidal wave washed over the Hunters, and they barely managed to get to their feet, spitting up salt water.
Nevertheless, Ha-ri was relieved that the behemoth didn’t seem to care about them.
Whatever happened, they were alive, or so she thought. But then──
[The area is tainted with chaos. All living things are in a state of ‘confusion’]
The entire region was tainted by Rakshar’s passage, just for that simple reason?
“Hmph, hmph… hmph, hmph…….”
But a familiar chuckle from behind her back.
The cackle of despair, of giving up on everything, echoes ominously.
“Hmph, hmph…!
“I must… die.”
The human voice choruses in a cacophony that is chilling to listen to.
Just as Abrams did when he first saw the Rakshar, all living things have seen the Rakshar and lost the ability to think normally.
Chaos.
Despair.
Screams.
All that remained was purely instinctive goodwill, which was──
“Kaaaah!”
They swing their sword towards a comrade.
-Caw!
Slashing, stabbing, and dismembering each other here and there. It was only a matter of moments before Ha-ri realized what happened.
“What are you all doing- -Ugh!”
A flurry of spears stabbed at Ha-ri and although she managed to block it, but the impact alone knocked her back a few steps.
Allen Taylor.
Even S-class Hunters, who were said to be the strongest of the human race, were stunned by the sight of Rakshar.
Minuteman, a fellow S-class Hunter, in addition, the A-class Maverick raiding party was moving, and a different black aura was emanating from them.
[Blessing of Archduke Rakshar]
: To all who submit──■■■■■
Destroy.
Ruin.
Obedience.
Their pride as America’s finest hunters was shattered along with their humanity and they realized.
“We are… too weak.”
“You’re mistaken. With this much power… you’re Class S, you’re the best hunters… you’re looking down on us…….”
Their eyes are filled with despair and there is an uneasy air.
It was an air of abandonment and degradation.
“Oh, no…….”
Ha-ri cried out. The only good thing was that their killing spree did not include the members of the Ten Thousand Gods Guild.
Perhaps they were blessed by the gods, or perhaps they had been eating blessed crops in between but they are trembling, crushed by Rakshar’s pressure, and dare not move.
Only members of the Maverick Guild are able to move their cowardly legs in exchange for obedience to Rakshar.
It is clear what those who can move will do from now on.
Kill each other, help each other commit suicide, and give each other whatever chaotic goodwill they can.
“Jugger, jugger! Jugger—-! That’s the right thing to do!!!”
Allen raised his spear.
By the time Ha-ri instinctively raised her sword, the spear was already raining down.
-Crack!
The weight of the spear was transmitted through the sword and Ha-ri was pushed back.
“Grrr… Mur, stop──”
Instantly, Ha-ri felt a pressure above her head and when she looked up she saw Minuteman slamming his giant gauntlet down.
Minuteman’s fist barely missed but a shockwave hit the floor, knocking Ha-ri to the ground.
“Kuck?!”
Ha-ri’s light body bounces off the ground, she rolls on the ground, sand in her face, and bounces again and again.
“That’s enough…!”
When she gets up, she’s faced with Allen’s spear barrage.
She dodged his spears with the best reaction of her life but a slash across her forearm, a graze across her thigh, a graze across the nape of her neck appeared.
In less than ten seconds, Ha-ri’s body is ravaged.
“Ugh…!”
Ha-ri, who had been struck thirty times by Allen, was already bleeding all over but she didn’t let go of her sword, even though she looked like she was about to die.
“Kill──!”
It was then that an impossibly large fist slammed into Allen’s back as Minutemen had swooped down on Allen.
-Kwak! Kwak! Kwak!
Allen is sent flying, bouncing off the floor but with him out of the way, Minuteman sets his sights on Ha-ri.
Just as Minuteman’s fist was about to strike Ha-ri’s abdomen──
-Bang!
Ha-ri’s body bounces into the air, the gravity pulling her down to the surface.
* * * * *
The sun may shine on the surface, but beneath the surface is an abyss that never ends.
Ha-ri stretched out her hand, watching the light fade as it mixed with her blood.
‘Ah… will I die like this?’
If she’d known, she’d have used her savings.
Ha-ri had been orphaned for reasons that are commonplace in modern times.
Caught in a dungeon break, or a gate raid── the epitome of the typical 21st century orphan, raised in a state-run orphanage to provide for the children who flooded the streets after the Cataclysm.
She wasn’t rich, but she wasn’t poor either, and while she didn’t want a private education, she had the talent to get one.
She dreamed of being a righteous hunter.
Her parents died saving the world, as the orphanage’s director told all the children.
Even though there must have been countless other cases, the director wanted Ha-ri to be proud. She wanted the children to be proud of their parents, whom they had never met.
Even though the story was a lie, Ha-ri never lost sight of her goal of becoming a great hunter.
So she was naturally disillusioned with the Ten Guild’s rhetoric about defending the nation and protecting its citizens when she realized that their priority was money.
She turned down the huge salary offered by the Ten Guilds and joined the Hunter’s Association.
In the Hunter’s Association, she thought she could at least fight to protect people but even as an employee of the Association, she could only do so much.
Surely the Hunter’s Association was fighting a better fight than the Guilds and they were doing more valuable work but that’s all it was
They were not moving forward.
Same as it was 30 years ago, same as it is now, same as it will be 30 years from now.
In the end, all Ha-ri could do was adapt to reality and become a lazy civil servant waiting for her pension, just like any other civil servant.
“This King is the Lionheart King, King of the Glorious Knights and agent of the Gods, Leon Dragonia Lionheart.”
When she first saw him, she thought he was crazy.
Authoritarian, superstitious, discriminatory, arrogant, misguided, and rabid.
He doesn’t belong in the 21st century and it was no exaggeration to say he was a barbarian but he had a will, a purpose, a conviction, and the power to carry it out.
Inadvertently, she wondered if he could change the world, so when she was chosen to be a priestess of the god of the sea and waves, she was pleased.
‘Damn… damn…!’
But why?
Why am I so helpless?
Unlike the Lionheart King, whose mere existence gave her hope, she couldn’t even stand on the toes of that knight, Sir Georgic, let alone the Lionheart King.
Would it be any different if she were like Yakt Spinner?
“Come, let’s go. My brothers and sisters. Today we will die for justice. The gods will look upon us.”
She willingly chose to die, sparking the final flame.
Even her final moments, could not keep the flames──
‘That’s right. The fire goes out right away…….’
Damn gods! Gods who can’t help her!
No matter how much she stretches out her arms, all she can grab is a handful of water. Even if it was a senseless act, all she can do is reach out with her hands in desperation, but even that scatters meaninglessly.
‘Do something! Do something!’
At that very moment, the turtle she had missed during the battle with Allen and Minuteman appeared in front of her.
“……!”
The turtle’s gaze was different than before.
The sea god, who had been devious and sinister, intoxicated by the smell of women’s flesh and dazzled by the sight of bare skin…was looking down at Ha-ri with a more serious gaze than ever before.
[Han Ha-ri]
Poma said.
[Do not try to grasp the sea, for you are but a handful of water in the palm of the endless ocean.]
[The ocean cannot be grasped, but you can throw yourself into its embrace.]
I don’t know what you mean.
But all I know is that what I’ve done so far is meaningless.
[You have holy power within you but using it does not mean becoming a Holy Knight. A Knight of the Gods does not belong to the idea of limits.]
‘I don’t know what you’re talking about, it’s… so vague!’
[What you lack is not strength; fill your heart with faith and trust; perceive and understand the enormity of what you hold.]
And again, unintelligible words.
I don’t understand, for what I need now is a miracle, and what does a miracle-maker expect from a rascal like me.
As if reading Ha-ri’s intentions, Poma said.
[Do not look for miracles, but perform miracles. The most favored of the gods do not beg the gods for power.]
“…….”
[Listen to the sea, for it is infinite, and if you did not know that you are held in its embrace, you will now feel it.]
I once peered through the telescope of an observatory.
I’ve looked through the eyes of a telescope in the orphanage. Like when I zoomed in on the vastness of the universe, the vastness of the ocean it’s the same.
Your senses relay information about the world you’re immersed in.
The tumultuous movement of the currents, the flailing of the coral reefs, the gently swaying of the seaweed in the currents.
[A world of nothingness, a handful of seaweed, a handful of water.]
Infinite power is not to be grasped, but embraced.
[Finite beings, mortal ahimsa, if you wish to attain your true immortal power.]
Do not try to grasp it.
Infinity is to be worn.
You are now, within the infinite.
Once Ha-ri realized this, she realized what she could do.
She feels the ocean, is surrounded by it, and controls its waves.
In the infinite ocean, her gesture would become a wave.
Her senses have even reached the Lionheart King in the Deep.
Holy Art
At that moment, from the bottom of the ocean to the sky above the surface the sea split in two.
At that very moment──
-Purrrr!
From the depths of the ocean a Pegasus rose.

chapters.title: Chapter 82: Demon Archduke Rakshar (3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 82: Demon Archduke Rakshar (3)
Rakshar moved toward the last of the statues.
Not so much for the sake of destroying it, but for the sake of his long-standing grudge against the native creatures of this land.
It is only fitting that the enemies who sealed him and kept him should be prioritized.
-Kiruk!
– Kiruk!
From the islands all around came the clawed creatures, tens of thousands of them, the clans that instinctively came to stop Rakshar when his seal was broken.
[Obedience──!]
Rakshar’s cry made the world tremble but the native creatures resisted.
[Hmm?]
Demon Archduke of Chaos Rakshar is an evil demon that taints life itself. All who face him descend into chaos, unable to maintain their sanity.
With very few exceptions.
[Holy Knight…!]
There was a divine energy on that island that could withstand even his own magic and Rakshar knew who they were, having invaded the world of knights long ago.
Chosen by the gods to change the laws of the land, they should have killed most of them, so how could they exist on that island?
He couldn’t imagine anyone else being so favored by the gods.
[No wonder!]
Rakshar swung his giant tentacles around and slammed them into the Kikiruks.
-Boom!
-Bang!
A thunderous explosion struck Rakshar but mere firearms meant little to Rakshar.
His armor is so hard that the difference between an arrow and a shell is meaningless but these shells are different.
-Battery three, firing. Fall back to cool barrels. Move the ammunition carriers.
Holy Knight Yakt Spinner, Saint of the God of Iron and Blacksmithing.
Everything he touches is a holy object in itself, imbued with holy power.
It was these Holy Grenade shells that gave the overwhelming Rakshar pause.
It was a feeble struggle as Rakshar raised his claws high, slapped the water, and a huge tidal wave rose.
Forty-six meters high, a natural disaster capable of wiping out life on a single island.
The moment the terrifyingly high waves were about to overwhelm the island──
[Holy Law]
The waves, which seemed to be about to overwhelm the island at any moment, scattered. That’s not all, the waters beneath Rakshar’s feet swirled and turned upside down, trapping him.
──!
Rakshar’s gaze is fixed on a single point. Above the blue expanse, a dazzling pure white divine beast stared down at him.
[Lionheart…!]
Leon and Han Ha-ri looked down at Rakshar.
* * * *
The moment Han Ha-ri used her miraculous holy power, the pressure of the deep sea that had trapped Leon temporarily cracked.
Like the miraculous parting of the biblical Red Sea, Leon didn’t miss it.
“Stallion!”
He summoned his oldest ally and Stallion, who understood the situation in a flash, picked up Leon and spread his wings.
-Heh!
The Pegasus soared through the air as crumbling sea walls and deep-sea fish pounced on Leon, but the fastest and best steed dodged them all with ease.
“Stallion, let’s get out of here first.”
Leon used the power of Poma to pluck Ha-ri from the surface and grabbed by the nape of her neck, Ha-ri gasped for air.
“Your Majesty?”
Ha-ri gulped and spat out the seawater she’d swallowed, then looked up at Leon and smiled as if she’d found a savior.
“Well done.”
Leon praised frankly, then tucked Ha-ri in front of him as she reported what happened.
“The Demon Archduke has been resurrected, and everyone is going crazy, killing each other and cutting themselves…!”
“I know. It’s hard for criminals to stay sane in the face of great evil.”
Leon quickly landed on the island where the Maverick Guild and the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods Guild were. In the midst of the scuffle, as each side swung their weapons at the other, he called out.
“I’m here!”
Leon’s voice rings out. At that moment, not only the members of the Ten Thousand Gods Guild, but also the Maverick Hunters see a system window before them.
[Lionheart Aura]
◆Effect
: ──────
Grants Legion-enhanced Corruption Resistance.
Among the many effects of the Lionheart is the ability to purify pollution.
[Demon Lord Slayer]
With a great being in front of you who has slain even a Demon Lord, you regain your senses──
[Greatest Demon Slayer]
The effect of granting a percentage reduction to all demons’ actions was granted to everyone.
Crucially, the light from the Holy Grail Leon took out healed their wounds and restored their shattered spirits.
“Uh, uh?”
“My, what did I do…….?”
The awakened Hunters stare at each other and it wasn’t long before they turned their gaze to Leon.
“You lowlifes, if you’ve come to your senses, prepare now.”
“What are you talking about?”
Allen asked naturally, waiting for Leon’s instructions. All the Mavericks fell to their knees, feeling the holy power radiating from the Lionheart King and the Sea Goddess.
“You are of no help. Run for the gate now.”
“What?”
Inwardly, I was relieved that this wasn’t an order to fight Rakshar, but run for the gate?
The gate was in the middle of the ocean and there weren’t enough boats to take everyone.
“You have before you a new daughter of the sea god. Have faith, and you will walk on the surface of the water.”
A new system message flew in front of them.
[Protected by the Goddess of the Sea and Waves]
Effect:
-You gain a 35% advantage on actions in the sea.
-Waves are favorably affected.
-Penalties for being underwater are removed.
-You can walk on water.
It was a favor given to those who worship the sea god but now that she’s awakened as a goddess of the sea, she’s able to bestow them to even the most ignorant of unbelievers.
“It’s real.”
“I can walk on water?”
They marveled at the miracle of not drowning and walking on the surface of the water.
“Lionheart, what are you going to do?”
Allen asked politely. Do you think even two people can stand up to such an evil? It was a natural thought.
“Save as many survivors as we can. We cannot win against it in this world.”
The oceans of this world are Rakshar domain and their force was powerful enough to temporarily block even the power of the gods so they had no chance of winning in this world.
Leon would buy time until he could get as many survivors to retreat.
“Let’s go, Stallion!”
Stallion leaps to his feet at Leon’s shout, then Leon grabs Ha-ri by the scruff of the neck.
“Your Majesty, Rakshar, Rakshar is attacking Lord Yappy!”
“We’ll have to bind his feet first. Han Ha-ri, you do it.”
“Me?”
Leon sighed at Han Ha-ri’s half-question.
“The whole world is an ocean, so how can you argue the impossibility. Manipulate the flow of the ocean and tie his feet.”
“Eh, eh…!”
Ha-ri was at a loss, and Leon grabbed her by the shoulders and pulled her face close.
“Your Majesty?!”
“Close your eyes and concentrate. You have already heard the sound of the sea.”
Whether Ha-ri blushed or not, Leon spoke from his experience as a senior priest.
“The ocean is a flow. Think of it as one giant living thing. Manipulating the current is nothing more than moving your hands and feet. You will feel it now.”
Leon was right. Ha-ri had awakened to the power of the ocean and its waves, and she could feel its flow.
She did as she was told, manipulating the currents around Rakshar to submerge the hulking Demon Archduke and trap him within.
Sensing that this was his limit, Leon continued to order.
“Next, ignite the flames. You have been chosen by the God of War and Flame.”
“What?! Flames? It’s underwater, so it won’t work──”
“You fool, how dare you reduce the power of a god to a set of intelligible laws. The Holy Law is the power to change laws. No common sense you know applies there.”
Stir up fire. A sacred flame that will burn brightly even under the sea.
Ha-ri stoked the fire as usual. Once awakened, her powers bend to her will.
“This fire cannot be extinguished by water. It flows like the currents and moves like the waves at your will.”
Leon took Ha-ri’s hand to assist her. Then something amazing happened.
Ha-ri’s fire began to envelop Rakshar under the sea like a giant wave. The fire was indeed underwater, burning Rakshar without being extinguished.
“I did it, I did it, Your Majesty!”
“Well done.”
Leon gave Ha-ri a rare pat on the head and landed in front of Yappy, who was still resisting Rakshar.
“Your Majesty!”
There was not only Yappy, but also Yong-wan, Ha Yuri, and Kim Jae-hyuk from the Firebird Guild.
“Lord Spinner. We need to get out of this gate right now.”
-Enemy Severe blow. Gradual retreat possible.
“No.”
Leon denied Yappy’s speculation.
-kraaaaaaaaaa──!
A monstrous roar was heard as dozens of tentacles clawed at the bottom, breaking through the vortex of fire and the backwash of waves.
“Close the gate and retreat.”
Leon wanted to slice the Demon Archduke in front of him, but he lacked the strength.
At the very least, if he didn’t recover the Holy Sword, he wouldn’t be able to defeat Rakshar.
With his power limited, the best he could do was to save as many people as possible.
“Lord Spinner. We must close the gate now.”
-Gate closing conditions. To destroy the statue.
Destroy the statue, then, and that’s it. Then, Yappy made an additional suggestion.
-The Kikiruks. The clans that sealed the demon. Not ‘NPCs’.
“Then?”
-Survivors. Suggesting they leave.
“Do you think we have time? It won’t be long before the divine punishment binding him is extinguished.”
-Possible. Willing to use the last resort.
While Yappy was worshiped as the savior of the Kikiruk, he read the island’s remaining records and their epitaphs.
As only he could interpret their language in real time he could read even the most weathered traces of civilization.
And he knew that the Kikiruk had a last resort.
* * * *
[The ‘Statue of the Great Rakshar’ has been destroyed]
Destroyed Statues 3/3
All the statues have been destroyed.
Rakshar, who had been imprisoned and sealed in the statues for hundreds of years, immediately recognized the change.
[He intends to escape]
Rakshar knew the terms of the gate’s closure: if his seal was broken the gate would close.
Of course, Rakshar had no intention of sparing the visiting Hunters, so it would be pointless, but they would flee while this pillar of fire bound him.
With the help of Ha-ri, the Sea Goddess, all of the Kikiruks raced across the surface of the water toward the gate.
The Holy Knight, revered by the Kikiruks, the beloved of the sea, and the Grail Keeper, who could bind even the mighty Rakshar.
Three miraculous beings, all in one place.
[A foe of the demons, indeed, but one step short]
Rakshar crawled out of the fire vortex.
As a Demon Archduke, the holy laws of the newly awakened priestess only served to bind his ankles for a moment.
[Do you think you can escape?]
A resounding roar that was enough to make all those fleeing stop in their tracks shook the sea.
[Lionheart!]
A steed and a knight with a spear swooped down. Just as Leon’s spear was about to pierce Rakshar by surprise, a long tentacle slammed into his flank.
-Puck!
With a fierce crash, the steed plummets toward the sea. Just before its wings touch the water, the awakened Stallion barely manages to fly above the surface.
“Stallion!”
Stallion dodges the threatening tentacles and Leon strikes with its lance at those it cannot.
He closes in until the sharp tip of his spear touches the giant beast.
[Ugh!]
Rakshar’s gaze is fixed on Leon, and in that instant, his eyes glow with an immense amount of magic.
-Kaaaaaahhhhh!
The light cut through space as the two reacted at the same time.
Throwing themselves at each other, Leon and Stallion sliced through the magic beam with a juggling move. Leon was defenseless in the air, but he had a footing.
Leon steps on Rakshar’s tentacles as they unfurl and keeps running.
-Kwaah──
Just as it was about to unleash its light once more, a spear pierced its eyeball but Rakshar didn’t stop his massive display of magic.
The magical light, centered on the spot where the holy spear pierced, tore the sky into dozens of splinters.
A dark light filled the sky but Leon and Stallion ran through the light.
Tentacles lunge at Leon, but Stallion’s acrobatic flight evades them, and his holy sword slices through the flying tentacles.
[Swatting like flies…!]
Stallion is knocked back into the air by the shower of magic light.
[Holy Law]
A spell that blocks all ranged attacks. However, in an instant, it is forced beyond the limit of his defenses, and the magic irradiation is more like a piercing blow to a massive mass than a ranged attack.
“Stallion, hold on!”
-Phew!
Leon is finally pushed into the sky by the immense energy.
In the end, Leon is unable to reach Rakshar, and Rakshar is unable to finish him off with the blow he just delivered.
Even in that moment, the two beings continue to pressurize each other.
[Chaotic Curse] hits Leon Dragonia Lionheart, the Lionheart King]
◆Effect
: Weakness, Chaos, Eeriness, Confusion, Tetanus, Screaming, Horror, Confusion, Despair, Physical Decay, Mind Pollution, Soul Erosion────
It was a powerful curse that can kill a normal human instantly and drive a Hunter insane but the Grail Guardian’s has protection against it.
[Grail Guardian] resists the curse]]
◆Effect
Vitality, Order, Fear Immunity, Confusion Immunity, Wound Regeneration, Valor, Perfect Body, Pollution Resistance, Great Soul────
Perfect Resistance. No, rather, the power of the blessing that surpasses him strengthens Leon, and even the greatest of demons cannot help but be affected by it in his presence.
[Fear of Evil] weakens Demon Archduke Rakshar]]
◆Effect
Force Fear, Eerie, Decreased Resistance──
[【Demon Archduke Rakshar】 resists this]
[【Greatest Demon Slayer】────]
[【Demon Lord Slayer】────]
[【Demon Archduke Rakshar】────]
There was a flurry of system messages however the two beings were not the direct recipients, but the Hunters who saw them were horrified.
Each one was a Legendary… an Epic Traits, a narrative of power built from experience and self-created legends.
How many battles have they fought, how many limbs have they broken, that they have such Legendary Traits that are constantly activated?
A mere mortal would suffocate at the mere thought of stepping foot in that realm of blessing and curse.
They were powerful beings, weighing down space with their mere existence.
Leon raised his spear.
“I punish evil.”
The holy spear was raised high as the ‘battlefield flame’ began to focus at the tip.
The flames that envelop Rakshar surge like a tornado, then ignite into a pillar of fire. At the end of it all is Leon’s lance.
-What?
-What, what, that?
The flames were concentrating on the tip of the spear as a terrible heat was gathering at the tip of the spear, foreshadowing doom.
Warriors of Petos, the god of war and flame, have powers.
One of those powers is immunity to flame and control over it.
Among them is War’s favorite, War Knight Leon Dragonia Lionheart, who can control even the fire used by others.
“This is the fire that burned the Lord of Chaos to death. His screams as he burned in these flames for thirty days still echo sweetly in my memory.”
Instinctively recognizing the grotesqueness of it all, Rakshar gulped down a mouthful of seawater and spat it out at Leon.
The thousands of meters of water shot from the behemoth was enough to cut through the city. But it did nothing to extinguish the flames Leon had ignited.
As Rakshar concentrated his power in order to use the attack he used earlier.
-Giruuuuuuuuuu!!!
A giant being moved the waters and a raspy cry drew Rakshar’s attention.
A huge presence that even Rakshar could not ignore surrounded him, clawing at him.
This was the last bastion of the Kikiruks that Yappy had found, they were ancient guardians.
[There were still living ones!]
They were the last of the Kikiruks to be slain when Rakshar destroyed this world.
The giant Kikiruks charged at Rakshar.
-kraaaaaaaaaaa──!
The beast roars even while being held back by the three giant Kikiruks and shoots out a black light of doom.
At the same time the beast is engulfed in roaring flames.
[Divine Punishment]
A black mass and a red meteor accelerate toward each other. It took less than 0.2 seconds before they collided.
──────!!!!
The terrible collision destroys the space between them as clouds parted and seawater evaporated.
Leon shouted.
“To the Lionheart…! Glory be!”
The flames from the Spear of Flame pierce through the black magic.
[Divine Punishment]
A flame so powerful that it finally breaks through the black magic and flashes a divine light towards the Demon Archduke.
[Lionheart…!]
At that moment, the pillar of fire that evaporated the entire ocean rose into the sky.
“What, what, is that…….?”
“Is that the power of man…….?”
Many people were left speechless as they watched the pillar of fire burn through the clouds.
No one could believe it was human power except for a few guild members of the Ten Thousand Gods Guild: Soo-ho, Ha-ri, Jae-hyuk… and the members of the Firebird Guild, who remembered the divine punishment of the majestic Georgic.
They knew that the pillar of fire was a miracle wrought by human hands.
Miracles in human form, embodiments of a gift to be honored.
“Holy Knights.”
The culmination of those great beings is the rider of that heavenly horse.
All were silent, gazing in adoration and reverence as the pillar of fire poured forth a prelude to destruction.

chapters.title: Chapter 83: Demon Archduke Rakshar (4)
chapters.content:
Chapter 83: Demon Archduke Rakshar (4)
In the middle of the ocean, a pillar of fire rises.
It is a great flame that will surely burn anything.
Its energy is absolute, like the compressed explosive power of a nuclear weapon. Not even a Demon Archduke could survive that pillar of fire.
-Observation. Logic circuit error. Impossible.
At Leon’s denial, Yappy tried again to observe, and saw a creature moving within the steaming pillar of fire that was evaporating the pouring seawater in real time.
Demon Dink Rakshar was still alive.
Is there anything in this universe that can survive a direct hit of that kind of energy?
“Lord Spinner. What’s the status of the evacuation?”
Leon landed on Yappy, who was overseeing the evacuation. Leon and Stallion don’t say much, but their exhaustion is palpable.
-80% progress. Major supplies, records secured.
“A little short.”
-No. They’ll hold on.
Yappy’s gaze turns to Rakshar, trapped in the pillar of fire. Or, more accurately, the three giant guardians surrounding him, pincers raised, keeping a watchful eye on Rakshar.
“Have they made up their minds?”
-Have been sleeping for this moment for 500 years. Analyzing the language system. Prosperity to Kikiruks.
“Is that their name?”
Leon held out his hand to Yappy, grateful for their sacrifice.
“The gates are closing now. Let us retreat.”
Yappy climbs onto Leon’s forearm and boards Stallion, then Stallion flaps its wings and takes to the sky.
As they head for the gate, Rakshar calls out.
[Lionheart…! Fleeing is not a virtue of knights!]
As he burns in real time in a pillar of fire, his eyes remain fixed on Leon as he engages in hand-to-hand combat with the three giant Kikiruks.
Leon sneers.
“I would not honor the code of knighthood against such a lowly creature as you. Green beasts and abominations are not worthy of respect.”
With those words, Leon sprinted toward the disappearing gate.
[Lionheart────!!]
[Gate closed]
* * * *
After the East Sea Gate was cleared, the world was abuzz for a while.
The first Demon Archduke was discovered. It was huge news for humanity, who had suffered terrible losses even against Archdemons until now.
Even S-class Hunters couldn’t stand up to its mind pollution.
Naturally, the world began to place large orders for Mind Defense items, but it was a meaningless waste of money.
The news was not all bad, however.
There were some beings whose minds remained untainted by the Demon Archduke’s terrifying aura.
The first was Han Ha-ri, a priestess of Poma, the god of the sea and waves.
The second was Yakt Spinner, the first Holy Knight of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods.
And finally, there was Leon, who not only resisted, but went toe-to-toe with the Demon Archduke.
-Wow, what the fuck is that?
-Was there ever a demon that big? Can we beat that thing?
-Look at that. Flying around on a pegasus. They were almost evenly matched in hand-to-hand combat.
-What’s with that crazy pillar of fire? Han Ha-ri’s flames in the waves didn’t even make sense, but that thing just pierced the sky.
-The Otherworldly Lion King. Have you seen his Trait, The Greatest Demon Slayer? I mean, there’s no one in all the dimensions who’s slain more demons than that guy.
-Is that a human?
-Demigod.
Yappy’s footage of the Battle of the East Sea Gate was broadcast to the world via the guild YouTube channel.
People don’t despair easily. They somehow find hope in the midst of despair.
Leon was a symbol of that hope, and naturally, people began to learn more about TTG Guild and join.
The Maverick Guild’s S-ranked Hunter Allen and Minuteman, as well as other core A-ranked raiders, took it upon themselves to proselytize for the TTG Guild.
And.
“Uh, well, then… I hereby declare the district of Mokpo Special Autonomous Region of the Kikiruks as of today.”
-Giggle!
President Ahn Dong-gil smiled awkwardly and shook hands with the giant clawed creature.
The second issue was the mass migration of the Kikiruks. The relocation of the world’s largest group of 10,000 survivors required a huge administrative process and political decision that required the president himself.
“Thank you, President Ahn.”
“Ah…, no problem, Your Majesty.”
Ahn Dong-gil put on his best business smile and shook Leon’s hand.
In just a few short months, Leon had grown into a tycoon that even the president could not easily ignore, and he had brought with him an unprecedentedly large group of migrants: ten thousand survivors.
President Ahn and the political establishment could not refuse Leon’s request to give them land to live on.
There was some opposition from the citizens of Mokpo, but their territory didn’t overlap with the human population, and as the head of the South Korean government, they couldn’t ignore the only power they had against the Demon Archduke.
“That, Your Majesty… what is that?”
President Ahn stared in disbelief at the giant statue of a turtle in the middle of the sea, along with the giant statue of a Kikiruk.
Were they territorial markers for the survivors?
“It honors a great hero who sacrificed himself against the Demon Archduke. In the center is a statue of Poma, the god of the sea and waves.”
Ooh, idolatry… No, it’s not even an idol. They were real gods, and they really did bestow grace and favor.
President Ahn Dong-gil, a Protestant, had a bitter look on his face.
“I don’t think that’s the only statue.”
“Ah~ There’s one of this king and one of Lord Spinner. Lord Spinner is the actual representative of the Kikiruks.”
