On land, you’d spend money to clean it up, but in the middle of the ocean, the accessibility and scope of the problem is different.
“We’ve got a lot of work ahead of us.”
While the Japanese hunters and government officials were in a terrible mood, the leader of the Divine Sword Guild, Chun Jin-soo, was as nonchalant as ever.
“You think it’s someone else’s country?”
Takeda didn’t like that, and gave him a sharp glare.
“Of course it’s someone else’s country. It’s not like we’re f*cked.”
“You…!”
“No, I’m not, you wide-eyed little brat, I’m a few years older than you are!”
Chun Jin-soo doesn’t let go of his goofy spirit even in this situation. In fact, he felt no remorse for Japan’s catastrophe.
He was a patriot, but at the same time, he lived half of his life in a time when Japan and Korea had not established diplomatic relations, and he had been on the ground in a more direct way.
Above all, he was a person who was deeply disappointed by Japan’s behavior in the Ulsan tragedy.
He was the only one who participated in Japan’s attack on the Demon Sword not to help our hated neighbors, but to deal with his biological son and the host of the Demon Sword.
“That’s enough. What are you doing to the young?”
Unlike Chun Jin-soo, who was quite outspoken, Kang Jin-sung of the Blue Star Guild was not amused. He’s one of the legends of his generation, and his bitterness makes Chun Jin-soo sit up and take notice.
Kang Jin-sung turned to the former.
“It seems that the enemy is still in the process of creating a dungeon break in the sea. What is the scale of it so far?”
“Ah, yes, there have been three dungeon breaks so far, and there are about twenty thousand monsters that came out of them!”
“That’s a lot.”
Dungeon Breaks are usually caused by a failed strategy.
In other words, the number of monsters inside the gate had been reduced by quite a bit during the process.
However, the dungeon break caused by the Wandering Demon Sword occurred while the gate was still intact, without the raiding party having a chance to enter, so naturally, the scale of the break is not comparable to the previous one.
“Where did the Wandering Demon Sword go?”
“It…disappeared into the sea right after the gate was summoned.”
“……It’s been hiding its submergence ability all this time.”
All of the information and prerequisites for the Wandering Demon Sword so far had been overturned.
Summoning a gate and diving into the sea.
“Diving is one thing. What is summoning a gate, and is a gate something that can be artificially summoned?”
“Let me explain that part.”
It was Beatrice who spoke up, the cotton-cloaked magician queen deftly maneuvering a laser point and playing a file sent to her by ‘Yappy’ from Korea.
“About four weeks ago, our TTG Guild, along with the Hunters of the United States, attacked the East Sea Gate.”
One of South Korea’s ten guilds, Lee Yong-wan, had participated in it, and the discovery of the Demon Archduke Rakshar had made headlines around the world.
Even Skazakari, the one who caused the Shanghai disaster, was only an Archdemon, but a Demon Archduke?
That overturns the information that the highest-ranking demons are Archdemons.
Of course, since he didn’t cause a dungeon break and appear in the real world, it wasn’t a big deal, but government agencies took it seriously enough.
If there was a Demon Archduke on top of the Archdemons, there could be more.
“From there, we became suspicious of the ‘gate’ and the ‘system’ and the ‘quests’ it gave us, and we came to a conclusion.”
“What… is that?”
Hunters from both Japan and Korea dreaded TTG Guild answer, questioning what they had taken for granted.
Of course, many scholars had suspected and theorized about the gate or system, but it was all speculation.
But this guild of survivors had come to a conclusion, and it could be expected that it would not be information that was desirable to humanity.
“The conclusion was that the gates…were an artificially created phenomenon.”
“No way!”
It was such a shocking declaration that everyone was in denial. But Beatrice presented the video footage from Yappy as evidence.
Beatrice had created a gate using a large amount of magic stones, and from there, she could see the “field” inside the gate that Yappy had observed.
“Crazy…….”
“She can artificially summon a gate?”
“That would break the whole idea of gate attacking…….”
If it is indeed possible to artificially summon gates, then all you have to do is summon a series of gates in the middle of the ocean, just like the Wandering Demon Sword is doing now.
Humanity would lose its oceans and be doomed.
In the midst of the commotion, everyone with their own ideas, Leon spoke up.
“Be quiet.”
Leon is, technically, only the most marginalized newcomer here.
He’s not even officially qualified as an S-class Hunter, and even though his guild is large, most of the members are C-class Hunters.
There are countless S-class Hunters here, as well as leaders of large guilds.
Still, Leon’s words quieted the room.
“It’s clear we can handle the Gate phenomenon and once we’re realized that, it’s clear what we must do.”
Deal with the Demon Sword before it creates more Gates. The solution is always simple and clear.
“Prepare for a defensive battle. Prepare for their landing and locate the sword.”
“Arbitrary orders──”
Takeda started to say, but Chairman Kamiya cut him off with a wave of his hand. Even in this situation, he made a quick profit and loss calculation.
“The Wandering Demon Sword is strong, and the monsters that are about to land are probably just trying to attract attention.”
Chairman Kamiya looked at the Hunters from both Japan and Korea.
“We’ll form a separate squadron to maneuver as soon as the Wandering Demon Sword appears, with only the most elite Hunters to attack it.”
Kamiya’s plan was as follows
Depending on the landing route of the monsters, the main S-class strike force will be divided into three groups and loaded onto transport planes.
The plan is to drop the S-class raiders directly into the area where they appear and respond immediately.
It’s a tactic that’s only possible because of the availability of aircraft.
“That’s good, we’ll be able to join them quickly.”
Yong-wan thought the plan was perfectly reasonable. The only problem was… how would the teams be formed?
In any case, Chairman Kamiya’s plan went through.
* * * *
The first monsters to land were an army of monsters called Mermen.
Led by Class A Fieldboss Seiren, thousands of Mermen, with their hideous appearance and sharp tridents, descended on Miyazaki Prefecture, southeast of Kyushu, Japan.
“Gunners stand by.”
And before them stood a group of hunters.
Unlike inside the gate, where high-tech equipment could not be mobilized, hundreds of hunters, whose routes had been mapped out by satellites and reconnaissance aircraft, were waiting for the monsters to land.
-Sii-yin…!
The Merman’s gills flapped menacingly as they saw the Hunters. They charged straight for the Hunters, and the orderly Hunters opened fire in unison.
“Fire!”
A barrage of ranged fire pummeled the Mermen, and with that, a hand-to-hand combat erupted, swords and spears clashing.
-Bang, bang, bang…!
And in the midst of this landing defense battle a large helicopter carrying Hunters circles the area.
“…….”
Even Chen Jin-soo, who usually opens his mouth, Golden Chul, who is full of confidence, Lee Yong-wan, who is busy calculating the profit and loss, and Ha Yuri, who is watching from the sidelines, did not let go of the tension for this moment.
The Korean-Japanese Hunter Alliance was spread out towards the predicted landing site of the monster that had burst out of the Dragon Palace Gate.
Basically, the landing force would be blocked by the Hunters on the ground, and the helicopters would be used to mobilize when the Wandering Demon Sword appeared. The idea is to create a star squadron to deal with the sword.
In other words, the S-class Hunters aboard the helicopter are the ones who will fight the black-rank Wandering Demon Sword.
At this moment, with the world’s most dangerous battle ahead, everyone is nervous.
‘Damn, why isn’t the Lionheart King here?’
Yong-wan was disappointed that Leon wasn’t among the three forces that split into Miyazaki, Shikoku, and Wakayama.
TTG Guild is waiting in Wakayama with Park Yong-shin of Hanbit Palace. They’re scheduled to join him in the event of an emergency, but he can’t help but think he’d be safer with them.
“What about the other side?”
Yong-wan asks and Ha Yuri checks her tactical pad.
“Japanese Hunters are fighting monsters that landed in Wakayama. The TTG Guild is in the rear.”
“That’s surprising.”
Huang Yeon-ha, who had seen the TTG Guild act, said.
“What, My Sister?”
Golden Chul interrupted.
“I thought His Majesty the Lionheart King would say that he would fight first, out of chivalry and honor.”
“Certainly. He’s the kind of guy who talks like that.”
Leon is the embodiment of chivalry straight out of a medieval history book.
Of course, that chivalry is vastly different from the chivalry of modern Earth, but it’s not so different that he’s obsessed with winning and earning honors.
“I don’t think so. He’s surprisingly not the type to make the first move.”
“Senior Yong-wan, what does that mean?”
Yong-wan shrugged, but he was the one who had fought with Leon the most.
“It’s basically a commander’s style, whether it’s refraining from taking the lead or getting enough information…….”
Yong-wan has watched Leon fight and capture gates a few times.
He saw how he acted in the Jeju Island gate and during the Cheongju Gate.
Even in the battle against the Yakt Spinner at Cheongju Gate, where Golden Chul fought, this incarnation of chivalry was not one to take the lead.
“He may be active in the decisive parts of battles, but he leaves the basic outposts to his subordinates, which is probably why his guild is so strangely ‘militarized’.”
“Definitely…more of an army than a traditional raiding style.”
This contradicts the misconception that Leon is known for his knightly style of ‘charging in’ at random.
Leon knows he’s a king, and as such, he’s cautious in his actions. He knows all too well that he is irreplaceable.
Still, the image of Leon as a vanguard, smashing everything in his path, is a result of the impact of his combat prowess.
“Enough of that, get ready to fight, we’re closing in.”
That’s when Chun Jin-soo, who was sharpening his blade alongside Kang Jin-sung, pointed to the ground beyond the helicopter’s window.
The field bosses at the gate could be seen slowly emerging.
“I can see quite a few large Class A field bosses, we’ll have to deal with them──”
Before Yong-Wan could finish his sentence, the sky lit up.
No, more than the sky, higher, beyond the stratosphere.
Somewhere in space, a light flashed and shot down vertically.
A charged particle with no mass penetrates the crown of the field boss’s head. It was a pinpoint snipe, with an error of less than 0.01 millimeters.
The heated, sub-luminescent particles hit the seawater, causing it to boil instantly, with secondary damage.
-Eek, eek, eek, eek?!
A whole bunch of mermen were instantly turned into boiled meat.
“…….”
“……What is it?”
Ha Yuri nonchalantly replied to the stupid Golden Chul question.
“Don’t ask me…….”

chapters.title: Chapter 113: Disaster
chapters.content:
Chapter 113:
Disaster
After the Cataclysm, humanity felt the need to proactively attack the Gates in order to prevent them from dungeon-breaking.
To do so, they first needed technology to identify the gates as soon as they occurred, and the technology they used was space technology.
Orbital weapons represented by the Staff of God were commercialized, and reconnaissance satellites with powerful navigation capabilities covered the Earth’s orbit to search for gates around the clock.
Starfield, the Great Gate Reconnaissance Satellite, is the largest space structure on Earth, a collaboration of space development nations around the world.
Built by 20 countries around the world, including the United States, this next-generation reconnaissance satellite is the largest space structure on Earth at 150 meters and a space platform with 27 satellites covering the entire globe.
It observes and delivers information from space and Earth in real time.
Its technological capabilities are the sum total of human wisdom. No space technology can surpass it, and if it does, it will never belong to Earth’s civilization.
“This is Star One. This is Star One, base, come in!”
And so it was in the main communications room of the Starfield. U.S. astronaut Johnson frantically tried to communicate with Mission Control in Houston.
[What’s going on, Johnson?]
The U.S. space agency has been on edge lately.
The agency has been heavily criticized for the hacking of the God’s Staff during the Jilin orc coup and the recent failure to predict the impact of a 6-kilometer comet on Earth.
But it would also be embarrassing for the space agency.
Who would have thought that the ironclad, invulnerable network of God’s staff would be hacked at the same time as Russia’s 5M65 Grizzly?
And who knew that a perfectly good comet would suddenly enter Earth’s orbit and crash into South Korea, nearly wiping out the human race.
Anyway, the event happened, and the organization was tense. Astronaut Johnson spent an unusually intense day on the observation mission and spotted “it”.
“Please confirm that there are no other satellites within three kilometers of this one!”
[Three kilometers? There can’t be a satellite that close.]
After a moment of silence, the ground station returned a common sense answer.
[There are no other satellites in that vicinity.]
“No, there are! What is that thing I’m seeing?”
[What the hell is it?]
“At least 400 meters long…! At least 2,000 tons of mass! I also see a structure that looks like a particle accelerator. Could it be…a charged particle cannon?”
[Ha… it’s not April Fool’s Day yet, Johnson.]
“No, it’s real!”
It’s not even visible on radar but at close range, it was visible to the naked eye. The plasma particles even sped up and shot something toward Earth.
Johnson wouldn’t have noticed it if it weren’t for the glow from the blue particle’s sub-luminescence.
“Shit! I’m going to take a picture and send it to you, so you can see for yourself!”
But Johnson didn’t know that someone was already listening to his communications with the U.S. base in Houston, and they had the means to disrupt them.
“What, what, why isn’t the data coming through?”
[Johnson…pull this shit one more time and I’ll report you to the higher-ups, you know the atmosphere around here with the comet.]
“Gee, I’m serious!”
Johnson was jumping up and down like a madman, but no one believed him.
* * * * *
-Information control complete.
The TTG Guild compound in Naju, South Korea.
Yappy had prevented the information from the satellites that had been hastily launched for this operation from spreading.
Earth’s military satellites are of a very low standard.
The destructive power of the weapons themselves is forgivable, but maximizing their power is something anyone can do if they’re just plugged in.
They had no reconnaissance or communications security capabilities that mattered.
Yappy had launched his own satellites to give Leon more accurate information. It’s not a small low-orbit satellite from the last gate, but a full-fledged offensive military satellite.
Technically, it will be developed into a war satellite that launches an integrated armed platform from geostationary orbit rather than a satellite, but…….
-Lack of space law. Constraints on development. Information control needs to be strengthened.
This barbaric planet doesn’t even have laws for space development, so they had to operate under the radar.
Aside from that, Yappy confirmed the previous bombardment at the risk of exposing the information.
-Sniped 13 Class A Field Bosses. Confirmed 1,322 targets eliminated due to AoE damage on the main battlefield.
That’s a lot of kills and the logic circuitry that powers the AI has spoken.
-The charged particle cannon particle accelerator needs to be cooled and further refined.
-Failed to track enemy special object ‘Wandering Demon Sword’. Blind spots due to planetary rotation.
-Need to go to a geostationary orbit above 36,500 kilometers.
-Rejected. Charged Particle Cannon effective range 450 kilometers. Cannot support friendly forces.
-Recommended to replace the main armament with the Holy Grail. Can be equipped with doomsday armor.
-Rejected. City damage.
Leon will not tolerate blowing up a city to kill a monster.
-Start working on the rocket launcher.
There’s only so much Yappy can do in this situation.
Yappy looked down at the pure white starlight armor he was still tapping with his mechanical arm.
-Make deadlines. Deadline.
Yappy continued to work, moving his mechanical arms busily while simultaneously processing and checking information.
-North Korea unobservable?
Something black was covering the northern part of the Korean Peninsula.
* * * *
“The monsters that tried to enter Tokushima City have all been dealt with. What about you?”
Takeda asked, as the other Hunters reported through his earpiece.
[Minamijo’s horde of merman has been dealt with]
[Anansi’s side is also cleared]
The landing of tens of thousands of monsters from the Dungeon Break was certainly a threat.
However, in this area alone, there were seven S-class Hunters and two hundred A-class Hunters from Japan, including Takeda. In addition, there were more than three thousand other Hunters from various branches.
A few A-class Field Bosses have shown up, but they’re just warm-ups for the S-class Hunters.
Takeda looked around at the piles of Merman corpses around him.
“What about the Koreans?”
They couldn’t have done it any faster than they did. Takeda, who doesn’t admit it, but has a competitive streak against Korean Hunters, checked the status of the Korean side.
[The battle was said to have ended thirty minutes ago. Both Miyazaki and Wakayama successfully prevented the landing.]
“……Thirty minutes ago?”
It was fast. Strangely fast.
The South Korean S-class hunters were fewer than their Japanese counterparts.
Excluding the hunters from the Tokyo area and the Hokkaido chapter, there were only thirteen mobilized S-class hunters. Six of them are on the Korean side.
But they’re not the main force. Even the same S-class, there’s a big difference, and the six S-class hunters on this side, where Takeda is, are the strongest in Japan.
But they were able to take out the landed monsters faster than Takeda’s team?
‘Were there fewer monsters that landed?’
No. Even if there were, could it make such a difference? Takeda asked the control center.
“What about the Lionheart King? Did he go out on his own?”
[He is on standby]
“……And the Queen?”
[Likewise on standby, but… there was a strange ‘shelling’ in the sky…….]
‘It must be the queen.’
He’s not a mage himself but he heard that the magician queen of the Spero Kingdom is fearsome.
Takeda, who knew what the firepower of mages could do on the battlefield, naturally assumed that it was Beatrice who took care of the landed monsters.
[Takeda.]
It was then. Chairman Kamiya, who oversaw the All Japan Association, the heart of the control center, sent Takeda a personal communication.
“Yes, Mr. Chairman.”
[Team 4 hasn’t sent a response since earlier, so let’s check before the monsters make their second landing.]
“Is it possible that the Demon Sword has appeared?”
[No Magical Swordsman were spotted, only Land Sharks, which are boss-level entities.]
A class A field boss rated above the Orc Warrior in terms of difficulty, but Team 4 has the S-class Hunter Nishimori, so there’s no way they would have been defeated.
‘Device malfunction.’
It’s a common occurrence in the field.
The four-team perimeter is about a 10-minute drive from where Takeda is and as an S-class Hunter, Takeda could get there in two minutes.
“Ishida, Fumio, you two follow me, and give your team leaders a heads-up just in case.”
“Understood.”
Takeda, the right-hand man of Kamiya, the president of the All Japan Association, was seasoned and cautious. The five remaining S-class Hunters would move quickly on orders from the control center.
Takeda arrived in the area with the two A-class Hunters… and doubted his own eyes.
“Damn it…….”
Even the cool-headed Takeda reacted this way, and the two Hunters who followed him recoiled in horror.
“No way…….”
“Nishimori-san was killed?”
It was true. All twenty hunters from the four teams that had lost contact were found dead.
Some had been decapitated, others cut diagonally from the shoulder blades. Some were missing their lower half or had been sliced open from the crown of their heads.
“Whoa…….”
Takeda swallowed hard. The four teams of Hunters were the elite of the elite that he had raised himself. Especially the S-class Hunter Nishimori, who was the best swordsman in the Alliance…….
Looking down at the mangled corpses of his fellow Hunters, Takeda honors them with a short moment of silence. Then he analyzes them coldly.
‘Strong and destructive swordsmanship.’
There is a school of swordsmanship called Yufa but it has been sharply divided since the advent of the Hunters.
‘Destructive and fierce swordsmanship. The swordsmanship of the Berserker Chun Jin-soo.’
Chun Jin-soo swordsmanship was famous for being better suited to monsters than humans. Even in hand-to-hand combat, he could shatter defenses with his overwhelming blasts.
He used his superhuman athleticism to leap around, scattering destructive kills.
There’s no way Chun Jin-soo could have attacked the Japanese Hunters, so there’s only one answer.
“Four teams have been wiped out by the Demon Sword.”
Chun Ji-ho, the genius swordsman who was the successor of Chun Jin-soo.
“How the hell did…….?”
“Takeda-san, look this way!”
Fumio urgently called out to Takeda. Where he pointed was the corpse of a huge monster… a land shark, and it was a strange one at that.
“There’s a mark on it that looks like it came out from inside.”
“No way…….”
He was swallowed by a monster to avoid detection and ripped open the monster after landing?
“Damn it. Why is he suddenly acting like this?”
None of the six generations of Demon Swordsmen had ever done anything like this, and the previous generation of Demon Swordsmen had been wiped out in less than two years… Is this kind of strategic activity possible in the fourth year?
“Why now?
The unanswered question was buried with the next message.
[Team 2 is unreachable!]
* * * *
“Demon Sword!”
Yong-wan and his crew, who were preparing for the second landing, blinked at the urgent communication.
“Demon Sword? We couldn’t confirm it with the satellite reconnaissance!”
“That, that… there are reports that it seems to have protruded from a monster’s stomach!”
“Why is he doing something he’s never done before?”
The summoning of the gate and the behavior of the demon sword and the demon swordsman were completely different from before. But apart from that, the S-class Hunters, who were acting as a separate unit, had to leave immediately.
“Where did they come from, Shikoku or Wakayama?”
“Shikoku! We’ve already lost three S-class Hunters from the Japanese side alone! Hunter Takeda is rallying all the teams!”
“Three have already been defeated?”
Lee Yong-wan hesitated for a moment, but Chun Jin-soo shouted out in anger.
“Let’s go!”
The Osprey took flight and as the transport, purchased for 15 billion yen each, carried them over the island of Shikoku, where the Takeda team was, Yong-wan asked.
“Id His Majesty the Lionheart King coming?”
The idea of finding Leon there on the other side of the world caused Chun Jin-soo and Kang Jin-sung to glare at him, but Ha Yuri, Golden Chul, and Huang Yeon-ha gave him a look of understanding.
“Uh… that.”
“What, what, he couldn’t have been hit!”
“He landed briefly due to a mechanical anomaly, and was shot down by a ranged attack from monsters on takeoff…….”
“Holy shit!”
He didn’t say that out of concern for Leon, because he was pretty sure that thing would survive a fall from space.
The problem was that it would delay Leon’s arrival.
“Well, can we just not go?”
“What the fuck are you talking about?”
Chun Jin-soo glared and slapped him, but Yong-wan was uneasy.
He was the embodiment of self-preservation and a well-connected businessman.
His senses were warning him of danger but he was more afraid of Chun Jin-soo in front of him. After all, the plane had already departed.
“Landing!”
The tilt-rotor plane’s rotor blades rose vertically as it approached over Shikoku Island. With no open space to land, the South Korean S-class Hunters had to jump from 50 meters in the air.
“Hutcha…!”
Chun Jin-soo and Kang Jin-sung landed, along with 50 other elite Korean A-classes and Takeda greeted them.
“Thank you for coming.”
Takeda was pleased with the arrival of the Korean Hunters; he’d lost contact with the second team and gathered them all in one place at the same time.
“Weren’t we supposed to stall for time and secure a position against the Demon Swordsman?”
Chun Jin-soo scolded Takeda for not playing the delaying game as originally planned. However, he had no choice.
“He’s stronger than I imagined. If we’d gotten caught separately, we’d have been destroyed individually. In fact, we’ve already lost three teams.”
“Three S-class Hunters…That’s a heavy loss.”
Takeda nodded at Yong-wan’s words. Although Japan had thirty-eight S-class Hunters, its land mass was four times the size of South Korea.
The loss of an S-class Hunter would be devastating. No wonder they had to rally their forces so quickly.
“Anyway, with five here and four in Korea, we have nine S-class Hunters left. That should be enough for us.”
“Why don’t you count me?”
“You’re an S-class.”
“C’mon…you’re behind.”
The S-class Hunters are not the only ones in the room. There were over a hundred A-class Hunters moving in teams. Even if it was the demon sword, it would be foolish to charge here──
“……!”
“……?!”
Lee Yong-wan was started, the hairs on his body stood on end, a chill ran up his spine, and his heart pounded.
Yong-wan had experienced something similar twice before.
The first time was when he encountered Georgic’s punishment, and the second time was when the Demon Archduke Rakshar appeared…….
“No way…….”
Ha Yuri, Golden Chul, Hwang Yeon-ha, Kang Jin-sung, Chun Jin-soo… and the rest of the Japanese powerhouses were stopped in succession.
Even the S-class Hunters, trembled as they felt an invisible presence.
“Ma…….”
A presence from across the street was staring at the dozens of S-class Hunters and over a hundred A-class Hunters, it was the Demon Swordsman.
Yong-wan’s complexion turned pale as beyond his gaze, there was a demon clutching a sword.
The blood-soaked Demon Swordsman opened his heavy mouth at them.
“Brutal slaughter…merciless destruction… …….”
Obtain.
Blood, skulls… stand at the pinnacle of destruction.
“I am the Carnage Archduke Akasha. I am the destruction of all life.”
[Carnage Archduke dominates the space.]

chapters.title: Chapter 114: Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter (1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 114: Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter (1)
Golden Chul felt a strong sense of discomfort at the sight of the demon swordsman before him.
‘Is there… someone with this kind of presence?’
Just by being there, he exuded a powerful presence.
Even though he couldn’t be seen or heard, everyone instinctively realized his presence.
He had faced countless S-class monsters.
The Red Gate he had cleared so far, or the Yakt Spinner, Cheongju nightmare but even they were merely inorganic ‘enemies’, not worthy of such a dangerous intuition.
‘Lionheart.’
For the first time in his life, he felt that the demon swordsman in front of him was untouchable──
-Pow!
At that moment, the Japanese Hunters leaped forward in unison and at the same time, the Demon Swordsman was crushed by something. It was a torn Demon Tower Sealing Scroll.
“It’s a 100 million yen item that crushes through space! When he can’t move, surround him!”
At Takeda’s command, a thick shield centered on the tanks blocks the escape route and aims their weapons. In a matter of moments, they had the Demon Swordsman surrounded.
The swords and spears of over a hundred Class A Hunters pointed at Demon Swordsman Chun Ji-so…no, Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter.
“I can’t believe that any demon swordsman could face this many Hunters.”
“Don’t worry, no mage swordsman in history has been able to defeat so many hunters.”
He was the sixth-generation demon swordsman. In other words, the previous five Demon Swordsmen had been defeated.
“Now, wait….”
At that moment, Yong-wan felt a very serious case of déjà vu. It was the same for Ha Yuri, and when he was about to say something──a creepy feeling came over them.
“Dodge──!!”
Thirty super-fast stabs rained down in an instant and “thirty” hunters were pierced.
Most of them were beyond the reach of the sword, but a scattering of crackling energy pierced through the Hunters as if space were no barrier.
The only ones who survived were the few who retreated backwards with all their might, acting on instinct.
“Slash…!”
Takeda calmly drew his sword at this moment but Akasha’s sword was faster than him.
-Kwah!
In a moment that can only be described as a flash, the blade that blocked the magic sword broke into pieces while Takeda’s armor shattered and bounced back.
“What?!”
It was a Legendary class armor, but the demon sword crushed Takeda’s sword along with it, trying to cut through his torso.
“Damn it…!”
The Japanese S-class Hunter instantly threw himself down and stabbed Akasha but the attack was blocked by a sword.
“Boom…!”
Takeda managed to avoid being sliced in half, but he didn’t expect him to defend so perfectly. He tried to close the distance for now, but the slashing sword didn’t miss him.
-Bam…!
He blocked but the blow bent his sword and Akasha added more power.
-… Zip!
The sword splintered and the figure was cut in half from the crown of his head.
“Hmph…!”
Golden Chul swung his huge two-handed hammer and a devastating blow, capable of demolishing a building in a single blow, struck him in the buttocks but,
‘He blocked it with his hands?!’
Akasha caught Golden Iron’s hammer with his palm and even with his strength, he couldn’t break free of his grip on the hammer.
“Hold it!”
Looking for an opening, Yong-wan fired three enchanted arrows at Akasha but the demon swordsman swung his sword, however at that moment, something happened.
Skill <Multiple Arrows>
The three arrows split into 30 arrows. This is not a fake or an alter ego. It’s an inescapable shot, multiplied tenfold.
-Pabat!
The greatsword as tall as a man moved swiftly, a movement that even Yong Wan, an S-class Hunter and Archer with a good eye, couldn’t keep up with.
The next moment, a stab of lightning speed that cut down thirty Hunters is in front of him.
-Boom!
The stab was blocked by a sword that reflected a shaped light. Kang Jin-sung grabbed Yong-wan and blocked the blow, but he couldn’t stop the destructive power of the sword’s thrust and was knocked back.
“Thank you, old man.”
“……strong.”
Kang Jin-sung’s right arm, which had blocked the demon sword, trembled.
“Strange…I fought a demon sword in Ulsan…but it wasn’t this strong.”
During Chun Ji-so awakening as a demon swordsman, Kang Jin-sung had fought alongside Lee Yong-wan in the Ulsan tragedy.
“He’s much faster than he was then… and he’s grown stronger.”
“Grown?”
Were demon swordsmen also growing beings? But even so, this was…….
“Is Takeda-kun okay?”
The Japanese hunters answered Kang Jin-sung’s question.
“His injuries are…severe. The healers are working on him, but he’s… strangely unable to recover!”
“……Yong-wan-kun, what does the system window say?”
Kang Jin-sung, who was too busy watching out for the Demon Swordsman to pay attention to the system window, asked instead.
“Slaughter…Declaration.”
[Slaughter Declaration]
[Effect:
-Applies to all creatures.
-Physical Resistance decreases by 90%.
-All biological defenses are reduced by 90%.
-Vitality is rapidly reduced.
-Wounds do not heal.]
It was a terrible debuff that couldn’t be offset even with the best Commander-type Hunter in the world.
‘That’s not all.’
There were also Slaughter Archduke Akasha’s aura, Despairing Presence, and countless other debuff auras.
One is legendary, but there are many. Even S-class Hunters, who normally carry buffs, can lose more than 50% of their power.
‘The Slaughter Archduke…He’s on par with Rakshar!’
How could humanity possibly win against such monsters?
“It doesn’t matter, we’ll just have to kill them.”
It was then that Chun Jin-soo stepped forward, with his greatsword slung over his shoulder.
“Seeing as how you’re so strong, you must be doing well.”
Chun Jin-soo spoke to the Demon Archduke in a low tone but Akasha twisted the corners of her mouth.
“The host’s…flesh and blood, I see.”
“I’ve never had a son like you.”
“Hmph…old man. Where is your ‘granddaughter’?”
“…….”
By granddaughter she meant Chun So-yeon.
Even Chun Jin-soo could not help but pause at Akasha’s question about his granddaughter.
“You will die by my hand today.”
Chun Jin-soo points his sword, and Kang Jin-sung steps forward as the swords of the two old swordsmen crossed.
Korea’s strongest hunters rushed toward the demon swordsman.
* * * * *
[The demon swordsman is on the loose!]
Chun So-yeon, who had been dealing with the remaining monsters on the Wakayama coastline, heard the news through the public channel and immediately moved.
“Uh, uh, Chun So-yeon, where are you going!”
Jae-hyuk called out in a muffled voice, but the dark-haired girl didn’t pay him any mind as she ran, heading for the Hanbit Palace, which was just preparing to take off from the helicopter dock.
“Guild Leader Park Yong-shin!”
“Miss Chun So-yeon?”
Park Yong-shin had just boarded the ‘self-made helicopter’ that had been mobilized for this operation. The transport helicopter, which was quite large for civilian use, was filled with the elite hunters of the Hanbit Palace.
“Please… take me with you.”
“Hmph, where do you think I’m going?”
Knowing everything… Park Yong-shin twisted his mouth in a sneer.
“The demon sword. You want to obtain…merit… by defeating it, right?”
“Hoo-hoo, of course.”
Park Yong-shin and the believers behind him had the same determination… no, ‘faith’.
Even though he was impressed by the TTG Guild, Leon treated Park Yong-shin and his group as something in between believers and heretics.
Sin is sin, even if it is unwitting idolatry so Leon ordered ten years of service for the Hanbit Palace Master and his men, and they willingly complied.
“We all felt it, the light of salvation enveloping us as the seeds of evil disappeared.”
On the way to Shikoku Island with Chun So-yeon in tow, Park’s lips twitched into a smile of ecstasy.
“The gods of the pantheon watch over us directly, and grant us favor. They have even set up their representatives on earth. What clearer salvation could there be?”
Chun So-yeon was silent. She had no choice but to believe in the existence of a god. Even if it was an “evil god,” it was still a god that was actually favoring her.
But they went further than that.
“We must obtain merit. We have to beg for forgiveness. Oh, and of course, it’s not like we’re asking the gods, you can’t trade with the divine… we’ve learned that the hard way.”
In other words, they would risk martyrdom for an uncertain salvation. Perhaps their fanaticism hadn’t changed, just the object.
“Well, there may never be a moment when we can come into play.”
“What do you mean?”
“Because the two elders have already pointed their swords at it.”
“…….”
Light Swordsman Chun Jin-soo and Infinite Sword Kang Jin-sung were two of the three strongest hunters in Korea.
Even the strongest demon swordsman might not be able to defeat them. In fact, during the Ulsan disaster, they repelled a demonic swordsman.
-Boom!
-Bang! Boom!
A loud shockwave shook the helicopter as outside the helicopter’s window, thousands of swords covered the sky.
“Infinite Sword <Demonic Sword>?!”
It was a storm that threatened to tear the world apart in the shape of a sword.
“Mad Sword… <The Ten Million Blades>.”
A unique skill that makes the two strongest swordsmen in Korea the strongest. The Infinite Sword, who manipulates countless deep swords and weaves them into the ultimate one, and the Berserker, who captures a storm in a single sword.
The deadly swords are all over Shikoku. But──
[The Sword of Akasha the Slaughterer is summoned]
A blood-colored sword is summoned from the sky. It was so enormous, it seemed like a force to be reckoned with.
“Oh, gods…….”
As Park Yong-shin spoke, Akasha’s sword fell.
It was doom.
[【Ventasis’ Magic Sword】 intervenes with darkness against Akasha’s sword]
[【Arianna’s Holy Sword】 dispels the evil with light]
* * * * *
It was a while later when Yong-wan finally recovered his vision from the pitch blackness.
“Oh…….”
All he could remember was that Akasha and the Infinite Sword had brought out their strongest moves, and the aftermath swept through the surroundings.
“Yuri-chan… Yuri-chan, are you okay?”
“Off… Don’t shake.”
Even S-class Hunters were caught up in the destructive clash but what about the two people at the center of it?
“Ah…….”
In the center of their still blurry vision, there was a result.
“Kuluk…!”
Kang Jin-sung spat out blood along with his broken sword, and Chun Jin-soo struggled while being held by the nape of his neck.
The two strongest hunters in Korea had been defeated.
The Wandering Demon Sword… Chun Ji-ho… No, the Archduke of Slaughter Akasha let out a voice that sounded like an insect gnawing at her.
“That was a good one. But you’re weak.”
The Demon Archduke’s overwhelming debuffs and their aging body was a fatal combination.
The Demon Archduke’s debuff, a deafening sound that drives people insane with its mere presence, is something no human can withstand. Yong-wan had learned this from the Rakshar he had witnessed at the East Sea Gate.
‘Damn… if only he were here!’
Yong-wan resented that the only person who could stand against it wasn’t here now.
“But it’s strange. It’s less powerful than I thought. Something intervened.”
That’s when a familiar ‘light’ burst through the dense dust.
“Your Majesty Leon?!”
No, in the swordsman’s hand was another sword opposite of the glowing one, ominously dark.
“Let go of him!”
“So-yeon?!”
The light from the holy sword and the magic sword sliced through the arm holding Chun Jin-soo. It was a perfect ambush.
“Hmm?”
Akasha’s movements were somewhat sluggish but it wasn’t just Chun So-yeon who attacked him.
“For Lionheart!”
“”For Lionheart…!””
The Hunters of Hanbit Palace attacked in unison. The sword of S-class Hunter Park Yong-shin and the weapons of the Hunters struck Akasha but at that moment, Akasha parried all of them with her demon sword.
“Oh no!”
She counterattacked in a split second, decapitating two Hunters.
“Damn…!”
Park Yong-shin narrowly avoided the sword that was also swung at him. Realizing that their ambush had failed, the Hunters of Hanbit Palace immediately formed a formation.
“We’re down two, my lord.”
“To counterattack at such short notice…What a monster.”
Still, the rescue of their targets, Chun Jin-soo and Kang Jin-sung, had been successful.
Park Yong-shin looked around.
“Why are you all so slack-jawed, why aren’t you resisting that evil creature?”
“It’s…easy to say…….”
Golden Chul said with difficulty. His resistance had already been drastically reduced by debuffs, and now he was hit by Akasha’s sword.
Even if it was just a shockwave, it was a shockwave from such a huge sword. The entire island was cratered as if it had been hit by a nuclear bomb.
“Ugh…….”
Huang Yeon-ha dragged her shattered body to her feet and leaned against her brother’s side, her weak voice crying out in frustration.
“You guys…why can you move so well…….You’re taking… debuffs.”
The fact that she came so quickly suggests that she was near the moment of impact with Akasha’s sword. A mere swipe would have killed most Hunters instantly, so how could they be so unharmed?
“Hmm… I don’t know? Perhaps it’s because of our faith in the gods?”
[Cultists] partially resist malignant curses]
They are rare talents to be able to believe in something so completely, and to be willing to lay down your life for it.
Others may call them crazy, but to them, it’s a testament to their faithfulness. And…….
“Chun So-yeon──”
Akasha…who controlled the shell of Chun Ji-so, So-yeon’s father, glared at her with an emotionless gaze.
“Divine──power.”
Ventasis, the god of darkness and vengeance, and Arianna, the goddess of light and justice.
Chun So-yeon holds a magic sword and a holy sword blessed by those two gods.
“There is no such thing as losing. I only take the body I should have taken four years ago.”
“…….”
Chun So-yeon glared at Akasha wordlessly. At this moment, her power was being amplified to a ridiculous degree.
[The avenger has encountered her foe. She mortgages her soul to amplify her power]
-Soul consumption rate: 12%.
The power of vengeance consumes Chun So-yeon’s soul, amplifying her power to realize her vengeance. It’s like mortgaging her future.
“I can do it. With this power…!
Chun So-yeon marveled at the omnipotence of the Holy Law that she could feel throughout her body but then, a sword slashed down.
-Boom!
“What?!”
If it weren’t for her amplified strength, she wouldn’t even be able to react but the cost of blocking such a huge force with his bare body was devastating.
-Crack!
Tendons all over her body burst as a ghastly sound coursed through her body, and it was only with the darkness of Ventasis supporting her and the light of Arianna resisting the force of evil that she was able to stand.
“The power of the gods is–mighty. Countless of my people have been annihilated by their power.”
Akasha looked down at Chun So-yeon and twisted her lips at the catastrophe, the annihilation of tens of millions of demons that only demons could know.
“A power that could shatter our immortality. But──”
The demon sword weighing down on Chun So-yeon became even heavier. The Demon Archduke’s gaze pierces through her, mocking.
“You are not one of those knights.”
You are nothing.
“Miss So-Yeon!”
Park Yong-shin and the Hunters rushed to her aid.
The Hanbit Palace was willing to risk martyrdom for a mere girl empowered by the gods.
[Blood Wave]
At that moment, a dense blood wave spread out from the center of the demon sword in the form of a ring.
-Kaaaah!
Hunters everywhere were swept away by the wave. With just a single wave passing through them, they were sprawled on the ground, feeling the pain of having their entire bodies shattered.
“I am the power of destruction.”
Akasha was about to spill insults as she displayed her overwhelming power.
“Hhhhhhhh…!”
But the first person to do it was someone completely unexpected.
“…….”
Akasha’s gaze snapped to the direction of the unconscious Hunters.
“What’s -so- funny, mortal.”
Yong-wan chuckled and fixed his broken glasses.
“No, it’s just… it’s kind of ridiculous.”
Everyone looks at him like he’s crazy. Smiling in this situation seemed like giving up on everything.
But Yong-wan wasn’t being silly because he had given up everything.
-Kaaaaaaaah!
Light pours in as a dazzling golden light spreads from the sky, threatening to envelop the island.
“What is immortality…….?”
The overwhelming light hit him in the back.
“In front of him… aren’t we all mortals anyway?”
A surge of simmering anger creeps up on him.
“Well, honestly, I’m irreligious… but this makes me want to believe in gods. Even demigods…are gods, right?”
Akasha’s gaze slowly moves toward the source of the light.
A golden hair color and blue eyes.
A living demigod and the greatest Holy Knight.
Terror of the Evil Ones and their greatest slayer.
“──Lionheart.”
The Lionhearted King.
The doom of all evil.

chapters.title: Chapter 115: Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter (2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 115: Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter (2)
“Takeda… was… defeated?”
Chairman Kamiya couldn’t hide a rare look of bewilderment.
Even when three S-class Hunters were defeated, he hadn’t felt this panicked.
Rather, he thought Takeda was wise when he rallied all the Hunters on Shikoku Island and hardened their defenses like hedgehogs.
With Korean hunters and other Japanese hunters around him, he saw no difficulty in repelling the demon sword with their support.
But then the Korean Hunters joined in, and the Demon Sword appeared before the coalition of nine S-classes.
[I am the Archduke of Slaughter, Akasha, the destruction of all life].
A terrible voice came through the receiver, followed by the screams of battle.
‘How many have we lost, and is Takeda among them?’
This was not the plan.
Obviously, the demon sword should not be capable of this kind of combat.
It would be possible to defeat it with 4-5 fully prepared S-class Hunters in hand-to-hand combat……….
‘So, the Demon Sword…was a Demon Archduke, not just a being that corrupts Demon Swordsmen?’
Why now…Chairman Kamiya’s fingertips trembled.
“Mr. President…The Light Sword and the Infinite Sword are currently battling against the Demon Sword…….Shall we…send support?”
At least four S-class Hunters from Japan alone were dead and South Korea hunters were seriously injured.
Of course, there are still Hunters left in Japan. There were nine more S-class Hunters on this battlefield alone, and twenty if you count the branches defending the entire country.
If we think about the long game and rally them all together, we can…….
“No, no…first…stop.”
“President?”
“We watch the situation. If… just in case, if we can end it by giving up one city…….”
So far, the pattern of the Demon Sword had been that once a city was wiped out, it would disappear somewhere. It had happened in Vietnam, too.
“Mr. President, there are 3.7 million citizens on Shikoku Island alone, do you intend to abandon them?”
“You idiot!”
Chairman Kamiya snapped at his employee. The normally calm man was losing his cool now.
“One S-class Hunter is worth a million normal people! Don’t you even know that!?”
That’s not something the man in charge of Japan’s hunters should have said.
Even though the All Japan Association was privatized and became a private company, its reason for existence is to protect the safety of Japan.
The head of the All Japan Association was discussing the value of hunters and the general public, saying that they might abandon their citizens.
‘We can’t lose any more S-class Hunters to such a ridiculous monster!’
How many Hunters would die and their power base would be shaken if they just pushed them in there?
I feel sorry for the remaining Japanese Hunters over there, but if we can end it with that kind of sacrifice…….
“President, the Berserker and the Infinite Sword…!”
In the image transmitted by the relay helicopter, countless swords and storm-focused swords are wielded in the sky.
Yes, if only they could end it here. It pains me to give credit to the Korean hunters, but this will end with the government paying a heavy price.
But──
“An unidentified sword…appeared in the sky…….”
“Diameter…over three kilometers.”
As the sword fell, and the damage was beyond counting, Chairman Kamiya had only one thought.
I was right.
‘I was right not to send in the Hunters from other areas.’
It would have been terrible if one more of them had landed on that island of death and gotten caught.
If that thing fell twice…….
Japan loses the ability to resist the gate going forward.
‘I’d rather give up the assault at this point and surrender the island…….’
Wouldn’t the Demon Sword be satisfied with having consumed a city and leave, as it had done before?
Chairman Kamiya was about to order the Japanese Hunters of Wakayama and Miyazaki to stop entering Shikoku.
“Shi, there is an anomaly on the island of Shikoku! It’s a light! An unidentifiable golden color has risen into the sky!”
That’s when it happened. The image on the screen… no, a giant pillar of light that could be seen from Osaka, where the control center was located, and perhaps witnessed by all Japanese in the Kansai region, was rising into the sky.
“What is that?”
A golden haze-a light mist-descended upon the island, as if a manifested miracle of God had touched the heavens and bestowed grace and at its center, a man stood.
“The Lionheart King…!
His heart trembles at the majesty of what I see on the screen and Chairman Kamiya suddenly realized that he had found hope.
Then.
The nightmare moved first.
* * * *
Once upon a time, there was a world.
There were kingdoms protected by gods, and knights favored by those gods.
To the demons, immortal beings, they were a nuisance.
Knights of the gods, who practiced holy law, bent the laws, and hated evil with a terrible hatred so demons sought to destroy them.
They used the Empire to weaken the kingdom, spreading their power secretly and taking steps toward summoning.
Thus, with the Emperor’s sacrifice of three million lives, Malus, Lord of Chaos, was summoned.
The Great War began as Four of the Seven Lords were summoned, along with six Archdukes and eighty-seven Archdemons that led legions numbering ten million to invade the World of Gods.
The result was successful as most of the world lay in ruins, and only two forces remained.
A legion of knights, preparing for a final stand, and an army of orcs, who treated the Great War like a festival and ravaged the East.
In the end, both armies fell to the demons.
Akasha, the Demon Archduke of Slaughter, was caught in the middle and never saw the end of it, but it wasn’t long before she realized…… It was her good fortune.
“Lionheart.”
Akasha understood the source of Yong-wan’s hope.
The Lionheart King, Guardian of the Grail, deserved to be the hope of the world.
“Swosh──”
Akasha’s sword slashed down towards Leon.
-Bam!
The blood red sword and the golden holy sword collided as Leon lightly withstood the demonic blast that no one had ever received before.
“Lionheart─!”
“How dare you call my name with your filthy tongue!”
It was then that Leon’s holy sword parried the Archduke’s magic sword, and in that split second, Leon’s fist flew out.
-Bam!
The moment it collided with his face, it sent his body tumbling to the ground.
Akasha hit the ground as if a batter had hit a flying baseball with a full force blow and an intense vibration rang out as if an earthquake had hit the ground.
“…….”
All the Hunters watching were stunned.
The Demon Archduke that they couldn’t even block, let alone touch, had simply been thrown away.
“K-kick─! K-k-kick!”
But the Archduke nonchalantly stood up and stretched out the arm that had been severed by Chen So-yeon.
The regeneration was instantaneous as if mortal struggles were meaningless.
The Archduke of Slaughter walked toward Leon and the Lionheart King also approached Akasha, his holy sword drawn.
The sight of them approaching each other, unprepared and defenseless, was enough to make the onlookers nervous.
-Gulp!
Even the sound of swallowing sounds like noise. As their gazes lock, a message pops up in their system window.
[Declaration of Slaughter]
[Effect:
-Applies to all creatures.
-Physical Resistance is reduced by 90%.
-All biological defenses are reduced by 90%.
-Vitality is rapidly reduced.
-Wounds do not heal.]
Demon Archduke had a terrible debuff but Leon used his own buffs.
[[Grail Guardian] resists the curse]
◆Effects: Vitality, Order, Fear Immunity, Confusion Immunity, Wound Regeneration, Valor, Perfect Body, Pollution Resistance, Great Soul────
“Huh…!”
An audible grunt escapes Akasha.
The hunters thought he couldn’t resist the Demon Archduke’s debuffs no matter what buffs he brought, but this was such a powerful buff?
Buffs that only those who belong to the TTG Guild would know about and that are granted by the mere presence of the Lionheart King.
[[Demonic Terror] weakens Akasha the Archduke of Slaughter]
◆Effect: Force Fear, Eerie, Decreased Resistance──
The Lionheart King’s gaze would suffocate an ordinary demon.
[【One-man army】 resists this]
[【Supreme Demon Butcher】────]
[【Duelist】────]
[【Demon Lord Slayer】────]
[【Demon Archduke Akasha】────]
Legendary buffs cancel each other out and collide in a battle that even the world’s best Commander-series hunters can’t reach.
Ordinary humans, demons…No, the heavens above the heavens, unreachable by all living things.
For the narrative of the heavens and the earth was upon them.
“I am the ruin of all life!”
“I am your doom!”
* * * * *
When the island of Shikoku was designated as a potential landing site for the monsters, the citizens of the island were forced to evacuate.
But Shikoku alone has 3.7 million residents. The Onaruto Bridge, which connects the island to the mainland and is larger than South Korea’s Gyeongsangbuk-do Province, was jammed with evacuees.
“Mr. Police Officer, when will the car in front of us be cleared?”
“We are currently guiding it. Please be patient.”
The evacuee man realized that there was a battle going on inside the island, and he wondered if he was going to get caught up in it and die.
At first, he refused to evacuate, thinking that with so many Japanese and Korean hunters, the city’s defenses could not be breached.
It was the aftermath of the battle on the island’s interior that caused many citizens to rush to evacuate.
A giant greatsword had been summoned to meet the deadly skills of Korean S-class hunters. It was still stuck in the center of the island, making a terrifying presence.
“Damn, why isn’t there anything on the news?”
Shouldn’t the battle already be over? There are at least ten S-class Hunters here in Shikoku alone.
There was also Takeda, the proud S-class hunter of Japan, and over a hundred A-class hunters.
Even if a black gate appeared in Japan right now, they would be able to clear it.
“This will never end, I’d rather go on foot──!”
The man opened the car door.
-Quang!
-Thwack!
“──?!!!”
“Crack…!”
The man crashed into the door of his car but he couldn’t care less about the pain in his back, because right in front of him, the ocean rose high, forming a huge tidal wave.
“Tsu, tsunami?”
<Waves>
A giant tidal wave poured out to crush something but at that moment, a blood-colored wave cut through it and slashed the sky.
“Aaah!”
The aftermath alone scrambled the people on the Onaruto Bridge. Car doors were ripped off by the blade winds, and the steel structure shook.
-Aah!
The cheek of the policeman in front of the man was cut by the wind.
“…….”
But the policeman didn’t even care that his cheek was cut. He just stared blankly at the ‘things’ battling on the sea beyond.
“What, people?”
They’re fighting fiercely.
Two objects fighting on a sea that looks like it’s going to drown them if they take a single step.
-Kaaaaaaaah!!!
A wave of blood erupts, and a giant flame evaporates the seawater and engulfs something.
The citizens can only watch with bated breath.
Since the Cataclysm, the Hunters, as the superhumans are called, have been fighting a war of attrition, an old-fashioned white-knuckle battle between cold warriors.
Occasionally, a powerful skill can cause great destruction, but it’s a skill reserved for the best of the best.
Citizens are accustomed to seeing the flashy skills of S-class Hunters and the destructive power of mages in the news and on the internet.
But what is that?
What does that even mean?
Light Sword Strike, a unique skill that can be said to be a Hunter’s deadly skill.
The air screams as if a giant bomb has been detonated, and the churning sea creates a tidal wave.
If they weren’t on a bridge hundreds of meters above sea level, they’d be swallowed up by that tidal wave, and if they weren’t hiding in a car that weighs tons, they’d be blown away.
That’s not the kind of power a living thing is capable of. It defies common sense and violates the laws of physics.
“What was that…….?”
The officer half-leaned against the car, shivering and plugging his eardrums. He didn’t know that his cheek, which had just been cut, had suddenly healed.
-Poof!
It was then that the swordsman with the ominous blood-colored magic sword crushed the knight with the golden holy sword in a frenzied wave of blood.
The surface of the sea pushes out and plunges to the bottom. Soon, as if filling a gaping hole, the water closed in between them.
[Die-er, la!]
The gnawing, insect-like voice echoed in their minds, as if proclaimed to every living thing in the area.
Everyone noticed that the <Akasha’s Sword> was falling from the sky, scattering a terrifying aura.
“Do, run…….”
It’s a pointless struggle. Now come on, you fugitives, do you think you can escape from that sword of destruction?
All the man could do was pick up his cell phone right now and say a final goodbye to his loved ones.
But──
The agent of the gods does not tolerate despair.
-Kaaaaaah!!!
A golden light shone brightly from the bottom of the sea. The density of the light overflowed at every moment and ‘pushed out the sea’.
Millions of tons of water pressure are pushed out by the density of light as nature succumbs to a force that ‘bends the laws’.
The Lionheart King emerges from the bottom of the cracked sea and the extreme light of the holy sword is revealed in all its glory.

chapters.title: Chapter 116: Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter (3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 116: Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter (3)
When a Knight completes a quest and becomes a Holy Grail Knight, chosen by the gods, they are given three holy items.
The first is armor.
Whether lightly or heavily armored, the knight is given the strongest armor available, forged from stellar iron, to protect his body.
The second is the lance.
The knight is the one who breaks the enemy’s spear in the vanguard.
At the moment of breakthrough, the destructive power of the lance breaks through the tidal wave that is the enemy.
Third is the Holy Sword.
A metal of the gods, compressed from the energy of the stars. A holy sword forged by the best smiths of the blacksmith god Heto.
It is not just any blade.
It is the ultimate holy weapon, designed to embody the power of the god the Holy Knight serves.
Thus, the Holy Knight’s holy sword symbolizes the power of the gods.
So what is the Grail Keeper’s sword?
Kingdom knights are given an indestructible sword.
With unbreakable faith, they cut down the enemies of the realm.
Holy Knights are blessed with the Blade of Fury, a symbol that reflects the brilliance of the gods.
So what kind of sword does the Grail Keeper receive?
Those who are implanted with the Lionheart and become demigods, guarding the Grail, the holy relic of all the gods.
They cut down the enemies of the realm and ensure that the glory of the gods flourishes.
But
Lionheart Kings do not symbolize the power of the gods, they represent the will of the gods.
The Lionheart King’s holy sword is forged by the hammering of Heto, sharpened by the flames of Petos, and engraved with the light of Arianna.
In addition, countless gods put their blessings into the sword, and the divinity of countless gods is contained in it.
Thus the holy sword is a polarizing light. It is the power wielded on behalf of the gods, as their representative.
The will of the living demigod is the will of the gods.
The Lionhearted King is the will of all gods.
“Light.”
Come. I am the hope.
I am righteousness.
“Flame.”
Burn my enemies.
The flames of battle that the War Horseman will raise.
“Sea.”
Swallow up their footsteps.
The waves are always on my side, and the winds cannot harm me.
The mists of death unfurl and lead to eternal dreams.
Life grows in the salty earth, sheltering only one person.
The sky turns yellow and the thunder rumbles.
The sun shines with intense positivity, proclaiming one man to be the judge of the world.
Darkness falls, designating an avenging foe for the destruction of the world.
That’s not all.
More. More. More. More.
The gods protect him.
No end of favor and blessing for the representative of the gods.
The holy sword of extreme light blazed with a brilliant light that seemed to represent the power of all the gods.
“──Monster.”
Akasha grew tired of seeing Leon wielding such immense malevolent power, yet layered with divinity.
He had heard of several Lionheart Kings through rumors.
He knew that they were the strongest of the Grail Knights, and that they were far above the level of saints.
But in the end, they are human. Even if they were half-divine, they were still half-human.
Even their vessels had their limits. Even if they represented the power of a god, they could only take so many gods and so much power.
But what was this guy?
How many gods had he taken in?
Akasha did not know how a mere mortal held all the gods within his heart.
He was the strongest Grail Guardian of all time and the greatest Lionheart king of all time.
The gods may not approve, but he claims to speak for all the gods because he is a man who can.
“It’s dangerous, that catastrophe could be reenacted.”
In that war, the demons lost most of their leaders, especially the Lords of Chaos, Pleasure and Wisdom, and suffered a devastating blow.
Three of their four lords that participated in the war died at the hands of Leon.
Even the Demon Archduke of Slaughter himself has been killed by a damned orc.
This must be done now.
She realized instinctively that if Leon continues to survive and add to the source of its power, the Faith, he will become even more terrifying.
“Die, with your past glory behind you!”
“My glory is eternally immortal!”
A falling sword of destruction and slaughter was countered by a holy sword that represents the blessings and power of all the gods.
A beam of light rushes forward toward the falling blade but at the moment of collision, it is the demon sword that is crushed.
“──!!!”
The form of the demon sword crumbles and burns as the scream of a lifeless thing echoes through the world as it burns.
“Monstrous bastard…….”
Even the Archduke of Slaughter couldn’t stop the words from flowing out of his mouth.
Slashing through space, shattering swords, and slashing the sky, the holy sword sails into the far reaches of the universe, toward the stars.
* * * * *
Everything he touches disappears.
After devouring Akasha’s sword, he is not satisfied and transforms the atmosphere above Shikoku Island.
The entire world is bathed in the power of the gods, and otherworldliness spreads to areas that have never been touched by their grace.
In this space, the presence of evil gnaws at its existence just by being there. This is why holy swords, especially Leon’s, are so terrifying.
“…….”
Even after such a miracle, Leon didn’t look satisfied and he had every right to be.
He had just struck with the intention of extinguishing the Demon Archduke’s soul.
“K-k-k-k-”
At the bottom of the evaporated sea the fallen Demon Archduke Akasha was breathing heavily, or more accurately, the body of her host, Chun Ji-so.
“You’re as tough as a cockroach.”
Leon shot him a scornful glance.
“Kkkkkk-weak. No, you’ve lost all your strength.”
Akasha knows of Leon’s power at his peak as she had witnessed how the Lord of Wisdom died.
The Great Lionheart King, who drew upon the power of the stars and broke the Transcendent Spell that threatened to annihilate the continent.
The power that defeated the three lords was severely lacking compared to then.
“Faith is lacking.”
Even if one receives the laws and blessings of all the gods, one’s power is ultimately a substitute for the sum total of one’s faith.
This world was still far too lacking in worship of the gods, and as a result──
-Thud!
A wound appeared on Leon’s body. It was the first wound he had received since his arrival in this world.
A wound on the flesh of the Grail Guardian, whose body was harder than armor?
“You are a worthy leader among cockroaches.”
It wasn’t even a direct hit from Akasha’s sword, but a shockwave of disintegration. If only Leon’s armor had been there, this wouldn’t have happened.
‘But it cannot be helped.’
Leon had been fighting for over two hundred years.
He had defeated the Lord of Pleasure in the Great War against the Demon Legion at the age of 121, and single-handedly defeated dozens of Archdemons, several Demon Archdukes, and endless armies of evil stretching to the horizon.
Leon fought where there were no believers to offer his ‘faith’ to.
Consuming the relics left behind by the Holy Knights.
Using the countless holy swords, spears, and armor that had been blessed with their power, he used even his own armor as a source of energy during his final battle when he was 266 years old but even that wasn’t enough, and his holy sword was eventually destroyed.
“However, you are mistaken, evil creature.”
“──?”
“Certainly, I am weaker now than I was when I was hunting you filthy fiends. But…….”
He pointed his sword and the holy sword still glowed with the power of the gods.
“Even if I’m weakened, you’re not stronger than me.”
The Lionheart King stomped on the ground as his holy sword struck down with the same speed as he had charged.
-Boom!
“K─!”
Akasha barely manages to block it, but the shockwave spreads out and creates a crater.
Akasha, who could barely withstand it with her wounded body, kicked Leon in the stomach and retreated backwards.
<Red Wave>
As he retreats, a red wave swoops down on Leon and the holy sword strikes.
It was a movement that violated the laws of physics as energy cuts through and the wave that shattered like glass grazed Leon’s cheek, but that was all.
Akasha fell back even further. Running on the ground beneath the surface of the ocean, to buy time.
“Stallion…!”
Stallion is summoned towards the fleeing man as Akasha fired her sword at the Divine Beast of Light that was running in a straight line towards her, but──
-Quack!
It didn’t work at all.
Fueled by Leon’s holy power, Stallion was invulnerable to a frontal assault.
Even if Akasha had any magic left in her, she wouldn’t be able to stop it, regardless of the quality or quantity.
“Yes, you’re stronger!”
Admitting that outright, Akasha took the opportunity to restore her power but……a flurry of light from the sky
The otherworldly coloration created by the extreme light of the holy sword as it slashed through the sky hindered her recovery.
With the miracles of the gods overlapping, this space was like a sanctuary.
“Ignorant bastard! How dare you waste so much power?”
Akasha blood-colored waves overlap one after another and turn into a sphere with a terrifying amount of magic power, a bomb that is sure to engulf the knight in front of her.
“Lionheart…!”
The Lionheart King, holding the holy spear, is unperturbed.
“Glory be…!”
He made a straight frontal charge with no room to maneuver.
There’s an explosion, and a massive wave of tyranny crashes into Leon.
‘Stupid…!’
To meet tyranny head-on with no armor is staggering in its ignorance.
Divine Punishment <Battlefield Flame>
“K──!?”
The rider breaks through the flames. No, not breaking through. The flames that should have burned Leon to a crisp through are whirling as if entangled in his spear.
‘The power of flame…!’
Leon remembers how the Holy Knight of the Flame walked through the fires of the Archduke Inferno in the Great War.
No fire can hurt a Holy Knight with the power of flame. In fact, it only adds to their power, as they control every flame on the battlefield…!
“Die, you bastard!”
A concentrated blast of flame shoots toward Akasha. For a person that hates ranged weapons, he is irrational enough to prefer a javelin thrown with full force.
But irrationality aside, the effect it produced was phenomenal.
The sea was split as a destructive force pushed all the water within a three-kilometer radius around Leon away from the swarm of light.
The hole in the ocean was stretching all the way to the South Sea of Japan but that was not all.
The sea through which the spear passed would instantly boil over, raising the water temperature to horrific levels and turning countless lives into boiled meat.
The carnage would be so great that it would be impossible to tell who was the murderous demon.
‘It cannot be defeated. Not alone!’
Leon was about to charge without hesitation when he felt something flying at him and deployed his Holy Art.
Holy Art <Barrier of Arrows>
It was a one-time-only defensive art that blocks any ranged attack. It ‘nullified’ the trident that was thrown at Leon’s head.
“Hmph?”
Leon’s gaze traveled beyond the sea wall where a group of people were falling out of the sea wall like a pregnant woman giving birth to a fetus.
“Monsters.”
Akasha artificially triggered the dungeon break and unleashed the monsters. She thought she’d used them up in the landing, but the numbers were still staggering.
“Do you think you can stop this king with these lesser beasts?”
“I can’t but I can buy time.”
Akasha gritted her teeth, though she didn’t seem to mind.
Since the events of London, Akasha had amassed her power through much killing and destruction.
She sought out the best host to replace her lost body, and while not quite as good as that bitch, Chun Ji-so was a pretty good host.
‘I’ve gathered a lot of power. Now all that remains is to completely demonize the host.’
A monstrous creature ‘hunted’ her body with the power of the ‘Shaman God’ under the protection of the ‘Tusin’.
Even if it wasn’t the best body, she was on the verge of completely demonizing Chun Ji-so, but──
“You’re the reason I have to consume this much magic power!”
The demon sword that had swallowed so much blood and caused so much destruction was itself a huge mass of magic power.
It created a ‘gate’ with it.
-Ohhhhhhh…!
The sword’s power scatters, causing the arcane energy to fluctuate.
To escape his pursuit, this must be no ordinary gate but perfect space, an absolute safe house.
An ‘estate’ that is unaffected by the system and can be closed by itself.
“You…!”
Leon’s complexion fills with anger. He doesn’t care about winning the battle, all he cares about is the destruction of evil.
Having lost the final battle and slaughtered each and every demon that fled in every direction, the fleeing demons are a terrible stress for him.
“Stop him! I need time!”
Dozens of Field Bosses, hundreds, even thousands of monsters rush towards Leon at that very moment──
-Critical targeting. Annihilation weapon activated.
Plasma beams fall from space.
It was a charged particle cannon shot at Akasha and the Field Bosses, piercing their skulls.
“──!!!”
Akasha blocked the attack, but turned around and her gaze stared off into space.
“You-!”
His gaze crosses with the Mechanical Holy Knight, albeit through the camera eye but he’s not the only one.
-Crack…!
Dozens of lightning bolts fall from the black clouds that Leon activated with the Sky and Thunder Holy Art.
“I have to conserve my magic just in case.”
Above the sea, atop a cliff-like formation, the silver-haired Magician Queen smiles bewitchingly from a horse.
“Leave the supporting fire to me, Ms. Ha-ri.”
Behind her were dozens of horses and hundreds of soldiers.
They walked on the sea, a miracle wrought by the goddess of the sea and waves.
“Are you sure we can just walk from here?”
Standing on a cliff in the middle of the sea, Ha-ri looked anxiously down at the blackness below as Jae-hyuk asked.
“Ugh! Senior Ha-ri, you lack faith!”
Jae-hyuk chuckled and stretched out his hand.
“Lord Ultima will protect us!”
Jae-hyuk takes the reins and plunges off the cliff as pure white clouds gather in his path.
“Hahahaha, I’m going to ride these clouds and land like Geun Doo-woon, that’s what I’m saying──!”
-Swoosh!
But Jae-hyuk’s wish was not fulfilled because the moment he landed on the gathered clouds, he crashed through them.
“Oh, I see, you’re not quite up to speed yet.”
Beatrice extends a beautiful finger in regret and at that moment, gravity reverses in the area.
“Oh, oh, oh…….”
Jae-hyuk flies through space in a sort of weightlessness, landing with a splash. He is followed by dozens of Knight Cadets and Man-At-Arms.
“…….”
Akasha couldn’t hide her frustration seeing this scene.
It was only four months ago that the world had announced the existence of the Lionheart King, and yet he had already assembled such a large army along with two Holy Knights: that hunk of scrap metal and that silver-haired magician.
There are still only a handful of Kingdom Knights, but they’re a threat even to himself.
“Soldiers of the Kingdom…!”
Leon shouted, the army of the Lionheart King gathering behind him.
“Raze the enemy…!”
“”I will fulfill your orders!!!”
With the Lionheart King’s shout, the Hunters of the TTG Guild charge toward Akasha without hesitation.
Even the terrible debuffs that Akasha’s mere presence inflicts are nothing to those in the Lionheart King’s Legion.
-Quack!
-Quack!
-Crackle…!
Lightning crashes and flames rage as light protects them…along with the vengeful power of darkness.
It was overwhelming.
A part of the Field Bosses had been sniped beforehand or hadn’t been able to block the initial bolt of lightning. But…….
-Geeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee…!
“The gate is open!!!”
Akasha managed to hold on long enough to escape.
Leaning into the black rift, the Archduke of Slaughter proclaimed.
“I will not forget, and I will return, even if it takes a thousand years!”
That period was not a long time for an immortal being and since this was not the only place to slaughter, there will be plenty of time to regain strength elsewhere.
“Where… are you running!!!”
Just then, Leon threw something in the distance. It was a holy spear, retrieved from the subspace.
-Kwak!
It cut off Akasha’s arm as she tried to cross over the gate but that was all.
Akasha frowned, but didn’t stop running, and soon the gate was closed and the rift disappeared.
“”…………….””
They stared at the vanished rift.
………
……
…
The battle was overwhelming.
Leon, Beatrice, and Yappy could not be stopped by a bunch of monsters that had lost their leader.
“I see what we feared has happened.”
Beatrice came to Leon’s side as he stared at the disappearing rift.
“Yes. It was a waste.”
…They missed the Demon Archduke. Still, Leon didn’t feel too bad.
“Your Majesty, have you secured insurance just in case?”
Beatrice asked and Leon twisted the corners of his mouth as a fierce smile that would have horrified the demons if they had seen it appeared.
“Here it is.”
Leon held up Akasha’s severed arm.
“Can you summon the gate with this?”
“Of course.”
Beatrice smiles, her bewitching smile somehow exuding a similar aura to Leon’s.
“They’ll see that there is no safe place for them anymore.”
“Exactly. No place is safe for them anymore.”
“Hoohoohoohoohoo…!”
“Kkkkkkkkkk…!”
The laughter of the two kings, twisted with hatred, echoed eerily beneath the surface of Shikoku Island.

chapters.title: Chapter 117: It’s Not Over Yet
chapters.content:
Chapter 117: It’s Not Over Yet
“Huh…!”
Takeda opened his eyes and stared at the white ceiling.
‘Hospital?’
He must have been attacked by the demon swordsman and suffered irreparable injuries.
The ringer in his arm was annoying so Takeda pulled the ringer needle out and pushed his eerily still body to his feet.
‘Did Michiru do this?’
Michiru is a Japanese S-class healer. She’d been with him on Shikoku, preparing for the attack.
‘No, it’s weird. I don’t think it’s possible to heal to the point where there’s not even a scar.’
An S-class healer can reattach a dismembered body in an instant, but his body had been dismembered down to the guts, and she managed to save him?
‘No, she can’t. She specializes in trauma. She can’t treat internal injuries.’
At best, it greatly enhances natural recovery but it was not enough to bring someone back from the brink of death.
“Takeda-san!”
Hunters in suits rush in, not long after Takeda woke up. They had apparently been waiting outside.
“Ishida. Fumio.”
“You’ve been out for a week!”
The A-class Hunters on Takeda’s team were delighted at his recovery, but he was full of questions.
“The demon sword… what happened to it?”
“……missed it.”
“You missed it?!”
Four S-class Hunters had been defeated. There was no telling how much damage they might have suffered after they fell, and they missed it?
“However, His Majesty Lionheart has a proposal regarding the matter.”
“The Lionheart King?”
“Would you like to check out the video?”
Fumio pulled out her cell phone and showed Takeda a YouTube video.
“TTG Guild Channel?”
Takeda was familiar with the channel. It was a YouTube channel set up by the Survivor’s Guild, and the content was amazing.
It had been well translated and had become quite popular in Japan. I wondered if it was a video of the battle after he had fallen.
The video was basically a well-edited compilation of bodycam footage from the hunters in the raid. AI rendering technology was used to neatly upscale the smartphone quality to 8K.
‘Is the South Korean government providing technicians?’
Judging by the extraordinary image quality correction capabilities and over a hundred translations, it seemed like a very big project. There must have been a hundred technicians and academics involved.
Takeda, the second-in-command of the All-Japan Association, was well aware of this, as he often brought up this kind of correction work.
Even so, the quality of the video on the TTG Guild channel was stunning.
“Wait, was this live?”
Takeda looked at the chat window next to the video and wondered.
Of course, the All Japan Association or the Korean Hunter Association had made the Hunters wear body cams to publicize this combined offensive.
The demon sword appeared from a black gate and if the Japanese succeeded in capturing it, would make a good propaganda piece.
But that’s only if the capture is successful. If it fails, there’s no such propaganda.
Naturally, they were going to post an edited video after all the battles were over…….
‘Isn’t it like all the bodycam footage was broadcast and spread in real time?’
No, it doesn’t. The bodycam footage goes through a control center. It’s a military network with the highest security in Japan…….
Aside from that, Takeda, who was checking the footage, kept his mouth shut but soon Takeda’s jaw dropped as he checked the footage, which appeared to be from one of the Hunters’ body cameras.
A one-sided defeat that not only the Japanese Hunters but also the Korean Hunters were forced to endure.
-What? Takeda, our number two in Japan, is so easily defeated?
-It’s strange to say the least. The Demon Swordsman is too strong.
Yes, the Demon Swordsman he faced now was different from the ones he faced before.
One of the reasons why S-class Hunters were so easily defeated was due to the debuff trait he unleashed.
Ignore defense, reduced resistance…Cheat debuffs that increase damage by at least 70%, not just 10% or 20%.
With such ridiculous debuffs, even S-tier Hunters were unable to perform to their full potential. So how come…….?
-Crazy… Berserker’s down.
-Damn it, we’re going to get all our Hunters killed helping these idiots!
-Do something!
Waves of Japanese, Korean, American, Australian, European, Middle Eastern, Southeast Asian, and other languages flood the chat.
-It’s the Lionheart King.
-His Majesty Leon is up!
Leon Dragonia Lionheart. Takeda swallowed hard at the sight of him.
His back… no, his entire battlefield was lit up with golden light.
“It’s called the power of His Majesty Leon’s Holy Grail, and it scattered a mist in the sky that channeled holy power and restored a wide area.”
“Even Takeda-san was able to heal his wounds thanks to it! It regenerated you cell by cell, even though your injuries were hopeless.”
“The debuff also had…non-regeneration?”
The moment Leon appeared, his overwhelming buff stats rained down on everyone present.
‘Even the highest ranking S-Class Commander can’t do this…!’
Each and every one of the Buff Traits the two combatants called out was mind-boggling.
‘Buffs that were granted just by existing, not by using a buff skill?’
Add to that the dizzying array of debuffs just by reading them… Leon’s mere existence is like an epic totem that changes the battlefield.
But apart from that, there’s the demon sword… Akasha, the self-appointed Demon Archduke, whose power was at a terrifying level.
