‘I know the debuffs prevented the S-class Hunters from using their strength, but even without that, would we have been able to win?’
Just then, Akasha moved, and Takeda’s heart sped up in fear, even though he was only looking at a screen from the past.
* * * *
The Japanese archipelago… no, the entire world was on edge.
The Wandering Demon Sword was actually Archduke Akasha, a demon of murder and destruction, and he had killed countless Hunters.
That alone was enough to make it a global topic, but the duel between Leon and Akasha caused a huge stir.
-Crazy, demon archduke…….
-I knew there was a demon on top of the Archdemons, but…….
First was the shock of the Demon Archduke.
Mankind had already realized the existence of the Demon Archdukes through the East Sea Gate, but that was only inside the gate.
Now they had seen firsthand that the Wandering Demon Sword was actually a Demon Archduke and what it could do.
He was a destructive force that overwhelmed S-class Hunters and ravaged islands.
Nevertheless, there was an equal amount of good news for humanity.
-The Lionheart King!
-His Majesty Leon.
-Is he a human?
-Demigod.
The story spread among the hunters and citizens who witnessed it, not just on video, but in person.
The heavens and earth shattered as the Holy Sword engulfed Akasha’s sword.
In the aftermath of the battle, wounded citizens were healed by the golden light that enveloped the island and felt the evidence of its divinity on their skin.
Even on video, the scene was full of admirers, but what about those who witnessed it in person?
People in Shikoku and the neighboring Kansai region began to call Leon their savior.
[A savior! Believe in His Majesty the Lionheart! He is the savior of our world!]
At this point, Park Yong-shin, the owner of Hanbit Palace, moved quickly.
He first addressed the Japanese believers and proclaimed Leon as the savior.
With hundreds of thousands of followers in Japan alone, and a strong artificial intelligence across the sea, Japanese public opinion was bound to focus on Leon, whether they liked it or not…….
[I am the Lionheart King]
Leon did not miss this opportunity.
* * * *
The atmosphere at the All-Japan Association was horrific.
Four S-class Hunters had been killed and over a hundred Class A’s were dead, and Takeda was almost dead.
That’s how bad it was. The Japanese and Korean Hunters had been wiped out by a single demon swordsman.
‘S-class Hunters were weak?’
No, of course not.
Both Japan and Korea sent only the best elites they could muster and their track record has been proven by their previous gate attacks.
The Demon Swordsman…the Demon Archduke was just too strong for them to imagine.
What was even stranger was that even the Demon Archduke, who had slaughtered S-class Hunters, had been overwhelmed by Leon.
“Damn it…….”
Chairman Kamiya swallowed dryly and felt a chill run down his spine, and it was no different for the other members of the Alliance.
An overwhelming power that could slice through the sky, cross the ocean, and cause thunderstorms!
Was that all? The Demon Archduke’s terrible debuffs, as the Hunters testified.
To overcome them, the presence of the Lionheart King proved indispensable.
‘There is no substitute…!’
Leon was irreplaceable.
Not just in force, but as a leader, and as a fighter on the battlefield…….
Chairman Kamiya sat back in his seat with a somber expression.
The influence of the Ten Thousand Gods Guild was spreading throughout Japan.
Originally, the Japanese had a light belief in gods and in a country that doesn’t have any major religions, a performance like this naturally attracts worship.
Some shrines even have Leon’s photo on display.
‘It’s dangerous…….’
Shortly after the battle, Leon made a bizarre move.
He began gathering worshippers at shrines across the country, performing unexplained rituals and meeting with political figures. Not surprisingly, Prime Minister Fujisawa was among them.
Most dangerous of all, though it hasn’t become an official issue yet, comments that suggest he was ready to abandon the island of Shikoku and its 3.7 million citizens were leaked.
“One S-class hunter is worth a million civilians, don’t you know that!”
Of course, the All Japan Association is the largest private organization in Japan. It was also the most powerful.
Major media outlets could not go against them but Kamiya’s words were spreading like wildfire.
It was echoed within the organization.
‘If the Koreans had failed…….’
They could have saved face by calling for a general mobilization of Japanese Hunters, or sought support from the United States and Europe but Leon had won overwhelmingly.
What other human being in the world could cut through the sky, part the oceans, and single-handedly defeat a Demon Archduke?
Chairman Kamiya had tried to keep Leon in check, but if he touched him now, he would become a criminal.
‘It’s okay, I still have thirty-three S-class Hunters left.’
Despite suffering so many losses in a single battle, Japan has a huge talent pool.
The population is large enough, and the environment is conducive to finding and nurturing talent. They weren’t losing prospects to foreign countries like Southeast Asia and the Middle East.
He thought, ‘There’s nothing different. There’s only one thing I have to do from now on.’
Stop hostilities against the TTG Guild but he hadn’t even brought it to the surface in the first place.
Naturally, he shares the credit for the alliance, honoring the sacrifices of the Japanese Hunters and promising a solid working relationship.
Leon will only be in this country for a short time anyway. There may be a growing number of domestic worshippers of the TTG Guild, but that’s in the distant future.
‘Leon Dragonia Lionheart…….’
He had to admit, he was too big for his own good. He was too big for Japan to contain, and he was sure it was the same for Korea.
Kamiya didn’t care if Leon was the king of the world, he only needed to be the king of Japan.
‘Let’s have a banquet. We’ll have a big banquet, make a good case, and send them back to Korea in a hurry.’
Mr. Kamiya had a very reasonable plan. But──
“I will announce it here and now. This king will open the gate, and we will put an end to that evil bastard.”
I trust you will cooperate.

chapters.title: Chapter 118: The Avengers
chapters.content:
Chapter 118: The Avengers
A banquet was held to celebrate the victory.
Although they had succeeded in defeating the Demon Swordsman, the mood in the Japanese archipelago was now somber.
Four of the country’s leading S-class Hunters were dead and over a hundred Class A Hunters had died.
In such a mood, it’s necessary to celebrate victory in order to forget defeat.
Luckily, there’s someone to symbolize that: Leon.
-Long live His Majesty Leon the King God Emperor!
-The future of mankind depends on His Majesty Leon!
Neither the Japanese government nor the All Japan Association wanted to cover up the fact that they had suffered heavy losses and were unable to defeat the Demon Sword despite those losses.
It’s also an uncomfortable fact that the TTG Guild is the only one that made a significant contribution to the Demon Sword campaign.
That’s why they had to package the outcome of this battle as a ‘victory’.
“Wow!”
Ha-ri marvels at the splendor of the banquet hall.
The banquet hall, located outside the hotel, was set in a Japanese-style garden with a long walkway and a pond.
As they walked through the Japanese stone lantern path, which is often used for wedding photography, they saw a huge number of dishes lined up left and right for a gathering of guild executives.
She thought it was a traditional Japanese garden, but in this part, it was also a western-style banquet hall, which was designed to cater to foreign guests.
In the middle of the banquet hall, musicians playing the shamisen, a traditional Japanese instrument, play relaxing music, and staff dressed as chefs take care of the guests.
“Wow, Sis, I’ve never seen anything like this before.”
“Me neither. Oh, and I’ll have a drink.”
Ha-ri accepted a single glass from the waiter offering champagne.
“… Elder sister, I want to drink too.”
“Ugh! No, no. You’re too young to drink.”
“I’ll be an adult in a few months, right?”
Soo-ho whined, but Ha-ri scoffed and sipped her champagne.
Soo-ho glared at Ha-ri, who was feasting to the fullest in a dress provided by the Japanese government.
“Sister, aren’t you an Association employee? Shouldn’t you be over there with Mr. Oh, Kang-hyuk?”
-Boom!
Ha-ri’s gaze darted to the center of the banquet hall, where Prime Minister Fujisawa and Oh Kang-hyuk were exchanging pleasantries.
Behind them is standing in formal attire, department head Kim Jin-soo.
Han Ha-ri, who isn’t technically a member of the TTG Guild, should be over there.
“Soo-ho.”
“Huh?”
“In your life…when will you ever be so pampered?”
Ha-ri’s golden eyes sparked with fire.
“What is it, senior?”
Just then, Jae-hyuk interrupted, looking quite dapper in his suit.
“Jae-hyuk, are you enjoying the party too?”
“Not really. As a member of TTG Guild, I’m treated like a VIP.”
Hotel suites, dresses, and banquets.
Ever since the Demon Sword Battle, the TTG Guild has been treated like royalty down to the last soldier.
“It must have been impressive to run across the sea and fight. You’re getting quite a few interview requests, aren’t you, Ha-ri?”
“Absolutely! I’m an association employee, that’s all.”
In the Japanese archipelago, Leon’s video of the mythical battle was viewed over 100 million times in three days.
They’ve heard stories of people being promised tens of billions of dollars in ad revenue for each of the five-minute highlights.
The TTG Guild, which had absorbed the Hanbit Palace, had already guaranteed a fast rate of cultivation, and this battle drew a lot of attention.
It was no wonder that Leon was getting so much attention.
“His Majesty isn’t the type to grant interviews.”
“Queen Beatrice must be busy, too.”
It’s a tricky business to get access to TTG Guild Number One and Number Two so the Japanese naturally turned their attention to the ones beneath them.
– Hunter Han Ha-ri, is it true that you are the one who used the holy law that allowed the guild members to walk on the sea?
-Can you explain the Holy Law to me?
-You use water and fire at the same time, how is that possible?
-Would you ever consider becoming a Hunter in Japan?
“Ugh… it was a little scary, was I being secretly photographed or something, like a hundred people all of a sudden rushing around.”
“They say that the Senior Hunters are half-celebrities… but what kind of broadcast is this?”
With the organization’s top executives out of the picture, the people below them were naturally targeted.
Jae-hyuk has also been getting interview requests and high-priced scouting offers from reporters lately.
“Both of you have a lot of trouble. Everyone is interested in holy law users.”
They allowed troops to run on the ocean, created waves to sweep enemies away, and rain down thunderbolts from the dry skies.
There were plenty of unique skills that could cause magical phenomena, but the Holy Law was a different kind of power.
“By the way, where’s Chun So-yeon? Isn’t she a Holy Law user as well, and hasn’t she attracted quite a bit of attention?”
“Speaking of which, His Majesty is nowhere to be seen.”
The three of them searched for the two of them, but they were nowhere to be seen in the banquet hall.
* * * *
Chun So-yeon shuffled onto the second floor terrace of the banquet hall.
Even though she is an adult, the off-the-shoulder party dress that showed off her legs was embarrassing, but it was familiar to her as she had participated in the family’s parties since long ago.
-Ms. Chun So-yeon, you’re the next guild leader of the Divine Sword Guild, so why are you in the TTG Guild?
A Japanese reporter who was quite persistent in requesting an impromptu interview.
Yes, she was planning to return someday and the only reason she was here is to get her hands on the Holy Law but none of the gods would grant her the power to do so with such impure intentions except for one.
“I am the only one who will honor your foul bargain. Despite your distrust, I give you power. Do not take that good fortune lightly.”
She risked her soul for revenge but she had to do it, to appease her mother’s and the guild’s spirits.
It had to be done with her own hands, down to the last detail. But…….
‘I wasn’t even a match.’
She thought she had gotten stronger with the Holy Law, with its omnipotence, and she did but it wasn’t enough.
‘You’re not one of those knights or one of those orcs.’
You are nothing.
The words were harsh.
How stinging to be ignored by the object of one’s vengeance.
“It’s not… over.”
[Yes, it’s not over]
The darkness whispered in her ear and he was right.
Leon has no intention of letting this raid end here. He planned to open a gate of his own and follow Akasha, just as he did with Holy Knight Jerea Relic Convoy gate.
She still has a chance.
[But you are an unworthy foe. You have your talents, but they pale in comparison to his.]
“Your Majesty…You mean?”
Ventasis knew that his blessing would not be enough for her to face the Demon Archduke.
The Demon Archduke is the second in command, directly beneath the Demon Lord. They are the most powerful demons who would normally vie for the position of Lord.
Even Ventasis has seen only a few powerful Holy Knights in its long history that could rival the Demon Archdukes.
Among the Holy Knights, only the Holy Knights of War could do it but it’s just that Leon is so out of the norm.
[But there is a way, my child has actually succeeded, for he has defeated the Demon Archduke of Sloth]
“Is that… true?”
Someone with the blessings of the God of Darkness and Vengeance has defeated a Demon Archduke.
[I’ll give you that power if you want it]
“I have already paid the price of my soul. I have no more…….”
[If it’s to kill the demons, I don’t need anything in return, the soul is just a condition of receiving the power]
Chun So-yeon was tempted by Ventasis. No, it wasn’t a seduction.
It’s just that she and Ventasis have the same common goal.
“Then…….”
“Forget it, you’re not crossing a river of no return.”
“……!”
She turned around to find a tuxedoed Leon staring straight at her.
“Your Majesty…….”
So-Yeon stood and bowed as Leon said.
“Power out of proportion is expensive.”
“Are you asking me to give up……revenge?”
So-yeon didn’t hide her repulsion at Leon’s insistence, knowing that what he was about to say would end up being the same old clichéd advice from her grandfather and other adults.
“If you’re going to say something about the futility of revenge or that the living must live, then──”
“Who do you think I am, I am the avenger of the gods.”
[Hmph…so it should be]
Ventasis agreed.
[Wench, imitate him, for he has lost his people, his comrades, his country, his world, and sworn a vengeance more bitter than any other.]
It was a vengeance so great that even Ventasis was moved.
[That man has fought alone for two hundred years to avenge his losses, he is a great avenger who has triumphed against the impossible]
He destroyed three Demon Lords and two Archdukes, and beheaded over forty Archdemons while slaying millions of demons in the process.
He traveled from one end of the planet to the other, slaying every single demon in his path.
It was a journey of vengeance so great that even the God of Vengeance, Ventasis, was ecstatic.
Would he deny her vengeance? No.
“This king does not deny revenge. He embraces it and has spent so many years fighting for it.”
“For the gods… no?”
“It was just a common goal.”
“Then why…….”
He makes it sound like he’s encouraging her revenge.
“Revenge is sweet. But it must be done in cold blood. If you give yourself up for revenge, it’s not revenge at all.”
Leon looked at the faceless dark god behind So-yeon’s back and said.
“Mortals are easily seduced by power and abandon themselves, and you are offering the destruction of mortals as a condition.”
[There is a difference in aesthetics. I approve of all vengeance but this one lacks the strength to achieve it, so she must pay the price.]
“This mortal has a backstory, a future. Do you intend to take it away, as you did with ‘the child’?”
That child….So-yeon suddenly remembered hearing Ventasis say something similar. When Ventasis had blessed the Starsteel Armor, when Leon had intervened──
“Like when you lost your daughter?”
Leon’s daughter. Could she be related to Ventasis?
[The Archduke of Dragonia borrowed the power she deserved from me, and got her wish]
“And she didn’t get anything in return, did she?”
[Yes, due to an unexplainable accident, though I think I understand now]
“The deal is done. I paid the price.”
[I’m not going to deny your credit, you’re the greatest avenger, but this and that are two different things]
“…….”
There was a moment of silence between Leon and Ventasis but it was Ventasis who finally surrendered, preferring to compromise than lose the favor of the Lionheart King.
[Speak the alternative, the darkness and vengeance will listen to you]
“This king will help the child get revenge.”
“Your Majesty…!”
Leon protested.
“You may have the power to avenge yourself, and the God of Darkness and Vengeance certainly has the power to do so. However, it will end up extinguishing your soul.”
“Something like that──!”
I can take it. Chun So-yeon was about to say so when she met Leon’s furious gaze and was forced to shut up.
“Don’t take the destruction of your soul lightly. Even a sociopath who betrays the gods retains his soul. They get what they deserve and have a chance to purify.”
“Do not underestimate the price you will pay for being blinded by your own blood, young one who has not even lived half a century.”
“You will never enter the banquet hall of the gods, nor will you have the chance to be pardoned for your sins while your soul is torn apart. Nor will you be left behind as an avenger of darkness and vengeance.”
“The price you are about to pay is the burning of your soul. Do you not know that?”
Leon saw the daughter he’d lost in Chun So-yeon but he didn’t deny that his actions were not out of remorse.
“Young one, if you are going to speak of revenge, cool your head first.”
“If you feel a lack of strength, find something to fill it, but don’t lose yourself.”
“Do not be afraid to laugh, for at the end of revenge you must laugh.”
Leon did not discuss tolerance, mercy, or oblivion.
He had done too much revenge to say that living well is true revenge, and──
“Who do you really want to avenge?”
“That, of course…!”
“The one, who killed your mother and your friends, or yourself, who was chosen by the Demon Sword.”
“……!”
At Chun So-yeon’s reaction, Leon let out a deep sigh.
This child is so damn similar to my daughter.
Looking for someone to hate, blaming her father, and ultimately blaming herself──
“It’s because of you, Your Majesty, you and I… killed him.”
The father and daughter had paid too high a price.
In the end, only the failed father remained.

chapters.title: Chapter 119: Creating a public opinion
chapters.content:
Chapter 119: Creating a public opinion
S-class Hunter Chun Ji-ho, a promising genius swordsman and the next heir to the #1 hunter guild in the country, the Divine Sword Guild and Hanara, a quasi-S-class hunter who was considered an equal genius.
Parents she admired and was proud of.
Often traveling to the provinces to capture gates, So-yeon’s parents would take her with them on school days off to spend time with their daughter.
Chun So-yeon was the sweetheart of Chun Ji-ho’s raid team, and So-yeon loved her parents and her raid hunter uncles and aunts.
But four years ago in Ulsan Chun So-yeon was greeting her parents as they came out of the gate like any other day, when a “demon sword” appeared in front of her.
[That’s quite a bowl. You have talent]
Take the sword. I will make you the strongest swordsman.
Even though she was only fourteen years old, she instinctively recognized the ominous aura of the demon sword. But… she reached out.
It wasn’t her will but the aura it emitted, the temptation, was beyond the power of ordinary human will to resist.
“So-yeon…!”
Just as Chun So-yeon was about to grab the sword, it was her father, Chun Ji-ho, who grabbed the hilt of the demon sword.
“It’s because of me, because I was tempted by the demon sword…….”
Her father took the sword for her, and she became the sixth generation of Demon Swordsman.
His mother and the uncles and aunts of the raiding party had all died at his hands.
“You know what? It is said that the Demon Sword… wanders in search of humans with the most exceptional swordsman’s temperament, and the reason it came to Ulsan… was because of me.”
From that day forward, So-yeon was given her destiny.
Kill her father, who became a demon swordsman, and take revenge on herself, who was the cause of everything.
Thus, her revenge would be twofold.
“Stupid.”
“…….”
As Leon listened to the poignant story, he denied her vengeance.
“How can the target of revenge be the victim and not the perpetrator? You’ve got the target of revenge all wrong.”
“……Are you saying that my true target of revenge is the Demon Archduke?”
“That’s right.”
Chen So-yeon hadn’t realized that the Wandering Demon Sword was a creature. It was a fact that no one on Earth knew.
“Make amends with the God of Darkness and Vengeance, and take the revenge you deserve. That would be the right way to be an avenger.”
“But I…I’m not even a match for him.”
“Recall what a miracle you have before you.”
Leon chuckled and placed a hand on Chun So-yeon’s shoulder. A moment later… in front of the throng of government officials, reporters, and Hunters in the ballroom, he declared.
“I declare it here and now. This king will open the gate and we will put an end to this scoundrel.”
* * * *
I will open the gates and slay the Demon Archduke.
Leon’s words shocked the Hunters and others gathered in the ballroom.
“Open… the gate… is that even possible?”
“It is possible……..”
Beatrice jumped to the podium at Leon’s call, and she wasn’t the only one.
“Lord Spinner.”
-Da-da-da-da!
A minimalist mechanical spider climbs the stairs. It was Yakt Spinner, the first Holy Knight of the TTG Guild.
-Tsk!
With a sputter of machine language, Yappy projected a giant holographic image in the center of the ballroom.
-What is that?
-It appears to be a hologram.
-Was that… a practical application of the technology?”
-As far as that kind of precision imaging goes…….
Yappy showed a video of the moment when the TTG Guild formed an artificial gate and entered it.
“Hmph…A gate was created?!”
“Your Majesty, is that video real?”
The fact that the Demon Sword had created the gate was well known among the Hunters, but it hadn’t yet spread to the civilian world.
To the shocked reporters, Beatrice explained slowly.
“Gates can be artificially created. It’s more of a phenomenon. The question is, ‘which’ gate?”
A reporter raised his hand.
“So… you’re saying you can artificially select the gate you want?”
“Not 100%, but you must have something that can help you pick the coordinates.”
The roaring reporters, the Hunters, the higher-ups and the government officials came to one conclusion.
“Your Majesty, you mean to open the gate and slay the Demon Archduke…….”
“We will open the gate after his escape. This time, we will end the evil bastard.”
Chase the fleeing Demon Sword and slay it.
There was no one here who did not know what that meant.
* * * *
“Foolish.”
Chairman Kamiya was appalled by Leon’s declaration.
“Mr. Chairman…….”
Takeda, who had come to the banquet hall to assist Chairman Kamiya, swallowed what he wanted to say.
As far as he was concerned, Leon’s declaration was not realistic.
Opening the gate is good. It’s amazing that they have the ability to do that but apart from that, the problem is that the being he’s trying to defeat is the Demon Archduke.
“We, Japan, have already suffered great losses. There’s no point in sending a bunch of people here to attack a Black Gate.”
The Black Gate is a gate of immeasurable difficulty that must be captured at the risk of national honor.
Any country would be disgusted by this, let alone Chairman Kamiya himself.
“But Mr. Chairman, this might be an opportunity.”
“A chance?”
“Yes. We haven’t gotten anything out of this slaughter. Besides, with the Lionheart King, we can slay even those nasty demons. It won’t even be able to resurrect like the one in Shanghai.”
A demon is something that cannot be killed.
The Archdemon Skazakari, the one responsible for the Shanghai massacre, was slain many times, only to be resurrected and turn Shanghai into a hellhole.
But with Leon, they don’t have to worry about the immortality of demons.
Leon’s power, the Holy Law, extinguishes the demon’s soul itself.
“That’s the problem!”
“What?”
“Even if they manage to defeat the Demon Archduke, all of your hard work will go to the TTG Guild. The Hunters of the Alliance will be nothing more than accessories for him.”
“…….”
But Takeda felt that he had to put that aside and defeat the Demon Archduke now.
Demons have an unreasonable tendency to resurrect and return after being defeated.
What if the Wandering Demon Sword returned after regaining its strength? What guarantee was there that the Lionheart King would be with them then?
Above all…….
“Nishimori, Asada, Miyamura, Kanae… they were all great hunters, even for their revenge──”
“Those weaklings can be replaced, there are still over thirty S-class Hunters in Japan!”
“…….”
Takeda’s brow narrows. He was fed up with Chairman Kamiya treating even S-class Hunters as expendable.
Without even seeing Takeda’s expression, Chairman Kamiya continues.
“Besides, the people won’t accept it. No one wants to see a black gate in front of their house.”
President Kamiya doesn’t usually care about the public’s opinion, but when it’s in his favor, he takes it into account.
However public opinion has begun to take a strange turn.
* * * *
Leon’s public declaration that he will slay the Demon Archduke has, unsurprisingly, become a hot topic throughout Japan.
First was the need to open a new gate off the coast of Shikoku to follow Akasha’s trail.
Then there was the massive amount of magic stones required to open the gate, which the Japanese government would provide.
Most importantly, he called for the massive participation of Japanese hunters in the hunt.
-Why would we want to capture the Demon Archduke in Japan?
-If we fail and there’s a dungeon break in Japan, we’ll be blamed for it.
-We’ve already lost a lot of hunters in Japan.
“Hmm… of course they’ll say that.”
Ha-ri had a look of helplessness on her face as she read the internet reactions that the Yakt Spinner was translating in real time.
Of course, it’s in the best interest of humanity as a whole to take down the Demon Archduke when they can.
It would be shortsighted and self-serving to let an Archduke go because they’re afraid of the damage to their own country, because the demon will soon recover and invade Earth again.
Logically, it would be wise to follow Leon’s lead but apart from that, people don’t like to lose.
They recoil from the idea of sacrifice for the greater good.
“If this were the Lionheart Kingdom, we wouldn’t be having this debate.
“I’d gladly give my life for the chance to slay an Archduke!” the hard-core demon-hater would say.
“Lord Yappy…won’t this be hard? It looks like even the All Japan Association won’t cooperate, citing public opinion.”
-Hmm?
At Ha-ri’s question, Yappy looked at her as if she were a savage who had found fire and could only roast meat.
“How is it possible for a camera eye to display such a wide range of emotions?!”
-Public opinion is not formed. They are ‘made’.
“For example?”
-Triggering the appropriate protocols. Taking over Japanese networks. 3…2….
“Lord Yappy?”
-……Takeover complete.
At that moment the internet comments that Ha-ri had been reading were flooded with dislikes and objections, and new ones began to appear.
-How dare you say that in front of people who’ve been killed by demons. Aren’t you the devil’s followers for letting the devil go?
-Proud Japanese hunters have been murdered. We must avenge them.
-Fleeing here is like surrendering to the demons. Everyone who says we shouldn’t attack the gate now is a demon follower.
It’s not just the comments.
As if to bury the articles that were skeptical or negative about the gate attack, articles supporting the gate attack and its benefits began to pour in.
-Japan will never give in to the demons!
-Korea Hunter Association pledges full support. The All Japan Association still hesitates.
-The Otherworldly Lionheart King, who has come to Japan’s defense, promises to lead the way.
-After defeating the Demon Archduke, the Transcendent sided with Japan.
“Uh, uh, Lord Yappy! Lord Yappy, suddenly the public opinion on the Internet has started to change? This is no joke! I guess people’s goodwill…….”
-Kiruk. Attempt to manipulate public opinion discovered. Blocked. Blocked. Blocked. Began work on exposing the scandal of the Strategic Opposition.
“Lord Yappy?”
Ha-ri looked at the additional articles posted as breaking news.
-Leak of shocking remarks by All Japan Association President Kamiya. A single S-class Hunter is worth a million citizens.
-Four-term LDP lawmaker found to have shocking off-the-books funds. Where did the money come from?
-Japan’s S-class hunters, who refuse to attack because they value their lives. When did Yamato’s samurai become such cowards?
Articles that would normally never be published under the watchful eye of the All Japan Association appeared.
“You crazy bastard! What are you doing? What are these articles?”
“Ugh! That’s unfair! We never published anything like this!”
“Shut up and get off!”
“Hey, the server is down, I can’t even access the Internet!”
The media outlets were blocked with pinpoints. Even the Nippon Keizai was hacked, and no one could make a move against them.
-We, the great nation of Japan, do not need to be at the mercy of the Chong (a derogatory term for Koreans).
We must take revenge on the Chongs for sacrificing Japanese hunters in an all-out war.
Before some far-right sites could react, their community servers were blown up. It was an EMP attack.
-Controlled. Public approval of the gate attack remained in the 80s.
As Ha-ri watched, she thought to herself.
‘Is this okay?’
Was she watching the birth of a media-controlled dystopian dictatorship?
Apart from that, people from all walks of life in Japan were also starting to make moves, fueled by the power of public opinion.
“Prime Minister Fujisawa, dismiss the president of the All Japan Association, order the creation of a temporary government-affiliated hunter organization, announce unlimited supply of blessed crops and ‘gate-operable reconnaissance drones’!”
“Hunter Takeda, second in command of the All Japan Association declares that he will repay the price of his colleagues’ lives! Will he part ways with Chairman Kamiya?”
“Chairman Kamiya Exposed for Illegal Political Funding. Prosecutors begin investigation.”
“The Japanese branch of the TTG Guild expands! It is recognized as an official religion and begins its activities.”
Ten days after the defeat of the Demon Sword.
That’s how long it took for the TTG Guild to take over all of Japan.
* * * *
With public opinion under control, the government and the Hunter’s Association in full cooperation, the gate attack was prepared in a flash.
First, the government warehouses were opened and a huge amount of magic stones were prepared, and as Chairman Kamiya’s remarks and scandal were exposed, Japanese Hunters from the All Japan Association joined the attack on the Japan-Korea Alliance.
“Twelve S-class Hunters from Korea! Twenty-one from Japan! Over five hundred A-class Hunters from both countries! This is the largest raid ever!”
That’s not all, there were also a lot of B-class Hunters mobilized, including Leon’s TTG Guild members, bringing the total number to over 3,000.
Even though more than a thousand people were mobilized from the TTG Guild alone, the Japanese B-class Hunters were not happy about the situation.
-With the Lionheart King, we’ll be strengthened by at least one rank, which should help us considerably.
-This is one of the few chances we have to attack the Demon Gate. If we do well, we could turn our lives around.
The governor and prime minister have agreed to provide gate-operated reconnaissance drones and tons of blessed crops to any raiding party that participates!
Public opinion may have turned against them, but Hunters from both Japan and Korea have a lot at stake in this raid.
It was the Blessed Crops, which were once famous, but were in short supply and barely available to even the largest guilds.
The TTG Guild, which holds the rights to the crop, has promised to supply it first.
Blessed Crops are a high-end supply coveted by Hunters around the world, as they provide a significant amount of buff potions and health over time.
It’s worth joining just to get priority access to something you can’t buy. And──
“The Temple of Ten Thousand Gods is announcing a scout drone that can be activated from the gate. It’s a revolution in gate capture that can observe the entire field.”
Electronics don’t work properly inside the gate. This is due to mechanical failures caused by the high concentration of mana and miasma.
At best, small electronics, such as photography equipment, can barely work, and they cost a fortune.
Obviously, reconnaissance drones are out of the question, and satellites? There isn’t even a simple satellite technology that can be launched individually.
Yappy has already developed a combat satellite armament platform that works from the gate, but it hides the fact that it’s supplying the hunter raiders in the field.
They’ve even created a simple satellite, a reconnaissance drone unencumbered by magic and miasma.
In fact, in a small field, a reconnaissance drone would be much more cost-effective than a satellite.
“Why is the Japanese government so cooperative?”
Ha-ri was puzzled by the strangely cooperative Japanese government but Beatrice, who had been leading the negotiations, shrugged it off.
“Politics.”
“Politics?”
“For years, the Japanese government has been beholden to a private organization, the All Japan Association, and His Majesty has helped to break it up and create an independent Hunter’s Association under the Japanese government.”
“Ah… ah, so the blessed crops and drone offerings…?”
“Those were the first gifts we gave them in exchange for their cooperation.”
Both the blessed crops and the drones were given to the Japanese government so that they could be distributed by the government.
Naturally, Japanese hunters need to look good to the government.
Crops and drones are powerful items that can save the lives of raiders.
In Korea, it’s one thing to be manipulated by a top ten guild, but the All Japan Association, which was completely privatized and not even a government agency, was a blight on Japanese society.
It was only covered up by the Hunter’s heroization and public opinion manipulation.
When that manipulation didn’t work, it didn’t take long for it to collapse.
“Let’s get started.”
Leon approached, and Ha-ri shot him a surprised glance.
Leon had engineered all of this and in just ten days, he had brought down Japan’s impregnable fortress.
“What?”
“Nothing. Your Majesty is… smarter than I thought.”
She doesn’t say it, but her expression reveals the impure thought: He’s not just a thug…
“This?”
It was Beatrice who saved Ha-ri from the brink.
“Your Majesty, I will open the gate then.”
The massive combined invasion force of 3,500 hunters from Japan and Korea crossed the gate opened by Beatrice.
“All the gods are with us. Even the Demon Sword is useless against the Lionheart King, who overpowered the Demon Archduke!
‘I wonder how the Lionheart King and the Ten Thousand Gods Guild will fight.’
‘I’m reluctant to face a demon, but only if there’s the Lionheart king…….’
As their thoughts intersect, they are met with a culture shock beyond their wildest dreams.
“Take them all! They are not worthy of death!”
Leon commands, but they can’t hide their dumbfounded faces.
‘Something… something doesn’t seem right.’
Leon’s gravelly voice reaches all 3,500 of them.
His voice, filled with boundless hatred and boundless anger, had a force that bent even the common sense they took for granted.
“These scums will be reduced to serfdom and suffering, take as many as you can!”
The first thing the Allied Exterminators who entered the Demon Archduke’s territory did was──burning villages, slaughtering civilians and hunting down slaves.
“”Is this, is this right?””
They had forgotten that the Lionheart King was a medieval fantasy super racist.

chapters.title: Chapter 120: Serfs of the Lionheart
chapters.content:
Chapter 120: Serfs of the Lionheart
The gate opened to reveal a world far different from Earth or any other similar planet.
The sky is a blazing red. The barren land and blood-colored rivers make them wonder if this is hell.
“Wow, this is amazing…….”
“From the air to the moon…!”
That was when the system message warned them.
[You have entered the realm of the Archduke of Slaughter, all stats will be reduced by 80%.]
“Insane…!”
It was an outrageous debuff but as they stood there in disbelief, an additional message came through.
[You have entered the Lionheart King’s gate. The Lionheart’s aura is applied.]
◆Effect:
Grants Legion Upgrade Charge Defense.
Grants Legion Upgrade Fortification.
Grants Legion Upgrade Battalion Reinforcement.
Grants Legion Upgrade Strengthened Valor.
Grants Legion Upgrade Light Armor.
Grants Legion Upgrade Tough Skin.
Grants Legion Upgrade Heavy Strike.
Grants Legion Upgrade Archaic Empowerment.
Grants Legion Upgrade Ranged Resistance.
Grants Legion Upgrade Keen Gaze.
Grants Legion Upgrade Anti-Infantry Slaughter.
Grants Legion Upgrade Pollution Resistance.
[War Knight’s Favor]
◆Effect:
-Increases Leadership by 150%.
[War Knight’s Man-At-Arms]
-Gain 20% Physical Resistance when fighting alongside a Knight with the War Knight talent.
[Terror of Demonic Species] – Weakens all demonic species]
◆Effects: Forced Fear, Eerie, and decreased Resistance──
【Greatest Demon Butcher】
【Demon Lord Slayer】
【Ranged Abomination】
【Mightiest Charger】
The hunters are dazed by the barrage of Traits. For the veterans, it’s a familiar sight, but for the uninitiated, it’s something to behold.
Demons that make it difficult for ordinary humans to even breathe… overwhelming buffs that exceed all debuffs from the demonic realm.
‘I expected it, but I didn’t expect it to be this good.’
“It’s not just one or two people, it’s thousands of people…what’s the range of effect?
“With the Lionheart King, we can survive in this place where humans can’t even survive. No, we can win!
And then came the quest.
[You are an expedition following the Lionheart King on his quest to defeat Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter. Help the Lionheart King defeat Akasha.]
Leon said after hearing Ha-ri’s quest report.
“Defeating him is a no-brainer. I’ll do what I can here to do but this is our first time in the Demon Realm, so let’s get as much information as we can.”
-Kiruk.
It was then that Yappy walked over. Normally, it would have made a dull, mechanical sound, but today’s Yappy was different.
“Ooh, oooh…!”
“Aaah!”
He recalls old memories and is horrified.
“Hey, Lord Yappy?”
Ha-ri had to look up to see the approaching Yappy.
A cold disc-shaped fuselage, ominous red wide-angle lenses scanning the surroundings along with its eight thick legs were cold and hideous.
Worst of all are the guns and bladders on the fuselage’s carapace. Snarling, heat-belching superconducting cannons and 60mm chain guns.
The Cheongju nightmare.
A killing machine.
Everyone is overwhelmed by the majesty of the massive multi-purpose vehicle.
“Lord Spinner your exoskeleton is well crafted, and I sense a much stronger aura than before.”
-Crack!
The carapace opens up, and from within, a minimalist Yappy stands up like a pilot out of a cockpit.
-The original Yakt Spinner from the Integrated Armament Platform. Combat sequence operational. Reporting for recon.
“Hmm, did they do it already?”
-Integrated Platform’s drone reconnaissance system in operation. Multiple colonies of presumed hostiles detected.
“Colonies?”
Demons, he thought, but Yappy denied the possibility.
Yappy is a war machine that has kept the demons buried for a thousand years. However the energy he sensed from the demons was subtly different from what he had observed.
“The nearest colony is that way.”
Leon would be the first to meet them.
* * * *
The colony was closer to the gate than he thought and after ten minutes they reached it.
“Whoa, whoa, whoa!”
People standing on the wooden fence, wary as they saw Leon and his group approaching.
“Humans?”
Why would humans be here? Ha-ri scratched her head, while Leon took the lead.
“Who are you people?”
“No, I asked you first──”
“How dare you, you insolent commoner, make me say your name twice! I will consider this a mistake born of ignorance.”
“Ugh… Now, wait a moment, I’ll fetch the chief!”
Frightened by Leon’s fierce anger, the man on the wooden stool backed away, and a new face appeared on the stool.
“I am Veron, the chief of this village… Hmph, King Lionheart!”
“You know this king?”
The village chief responded as if he knew him. Leon was about to ask something when a voice boomed through the woodwork.
“Lord Spinner.”
Leon snapped his fingers.
-Cannon set.
With a bang, a railgun round shatters the woodwork.
The futuristic hardcore AI crunched through the rubble with its giant mechanical legs.
“Hic…!”
Leon and Yappy enter, and the terrified inhabitants fall to the ground. Leon knew they were in bad shape, to say the least.
“Who are you guys, and why did you run away when you saw this king?”
“God, help us!”
Leon showed no anger toward the cowardly commoners. The majesty of a king can sometimes lead to the persecution of innocent people.
“This did not come to persecute you. He’s here to slay a demon-hmm?”
Leon heard the voice of the War God speaking to him. He said to Leon:
[This is the one who was a soldier in the Imperial Army. A follower of the devil, mixed up in the ranks of the Archduke Slaughter.]
“…….”
Leon’s eyes widened as he recognized the man’s face from memory.
Demon followers descended to earth and led the way in killing their own kind.
If such a man was the chief… What about this group?
“All troops! Don’t let anyone escape! Kill those who flee!”
The flames of war erupted from Leon’s body.
* * * *
If paradise is the end of those who followed the code of the gods and served them, what is the end of those who followed the demons and gave their souls to them?
There is demonization, for example.
The prefects and generals of the Empire who summoned Malus, Lord of Chaos, and embraced demonic power literally became demons, traitors who attacked humanity.
But what about the common people? The knights and soldiers of the Empire and the other barbarians.
They were too small a vessel to become demons and they couldn’t take on all of the demonic energy and transform the race itself.
Of course, the demons had their own rewards for such lowly followers.
In the realms ruled by the higher demons, they became subjects.
Of course, there was one reward for the commoners that followed the demons: immortality.
There was a natural limit to their immortality: they would die, but they would not grow old.
“But it was all a trick to keep us as slaves; we were forced to answer the demons’ summons endlessly, and we never knew when we would die!”
Veron was an Imperial Army Sergeant and when the demons descended, he followed his commander and offered his soul to the murderous demons.
He was lucky enough to escape from Leon’s world before the last Demon Gate was destroyed.
He knelt before Leon and said.
“Please save us, Lionheart King, and forgive your people for making this foolish choice!”
Veron burst into tears and clutched at Leon’s pants while the knight cadets had mixed feelings as they watched.
They, too, had been seduced by demons and forced to commit evil deeds──
“What bullshit.”
It couldn’t be true.
“What?”
“Answer me this, scumbag, how many innocent commoners have you killed by your own hand?”
“That, that’s…….”
“I ask! How many innocent people have you killed? Those who can answer, come forward!”
The kneeling inhabitants of the colony were silenced by Leon’s rant.
They may not have become demons, but their service was recognized by the demons and they were reduced to ‘slaves’.
How many other innocent people had they killed for their own survival and enrichment?
“I couldn’t help it but the general gave in to the demons, what could I do?”
“It is your actions, not your intentions that define you. Your intentions do not absolve you of your sins.”
With a snap, the blade was drawn. The holy sword in its sheath lit up the darkness with a brilliant golden glow but the blinding light was a terrible death sentence for Veron.
“Do not blame the King for your sins. The judgment to come is solely the result of your choices. I am not responsible for the judgment.”
“Aaah…….”
“A sin committed in ignorance is not a sin; a sin committed with difficulty is not a sin; a sin is a sin. Big or small, hard or easy.”
Falling flat on his face, Veron turned his hatred of the demons toward Leon, knowing he would never be forgiven.
He did it because he couldn’t help himself. He did it because he wanted to live, and he didn’t want to do it.
“But even scum like you were once the people of the benevolent gods.”
“……!”
In the darkness, even a small light can seem like salvation. Veron and the rest of the group’s demonic followers responded to the space Leon had left.
“I will preserve your souls until your sins are punished by Tatar, the God of Judgment.”
Few understood what that meant but at the mere mention of the name Tatar, Veron’s complexion turned blue.
“Fifty years as a serf, so that you may purify your wasted life in the service of the gods!”
Fifty years, not a long time for the followers of the Archduke.
‘Serfdom? Even now, I’m a slave to a demon and I don’t know I’ll die, but a slave with a fixed term?’
“Thank you for your mercy──”
He was about to spew out his heartfelt gratitude with tears in his eyes.
“Don’t be ridiculous!”
The gazes of the demonic followers twisted in disbelief.
Leon’s terms are so benevolent that they’re almost grateful, but why is he so paroxysmal in his refusal?
“Will you shut your filthy mouth?”
“I don’t like it, I don’t like it, I don’t like it, I don’t like it, Lionheart, I don’t like it!”
He’s from a wealthy family, so he’s been riding horses as a commoner and hasn’t gotten over his bad habits.
That said, the noble and wealthy among the Demon Followers hated to see themselves fall to the bottom of the heap.
Even in the villages of these demon followers, they’d look down on the mayor.
“Damn it! Someone shut that bastard’s mouth!”
“I’m not going to be a serf, I’m not going to be a serf, I’m not going to be a serf!”
Veron’s resistance was cut off by the other demon followers. As the gagged man was dragged through the crowd of demonic followers, Leon shouted.
“Listen, you bastards.”
The colony’s inhabitants obeyed and awaited judgment.
“You will serve as serfs of Lionheart for fifty years, and you will carry out every command without reservation.”
“Do you accept the punishment that Leon Dragonia Lionheart, Agent of the Tatar, God of the Sun and Judgment, has decreed for you?”
“I accept!”
“”I accept!””
At that moment an intense beam of sunlight emanated from Leon and soon pierced through them.
“Uh, uh, uh?”
“Mo, something in your neck?”
The change was simple. A series of pure white rings, like tattoos appeared on their necks.
“Hmph. We’ll leave right away. Pack as little as possible and follow this king’s lead!”
The demonic followers had no choice but to follow Leon with dumbfounded eyes. Unaware of the promise of judgment they’d sworn to or what the Veron-inspired cries meant.
But it didn’t matter.
They would find out soon enough.
“Oh, no! No, no, no!”
Only Veron knew the ending, and he could only sob in agony.
* * * *
“Take them all! They are not worthy of death!”
Returning to the main camp, Leon began to subjugate the entire region.
He burned and looted villages, killing those who resisted.
At the end of it all was a bizarre act of plunder called “serfdom.”
“Is this it?”
The hunters of the joint Japanese-Korean raiding party were dumbfounded and had to start taking prisoners.
What’s even more bizarre is that the inhabitants are more civilized than they expected.
As followers of the demons, they expected a lot of resistance, but when they heard Leon’s offer of 50 years of serfdom, they didn’t seem to mind.
“I suppose it’s better than being a slave to the demons.”
“Apparently, the demon followers don’t grow old. I guess they think fifty years is a short time.”
“That’s damn reasonable.”
Occasionally, unlike the other Demon Followers, a few put up a fight, but those who did were decapitated with steel wire by a cold steel machine.
-Crackle! Free labor in large numbers. 5,034.
The villages of the demon followers were plundered, and all the wealth that came out of them went to the Hunters.
Leon called it filthy lucre and distributed it among the other Hunters, so it was worth the slave hunt.
-Discovered a large army of demons.
By the time they were done, they had taken out dozens of colonies but the demons had had enough of my front yard being ransacked, and they came from beyond.
The demons of killing and destruction, in other words, the henchmen of Akasha, the Archduke of Slaughter, appeared.
“Finally, a moment that can be called a battle.”
“It’s a good thing I’m so tired.”
The Hunters, who had won victory after victory in plundering battles despite facing an army of demons, were in high spirits.
But against their expectations, Leon gave the order.
“Serfs, forward.”
The serfs, each of them armed with the best weapons in town, reacted dumbfounded.
“Uh, are we in the lead?”
“No, we’re no match!”
Demons and their followers, naturally, are a lost cause but to have a bunch of prisoners take the lead?
“Even if your limbs are severed and your intestines spilled, hold on to at least one more enemy for that is all you are worth on the battlefield.”
Become a meat shield.
A more blatant suicide order could not have been given.

chapters.title: Chapter 121: Slaying the Demon Archduke
chapters.content:
Chapter 121: Slaying the Demon Archduke
“Hold one more enemy by the ankles, even if it means severing limbs and spilling intestines. For that is all you are worth on the battlefield.”
The serfs recoiled at the open invitation to die.
“What!”
“And you call yourself a knight of justice!”
“Don’t be ridiculous! I became a serf just to die like this-─!!!”
The serfs couldn’t even answer Leon’s glare, and they were shuffled to the front of the line like stiff puppets.
“You have already accepted your punishment, and you will not die easily until you ‘complete your punishment’.”
All serfs in Lionheart are reduced to serfdom by the judgment of Tatar, God of the Sun and Judgment.
There is no “freedom” for serfs who are not freemen.
It’s not just a meaning or a symbol, it’s a real deprivation of the concept of freedom.
“Ugh, ugh, ugh…….”
They were forced to move at the command of the Lionheart King, to fulfill his orders against their will.
The demons looked on in disbelief as the serfs marched right up to them.
-Are these people insane?
-Go back to your villages! What are you doing?
“Charge!”
King Lionheart commanded and the serfs charged.
“Arrrrrrgh!!!”
“I don’t want to die!”
The serf meat shields, deprived of their physical freedom and forced to do as they were told, clashed with the demons.
Naturally, a one-sided massacre and slaughter was expected, but they held up surprisingly well, thanks to Leon’s favor.
[Lionheart King’s Serf Charge]
Effect:
-Grants Meat Shield.
-Grants Tenacity.
-Increases Strength.
-Increases Survival Instinct.
-Increases Vitality by 250%.
Using even his serfs as a viable “resource,” King Lionheart’s serfs have proven to be meat shields, even in hand-to-hand combat with demons.
They are even healed by the Holy Grail as soon as they are injured, what a gracious gesture on the part of King Lionheart!
“Send the hunters into the chariot! Use the gap to flank the enemy!”
While the serfs held off the demons, Leon spread his hunters out like two wings and surrounded the demons.
The demons were a large army, over three thousand in number, and of great quality, but they were being held back by the five thousand serfs.
“Our flanks are empty!”
“With so many flanks, this is what you get!”
For the Hunters, who are used to 50-man raids, the overwhelming number of allies is a new experience.
Easily flanked by meat shields, the Hunters became powerful hammers, pounding away at the demons.
“Argh!”
“The humans…!”
The demons fought back, surrounded on three sides, but their numbers were too great.
“Whoa, something’s coming from the rear!”
Leon and his 40 knights, including Holy Knight Yakt Spinner and Death Priestess Beatrice along with Han Ha-ri, a priestess of two gods.
Leon let out a thunderous roar as he rode the war bull of Petos, the god of war and flame.
[Mightiest Charge] is applied to the troop. [War Knight’s Protection] and [Terror of the Evil Species] are combined]
-Troop Upgrade: Increase Charge Bonus by 400%.
-Troop Upgrade: Increase Charge Bonus by 120%.
-Troop Upgrade: Increase Charge Bonus by 100%.
-Troop Upgrade: Increase the Physical Resistance of your Assault Troops by 35%.
Weaken Enemy: Demon races have 80% less Charge Defense.
[Warbulls of Petos grants friendly Legions the attribute: <Flaming Sword>]
[ 【Supreme Demon Butcher】 applies reduced physical resistance, reduced holy law resistance, reduced melee defense, and automatic soul retrieval to all demons in a 1 km radius]
“Slaughter!!!”
In the moment of clash the demons were torn apart and literally pierced.
Thousands of demons were cut in half by 50 charging knights.
Leon’s holy lances skewered the demons, and the Yakt Spinners’ railguns and chain-guns ripped them apart.
Beatrice’s blitzkrieg blasted the demons with pinpoint accuracy, while Ha-ri and Jae-hyuk’s holy arts slaughtered the more advanced demons.
The battle was a landslide victory.
-Your Majesty, 3,243 enemies destroyed. 300 prisoners taken.
“What will you do, Beatrice?”
Leon turned to Beatrice for her opinion since in this battle, her devastating magical bombardment, ranked her first in terms of contribution, except for Leon.
“Could you please give me thirty of every rank, the higher the rank the better.”
“Evil is supposed to be destroyed straight away… Why?”
“Hoo hoo hoo.”
Beatrice replied with a smirk.
“Your Majesty, the more chances we have to open the Demon Gate, the better, right?”
“Oh…….”
She was indeed an intelligent magician.
Leon gladly agreed to hand over the captured demons, and as he was sorting through them, the Japanese S-class Hunter Takeda approached.
“Your Majesty.”
“What is it?”
“Would you be willing to hand over some demons to our raiding party?”
“No.”
“……Why, our hunters have bled too.”
In short, he was asking for victory spoils. While he understood the idea of sharing the spoils, Leon said no for another reason.
“There are many spoils to plunder this gate but the voices of the demons will tempt and test you.”
“We will not fall for the devil’s twists!”
“Are you so sure you won’t?”
“…….”
Takeda could not answer. But he also wanted to prove that they had captured the Demon Gate.
A captured demon would be a good propaganda piece.
Now that he had split from the Alliance, Takeda needed an excuse.
“Hmm… It’s unreasonable to keep the demons alive… but if there are only three of them…….”
Leon turned to the captured demons.
The demons of murder and destruction are the most unruly and destructive of all demons, they were not easy to capture.
Even though they were in a cage, they seemed to have the energy to break the grate.
“Damn it, tie them up!”
“Don’t get too close!”
The Hunters were barely tying them up as they tore off additional binding scrolls, but the snarling demons were menacing.
“We will destroy you and open the slaughterhouse! You will be doomed! Wahahahahahahahaha!”
Demonic voices that would drive a normal human insane just by hearing them and even the Hunters trembled in fear at the demon’s insane curses.
“Shut up, you demon!!”
The Lionheart King’s chop crushed a skull.
The demon whose skull had been crushed by Leon and one of its eyeballs had popped out, stuttered, unable to get the words out.
“These fiends try to curse people with their sly tongues every chance they get.”
-Hiss!
-Bam!
The demons fell silent at Leon’s entrance. Some of the shivering demons were even leaking yellow liquid from their crotches.
“Hmph…….”
As Leon rolled his eyes like he was judging a fish at a slaughterhouse, the demons tried to avert their gaze. ‘They’re like dogs that met a groomer,’ thought one Hunter as he watched the demons close their mouths as if making a promise before the dreaded Lionheart King.
The demons that the other Hunters had poked with spears and tied with ropes were now as docile as dogs in a cage.
“This one and that one should be okay.”
Leon points to a few demons and opens the cage. The demon that had been rattling the cage earlier shook and ducked as Leon opened the grate.
“Huh?!”
It is yanked out, its face and torso slamming into the grate and shattering it. It bounces back and is slammed to the ground by Leon, who grabs it by the tail.
“Bam!”
The demon’s skull cracked as it was thrown from the back and Leon handed it to Takeda.
“……Your Majesty?”
“This is enough to make the demon stop thinking and start drooling. They are said to be ornamental, except that when they see a butterfly, they break free and chase it.”
Did he know anyone close to him who enjoyed such things?
Takeda couldn’t bring himself to ask the question that would lead him to that abyss. Anyway, a demon who drooled and said he liked the leash around his neck.
Leon stood up firmly as he took over these demons.
“Two days. We’ll deal with them two days after you return, so you know.”
“Ah, yes…….”
Takeda snapped a few pictures of them, thinking that he should just hand them over and move on.
“Then let’s get to their leader.”
“You’re going to use…serfs again?”
Seeing the serf meat shields, which were somewhat of a culture shock to modern humans, Takeda was fed up.
“We’ve hunted a lot of demons, but the damage on this side is still pretty heavy.”
The total casualties reached nine hundred. Most of them were dead.
“Yeah, a lot of them are hurt, but ten… no, maybe more than twenty dead.”
“What?”
Takeda scratched his head at the strange math.
“Your Majesty, in the battle a little while ago, over nine hundred died.”
“Hmm?”
Nine hundred and sixteen to be exact.
Almost 1000 of them were killed, which is a serious mortality rate for a war.
Even after hearing such casualties, Leon stared at Takeda as if he couldn’t make sense of it.
“Are you… are you including the serfs in your numbers?”
“……?”
At that moment, Takeda remembered the numbers he’d been briefed on.
Hunter casualties, 34. Serf casualties, 882.
Of those, if you exclude the serf casualties…….
“34 hunters…….”
“Yes, that would be correct.”
Leon patted Takeda on the shoulder while Takeda stared at Leon’s back and felt a profound internal conflict.
Are humans…are they really better than demons?
* * * *
After fleeing from Leon, Akasha locked herself in the castle of her estate.
“Ugh.”
Pain radiates from the mouth of Chun Ji-so. Though he had lost his body and borrowed the form of a sword, her host’s pain was her own.
‘The wound from the holy sword is deep.’
The blow of the holy sword, imbued with the power of all the gods, was intimidating to Akasha, and it is a wonder that his power is not comparable to his prime.
Moreover, Akasha’s wounds weren’t only caused by the holy sword. The effects of the Holy Law left by Leon’s holy spear at the moment of the gate leap were still slowing down her physical regeneration.
Indeed, the Lionheart King is the demon’s nemesis.
‘After all… it must be a monarch.’
The pinnacle of all evil, the Demon Lords.
Though most of the Demon Lords perished in the expedition, their strength was in no way inferior to the Lionheart King.
In fact, most of the Demon Lords were more powerful than the Lionheart King.
‘It was the addition of his knights that allowed him to defeat Dothraddon, Lord of Pleasure, Malus, Lord of Chaos, and Caracael, Lord of Wisdom, in the Great War.’
The Lionheart King is strong, but it is the strength of his Holy Knights and Kingdom Knights that make up the Lionheart.
In the distant past, the Lord of Chaos, Malus, reduced the Lionheart King to nothing.
If it weren’t for that flame monster, the Lionheart King would not have survived.
‘He is at his weakest now. Compared to his former power, he’s a joke.’
He must be defeated before he regains his strength.
‘Indeed, preparations are already underway. Soon, Rakshar…will awaken.’
The reason she had abandoned her new slaughterhouse and headed to Korea was to support him.
“Archduke!”
It was then that the demon butler, a lowly demon in the castle, rushed into Akasha’s room.
“What’s going on?”
“They’re here! They’ve come to the front of the castle!”
“Kr—-”
Akasha snarled at the Lionheart King, who had marched to the front of her castle.
She didn’t know what he did, but he opened the gates and invaded her territory.
He was definitely insane, to think of coming directly into the demon realm.
“What happened to the… support request?”
“That, that…….”
The demon butler hesitated for a moment, as if to say, “I’m sorry. There were plenty of Archdemons in the nearest estates, but…….
“They… did not… answer the call. They said that the Archduke is not worthy…….”
“Kr–”
The Demon Archdukes are definitely the second most powerful beings among the demons after the Demon Lords.
However, only a Demon Lord has the right to summon the Archdemons who have territories and lead the Demon Legion.
Among the demons of slaughter who have ‘lost their lord’, there is much confusion as to who is in command.
‘If only it weren’t for that orc.’
The Lord of Slaughter and Destruction died at his hands and the Archduke herself was disembodied by the creature and has been a wanderer for the past decade.
“Murka…that bastard.”
Like the Lionheart King, the Orc High Khan is feared by all demons and stirs up trouble.
If it weren’t for him, the battle with Lionheart would have been a battle involving all the lords and demons.
“Release…!”
“Archduke?”
The butler’s head snapped up at Akasha’s suddenly loud voice and Akasha’s brows narrowed.
‘The host bastard…….’
It wasn’t Akasha who had just spoken. It was her parasitic host, Chun Ji-so.
The host’s consciousness was awakening due to the depth of Akasha’s wounds.
“Not good.”
Akasha had been searching for years for the perfect host with the gift of the sword to resurrect her body.
Of the six hosts she’s had so far, Chun Ji-so was the best, but there was a genius body with a talent beyond even Chen Ji-so.
“Chen So-yeon. I must find her.”
Chen Ji-so’s body was no match for Leon but what about Chen So-yeon?
If she could take her body as a host, and fully blossom her potential with her own power…….
One of Akasha’s eyes flashed with greed.
“So-yeon…run away.
While a fatherly tear rolled down the other.

chapters.title: Chapter 122: The Holy Knights Siege
chapters.content:
Chapter 122: The Holy Knights Siege
When we think of siege warfare, we think of white-knight battles with walls, ladders, and crossed spears.
Demons, however, are invaders of all sorts of worlds, and their armament is highly advanced, though it varies by demonic lineage.
“Prepare to open fire!”
“Turrets ready to fire!”
Vicious guns loom over the city walls.
Some are similar to the modernizers of Earth’s civilizations, while others are more advanced.
They had no air force, but they also had cluster bombs that exploded with magic.
It’s a common misconception that the Gates and the battles fought within them are all about white-knuckle warfare.
Anyone would despair in the face of such an overwhelming array of weapons.
“What, what, cannons?”
“What the hell is that?”
“Artillery, it’s exploding!”
“Shoot!”
A barrage of demonic firepower proved too effective at the Hunters gathered in formation.
“Ugh…!”
“Get down!”
Hastily erected magical barriers and tanks defensive skills were only useful in small 50/50 engagements.
In a battle of thousands of units, it’s impossible for an individual’s exceptional strength to stop such firepower.
Speaking of “exceptional strength.”
-Quack, quack, quack, quack!
A terrible explosion rang out in all directions, drowning out the sounds of the world.
“Huh?”
The Hunters couldn’t help but make dumbfounded faces as the results of the explosion were revealed.
A brilliant light enveloped the army of over eight thousand people, including the serfs.
“Wow…….”
“What the…….”
No one was injured, not even a tan from the explosion and exposure to the fire network.
There is only one person capable of such a miracle. All eyes turn to Leon.
“A knight sworn to the Holy Grail is present. How dare you violate the splendor of the Knights with mere ranged weapons?”
Legion Holy Law <Ranged Nullification>
Applies the power of the concept to the entire Legion. This is deceptive enough, but the Holy Knight’s army is even more vicious.
“Lord Spinner. Beatrice.”
-Commencing fire.
“Let us begin lightly.”
The two respond to Leon’s order. Yakt Spinner and Beatrice, both Holy Knights, activated their respective powers.
-Whoosh!
Carapace-mounted drones scatter in all directions. Their armament includes 20 30mm grenades and 1,200 12.7mm machine gun rounds.
-Integrated firepower=javelin deployment
The Yakt Spinner’ railguns and chain-guns fire at their respective targets, along with the drones.
-Toadadadadadadadadad!
The fire fight between the 24 unmanned drones and the Yakt Spinner swept through the demons on the ramparts.
‘Geh, modern weaponry is useless against the monsters inside the gate, isn’t it?’
The Hunter wondered, realizing that most of the weapons used by the Yakt Spinner were not that different from modern weapons.
With the exception of the railgun, most of Yappy’s available weapons were Earth-made modern guns.
If Earth weapons had worked, the Hunters would have been carrying guns, not cold weapons, or pulling tanks and self-propelled guns through the gate.
Modern weapons that can’t contain magic don’t work against monsters. That’s common sense──
“Kaaaah!”
“Mo, body, body, body…!”
But the demons on the ramparts are met with disaster and are “burned up” by the firepower.
Dozens of demons are burned to death from the heat pressure alone as the railgun blasts through the walls.
“Hey, Lord Yappy attack is working!”
“How did this happen?”
They wouldn’t know that to be a “living saint” means to be a holy being in and of itself.
The Yakt Spinner has been destroyed to the point where it shouldn’t be able to operate, yet it has managed to defy physical limits.
They are miraculous in their mere existence as living saints have the power to sanctify what they touch with their flesh.
Thus, every shell, every bullet that pours from the fuselage of the Yakt Spinner is a Holy Grenade and lesser demons burn to death on contact.
“Wow….”
Ha-ri watched in awe, but a question suddenly occurred to her.
“Isn’t that a ranged weapon?”
-The bullet firing mechanism. Derived from the electromagnetic force generated by the main body. The power of the main body.
“Isn’t that……a lie?”
– Silence, organism.
It was then that the demon mages who had spotted the Yakt Spinner shouted.
“That’s him! Shoot him!”
The demons aimed all their firepower at the Yakt Spinner but the brilliant light negated them all.
“Damn it!”
The demons make a wailing sound, and with good reason.
Their side is forbidden to use ranged weapons at all, while the other side uses them at will.
The Holy Knight’s Legion imposes what they are most confident in: hand-to-hand combat, while they themselves use ranged weapons with impunity.
This is what made their army so vicious.
“If ranged weapons don’t work…!”
The demon mage on the ramparts opened his palm and swung, and a shower of infernal fire engulfed the drone.
A blind spot the demons had learned in countless battles with the Lionheart Kingdom.
They don’t recognize something like a javelin that’s thrown entirely under their own power as a “ranged weapon.”
In short, it’s a matter of whether the knight recognizes it as a ranged weapon or not.
“Center your magic on him, don’t give him room to dodge, and bury the Holy Knight!”
And their magic is directed at the Yakt Spinners in unison… before a black light engulfs the demonic mages that have appeared.
Great Magic <Destroyer’s Eye>.
The spells of the Magician Queen rain down on the demons.
“What the hell is that?”
“A barrage of Archmagic-level attacks?”
The crowd is overwhelmed by the black light that pierces the sky.
The pinnacle magician of an era and a world unleashes a phenomenal barrage of magic, but it is only one of her many tricks.
“Take care of her!”
Hellfire rains down as the demons of slaughter and destruction use the destruction magic that they are specialized in.
Their offense is unparalleled among demons but the Magician Queen scoffs at their magic as if it were plastic.
“Magic against me, how shallow.”
She snaps her slender fingers at the spells hurled at her and in the next moment, they’re gone.
“Huh?”
The demonic mages let out a stunned sound because they had seen their magic disintegrate into elemental units and scatter.
It was the realm of Great Magic to nullify an opponent’s magic rather than defend against it. Even the Demons of Wisdom, the pinnacle of the magical family, could only do so after deploying at least a magic circle.
And she could do that with a snap of her fingers?
Seeing their bewilderment, Beatrice twisted the corner of her mouth.
“My previous spells specialized in killing demons, but… I had to learn ‘torture’ because they would eventually come back to life…….”
Black and purple glyphs begin to form in the air as the magician queen’s holy power mingled with the concept of death.
“More death. More tribute. Woe to those who survive. For I know a thousand ‘plays’ to torment you.”
Having lost her country, her people, and her knights, the queen is always filled with rage against evil.
It’s just that, true to her character, that rage is very cold and bitter.
A fog of death sweeps through the castle, cursing the surviving demons to wish they were dead.
The demonic mages groan and let go of their wands as the waves of mist plunge them into eternal rest at the mere touch.
“Archduke…Your Excellency!”
The legions are swept away but watching them fall asleep, the Magician Queen feels sorry for them because they died too easily.
‘But apart from that, I didn’t kill as many as I thought I would.’
Her spell had lost its power halfway through and Beatrice realized it was a function of the castle.
‘Defenses to scatter the enemy’s magic… something like that, I suppose.’
In a world where magic was widespread, it was a necessary facility.
The Demon Castle was well prepared in that regard but…what about ‘overwhelming physical force’?
“Stand back.”
The golden knight flashed his spear, splitting the group of hunters and serfs in half.
It’s not a time for the Lionheart King to step up, but Leon is considerate of the Hunters, who are vulnerable in the siege.
“This king will breach the gates. Prepare to push right through.”
“Yes?”
“Your Majesty, wait!”
The Korean and Japanese Hunters were stunned, and rightly so, for the gate Leon was about to charge through was a giant, nearly 100 meters across.
A short charge against the gates of a demonic castle that could only be opened by the power of magic, or even worse, something out of a fantasy movie?
But Stallion’s hooves had already pounded the ground.
“Ugh!”
“He’s out of the barrier range!”
That means he’s out of the Legion Laws that Leon himself had placed on the Legion and demonic firepower rained down on the Lionheart King.
“Ha…! Stallion, shall I unfold the Holy Law for you?”
-Heh!
Stallion shrugged off Leon’s question. Stallion glances at the guns and cannons raining down on them and slams his foot on the ground.
-Bang! Boom!
The barrage of firepower was dizzying. But Leon and Stallion ran through the rain of firepower like it was a storm.
“What!?”
“How is that possible?”
They made acrobatic moves but the most amazing thing was that it didn’t slow down in the slightest while performing such acrobatic maneuvers.
Misplaced firearms and brute force were unable to injure the two beings in the slightest, and the tip of the spear was pointed at the gate.
“Glory to the Lionheart…!”
The holy spear with its dense holy power smashed into the gate. At that moment──
-Kaaaah!!!
The entire gate bursts open as it is pierced.
The aftermath of being physically pierced through the strongest and thickest gate caused the entire gate to collapse.
“What the…….”
It’s not just the demons who turn blue in disbelief.
The Hunters were also stunned by the miracle before them.
“This is…a Holy Knight.”
Saints who bend the laws of reality as they breathe.
Is this heavenly realm truly within the reach of humans?
At the overwhelming sight of a siege by just three people they naturally sought a god.
The gods they worship must be the true gods.
* * * *
The gates were breached in an instant and the castle was about to fall to the tide of the incoming allied forces.
“──”
Akasha remained silent despite the tumultuous situation outside with the demon sword in his hand… Akasha’s body seemed to be sensing something with his cold gaze.
The only thing that could turn this situation around. If there was at least a way to get away from him or hurt him…….
“Found it.”
A group of people break through the inner wall, and among them is Chun So-yeon.
Akasha dives straight for Chun So-yeon with the body of Chun Ji-so at her side. Using the demon sword’s flying ability, she leapt in front of her in an instant, causing Chun So-yeon to be startled.
“You…!”
“Stupid.”
One of Chun So-yeon’s two swords rushed towards her but Akasha simply parried her sword and grabbed her by the throat.
“Ugh…!”
“You’re foolish to go on a rampage alone.”
“Give me…my father back!”
Even as Akasha choked her, Chun So-yeon struggled but it was like a cornered mouse trying to bite a cat’s tail.
“By taking you, I will become more complete.”
“Why… why would you want someone like me…….?”
Akasha could tell her more about the secret of the demon sword but she didn’t. She was a practical person, and she had no time to waste.
She forcefully twisted Chun So-yeon’s wrist, causing her to lose her grip on the sword and forcing the demon sword into her hand. At that moment, Akasha’s will began to dominate her instantly.
“K-k-k-k-k-k-k-k.”
The corners of Chun So-yeon’s mouth twisted viciously. On the other hand, Chun Ji-so, who was losing Akasha’s magical energy, trembled with parched lips.
“Ah, no. No… So-yeon…….”
His cries did not reach his daughter as Akasha looked around her new body and smiled.
“So-so, so good. If only I could have grown up like this.”
Over the years, the Wandering Demon Sword had pursued countless genius swordsmen.
There was one reason she had spent so many decades traveling from host to host: to squeeze out the bodies of his hosts and duplicate their swordsmanship.
The first demon, James Spencer, was a master of formal, heavy swordsmanship,
Andrea Shaikh, the second, was the pinnacle of stabbing, arguably the best on the planet.
The dagger skills of Ortega the Third, and the two-bladed skill of the fourth, Samrin.
The swift sword of Javier the Fifth Demon Swordsman and the broadsword of the 6th Demon Chun Ji-so
The accumulated swordsmanship of all those demons and the essence of the magick that had eroded her six victims was all in order to restore Akasha’s lost body and resurrect her as the strongest magical swordsman.
“Though I have lost my essence, I have gained a new body.”
She’ll have to start over, but it didn’t matter. The swordsmanship she had accumulated so far remained with her.
“Let’s get him out of the way.”
“That won’t work.”
“──!!!”
It was then that a voice was heard from behind Akasha’s back.
“Lionheart.”
The Lionheart King was staring straight at Akasha. To be precise──
“Let’s end this quickly, you filthy parasite.”
At the violet trinket that was in Chun So-yeon earlobe.

chapters.title: Chapter 123: Parasite
chapters.content:
Chapter 123: Parasite
Upon entering the Demon Castle, Yong-wan sniped at the high-ranking demons.
Normally, an archer’s primary role in a raid is to snipe enemy ranged classes.
However, thanks to Leon’s Legion Law, ranged weapons don’t work on this side, which can be used without a circle.
In this vicious imposition of white-knuckle warfare, archers naturally limit their targets.
Pah-pah!
Enchanted arrows are no match for medieval archery. Especially for an S-class Hunter like Lee Yong-wan, each arrow is like a tank cannon.
“Kuwahhhhhhhhhh!!!”
The demonic beast continues to run silently after being bombarded with arrows. It was a Blood Minotaur, a high-level demon.
“Failed to stop it! It’s charging straight through!”
“What the…!”
Knowing the terrifying breakthrough power of the beast infantry, Yi Yun fired another arrow, but he was unable to stop the Blood Minotaur, which crouched low and charged at full speed.
‘Damn it, I need to get to the front and make sure I hit it!’
Uncharacteristically for an archer, he rushed to the front, hoping to make a clean kill of the enemy shock troops.
However, in a battlefield where thousands of troops are clashing, even an S-class Hunter can’t easily take the lead.
‘We’re late!’
That’s when Yong-wan realized that the Hunters in the lead were about to be torn apart.
“Shields up!”
A man’s voice rang out from the front and the voices that followed chorused in unison.
“”Shields up!””
The shields are raised in an instant.
The Man-At-Arms of the TTG Guild, including leader Kim Do-han, raise their shields in an orderly fashion.
The leading soldiers are sent flying backwards by the impact of the Blood Minotaur, but that’s all.
“Hold on…!”
The Blood Minotaur’s charge only pushed back the leading infantry, but it didn’t do its job of breaking through the formation.
“Krrrr…!”
The demon tried to push ahead while it was already stopped. But the dozens of Hunters in the back row push each other’s backs with their shields and hold on.
“Good job!”
It was then that a series of horses, galloping through the complex, broke through the demons’ flanks in an instant and a red-haired girl leapt from her horse and swung a flaming sword.
-Crack!
Ha-ri, who had just sliced through the thick minotaur’s neck, exchanged glances with Yong-wan.
“Aaah! Guild Leader Lee Yong-wan! Hello!”
Ha-ri greeted him with a bow and Yong-wan replied awkwardly.
“Uh, Deputy Han.”
“I’m in a hurry to battle, I’ll greet you later!”
Ha-ri, who had been greeting everyone in passing because of her position as a Hunter Association employee, soon mounted her horse and rode off to the next battle.
“What are you looking at?”
The voice from behind him back was Ha Yuri. She was clutching a bunch of demons’ heads.
“What are they?”
“Demon mages. The TTG Guild reward us if we bring back a lot of supplies.”
“…….”
The demon’s eyes are grotesque as he rolls his eyes at the decapitated heads. But there’s no reason to tackle them.
It’s been said that higher-level demons often don’t die when decapitated, so it’s best to collect as many supplies as possible.
They’ll probably pile them all up and burn them alive as a sacrifice.
A tragedy that would be unimaginable to 21st century civilized people naturally comes to mind when interacting with the medieval Lion King.
“More than that…you’re kidding.”
“What?”
