“I will do so, Your Majesty, rather than…….”
Beatrice held up the Ritual Dagger of Vulcanus.
The old dagger burned brighter than before. The lava-like flames flowing from within are slowly revealing themselves.
“We are closer to Lord Vulcanus. His dagger will be our guide.”
Leon takes the dagger from Beatrice and begins to walk across the Glacial Continent,
* * * *
The Glacial Continent gave the two of them all sorts of penalties.
There’s not much they can do about it, given its ‘freeze in time and space’ nature. All they can do is walk in the direction pointed by Vulcanus’ flashing ritual dagger.
But it’s not just the cold, icy continent that plagues them.
“It’s an ice storm.”
Beatrice clicks her tongue at the blizzard she’s encountered many times already.
This glacial continent is a never-ending weather phenomenon that threatens to destroy everything that lives.
“…….”
It was a chill that seeped into their bones without even touching them and only a few superhumans could survive here.
“Whoa…….”
“Are you okay?”
“Yes… but we’ll have to hurry and get out of here, I’m sorry.”
“The forces here sealed your magic. Don’t blame yourself.”
Beatrice, who had her magic sealed to keep it intact, is no different from an ordinary woman.
“Let’s get out of the ice storm.”
She turns and heads back. The frozen glacial ground makes walking uncomfortable, the only consolation being the lack of slippery snow but the snow is ankle-deep with every step.
“Forgive my rudeness.”
“Your Majesty…?!”
Leon sweeps her up in his arms and walks away. Her purple eyes widen in surprise, but he doesn’t care.
“We have to go. I need you to hold on.”
“I’m… I’m fine, Your Majesty, but…….”
Of course, carrying a woman wasn’t enough to make Leon worry about his stamina.
“You’re too light as a feather to worry about the load.”
“Hee hee hee, isn’t that obvious for a lady?”
“Oh, no. Did this king’s words come across as pretentious?”
Beatrice smiled and let herself fall into Leon’s arms.
“No, I’m light-hearted, to say the least.”
“Ha-ha. You’re surprisingly nonchalant about saying blatant things.”
“It’s a logical fact.”
The two flirted more than usual. They instinctively know that in this harsh environment, it’s comforting to have someone to talk to.
“If I’d known it was going to be like this, I should have brought Ha-ri with me.”
“Miss Ha-ri is very talented.”
Of course, anything Ha-ri can do, Leon can do better. But in order to minimize the consumption of holy power, he needed someone to do it for him.
“She’s very talented. It’s rare for two gods to favor someone so much.”
“Would Ms. Ha-ri or Ms. So-yeon become the next Holy Knight of the TTG Temple?”
Beatrice asks, suddenly curious.
All the Holy Knights in the TTG Temple are survivors.
Not to mention Leon and Yappy, whose karma is enough to make them heroes.
But Leon needs more Holy Knights. The number of Holy Knights they saw in the Lionheart Kingdom gate was not even half of what Lionheart was at its peak.
“Hmm… Both of them are talented enough to become Holy Knights.”
“You think highly of them?”
“Talented people are everywhere but few actually fulfill it.”
Only a few had the talent to become Holy Knights, but even fewer are recognized as Holy Knights.
“The seat of the Holy Knight is not one that can be attained by mere talent. Strength and talent can be… surprisingly unrelated.”
Leon remembered the oldest Holy Knight.
A noble and faithful old knight, whose beliefs and faithfulness to the end had made him a Knight of the Goddess.
“Sir Jerea was…….”
Just as Leon was about to reminisce, the sound of light breathing drifted up his chest.
Beatrice was fast asleep, looking exhausted in more ways than one.
“We’d better hurry.”
After picking her up, Leon began to walk quickly across the glacial continent.
* * * *
The outbreak of Gates had spread rapidly enough that not only the Association and the Hunter Guilds, but also the civilian population felt it.
-Crazy, there’s a gate in front of my house.
-What color is it?
-Yellow!
-No big deal. It’s orange here.
-I live in L.A. and it’s crazy here too. The National Guard is out in full force.
-I was traveling in Turkey and a gate appeared in the middle of the tourist area…….
Gates are popping up all over the world, not just in Korea. It felt like a harbinger of something.
“Why is there a gate in the middle of the ocean?”
“Isn’t that a dragon palace?!”
The gate appeared off the coast of Mokpo, and the coast guard ships went into a state of emergency.
They sent fishermen home early and warned shipyards.
“Isn’t the Dragon Palace the first priority to be cleared? If that dungeon breaks, the sea here will die!”
“The whole country is in such a mess right now, if we’re going to dispatch an invasion force…….”
Captain Oh of the 3009th stared at the gate on the surface of the water while stomping his feet.
With the shortage of raiders right now, would there be any raiders who could clear the tricky Dragon Palace Gate?
“What? Oh Kyung-jung! Look at the radar!”
It was then. The Coast Guard officer who was checking the radar of the guard ship reported to him.
“We’ve got a lot of activity on the radar! Chinese fishing boats… no, this is coming from the direction of Mokpo!”
“Huh?”
Were they friendly vessels? No, they’re too small and too numerous for that.
“Distance 100! 90! 70! No, what’s going so fast?!”
The officers are alarmed. They’re approaching the 3009 at a speed greater than the speed of light!
“Chu, collision?”
“Armament ready!”
At the captain’s command, the 3009’s 40mm twin 40mm guns and 20mm Balkans are pointed in that direction. But there is nothing on the surface, which means it’s a submarine…….
‘A large fleet of submarines in the middle of South Korea? North Korea?’
But how can a North Korean submarine come to the coast of Mokpo, even on such a large scale?
Even though we haven’t received any information from North Korea lately, is there any reason for such a hasty offensive?
“Captain, give me permission to fire…!”
As the situation grew more urgent, Captain Oh was about to order the attack, but then something caught his attention.
“Don’t open fire!!”
Almost simultaneously with the urgent voice something broke the surface.
It was a small submersible, about 500 tons, similar to the South Korean Navy’s Dolphin-class infiltration submersibles, which could have carried ten men.
“Bam!”
The sub’s hatch opened and out stepped a familiar mascot from Mokpo. It was a Kikiruk.
Fully armed with large claws and distinctive “cannon armor,” the warrior saluted in human fashion and asked for greetings.
-Crackle, crackle, crackle, crackle!
The warrior’s words were translated in real time by the machine.
“Greymion Andrew Maximus Clygent, senior warrior, 1st Assault Landing Battalion.”
“Uh, I’m Officer Kang-tae Oh, Captain of the 3009th, Mokpo Coast Guard.”
After confirming each other’s affiliations, the chirpy warrior spoke.
“This unit is scheduled to destroy the hostile forces off the coast of Mokpo. We advise you to withdraw from the area of operations.”
“We can’t do that! These are our waters and we…No, more than that, you don’t have the right to operate in them and to act like this is…….”
“Direct orders from Lord Yakt Spinner. Authorized by the Hunter’s Association. I am also an official Hunter. No legal issues.”
It’s real. The hunter’s card that the Kikiruk warrior displayed was emblazoned with his pompous and majestic name and official certification as a Class B Hunter.
“Hmph…! Then this ship will proceed with the mission to return the fishing boats that have yet to be evacuated….Senior Warrior Greymion, please clear the Dragon Palace Gate.”
“No problem.”
The Kikiruk warrior then enters the sub again as dozens of stalled submersibles begin to move again.
“Whoa… when did they build those?”
“We almost shot them.”
The coastguards breathe a sigh of relief.
-Kaaaaaah!
A huge wave hit the 3009. It was big enough to rock a 3,000-ton ship.
“What, what!”
“What passed under there?!”
It took them a moment to realize what it was.
* * * *
The Korean Hunter Association has issued a general mobilization order.
Everyone knew why the Hunter Association, which usually frowned on interfering with private guilds, had urgently called the ten guilds.
“This isn’t a normal pandemonium.”
Golden Lion Guild’s leader, Golden Chul, came forward to give the eyewitness account of the gates he had seen.
“That’s two gates a minute. Who’s raiding them?”
“The auction hasn’t even started yet, it’s a complicated process.”
Yong-wan had flown in by helicopter, but he could see that the nation was in an uproar, and it wasn’t a normal uproar. Right now, Vice Guild Leader Ha Yuri is at the headquarters trying to figure out which gate to bid on first.
“Everyone’s here.”
Oh Kang-hyuk, the head of the Association who called the ten guilds, enters with a tired expression. Behind him, Yappy and Ha-ri enter together.
-Where are the Lion King and the Magician Queen?
-Did they leave?
-Are they attacking another gate?
The face of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods is, of course, Leon. Sometimes, when he was busy, Beatrice would fill in for him.
The appearance of Yappy, who has been invisible in public, came as a surprise to everyone and there are some people who are not happy that Yappy is taking a seat at the roundtable.
“No matter how multicultural you say you are, should you treat machines like people?”
“Mr. Kim Jin-cheol!”
Jin-cheol Kim of Shark Guild. He’s the biggest guy in the room, covered in tattoos and looking dangerous.
As a former thug, he has no qualms with his behavior, unlike the other guild leaders who are relatively gentle.
-Cringe!
But Yappy put Ha-ri in his seat and stood on top of her, despite Kim Jin-cheol’s words.
“Huh, is this what you do in meetings?”
-Complaint? Organism?
“Nope…….”
Ha-ri thought that Yappy on her head was like a monster from an old creature movie. The kind that climbs on top of people’s heads and manipulates their brains.
-Straighten up, organism. Keep your eyes level, warning.
“Yes!”
Ha-ri sat upright with a snap.
“Hmph… That’s too much. I’m an S-class Hunter now, and a priestess of two gods…….”
-I’m a Holy Knight, a being who exists above the law.
“No, Lord Yappy, isn’t the supreme being the King?”
-Is the king here?
“He isn’t.”
Yappy didn’t say anything more, just slapped Ha-ri on the cheek with his mechanical leg.
-Good one.
“I have…….”
Watching the scene, Yong-wan thought.
“The end of the……human era has arrived.
He realized that the terrifying killing machine was uncontrollable without the Lionheart King.
“These assholes are ignoring me now!”
With a bang, the big man stood up from the round table. Kim Jin-cheol stomped towards Yappy and Ha-ri with a fierce expression on his face.
“…….”
Oh Kang-hyuk watched the scene but he sighed and pretended not to notice.
“Hmph!”
Kim Jin-cheol, who must have taken that as a tacit rebuff, looked down at Yappy, who was perched on top of Ha-ri’s head.
“I don’t know if you’re Cheongju killing machine or the Holy Knight of TTG Temple, but don’t talk about machines in the presence of humans. Bring a human!”
“Uh, I’m a human, too?”
Jin-cheol bellowed at Ha-ri, who cautiously raised her hand.
“The end of the Association is woven!”
“Ugh…!”
Ha-ri cowered under the S-class Hunter’s tirade. Yappy’s camera eye glowed red as he looked at Ha-ri, wondering what was wrong with her.
“Mr. President, is it okay for a machine to appear in a place like this? Huh?”
“Sir Yakt Spinner is fully qualified. His Majesty King Lionheart has vouched for him.”
Oh Kang-hyuk sneaked a glance at Yappy but Yappy was obviously staring at Kim Jin Chul.
“What are you doing?”
-Considering, putting together a conversational paragraph befitting the intellect of an ancient organism.
“Huh?”
-Composition completed. Completing an appropriate sentence.
Yappy’s emoji is somehow distorted, as if he had been studying Kim Jong-Cheol.
-What a fucking asshole.
Learning too well was a problem.

chapters.title: Chapter 154: Who’s threatening you with a knife?
chapters.content:
Chapter 154: Who’s threatening you with a knife?
Yappy’s training data comes from the vastness of big data in the internet world.
Class systems, social systems, laws, hierarchies… the list is endless, and Yappy deduces the most appropriate, rational, and logical outcome based on big data.
This is even true in religious life.
If you put a person on fire, they die. If you set them on fire without a trial, you recognize it as irrational thinking, but if you add the extra code of “divinity,” you ignore the laws.
Next comes the part about living with people, and here, too, Yappy is surprisingly logical.
The Holy Knights are above the law, and their authority is recognized on Earth.
The reason for the authority is that the Holy Knight is a superpower.
Even in the world of Yappy, which is a futuristic world that is much more advanced than the modern, civilized world, power is power.
Respect comes from authority, and authority is borrowed from power.
In that sense, Yappy is the top predator in the ecosystem.
Wisdom for wisdom, knowledge for knowledge, force for force. It has no qualms about comparing itself to lesser organisms.
There are two other beings more powerful than him, and they are his ‘backup’.
Yappy analyzed Kim Jin-cheol.
Guild leader of Shark Guild, one of the top ten guilds in Korea.
Age 34. Eight criminal convictions. A criminal in his own right who is still committing colorful crimes such as tax evasion, assault, molestation, and drugs.
However, he is respected as the guild leader of one of the top 10 guilds in Korea because he has more power and social authority than others.
He’s made his fortune through a series of legal and illegal businesses.
The power to bribe political powers and gain their favor.
His own strength and the ability to mobilize two hundred high-ranking hunters.
Then.
What does this asshole have against me?
The machine can’t help but come to the same conclusion.
Wealth? What Kim Jin-cheol made in a lifetime, Yappy can make in a week.
Power? He can socially bury the politicians associated with Kim Jin-cheol right now.
Force? It’s ridiculous to discuss force in front of a Holy Knight.
No matter how he looked at it, this asshole doesn’t deserve to boss him around, but he is.
-Giggle!
Yappy understood Kim Jin-cheol’s upbringing and the personality it shaped.
He’s a bully and an asshole.
He’s lived in a world where strength is everything and he has to show it off.
He has lived in an uncivilized beast society where he is a pathetic bipedal beast who has no choice but to show his presence by baring his teeth no matter who he is dealing with.
A beast must speak to a beast. Yappy concluded.
-What a fucking bastard.
No matter how many times you look at it, there’s no way around it.
“………….”
“………….”
The room falls silent.
Everyone rolls their eyes and examines their ears in disbelief.
What did that mechanical robot say?
What about Kim Jin-cheol, who heard directly?
“You, you…!”
Kim Jin-cheol’s face was boiling red at the outrageous words.
Yappy had anticipated what a human being like Kim Jin-cheol would do in such a situation.
“You bastard…!”
A fist was swung and although he was unarmed, an S-class Hunter could smash a tank with his bare hands.
-Organic, block.
“Huh?!”
Hearing Yappy’s words, Ha-ri raised both arms to block Kim Jin-cheol fist.
With a dizzying sound, a wave of collision spreads across the round table.
No one here is surprised at the level of the S-class Hunter’s attack, but that’s not the reason for their admiration.
‘Han Ha-ri blocked Kim Jin-cheol attack?’
‘They said she grew to S-class, is that true?’
Han Ha-ri had only been with the Association as an A-class Hunter for about half a year after graduating from the Academy, and yet she was able to block an attack from an S-class Hunter?
‘After the youngest A-class, she’s the youngest S-class.’
‘Her tremendous growth must be due to the TTG Temple.’
It’s been a while since Han Ha-ri officially became an S-class Hunter. However, her experience level was still different from Jin-cheol.
“What are you…!”
Jin-cheol frowns as his attack is blocked by Ha-ri, who was only an A-class Hunter a short time ago but Ha-ri desperately shakes her head.
“Eh? No, no, no, Hunter Jin-cheol. I didn’t do that on purpose!”
-What? Are you defending him now?
The steel spider overhead tackled her and she felt the sting of its mechanical legs on her cheeks.
“It’s not that, Sir Yappy…….”
She’s tempted to agree with Yappy, but she’s an employee of the Association.
As an official of a public organization, it was necessary to remain neutral.
“I want to have a fight with you, you blue-eyed brat!”
“Me? Why?!”
-Don’t pout. You strike back.
“Sir Yappy, please leave me alone, please!”
Kim Jin-cheol, whose pride prevents him from backing down, and Ha-ri, who was forced by Yappy.
“Shut the fuck up!”
Kim Jin-cheol and Ha-ri flinched at the thunderous shout. The Divine Sword Guild’s Berserker Chen Jinsoo was glaring at them.
“This is not a market floor, not a store, why are you raising your voices in front of adults! Hey, Kim Jin-cheol, what’s wrong with your head?!”
Even Kim Jin-cheol, a former thug and the leader of a large guild, was helpless against Chen Jinsoo tirade.
“…….”
Kim Jin-cheol sat back in his seat with a disgruntled look on his face as he pouted and grumbled.
Chun Jinsoo didn’t say anything to Yappy. He was about to say exactly that when Oh Kang-hyuk whispered in his ear.
“Lord Yappy says that this year he became one thousand thirty-two years old.
‘……Really?’
‘Really.’
At this point, he couldn’t help but pout at the fact.
What the hell is three hundred years old in this modern society, and what is one thousand years old…….
“Hmph…! Anyway, in the absence of the Lionheart King, the representative of the TTG Temple is Lord Yakt Spinner, Holy Knight of the Iron and Blacksmiths, and his authority to attend the meeting is sufficient.”
That was a stern warning not to say more nonsense.
“And I’m sure there’s no need for further explanation of the situation.”
Even with the ten guilds in attendance, the conclusion was obvious.
Mobilize all Hunters to respond to the simultaneous outbreak of gates on a national… no, global scale.
“The operation will be led by our Association, which is a government organization, and we will ignore the gate auction and looting process in favor of a swift capture.”
In other words, no one would be allowed to waste time bidding on which gate was more valuable, and no one would be allowed to mine for magic stones.
This is a big deal, considering modern gate raiding is all about money.
“No, if you can quickly capture all those gates without getting any loot…….”
Although Lee Yong-wan expressed his regret that he was greedy for money, he didn’t come out too strongly against it. However, there were still voices that actively opposed it.
“That’s ridiculous, you have to earn money to feed your kids and pay salaries!”
Kim Jin-cheol of Shark Guild was a staunch austerityist.
“Well, you know our kids are expensive, so if we’re going to send healers, you should give them something.”
Yoon Soo-ah of Juwon Medical, followed by Park Jong-soo of Mujin Guild.
“We can’t. We’re a civilian guild, there’s no reason for us to be under the government’s command. We should at least be able to control our own operations.”
Kang Jin-sung of the Infinite Sword Guild.
The majority of the opposition is the so-called ‘Tax Free Expansion Alliance’, including Kang Jin-sung. Yong Wan of the Firebird Guild also belonged to this group, but had recently distanced himself from them.
And there’s one other former member of this group who has publicly broken away.
“In times of global crisis, heroes must step up to the plate, and we at the Hanbit Palace are willing to follow the government’s lead, as I’m sure he would be pleased.”
Park Yong-shin, the most cultish of the cultists, has changed his religion and is acting awkwardly.
When Park Yong-shin stirred the pot, Golden Chul chimed in.
“It’s a global crisis, isn’t it better to cooperate with each other in times like this?”
Chun Jinsoo threw his hands in the air in support of the Golden Lion Guild.
“In times of national emergency, we must obey the king’s orders, Mr. Kang Jin-cheol; you’re still playing with money at a time like this!”
Chun Jinsoo glances at Kang Jin-cheol but Kang Jin-cheol also has something to say.
“It’s not a matter of playing with money. It’s a matter of procedure and precedent. You know how the government used up Hunters in the early days of the Cataclysm.”
The early days of the Cataclysm were a time of chaos. The government took Hunters as soldiers and sent them out to attack gates, often with disastrous casualty rates.
Kang Jin-cheol believed that money and power were the only things that could be trusted in such times, and he prioritized the interests of the Hunters.
Moreover, the younger Hunters were more inclined to sympathize with his position.
“If Brother Leon were here, he’d be screaming.”
“Is the Lionheart King your brother or my brother?”
Kang Jin- cheol looked at his old friend, who had grown close to the TTG Temple since the incident with the Demon Archduke Akasha, with annoyance.
“Mr. Oh Kang Hyuk, you have no legal grounds to force us. You know that, right?”
The same old friend, now in a different position, stares at Oh Kang-hyuk. Kang Jin-cheol expected him to come up with something at this point.
It’s the natural order of politics.
“I see. I’d like to offer some rights to the Hunters who respond to this mobilization order.”
Oh Kang-hyuk looked strangely relaxed. He glanced at Yappy, garnering an unspoken agreement, and then announced the reason for the leeway.
“Kim Jin-soo, please come in.”
Kim Jin-soo opened the door and walked in, followed by several Association employees.
What made them stand out was that each of them brought a weapon.
“This?”
Armor, swords, spears, and other weaponry were placed on a round table as if they were for sale.
“Ha! It looks like a unique item, but do you think I’m going to crawl under your bed for a few of these? I have enough of this stuff in my warehouse.”
Kim Jin-cheol smirked as if this was his best hand. ‘Actually, when you’re an S-class Hunter, you’re supposed to carry some unique items as standard.’
Among them, securing a Legendary weapon is the basic skill of an S-class Hunter.
Of course, unique items weren’t something that could be easily acquired with money, but it wasn’t something that could make S-class Hunters suffer.
“The armor on display is ‘mass-produced’ Stellar Iron Armor from Lord Yakt Spinner’s workshop in the TTG Temple. How much is being produced this month?”
-1,300 sets of weapons and light and heavy armor? Production has been hampered by a decrease in serfs.
“”…………?!!””
What did they just hear? 1,300 sets of unique items? Over 2,600 unique items were produced in a “month,” even if you count each weapon and each suit of armor as a set?
“Nonsense!”
Rare items alone are painstakingly crafted by skilled artisans in small batches. Unique items are masterpieces that take weeks to create by blacksmiths who are said to be master craftsmen of large companies.
If you were to add up all the unique items on the Korean Peninsula, you wouldn’t get more than a thousand.
“Unique isn’t even your dog’s name!”
Ha-ri raised his hand in response to Kim Jin-cheol’s harsh retort.
“This is a matter that His Excellency the President confirmed during his last visit… The Association and TTG Temple have a formal supply contract.”
“Ms. Han is right.”
The Hunters in the room looked on in disbelief as even Association President Oh Kang-hyuk agreed and Lee Yong-wan raised his hand.
“Are there any…Legendary among those mass-produced items?”
“The knights of the Ten Thousand Gods Temple are all equipped with Blessed Star Iron Armor.”
The words stunned Yong-wan.
‘The Knight class in the TTG Temple starts with B-class Hunters. Once they became S-class Hunters they’re going to receive a full set of Legendary items?’
Is such a ridiculous amount of money even possible?
Or worse, what kind of crazy blacksmith is “mass-producing” these monstrosities?
“Guilds participating in the mobilization will be given ‘priority rights’ to purchase the stardust-containing armor and customizable stardust armor that our Association has contracted with TTG Temple.”
Everyone’s attention was drawn to Oh Kang-hyuk’s words. Not payment, but priority purchase rights.
It was a very arrogant sales pitch, but the Star Iron Armor is worth it.
“Oh, President Takeda of the Japanese Hunter’s Association and the Maverick Guild of the United States have contacted us to make a down payment of 10 trillion won.”
The Korean Hunters were stunned by Oh’s words.
-Boom!
All eyes turn to Ha-ri’s head.
The machine, seemingly devoid of human emotion, somehow managed to give all the organisms an arrogant glare.

chapters.title: Chapter 155: Next to You
chapters.content:
Chapter 155: Next to You
The enemy is coming.
Their name is the Demons.
Their song is endless pleasure, and their desire is bottomless depravity.
The general said. “I will defend this place!”
The scene is familiar.
Lines being pushed and pushed, friendly units retreating. Units of the Order holding the line to keep the main body intact.
Making sacrifices, ordering sacrifices, watching sacrifices, the resistance continues to retreat.
“This war…when will it end?”
None of her subjects could answer her lament with certainty.
The enemy does not die.
Even if you kill them, they come back from the dead.
To them, material bodies are no different than golems powered by magic.
Even when they organize a coalition to break down one demon gate, demons pour out of a new one.
Countless kingdoms and cities were destroyed, and in the end, in the last remaining city, a voice whispered to her.
[Queen, make a deal with me]
Plant the Essence of Corruption, and if you last a hundred years, I will end the endless war and step down.
She had no choice, so she accepted, and so began a hundred harsh years of revenge on the queen who had stood in their way.
“I am the Lionheart King.”
Until the man appeared.
* * * * *
The Magician Queen of the Kingdom of Spero.
Despite her exalted name and authority, Beatrice is no stranger to the outdoors.
As the kingdom’s supreme power, she has spent most of her life on the battlefield since her ascension to the throne as a field commander.
In the swamps of summer, where flies and mosquitoes swarm, and in the frigid snowfields, where horses freeze to death.
Her experience in the field and camping out over and over again has made her generally tolerant of most conditions.
Of course, as the face of the kingdom and a symbol of the Demon Resistance, she is constrained by the need to always appear well-groomed and relaxed.
In that sense, it could be said that she failed to maintain that dignity this time.
“Ugh…….”
Opening her eyes, Beatrice wore a rare expression of despair.
She had unwittingly fallen asleep, knowing how dangerous it was to sleep in the freezing cold!
But it wasn’t the icy cold of the snowfields that greeted her, but a soothing warmth.
“You’re awake.”
“Your Majesty?”
She heard Leon’s voice. He was stirring the flames with his bare hands, melting the center of the den.
Needless to say, the flames burning in the absence of a single branch for firewood are the flames of the god Petos.
“I dug a snow hole since we need to rest for a while.”
Beatrice blushed at the realization that she had fallen asleep in front of Leon but Leon smiled at her and handed her the Holy Grail.
“Quench your thirst with holy water. ”
“This precious thing…….”
It was said that holy water could be created with only holy power, but Leon was in a position to save every bit of it.
As if he could read her thoughts, Leon reassured her not to worry.
“This is fine. Consider it a necessary expense.”
“Then…thanks.”
Beatrice accepts the grail that should be enshrined in a shrine after all the work that went into making it, but for now it’s just a goblet of water to quench her thirst.
The holy water feels warm as it slides down her throat and Beatrice looks up at Leon with a puzzled expression.
“I…Your Majesty.”
“What is it?”
“To see if I…have done something impolite.”
“Nothing much. You seemed to have stirred up some old memories.”
“I was ……embarrassed.”
Sometimes she dreams of the past, her times of glory and the nightmare of her downfall.
It was a miserable time that she could not tell anyone about.
“You have nothing to be ashamed of.”
“Your Majesty?”
Leon smiled bitterly and confessed.
“The past is a beautiful thing. It’s a dream I long to return to.”
“…….”
Beatrice clenched her jaw, empathizing with Leon’s story.
She knew his past, how he’d lost people he loved and cared about, how he’d fought to the end.
How great was the loss he must have felt when they were all dead and he was alone?
The only person in the world who could relate to his pain would be himself. Conversely, the only person who can empathize with his pain is…….
“I’m going to take a break. Get some more rest.”
“Yeah…….”
Beatrice hugged herself in the generous snow and realized that she had been covered with something all this time.
“Your Majesty, what is this?”
“A knight’s cloak, acquired by chance on Earth. A gift from that honorable knight.”
It was the cloak of the Headless Knight that Leon had been honored with. Apparently, Leon had taken it out of subspace and covered her with it.
“Your Majesty…….”
With his cloak covering her, Leon is sitting virtually naked in the snow but he didn’t seem to mind.
“This king is fine. I’m a knight.”
Beatrice was suddenly reminded of her general, Ricardo Burns.
He was a loyal knight who had tried to serve his queen even as he became a Death Knight himself. For their foolish loyalty, Beatrice could not repay them.
“Is that what all knights are like?”
“So I was taught.”
Leon had been born to a grand duke and thoroughly trained in chivalry. He knew how to honor what men and women were supposed to honor, and how to treat each other with care and respect.
But more than that.
“It is a knight’s duty.”
“Duty….”
Does the word “duty” even begin to cover the endless sacrifices?
At least for Grand Marshal Ricardo Burns and his knights, the Lionheart King of the Lionheart Kingdom was a man whose duty was greater than his right.
“Your Majesty.”
Beatrice gently lifted her cloak, revealing the hollow inside.
“There’s plenty of room, please come in.”
“Hmph… I see your point, but…….”
When one cloak covers another, there is inevitably skin to skin contact. Leon didn’t think it was polite to the lady.
And Beatrice didn’t think it was polite to leave Leon alone and wear the cloak herself. Most of all──
“Come on, are you planning on embarrassing me?”
A rather blatant flirtation, one that the queen was quite prepared for.
“I would never… embarrass a lady.”
Leon carefully slipped into the cloak. Flesh pressed against flesh.
“Not uncomfortable?”
“Not uncomfortable, just warmer.”
Beatrice leaned against Leon’s shoulder, her abruptness catching him off guard.
“Beatrice…….”
“Please allow me this much. I won’t…ask for more.”
“…….”
Leon let go of his shoulder without a word. The seat next to him remained empty for a long time.
He watched Beatrice’s defenseless form as she slept soundly.
[Leon, my knight]
Arianna’s voice descended upon him.
“Do not speak.”
And in a rare moment, Leon refused but Light and Justice continued with a flurry of words.
[Your goddess asks, when will you make a new love?]
Leon smiled wryly at her words. He spoke out of turn, but the gods didn’t seem to think so.
[Nay, neither do we, for true and pure will make a good wife.]
At the sound of Poma’s voice, Fle rebuked him.
[Hush sea, for this is the turn of dreams and death, and the next queen’s place belongs to my priestess.]
[You don’t think of anyone to feed, but you talk a good game.]
[What is war, that thou shouldest defeat thee!]
Fle’s eyes whirled around as Petos spoke from the flames of the snow cave, but then the God of Vengeance spoke.
[Avengers, it is right that they should be joined by the same avenger, a motive.]
[The Darkness’s best candidate for queen is a young, blue child.]
[A year younger than the goddess of the sea and war. War.]
[Humans take that one year very seriously.]
Leon wiped his forehead as Ventasis slipped in. Meanwhile, the Goddess of Light and Justice is relaxed.
[Hoo-hoo, my knight, son of the Goddess of Light and Justice. I decide the pace.]
“Goddess…I have only two mothers.”
An orphan, but one on Earth. The other, the Grand Duchess of Lionheart. A goddess is an object of worship, but not a mother…….
[Let’s make it a third mother]
“I can only imagine.”
Leon stirred the hair of the woman who slept soundly beside him. She was a young, beautiful woman. She must be in the hearts of the gods because of her great favor with him.
[I hadn’t forgotten Castile yet]
“…….”
Leon smiled bitterly, remembering his old love.
He snatched up the priestess who served the moon and the goddess of chastity and whispered his love. Then he had to undergo trials to appease the angry goddess of purity.
It was a love so hard-won that Leon cherished his wife and protected his home.
Now that she was dead and in the arms of the gods, he cannot covet a new woman.
[Leon, my knight, your life is not meant to be with common women. Your tender heart may be pleasing to her, but what about your weary mind and body and your unrelieved misery]
Arianna…The gods, as well as she, were worried about this stout lion king.
Even the gods live for eons, sharing their mortal frailties and falling in fiery love.
As the gods would have it, Leon had protected his chastity for too long.
He’s been on a bloody demon hunt with an insatiable appetite.
In the eyes of the gods, his end should have come long ago.
[You also have a duty, as the only living human of the Lionheart, to keep its bloodline alive and thriving.]
“…….”
The goddess laughed and a tear ran down Leon’s cheek as he was still unable to answer.
[Love like a star, Leon, you deserve it]
Leon leaned back and glanced over at the queen, who lay exhausted.
He is still young and healthy. Even though it’s been two hundred years since he’s held a woman. But…….
[Father]
He recalled old memories. The fruit of his love and the hope that the child who did not end well is alive.
It’s not something to be taken lightly.
So for now he can only endure.
The lady next to him adjusts the cloak to keep her from getting cold, and even in the harshness of the glacial continent, her skin is warm and soft against his.
* * * * *
“The reactions are getting stronger.”
Beatrice led Leon in a direction where the flames of the dagger were becoming increasingly clear.
“Beatrice, there don’t seem to be any other creatures around.”
After several days of exploration, they had not seen a single demon in this frigid land.
Of course, in a land that Leon and Beatrice could only endure so much, any demons would attack on approach.
“I thought there would be glacial demons.”
“You mean the demons of sloth and idleness?”
“Yes, and the demons of icy coldness. They are quite troublesome… but nothing compared to the flames of the gods.”
At the turn of the Randolce Plain, Vulcanus led his knights against them and eventually Leon heard that they had repulsed the demonic legions.
“Nevertheless, the disappearance of Sir Vulcanus and his knights is puzzling. But now that I’m here, it’s not impossible.”
What a cold, bitter continent. It’s almost like a law.
“But that makes me even more convinced that Lord Vulcanus is alive on this continent.”
“You mean cold sleep… ah, in His Majesty’s world, the theory is…….”
“I’ve heard of it from Lord Yappy.”
In Leon’s world, science hadn’t progressed that far. But it’s not a theory he’s unfamiliar with, having vaguely heard of it in his time as an Earthling.
“They are the knights of God. They must have survived in a world where even space and time were frozen.”
It was then that Leon halted Beatrice and began to sense something.
“Petos.”
[Yes, I can feel it, I had to get this close to find it.]
Petos, the god of war and flame, shared the same sensation as Leon, his searing fire coursing through his body.
“There it is. There’s someone there.”
The two hurriedly headed in the direction of their senses, and as they got closer, Vulcanus’ ritual dagger glowed with vivid flames.
“Nothing but a giant…glacier.”
A massive, towering wall of ice stood in their way. Frozen solid with snow and ice, it is harder and more massive than a rocky cliff.
Leon stepped forward, facing the looming ice wall.
“Stand back.”
Leon drew his holy spear and the flames of Petos spun furiously around the tip.
The spiraling flames melted the ice wall as soon as they touched it, propelling him forward.
How far did it go? Several times before the icy water on the melted ice wall was vaporized by the divine flame, releasing a massive plume of steam.
“Found it!”
Leon spotted the familiar armor, though it was not Vulcanus── it was a crimson knight, from his helmet to his armor to his horse.
Even the banner of the unit, symbolizing the glory of the Knights Templar that would never be forgotten.
“Your Majesty, who are these?”
“Knights of the Flaming Sword of Baltan, under the direct command of Lord Vulcanus, Holy Knight of War and Flame.”
Within the ice wall, countless knights were frozen and preserved.

chapters.title: Chapter 156: Knights of the Flaming Sword of Baltan
chapters.content:
Chapter 156: Knights of the Flaming Sword of Baltan
In the Great War with Lionheart, the demons suffered terrible losses.
The demons of Slaughter and Destruction, Wisdom and Exploration, Pleasure and Decadence, Chaos and Ruin, who lost their lords, suffered the most.
The Demons of Wisdom and Exploration, in particular, lost most of their highest ranking Archdemons, including the Archduke, in an all-out war with the Kingdom Army.
All of the demons lost a monarch or archduke in that war, but the Archdemons of Sloth and Idleness were in a more delicate position.
They didn’t lose a monarch, nor did they lose an archduke.
“Lord Velotas…!”
At the observation post in front of Archduke Kadsha estate, the Archdemon of Sloth and Dullness, who was in charge of observing the glacial continent, woke up to the urgent report of Ice Observer Velotas.
“Tell me…….”
Velotas grunted, digging through his earwax and like an Archdemon of sloth, he stared at Beltata with a carefree expression.
“This observatory on the Glacial Continent is a time killer for demons who were born slothful and lazy.
It was here that Kadsha, the Demon Archduke of Sloth and Idleness, destroyed them over two hundred years ago, and it was here that they were nominally stationed to guard the seal.
Though it has been barren and uninhabitable to even demons since the events of two centuries ago, who could be trusted on a glacial continent in the middle of the Demon Realm?
Demons, of course, don’t trust each other, but what’s in there is their natural enemy.
It’s like a ball of radioactivity that destroys all demons, and who could–
“Energy has been detected inside the Glacial Continent! It’s the Zero Destruction Element!”
“Hmph…!”
Velotas, who had been reacting slowly, moved his unusually enlarged body.
“Has the seal been broken?”
“Uh, I don’t think so, since Archduke Kadsha’s magic reaction hasn’t awakened yet!”
That was a good thing. If the Glacier Archduke buried with him hadn’t awakened, it wouldn’t be the worst thing that could happen.
“Kadsha magic is loose.”
It had been more than two hundred years since the Glacier Archduke Kadsha had unleashed the great magic that froze the continent.
The Demons of Wisdom and Exploration said it was a seal that would theoretically last a thousand years, but it’s already starting to break!
“It’s a big deal, if that man… that monster… is released…!”
It was a day of horrific slaughter by that man who fell from the sky with flames──
“You go first, lead the special forces. I will head straight for the legions that can be mobilized.”
Velotas clutched at the burns on his side, recalling the trauma.
* * * *
“The Knights of the Flaming Sword, they must be.”
Leon thrust the flame of his holy spear into the icy wall.
“I will rescue them first.”
The holy flame does not hurt the worshippers of the divine. The only thing it melts is the block of ice that trapped him.
-Swoosh!!!
The ice wall melts in a massive burst of steam, then with a crack and a splinter, the knight falls from the ice wall.
-Thud!
The knight and horse land on the ground, just barely, before Leon catches them but it took a few seconds before he came to his senses.
“Ugh…!”
The helmet flashed up and the knight swung his sword in an instant.
“Die, you scoundrel! Die!”
Leon’s holy sword blocked the knight’s blade and the knight’s eyes widened.
“Your majesty?!”
“I’m glad to see you’re healthy.”
“Your Majesty!”
The red knight falls to his knees, stunned to realize that he swung his sword at Leon.
“Yes, my name is Leon Dragonia Lionheart, King of Lionheart.”
“Yes… I am Lord Laihar Dever, Third Sword of the Knights of the Baltan Flaming Sword!”
“Lord Laihar, do you know your current status, and how far back do you remember?”
“Ummm….”
Laihar searched his memory for a moment before revealing the most recent information he could remember.
“We were fighting the Glacial Archduke and his legions on the Plains of Randolce, chasing him as he opened the Demon Gate and fled!”
It was over two hundred years ago, when the Legions of Vulcanus and the Legions of the Glacial Archduke clashed on the Plains of Randolce.
Having won the fight, Vulcanus and his knights chased the fleeing Archduke inside the Demon Gate to finish him off, slaughtering demons in the process, at which point he lost his memory.
“Lord Laihar, I need to ask you something.”
“……With your great power of dreams and death, who are you, Lady?”
“I am Beatrice Alighieri Spero, Queen of the Kingdom of Spero and current High Priestess of Dreams and Death.”
“The Kingdom of Spero?”
Catching Leon’s eye as he tilted his head at the unheard-of name of the kingdom, Laihar put on his best polite face.
“You are the queen, and you are also a saint, so you are certainly not a stranger.”
After Laihar bowed, Beatrice finished her question.
“When your lordship arrived in this land, was it filled with ice like this?”
“No. It was a desolate land, but not with glaciers like these.”
“I see.”
“What have you found out, Beatrice?”
At Leon’s question, Beatrice told him her theory.
“It seems that this continent was artificially created by a demon, and Lord Vulcanus and his knights were caught in it and frozen.”
“Hmm…Do you think a Lord-level demon was involved?”
“If a demon of that caliber was involved, he’d rather take down Lord Vulcanus, but if it’s the Glacial Archduke…….”
“I see, so he froze space and time for this entire continent when he ran out of power.”
It doesn’t seem impossible if the Demon Archduke was willing to throw everything he had at it.
“This world is their world, a land of pure, unadulterated magic that doesn’t need to be tainted with miasma. They could perform miracles here and maybe… just maybe… Glacier Archduke is still alive.”
In other words, if the knights melted the ice wall where they were buried, they might come face to face with the Glacier Archduke.
“No problem. I wouldn’t be here if I was afraid of that.”
────!!
At that moment, a peculiar sound rumbled through the space, which no one could fail to recognize as a precursor to the summoning of the Gate.
“Your Majesty, it’s the demons.”
Beatrice pointed to about five hundred meters from the ice wall where hundreds of demons poured out of the open gate there.
“They’ve noticed.”
“They’re here sooner than I thought. Is there some kind of base that keeps an eye on this place?”
Beatrice felt embarrassed.
She couldn’t use magic at the moment and to open the gate in this frigid land that freezes even space and time, she would have to channel her own magic power.
“Your Majesty must also melt the ice wall and rescue the knights and Sir Vulcanus, and you can count on…….”
Laihar Dever, a member of the Knights of the Flaming Sword of Baltan.
“Lord Laihar!”
“Yes, Your Majesty.”
“One minute.”
It sounded like a suicide order to Beatrice since the enemy outnumbered them by a few hundred and the power difference was overwhelming.
“Understood.”
But the knight merely fixes his helmet and heads for the front. He took up his sword and shield and left the two behind.
“Your Majesty…….”
“Trust and watch.”
With those words, Leon headed for the ice wall, while the demons opened fire on Laihar.
The demons were surprisingly high-powered.
Their weaponry is beyond the comprehension of modern Earth, and magic is their mastery.
Naturally, martial science has advanced, and the machetes wielded by the lowest demons can bring down even giants.
-Fire!
-Three! Two! One! Power shot!
The first to be fired is a giant mahogany horse drawn by the demons of sloth. Fired by consuming magic stones, it could tear apart a modern Earth warship in a single blow.
-Boom!
With a dizzying roar, the cannonballs formed a parabola but thanks to the gunner’s skill, it went straight and headed straight for Laihar.
“With these toys…….”
He threw up his hands in annoyance and his bare fist struck the flying projectile with precision.
-Bang!
The bouncing projectile slams into the ice wall and the ice wall, which would never have been able to be broken by projectile strength alone, was pierced like a stone by the added force of his blow.
-Ki, knight…….
The Knights of Realm are those who have proven themselves in all aspects.
Only the most veteran of them, those who possess not only a mastery of the Holy Law but also phenomenal strength and mobility, become Holy Knights.
“I shall return the favor.”
Laihar grabs a fallen ice cube and his arm flexes like a baseball player throwing a pitch.
-Boom!
The thrown ice projectile slices through the air, cutting through the air for hundreds of meters.
It pierced through the demons’ armor in a straight line, stopping only after shattering their armor.
-Crazy…….
Holy Knights are the chosen members of the Holy Grail superhuman army and they are the definition of ‘strong’.
-Charge!
The demons charge in unison.
“Third Sword of the Baltan Flaming Knights.”
A sword is drawn from the Red Knight’s scabbard. His stellar iron blade is crimson, as if compressed with searing flames.
“Laihar Dever.”
In an instant, a fiery whirlwind engulfed the Starblade.
* * * *
Leaving the cleanup to Laihar Dever, Leon examined the ice wall.
The ice wall is massive and solid and there was no way to effectively melt it without the Holy Law.
“I’ll have to melt it all at once.”
Leon had a way to melt this ice wall but then came the problem.
‘If I do that, the waves will be too much to handle.’
This is a big ice wall and if he melted it all at once, a tsunami of waves would come crashing down on them.
Even if Lord Laihar can hold out, Beatrice, who is using all her magic to open the gate, will be swept away.
‘I can control the water by using the wave spell.’
The problem is, if he’s going to use a Holy Law that can melt an ice wall of this size, and then use another one to control the water, he won’t have the energy to follow it up.
He can do it, but he can’t waste his holy power as recklessly as he used to, so he has to be careful.
“No, I have people I can trust.”
Leon knows who they are. What he can do, they can do.
“Holy sword.”
From the subspace, the Holy Sword emerges from its sheath.
It takes a great deal of power just to summon it, and it appears before Leon.
He channels his power into the holy sword drawn from the scabbard of the first Lionheart King.
The flames of Petos envelop it and the holy sword’s brilliance shines in all directions.
He has one wish for the holy sword.
‘Cut down all winter before me.’
He swings the blazing pillar of fire.
The plane plummets toward the ice wall with the contradiction of its own weight.
────■■■■■■■■!!
The ice wall collapses upon impact with the fireball.
As it melted, the evaporated water vapor rose as steam. And then──
-Kaaaaaah!!!
The unevaporated water pours out in waves. It would sweep away not only the demons but also the allies.
“Should we stop here?”
After retracting his holy sword into subspace, Leon continued to use the power of the sea and waves.
Holy Technique <Wave Strike>
The enormous mass that seemed to be about to turn everything into a sea stopped. It unnaturally stopped in midair, just as Leon wished, using the power of the waves.
Some might call it foolhardy.
Why would he expend his power to block a wave when he could sweep away hundreds or thousands of demons at the cost of one ally?
But Leon’s gaze is drawn beyond the stilled waves, where he hears the sound of horses’ hooves, a sound that cannot come from the center of tens of thousands of tons of water.
“The Baltan Flaming Sword Knights.”
The Lionheart King commanded them and those who had broken free of the two-hundred-year seal and would face anything.
“Destroy the enemy.”
Without hesitation, the Knights respond.
“”Atrocity!””
“”Atrocity!””
“”Atrocity!””
Flames rise from their breath, leaving a horseshoe-shaped trail of sparks in the center of the room.
“”Merciless death…!””
The Templars burst from their long seals.
The flame-forged riders of the War God resume the battle they left unfinished two centuries ago.

chapters.title: Chapter 157: Holy Knight Vulcanus (1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 157: Holy Knight Vulcanus (1)
Standing back from the battlefield and watching the battle, Beatrice couldn’t help but be impressed.
Strong.
Purely strong.
She couldn’t help but think so as she watched the Flaming Sword Knights.
She had seen the last battle of the Lionheart Kingdom. She had fought alongside them, and there were Holy Knights among them, and Templars who followed them.
But she hadn’t kept a close eye on them since she could only hold her ground in the middle of a war of such magnitude.
It would be the first time she would ever see the Holy Knights in combat this close.
‘Can we even call this a battle?’
A huge knight in heavy armor swung his flaming sword and with that simple act demons died in droves.
What the demons feared most was their breakthrough.
Legion Technique <Wedge Charge>
A group formation technique used by the mounted troops of the Realm Knights as a basic skill.
As long as they are human, as long as they do not exceed human size, they will break through the heavy mass of the enemy as if they were exempt from the laws of physics.
-Reinforcements!
-Come on! Help!
Demons continued to pour in through the Demon Gate, their numbers increasing by the hundreds with each passing hour.
The number of demons has already exceeded four thousand. But──
“We, the war horsemen of Petos, have sworn an arduous march toward the Hill of Fire!”
“Through countless battles, sometimes victorious, sometimes defeated…!”
“With a heart of fire that will not be quenched!”
“Willing to run to the death…!”
“”War shall lead us to the banquet table!””
The Flaming Sword Knights, on the other hand, numbered barely fifty but demons crumbled before their frenzied violence.
As the mountains of corpses pile up and the wails of souls ring out, they are forced to retreat, even with a hundred times their numbers.
-Do not retreat! Advance!
Even the demons ordering the advance.
“No mercy!”
“Kill them all!”
-Monsters, monsters! Run! Retreat!
Demons shouting retreat.
“No prisoners!”
“”Kill them all!”
They grant death equally like angels of death.
It’s a rare sight to see demons cower in the face of such unbridled, ferocious violence.
Ruthless violence washed away the stains of evil. They were advancing when──
-Velotas! Velotas!
-Velotas! Velotas!
The mood in the rear transformed.
The fleeing demons let out a cheer and stopped running.
[Alas… they woke up after all]
It was an Archdemon with an enormous bulk.
The possessor of a terrible magic power that made one feel disgusted and turn away just by looking at it.
Its snow-white skin was chilling, and the breath it exhaled merged with the cold of the glacial continent to form absolute zero.
An Archdemon of sloth and idleness, an adaptor of the cold continent and the only being on this glacial continent that can move without restraint.
-Cold Velotas!
Archdemon Velotas has personally led his legions to the Ice Continent.
“Tarhan! Fall back and regroup!”
“Galatan! Maintain the flanks and reinforce the defenses at the front!”
Laihar, the Third Sword of the Flaming Sword Knights, reorganized the Knights. They formed up in an orderly fashion, even though their horses could barely find a place amidst the piles of demon corpses.
“Your Majesty, the Archdemon.”
Beatrice glanced at Leon. Until now, she’d had to keep her magic in check, but now that the Archdemon and his legions had appeared, she or Leon would have to step up.
But Leon was holding back thousands of tons of water from the melting of the ice wall with his holy spell.
Beatrice looks back at the Templars. She managed to keep her magic intact so far, but without Leon, they’d have to deal with the Archdemon on their own.
‘I’m sure we’ll be able to work something out when His Majesty arrives…….’
But having wasted her magic, opening the gate and retreating would have to wait.
At the moment Beatrice made up her mind and Velotas shouted for the demons to advance-──
-Currrrrrrr…!
Shaking the ground… no, the continent.
Something, something huge, is about to be unleashed.
-……!!
“”……!!””
Archdemon Velotas unleashed the full force of his magic.
-Bam…! Bam! Bam! Bam──Bam!
A huge ice cube that was a kilometer in diameter formed in thin air. The Glacial Continent is a special continent, and Velotas’ magic power is amplified by more than ten times.
The half-melted ice crashed into the wall of ice, creating a dizzying crashing sound, but──
-It’s too late…
But it was already too late…
Fragments of ice were splintering in real time, and from within something stretched out.
It’s a finger.
The fingers of a man reaching outward, crushing the pressure of thousands, no, tens of thousands of tons of ice.
-What the… what the… what the hell!
-Why is that bastard free!
In bewilderment and anger, the demons’ memories go back.
The monster that once invaded this world and the terrible disaster that left the Archduke dead in the flames of battle.
The Holy Knight whom the demons ultimately failed to subdue.
“Heavy.”
Velotas dropped the tons of ice that froze space and time.
He used the word ‘heavy’ to describe it.
“I am Vulcanus.”
The saint’s voice flowed, his breath a flame and his actions a banner to the next war.
Advent────
“I am Vulcanus…!!”
────.
Flame pours from his fingers, from the gaps in his armor, from the visor of his helmet… from his entire body.
It swallowed ice, evaporated water, and melted continents.
In three seconds, the flames stretched thirty kilometers in length and it took five seconds for a fire giant composed of nothing but fire to descend.
-Ah, ah…….
Velotas had witnessed the majesty of the Holy Knight’s descent into divinity, and even that was an outrageous monster.
But… this creature before him, the Archdemon understood, was far beyond that.
It was a miracle of the gods that the Archduke risked his life to bring down someone that challenged the demigods themselves.
-Vanish!
Velotas wove the magic of the half-melted glacial continent into his own. It was a massive maneuver that even Beatrice would be aghast at.
The miraculous maneuver of great magic that only he, the only blessed one on this glacial continent, could perform, dropped chunks of ice comparable to meteorites from the sky.
To use an analogy, Velotas’ ice magic is called a cannonball because its power is so great and vast but it’s even bigger than a shell.
Would it really be defined as a ‘cannonball’ in the eyes of a giant so huge that even a kilometer-diameter cannonball would have to be squashed?
Velotas witnessed the answer.
“Death to evil.”
Sparks flew toward the hail of ice shells.
The flames pouring from the gaps in his armor were enough to melt continents and against such a giant, Velotas’ great magic is──
“Die, scum.”
A catapult thrown by a child, a mere provocation but this adult is not the least bit merciful.
The giant’s flames scorched the cold world thoroughly.
* * * * *
The outcome of the battle need not be debated.
The legions led by Velotas, the Archdemon of sloth and idleness, were thoroughly crushed by the fifty Realm Knights and a single Holy Knight while the frozen continent, once frozen in time and space, was melted.
The Knights of the Flaming Sword rallied around a man who was a spark of God himself.
Under his influence, their armor blazed with overflowing flames.
“Khhhhh…!”
“Hot, hot, hot, it seems like it’s been a long time!”
The Flaming Sword Knights let go of their shields. It was a shield that didn’t miss even when the demons charged at them in unison.
They flashed their flaming swords and shouted like warriors worshiping a warrior god.
“Butchers!”
“Beheaders!”
“Infidel slaughterers!”
“Agent of Divine Punishment!”
“Horseman of Doom!”
After receiving the adoration and worship of all of them, Vulcanus turned to face Leon.
“Lionheart King! I salute you, Leon Dragonia Lionheart…!”
-Thud!
The giant being dropped to one knee. Thus, the Knights of the Flaming Sword give him the homage he deserves.
“”All of the Knights of the Baltan Flaming Sword…! We offer the Heart of Fire to the Most Glorious Lionheart King!””
Accepting the tribute from the mighty Holy Knight and his knights, the King smiles broadly.
“I’m glad to see you still have some blood in your veins, though it’s nice to enjoy the sea after two hundred years.”
Leon’s gaze traveled to where Vulcanus had been.
-Ahhhhhh…!
A monstrous beast with a massive presence pulses the air with rage, displaying its power.
────!!!
That’s not all. Not only the demons that Vulcanus swept aside, but demons that have sensed the anomaly in the Glacial Continent are opening gates from all directions and leaping towards them.
“Lord Vulcanus, which side will you take?”
“I will cut my ties with him myself…!”
“Then I’ll play the supporting role, not the lead. Make sure you take care of it.”
“Hahahahahaha…!”
Vulcanus gripped his holy swords with a boisterous laugh.
“Death to evil…!”
It was time to end the fight from two hundred years ago.
* * * *
It had been ten days since gates had sprung up all over the world. In other words, gates that started Dungeon Breaks also existed.
“Dungeon Break, evacuate quickly!”
The soldier’s urgent words sent the citizens fleeing in a panic, forcing them to climb an unmarked evacuation route.
“Damn it, why didn’t we find it?!”
“It must have been at the bottom of Chungju Lake. No, who knew that lakes could have gates?”
Over the past ten days, the Hunters, commanded and controlled by Lord Yakt Spinner of the TTG Temple, had cleared most of the gates with perfect raid formations and methodical attacks.
But even with Yappy control, there were bound to be some gates they couldn’t find, due to too many magical reactions.
“It seems that Europe and the United States have somehow managed to defend themselves.”
“They say our defense was overwhelmingly successful. We only had three dungeon breaks.”
He shuddered to think what was like in other countries, especially continents with dozens of countries that don’t have the resources, or countries with backward systems.
Normally, the United Nations or neighboring countries would send reinforcements, but they could barely deal with their issues.
“Corporal Kim, we’re done with the evacuees, we should evacuate too…!”
-Gahhhhhhhhhh…!
An ominous guttural sound was heard and everyone knew it couldn’t belong to an animal living in Earth’s ecosystem.
“Monsters are emerging!”
A monster that seemed to resemble a giant crocodile rushed fiercely towards the soldiers. The soldiers fired their rifles, but the rifles of infantrymen couldn’t even kill an entity of that size.
“Uhhhhhh…!”
The first victim was about to appear.
“Get down!”
The voice came from somewhere, and his ducking saved his life.
Dag-dag-dag-dag-dag!
They were knights on horseback, with a red-haired girl at their head.
“Ha, Han Ha-ri!”
Legion Technique <Wedge Charge>.
The knights charge at the monsters. They’ve just finished closing a gate nearby, and they’ve come as reinforcements!
“Corporal Kim, are you okay!”
“Ugh! I’m back from the dead! What are you doing?”
Corporal Kim gripped his gun. His gaze turned to the Knights, who had already defeated the monster and were running toward the source of the Dungeon Break.
“Let’s get the last of them and give them a little help!”
“Bring all the armored vehicles! The artillery firepower is effective against monsters!”
* * * * *
-Chew!
The monsters screamed as the knights’ spears pierced them.
The situation was serious in the Chungju Lake Dungeon Break, where the Knights of the TTG Temple had arrived.
-Crackle!
The thunder summoned by the Knight of Sky and Thunder, Kim Jae-hyuk, stunned the giant beast. He fixed his lightning-encrusted spear and said.
“Senior Ha-ri, we’re running out of firepower! Please shoot some fire!”
“Now, wait a minute, I’m at full strength too!”
In the past ten days, the Knights of the Ten Thousand Gods Temple had closed more than a dozen gates.
The reason why they were able to close the gates at such a high speed was because of the four Knights of the Ten Thousand Gods who were using the power of the holy artifacts.
Han Ha-ri, Han Soo-ho, Kim Jae-hyuk, and Chun So-yeon.
Aside from the fact that they are outside Yappy standard, they inherited the holy relic from Isabelle, the High Priestess of the Moon and Purity, and each one of them is an S-class power.
Ha-ri, in particular, received the bracelet of waves left behind by Three Seas and Waves High Priestess, and the Heart of Fire left behind by the First War and Flame Holy Knight, making her stronger than the S-class.
‘If only I had the approval of the Holy Grail!’
The bracelet has somehow lent her strength, but the Heart of Fire is the problem.
Although she has become much more skilled with fire than before, this ferocious and tyrannical energy does not recognize her.
“Senior Ha-ri, there’s danger over here, total danger, a boss monster has jumped out!”
“Boss?!”
Dungeon Breaks literally spits out everything in the dungeon. As annoying as the miasma is, the last thing they want to see in a dungeon break is the dungeon boss.
“Ugh… it’s big!”
The gate to Chungju Lake is rated orange, and the boss monster that emerges from it is a giant snake that requires you to look up until your head hurts.
“Is this, like, an Imugi (dragon) or something?”
“Whatever it is, it’s serious…….”
She whined, but she couldn’t give up so Ha-ri raised her Star Iron Sword and unleashed a blast of flame.
“Aaaahhh! Lord Petos…!”
The power and prayer would soon be transformed into flames. With that, somehow──
[Oh, no, this guy? Oh, no, I can’t, I’ve spent all my power!]
-Pooh!
Petos’ panicked voice aside, the flame that Ha-ri was about to swing went out with a whoosh.
“……?”
The flame went out and it wasn’t just Ha-ri.
-Hey! Why is it suddenly stopping?
-No, no, no! The fire just died! There’s no flame!
-What, what! Petos? Petos?!
-Switch to Arianna’s power! Damn, it wasn’t just him!
Petos worshippers across the country, dedicated to the god of war and flame, were in a panic.
“What the hell is going on?”
Ha-ri desperately sought out Petos, but the God of War seemed too busy to answer.

chapters.title: Chapter 158: Holy Knight Vulcanus (2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 158: Holy Knight Vulcanus (2)
More than 200 years ago, on the plains of Randolce in the Lionheart Kingdom.
There, the Demon Legion, led by Archduke Glacier, clashed with the Knights of the Burning Sword and their allies, led by Vulcanus.
They were outnumbered ten to one and everyone expected the demons victory. But──
“I am Vulcanus…!”
He was the embodiment of irresistible, overwhelming violence.
The strongest Holy Knight, who had been given two holy swords by the Blacksmith’s Holy Knight with great care.
With each swing of his one-handed greatsword, waves of fire covered the battlefield, cremating demons in a flame that left no ashes behind.
-Strong.
The Glacial Archduke acknowledged his strength and that he was the second strongest Holy Knight next to the Lionheart King.
-I admit it. You’re stronger!
Archduke Glacier opened the Demon Gate.
In this united front to destroy the Holy Kingdom of Lionheart, he is the supreme commander representing the demons of sloth and idleness.
His absence would tear a hole in the coalition and give up the souls of the Holy Knights, promised as spoils in a war already won…….
-Survival comes before loot.
Archduke Glacier was very wise, and made a much more sensible choice than the rest of the Demon Legion, who remained to consider the sunk costs of losing their later Lord of Wisdom.
Only──
“Where are you running……!!!”
It was just that the Holy Knight he was dealing with was extremely irrational.
He had opened the Demon Gate, taking only a handful of Archdemons and elites with him, and retreated to his estate.
Magul was the home base of the Demon Archduke of Sloth and Idleness.
That’s where Vulcanus and his knights chased them down before the Demon Gate closed!
-Madman, this is my territory!
“No…!”
The flames pouring from the Holy Knight’s armor intensified. It burned through the surrounding magick, dyeing the sky red.
“This place, that place, this place, that place, all the land of the gods!”
Vulcanus along with his knights and the demons of sloth and idleness that had retreated continued the battle.
But was the momentum of the battle? Or was it that Vulcanus was simply too powerful?
High-level demons were being slaughtered, Archdemons were being broken through, and Vulcanus’ sword was being swung at the Glacial Archduke…
“A human…! I have to gamble with my soul on a human!”
Archduke Glacier unleashed his last great magic by combining all of his magic power to freeze space and time.
This freezing of space and time was an absolute binding that even a Lord-level demon could not break. In other words, no external force could break it, and he himself would be trapped……….
“As time passes, he will lose his connection to the gods, and I will regain my power!
This is the Demon Realm, the domain of the Demon Overlord. On the day the seal is broken, he will be greeted by a vast army of demons, and he and his few tin foil hats will be swallowed up by a tidal wave of evil.
-Thud!
[Finally…!]
Glacial Archduke Kadsha sensed the loose seal and opened his eyes.
Although he had only been fighting Vulcanus a moment ago, a great deal of time must have passed.
[The time has come to avenge my humiliation, Knight of the Gods, for I, Archduke Glacier, will…!]
Raising his massive body, Archduke Glacier, snow giant Kadsha looked at his strangely ‘hot’ skin and the red sky, puzzled.
Even though the magic had been released after a thousand years, it was still a great magic that could freeze the continent.
Its traces alone should have created a tremendous cold snap, so why is it so hot and…….
The white giant’s gaze fell to the ground below, where a vast amount of water was evaporating in real time, creating a steam sauna.
‘I wonder if he woke up with me.’
This is getting annoying. I can’t believe he had this much energy left after being disconnected from his god for so long.
But it doesn’t matter, they must have summoned his legions when the seal was broken, and he must have been weakened during the seal.
Unless the Grail Guardian, the monstrous creature that killed Malus, the Lord of Chaos, come, there’s no way to bow to him-
Blond hair, blue eyes, a handsome man, perhaps even a stereotype, but the demons who saw his face couldn’t forget the image that was burned into their minds.
“To the Lionheart…! Glory be!”
The otherworldly Lionheart King who had killed the Chaos Lord and slaughtered millions of demons.
[Why…!?]
Archduke Glacier couldn’t believe his eyes when he saw the Lionheart King in front of him.
This is the Demon Realm. Even though it was tainted by the overwhelming flames of holy power, the miasma that filled the world was unmistakably the one he knew.
But why? Why is the Lionheart King here?
[You… are alive!]
Leon tilted his head at the Archduke Glacier shout.
“This is the first time I’ve met a demon who hasn’t received the latest information. For two hundred years, they’ve been cowering in fear in my presence.”
Two hundred years? Two hundred years since he was sealed?
[It can’t be! The Lord of Wisdom had ten million troops! There’s no way you guys could have survived──!]
“Shut up, evil creature…!”
Vulcanus shouted in anger and struck the Glacial Archduke with Petos’ flashing holy sword.
Vulcanus crushed the Glacial Archduke with a blast of infinite flame.
“Do not mention Lionheart with that filthy mouth of yours. Don’t you dare defile my lord and my ears!”
[You…! On the subject of savage tin cans…!]
Archduke Glacier unleashed an immense amount of magic power. Although the area has been purified by the sanctification, it is still strictly the demon realm.
His power connects to the world and presses against Vulcanus.
The demons gathered, one after another, with a massive presence. The great demonic forces triggered by Velotas death have been observed, and they are rushing to the continent.
“Even as we speak…the demons are coming. Hurry, Lord Vulcanus, we must get out of here quickly.”
“Death to evil…!”
Leaving Vulcanus behind, who was already engaged in combat with the Glacial Archduke, Leon chuckled at the gathering demons.
“Knights of the Baltan Flaming Sword.”
Leon said to the fifty knights.
“Follow me.”
──Then shall we be victorious.
* * * * *
–Crack, crack!
The world freezes.
A great spear of ice is formed from the moisture in the air, and it rushed in like a dizzying storm of ice caps──
“Grrrrrrrrrrrr!!!”
For the Red Knight, whose breath is a burning flame, evaporating the flying spear of ice is a matter of course.
[────!!]
Kadsha, the Glacial Archduke, was in awe.
The Demon Realm is more than just a place to live, it’s their foundation, their source.
For demons with estates, their home grounds are fortresses that repel the thieves who seek them out.
By the time they reach the age of lords and archdukes, they’ve been defending it for tens or hundreds of millions of years. It’s not an exaggeration to say that the manor itself has been assimilated by the demon and become its own body.
Of course, in the case of Glacial Archduke Kadsha, he had expended a great deal of energy to perfect a space-time magic in this estate that even a Lord could not touch in order to seal the Red Knight who was trying to kill him.
In other words──
[C’mon…! Stop your footsteps, you monster…!]
This means that even two hundred years ago, Kadsha was unable to repel that knight from his estate.
Numerous great spells are completed in an instant. The Demon Archduke, wielding the power of the realm, could unleash any number of magic spells he wanted, but none of them could stop that knight.
“Ignorant bastard, wasting power like that!”
There’s a limit to the amount of power a human can hold, and yet he poured it out as if he were a god himself.
Grand Technique <Crimson Meteor>
Vulcanus unleashes a frenzy of power that makes the demons scream.
As it leaps, it looks like a meteor rising backwards into the sky, and when it finally reaches the end of the universe-─
“Die, demon…!”
It fell with gravitational acceleration, aiming for planetary entry.
[Ouch…!]
Kadsha recalled the same memory from just a moment ago when a legion was swept away by that nonsense.
He’s a knight that doesn’t use horses, a ridiculous man who can travel between continents, so unless he’s joining the other Knights, he doesn’t even use transportation!
[Don’t think I’m going to get caught twice!]
With the Power of the Realm the Archduke can channel and manifest directed magical power.
He is both a warrior and an archmage. He may not be the Lord of Wisdom, but his magic is no less than the miracles of the Holy Law!
[A mere mortal making me unleash Great Magic twice!]
He draws upon the power of the realm and unleashes an energy-draining Great Magic.
It even saved Kadsha from the brink of death two hundred years ago.
[Frozen in time and space…!]
With the help of the realm, magic is manifested in the line of the meteor.
A miracle that could be called ‘magic’, such as freezing space and time, was limited to Vulcanus himself.
No human vessel can resist it, not even the Demon Archduke himself!
-Pow!
Space freezes and the meteor that was hurtling toward Kadsha stopped when it was three hundred meters away from him.
If it weren’t for the blowing snow and roaring flames, one would have thought that time had stopped.
[Ha, hot…! Did it stop?]
This is not a force that can be countered from the front. Even the most powerful Holy Knights were doomed once they were caught.
[I need to merge with the Legion before the Lionheart King can help──]
Suddenly, he looks up and sees Vulcanus frozen in space and holding a holy sword.
[One sword?]
Where did the other one go?
Just then, a holy sword falls from the crimson sky. The flame, compressed to the limit of Petos’ power, is like the fury of a god about to unleash heavenly punishment on the earth.
It lands precisely where it froze space and time.
[Thrown from orbit!]
Kadsha was not the only one who would not be caught twice. Vulcanus has also found a way to deal with the magic he was struck 200 years ago!
[Vulcanus’ Holy Sword – War God’s Flame!]
The holy sword pierced through the frozen space-time with a compressed flame──
“Grrrrrrrrrrrr…!”
Just as Leon had done, Vulcanus evaporated the frozen space on his own, and the meteor’s acceleration did not decrease.
[…Stop it!]
Kadsha summons a massive wall of ice, that became a huge shield and blocked Vulcanus, but──
-Ka-ching!
The ice wall was literally destroyed by a single blow as if an all-piercing spear had pierced through the shield.
[Vulcanus…!]
The same development repeats itself.
No, not the same. Any hopes that such a ridiculous display of holy prowess could have left him with anything left to spare were shattered by the merciless violence as Vulcanus’ advance continues unabated.
‘This cannot be!’
The Lionhearted King is the proxy for all the gods.
The Chaos Lord was defeated by the Lionheart, and so were the other lords who could not defeat him in the end.
He might have had an excuse for losing against the gods representative but the monster in front of him, expending such vast amounts of energy, pummeling him so ignorantly…The Demon Archduke is defeated by an ‘individual’?
[This cannot be!]
Vulcanus declared, evaporating the freeze that now seemed to have overtaken common sense beyond anger.
“You arrogant scum of the earth, the end of your era will be brought down by your arrogance!”
Kadsha, frozen for two hundred years, does not know that the pinnacle of the ages has already crushed the waves of the Great Sea that seemed unreachable.
A demigod, an agent of the divine, has done so and the exalted fighter reversed the malignity of destruction.
How arrogant to think that miracle, that feat, could not be accomplished by another.
-Crack!
The final shattering blow was like a meteor from the apocalyptic orbit that had so easily consumed everything in its path.
The unfinished battle of two hundred years ago has finally come to an end.

chapters.title: Chapter 159: Holy Knight Vulcanus (3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 159: Holy Knight Vulcanus (3)
After Leon opened the gate to the Demon Realm with Beatrice, the gate was guarded by the Association.
The gate that Beatrice opened doesn’t produce magic stones or dungeon breaks, but if Leon were to come out, he would need to be informed of the situation in Korea.
“Chief Kim, it’s almost time to change shifts.”
“Is it already?”
Kim Jin-soo glanced at his watch at his subordinate’s words. He flicked his cigarette into a portable ashtray and fiddled with his cell phone.
“By the way, Chief Kim, one of the deputies was crying on Dantok, did you see it?”
“Ha-ri? Why?”
“All of a sudden, the God of War and Flame powers were disabled.”
“Huh? Really?”
Since the landing of the Wandering Magic Sword in Japan, the belief in the Ten Thousand Gods has spread rapidly in both Japan and Korea.
Kim Jin-soo had recently become a follower of Arianna, the goddess of light and justice, and he had learned the holy laws, so it was rather awkward to hear that the holy laws were ‘not working’.
“The gods don’t take away favors.”
“It’s not just one deputy, it’s the other God War believers as well. The connection is still there, it’s just the Holy Law that’s not working.”
That was definitely a first. Among the growing number of Holy Law users in the country, the most of them are followers of the god Petos.
Not surprisingly, they’re mostly hunters and soldiers who have to attack gates.
“That sounds like a lot of work, but don’t those who worship the God of War usually also worship the Goddess of Justice?”
“It is said that faith in light and justice are the basic qualities of a warrior.”
Then why was only the war god’s power taken? Kim Jin-soo thought of something.
“That’s because the Holy Knights share holy power with the gods.”
That was the reason why Holy Knights’ power was ridiculously higher than normal knights.
Borrowing power and sharing power were two different things.
“You mean King Leon?”
“No, he’s different. The Grail Guardian said he could use any power and transform it as needed.”
The Grail Guardian, unlike the Holy Knights, is a representative of all the gods. They have access to all of the faith that the gods have gathered through the Lionheart.
If Leon had drawn so much holy power that he was unable to use the Holy Laws, then all the Holy Laws would be unavailable, not just those of Petos.
“Ugh… What the hell happened?”
Probably it was because the king opened the gate and disappeared.
‘That’s dangerous… Dungeon Breaks are about to explode all over the place while the TTG Temple’s maximized power wanes.’
The team was having a hard time dealing with this massive gate situation.
There are not enough ‘helicopters’ to deal with gates in remote areas.
‘There is still no news about the red gate in Seongnam.’
I had no idea that the existence of TTG Temple, which clears gates indiscriminately without economic calculation, was so great.
In particular, the presence of Leon and Beatrice, who are beyond S-class power, is a power that is desperately needed right now.
‘Please return quickly, Your Majesty…!’
Chief Kim Jin-soo prayed that he would return as soon as possible and was about to contact the higher-ups of the Association in frustration when he received a message──
────!!!
The gate had been opened from the other side and a searing heat escaped from the place.
“It’s His Majesty!”
Kim Jin-soo and the association’s staff automatically kneeled down on one knee to greet the king.
They had already received enough lessons in etiquette to satisfy even Leon.
“To His Majesty the Lionheart, Sir──!”
Boom!
Something bounced out of the gate and realizing that it was the head of a creature, Kim Jin-soo glanced at it.
“Oh…….”
It was an amazing head, endlessly evil, not like the field boss of the gate and he felt that if he made eye contact with it, he would die of a curse.
“You can just go in there.”
“Sorry, your Majesty, I thought it might actually lead to another world.”
Just then, a group of people emerge from the gate. The Association employees were delighted to see Leon and Beatrice, but soon stopped at the sight of the armored hordes that came with them.
They felt crushed by the mere sight of them and instinctively realized that these are dangerous beings.
Everyone realized that the hulking knight next to Leon was of a different class.
“Your Majesty!”
