Chief Kim Jin-soo steps forward on behalf of his subordinates. Leon recognized him and returned the greeting.
“You must be Chief Kim.”
“Yes!”
“Ah, yes. That head, keep it. It’s loot that needs to be used.”
“What the hell is that…….?”
“It is the head of the Glacier Archduke.”
“Huh…!”
The Glacier Archduke? You mean the Demon Archduke? The gate Leon said he went through was in the Demon Realm, and he killed a Demon Archduke there?
“Oh, King Lionheart…….”
I’ll only believe in your Majesty!
The envious glances of Director Kim Jin-soo and the Association staff gathered but Leon took the stares directed at him for granted.
“By the way, what’s all the fuss about?”
Beatrice asked, puzzled by the guild members who still hadn’t greeted them.
“Yes, it’s…….”
Kim Jin-soo reported about the absent Templars and Man-At-Arms, as well as Yappy, who was in charge of the Korean Hunters.
“I see. What’s urgent now?”
“……!”
Chief Kim exclaimed.
* * * *
After the massive gate incident, the Korean Hunters raiding parties, led by Yakt Spinner, quickly attacked the gates.
The gates that were selected and combined by the strong artificial intelligence were categorized and prioritized by the raiders.
After capturing the gate, the ROK military helicopters were deployed to move quickly.
Some in the chain of command wondered if it was giving too much power to a machine, but they were left speechless by Yappy’s discernment, which soon began to prove itself.
Yappy’s thoroughness allowed it to make real-time adjustments to the movement of the raiders based on data, coordinates, movement history, and calculated threats.
His command skills aside, it was impossible for him to respond in time to gates popping up all over the country.
Gate capture is not something that can be accomplished in a day or two. It usually takes four to five days for a properly-ranked raiding team to capture a gate.
400 gates appeared in Korea in 10 days and even if hunters organize raid teams from scratch, there are more than a dozen ‘dungeon breaks’ due to failed raids, tight schedules, and abnormal gates.
“Palace lord…! I can’t take it anymore!”
Gyeongbu Highway Gate, summoned in the middle of the highway, was the gate that Yappy had ordered to be attacked first.
It was a yellow-ranked gate, so it had been a week since the second group under the Hanbit Palace had entered. They thought they would be able to complete the assault easily, but they failed miserably.
“So it’s a fluctuating gate…….”
Yes, it is. This light highway gate is a fluctuation gate disguised as a yellow gate but the estimated attack rating is red.
Normally, they would have responded immediately, but their guild leader, Park Yong-shin, had captured two yellow gates in Wando in quick succession.
Yong-wan’s Firebird Guild and Hunter Association leader Oh Kang-hyuk, who had volunteered to join the raiding party at Hanbit Palace, rallied as reserves to stop the dungeon brakes.
“Brother Lee Yong-wan, we can’t block the entrance anymore, there are too many large objects!”
“Damn it… Our boys are tired too, Mr. Association President, let’s pull back and reorganize our formation. I don’t think it’s time to worry about miasma pollution!”
Park Yong-shin, Lee Yong-wan, and Oh Kang-hyuk were the only three S-class Hunters, but even so, they couldn’t stop the waves of monsters coming out of the fluctuation gate.
“If I had known it would be like this, I would have brought Yuri Yang!”
“I should have brought the Deputy Palace Lord too.”
“…….”
Oh Kang-hyuk swallowed hard and kept his eyes on the monsters pouring out of the broken gate.
They are so short-staffed that he, the president of the association, has to go to the front lines himself. He had hoped to enlist the help of the Japanese Hunter’s Association, with whom he had recently strengthened ties, but the unprecedented outbreak of three red gates in a row made that impossible.
‘That’s why Korea can afford it. Thanks to the troops he raised.’
The knights of the Ten Thousand Gods Temple are strong, but the most fearsome are the Man-At-Arms who have surpassed five thousand.
The D-ranked Hunters, who have been treated as baggage, have organized themselves into formations and are now as formidable as A-ranked raiders.
Their strength is in numbers. Under the tutelage of the Lionheart King, they have been thoroughly trained in group discipline and holy power.
Their power is multiplied when paired with a Knight Commander, who scatters commander-level buffs.
In Korea before TTG Temple, Dungeon Break would have been a disaster.
‘But there’s still a big difference in power with and without him.’
Even a Knight class can scatter Commander skill-level buffs, but Leon’s buffs are ridiculous.
It’s true that TTG Temple has gathered a lot of power, but that’s only a numerical advantage. The overwhelming quality advantage comes from the presence of the Lionheart King and the Holy Knights.
“Tell the Hunters that I’ll break through the line myself.”
“Mr. President?”
Park Yong-shin and Lee Yong-wan’s eyes widened when they heard that the Association President was going to lead the charge himself.
“I hope the boss monster is an easy one.”
Oh Kang-hyuk is a legendary Hunter in Korea. He’s defeated every single one of them, even the S-class bosses.
-Kieieieieieieieieie…!
With a terrible roar, the last monster emerged from the gate.
“Holy shit…….”
A skull-masked mage, jet-black robes billowing in the air, a rotting staff of dead wood in his gnarled bony arms.
It was an Ark Lich, the worst of the S-class monsters, with Death Knights as its bodyguards, the finest of the undead.
“Damn, an Ark Lich.”
Yong-wan gritted his teeth and let go of the arrow but physical attacks against this entity are halved in effectiveness.
“Lord Park!”
“What is it, brother?”
“You’re King Lionheart’s faithful dog, don’t you know how to use the Holy Law?”
“Dog… that’s too much for a sinner like me, I’m not even worthy to lick his paws.”
He’s actually happy here? Yong-wan was afraid of Park Yong-shin’s mentality.
“Anyway, to answer your question, I can’t use the Holy Law. The gods don’t give their favor to sinners.”
“Does this mean that a sociopath is a bigger sinner than an unbeliever? Damn…….”
It was a lost cause.
“Since it’s like this, we need to cut down the escort power, those Death Knights alone are annoying!”
These Death Knights are worthy of being the boss of any gate. Even an A-ranked raiding party will not be safe if they collide with them head-on──
“”Ravage the enemy…!””
It was at that moment that a group of anachronistic cavalry came out of nowhere.
For a moment, he thought it was the Knights of the TTG Temple, but their momentum was incomparable.
“Red…Knights?”
“Uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!”
Fifty horses raced down the highway, led by the Lionheart King and a hulking knight.
Their speed is obviously strange and the highway stretched in a straight line, like a sports car with an overheated engine.
[…….]
The Ark Lich puts up a dense barrier against the horde of horses that suddenly appeared behind him. His command group is reinforced by powerful magical powers and can withstand a head-on collision with a 20-ton truck.
A bunch of anachronistic horses──
“Glory to the Lionheart!!!”
[Mighty Charge] is applied to the unit.
At the moment of the crash, something soars into the sky.
When he realized that it was the corpse giant who had been wielding the club in the lead, the Lionheart King, holding the Holy Sword, appeared in front of him.
[……!]
The Ark Lich flinched. Where the hell were his escorts, the Death Knights?
“GRARARARARARA──!”
They were being torn apart by the screaming red knight with his unbelievable strength.
“How dare you turn honorable knights into ghosts! Your sins are deep.”
[You…!]
A brilliantly shining holy sword dug into Ark Lich’s chest as he tried to manipulate magic.
-Kuuk…!
The holy sword pierced through Ark Lich’s chest in a single blow.
“Your Majesty, the Ark Lich has a Life Vessel that holds his soul! If we don’t destroy it, the Lich will die──”
It was then that the Ark Lich, who had been pierced by Leon’s holy sword, let out a terrible scream.
“This king, agent of the gods, has commanded. Destroy the dead soul.”
It doesn’t matter if it has a Life Vessel that hides its soul or not. Even demons from across dimensions can be destroyed by the Knights of the Lionheart.
No mere undead wretch can escape their annihilating power!
“Oh, no…!”
In the process of annihilating the soul, the Ark Lich unleashed a great magic that bordered on madness. He gathered all the corpses and formed them into a single mass that would self-destruct!
“Die, fiend!”
In an instant, a fiery holy sword of terrible heat consumed the corpses and the flame of the God of War was so powerful that it left not even a soul behind, let alone a skeleton.
“Ah, ah…….”
Despairing in the face of overwhelming power, the Ark Lich crumbled to dust.
Watching the scene, Park Yon-shin exclaimed in ecstasy.
“King, be all-powerful…!”
“”Long live the king…!””
The worshippers of the Hanbit Palace fell to their knees in worship. They weren’t the only ones, some of the Hunters joined in the worship.

chapters.title: Chapter 160: Temporary Break
chapters.content:
Chapter 160: Temporary Break
The massive gate outbreak that swept across the country was put to rest by Leon’s return.
Leon and Beatrice, who are unofficially classified as “out of spec” beyond being S-class hunters, and Vulcanus and his 50 knights, who are smashing through the gates at lightning speed.
-Wow, what the hell is that?
-The Holy Knights.
-They smashed the red gate dungeon brakes and cleared three orange gates in one day.
-There’s no other group of monsters like them in the world.
It’s like a hundred S-class Hunters have formed a super party…….
Their strength was beyond imagination. Usually, A-ranked raiders spend a week raiding and clearing an orange gate.
The Red Gate required an S-grade raid team with two S-grade Hunters and 50 veteran A-grade hunters.
But they just had overwhelming firepower and tactical ability…….
-Holy Knight Vulcanus is a total badass, isn’t he?
-A-class Field Boss is a one-shot kill. Crazy.
-It’s an out-of-the-ordinary skill that connects the Lionheart King, Magician Queen, and Yakt Spinner.
-They all belong to the TTG Temple.
-Lol
Vulcanus, Holy Knight of War and Flame, a survivor of the same world as Leon, certainly made his presence felt as he slaughtered the monsters that jumped out of the dungeon break.
“Awesome.”
Takeda, the head of Japan’s New Hunter Association, was at the scene of the Red Gate Dungeon Break.
Three Red Gates were summoned at the same time, an unprecedented event. The gates had been summoned from all over the country, and the hunters had been mobilized.
He managed to close one of the three, but failed to close the other two, forcing him to prepare for a dungeon break.
Having lost many S-class Hunters to the murderous Archduke Akasha, Japan was in need of foreign assistance, and turned to the TTG Temple, bound together by the bonds of the same faith……..
[Your Majesty, we need reinforcements.]
Takeda explained his country’s desperate situation. He frankly reported that three S-class Hunters had been wounded in the failed assault on the gate, and that their available power had become very low.
[I’m not your fixer, what you can fix yourself, fix yourself.]
[Your Majesty…….]
Leon believed that Japan still had time to spare. Sure, it would be a lot of work, but they could handle the Dungeon Break, even with the damage.
Over-involvement in other countries was not a good thing, and above all, the Lionheart King trained his knights and soldiers harshly.
He is a spiritualist who believes that people can only become stronger through trials and challenges.
Therefore, he had no intention of sending reinforcements to the Japanese Dungeon Break…until Takeda complained in a weak voice.
[The boss monster of the Demon Gate is an Archdemon──]
-Thump, thump, thump!
[Your Majesty?]
Two hours later, Leon and Vulcanus arrived on a Korean military transport plane along with the Flaming Sword Knights.
“Demon spawn are in this land?”
“Where are they, I’ll twist their heads off!”
Chairman Takeda and Japan’s Prime Minister Fujisawa struggled to get the knights, who ran like angry horses, to the gate where the dungeon brakes would burst open.
And the slaughter began.
“I saw it with my own eyes, but I still don’t believe it.”
“It was on the scale of a major raiding party…….”
Other hunters, as well as staff from the Japan Hunter Association who were analyzing the battle, seemed shocked by the strength of the Burning Sword Knights.
“Their equipment is also incredible, and the appraisers say they’re outfitted with Legendary and above.”
“That’s Yappy’s stellar armor.”
Takeda had invested a lot of money in Yappy’s star iron factory.
From what he heard, every Knight of the Ten Thousand Gods is issued a pair of god-blessed Star Iron Armor.
“Those armor are supposed to be the originals. How much do you think they’re worth in terms of measurement?”
“Legendary. They say each one is worth a year’s budget for a small town.”
“That’s out of this world. Isn’t there a lot of inflation?”
“That, too, but good equipment is no more amazing than combat power.”
The staffer seemed at a loss for words as he read the power analysis file of the Burning Sword Knights.
“Every single one of them is at least quasi-S-class, and a dozen of them are above S-class average. And that’s just based on individual strength. If we move on to group combat evaluation, the S-class raiders won’t even compare.”
“Crazy.”
‘What kind of monstrous group was the Lionheart Kingdom?’
Even though they fought together, there were at least five people in the Burning Sword Knights who were stronger than him, the top S-class hunter in Japan.
Among them, Count Laihar Dever, who was ranked third in the order, could easily take on two S-class Hunters.
“Among such monsters, the pinnacle is the Holy Knight and Grail Guardian.”
“Monsters….”
Takeda shrugged at his subordinate’s point.
“I didn’t mean it in a bad way.”
“I’m aware of that, but the number of worshippers of the TTG Temple has increased significantly recently.”
Japan may have been united with Korea, but it had the monumental distinction of being the first country in the world to defeat a demon Archduke.
After the Wandering Demon Sword was revealed to be the Demon Archduke Akasha, and those who had witnessed Leon’s real-time demonstration of power were as likely to believe in the TTG Temple as anyone else.
In Japan, where there was no main religion to speak of, there was no faith to abandon, and the number of believers has already surpassed Korea’s and is approaching one million.
This is an unprecedented rate of growth in history, considering that TTG Temple is an emerging religion that has only been on the planet for a little over half a year.
‘I hear it’s also hot in the Americas and Europe.’
The world is revolving around TTG Temple and after witnessing the recent events of the Gate and the power of the Archdemon class, Takeda was convinced that without them, the world would quickly collapse.
“Let’s pledge our allegiance.”
“Agreed.”
He heard that many Hunters have recently become devoted to the TTG Temple, so he thinks they should send their hunters there for religious training.
* * * *
The third day after Leon’s return with Vulcanus.
Vulcanus and the Knights had successfully defeated the last assigned Dungeon Break, and were resting on the Mountain of Corpses.
“Lord Laihar, there’s a living one over there.”
-Ah, no…!
“What’s wrong, you stupid green beast?”
The last dungeon break was the Orc Gate. As with the Demon Gate, the knights slaughtered the orcs thoroughly.
“Your Majesty, all two thousand of the beasts have been exterminated!”
Vulcanus reported to Leon without even removing his heat-soaked armor and Leon offered him a piece of jerky from the mountain of corpses.
“Hmm…!”
Vulcanus removed his red, horned helmet and revealed inside was a middle-aged man with a feral look.
“It tastes good, but I don’t feel Goddess Demera’s favor.”
“That is because our crops have not produced enough to feed the livestock farms. We have enough vegetables and grains, but not meat.”
“Certainly. Holy power is lacking.”
Vulcanus raised his hand and summoned a spark of holy power. A dizzying pillar of fire rose from it.
Vulcanus shrugged his shoulders and cursed into the air.
“Mr. Petos, why aren’t you as good as you used to be?”
[You…!]
Petos immediately became enraged. The God of War and Flame spoke to his Holy Knight with a sharp accent.
[You’ve been so wasteful lately, releasing all the power you’ve accumulated like a dam bursting!]
As soon as he was freed from the ice, he wasted no time in unleashing his Divine Descent, but after three days of continuous battles, he ran out of energy and tore monsters apart with his bare hands.
Petos had seen this happen before, and naturally, his scolding was directed at Leon.
[Leon, my best war horseman, manage your men properly!]
When Leon responded with a shrug, Vulcanus spoke up.
“Mr. Petos, I am your best war horseman, am I not?”
[I have never had a warrior like you. All you know how to do is punch and smash. What kind of war horseman is he who leaves command and strategy to his subordinates?]
The Riders of War and Flame are all-around warriors who master tactics and are responsible for the firepower of their legions.
Vulcanus is a bit of a lopsided example, and would not be recognized as a Holy Knight if it weren’t for his ridiculous strength.
[At any rate, I should have stopped you when you said you were going to bring in a barbarian like that to edify him.
“Do not be too hard on him, Petos, for his vessels were coveted even by savage demigods.”
[…….]
Petos had nothing more to say. Yes, the barbarian who was about to be awakened as a vessel for an evil god was subdued by Leon and brought to the Temple of All Gods.
But Petos knew what Vulcanus had done since then, and he couldn’t just berate him.
“Lord Vulcanus, come here for a moment.”
“Yes…!”
Leon pulled a staff out of subspace as Vulcanus approached.
“What is it?”
Vulcanus glares at the unusual holy power emanating from the staff and Leon explains the staff’s history.
“It belonged to a prophet who refused to stop fighting, even in a land of evil. It was given to this king by a priest who served the gods of another dimension.”
“Oh…such a connection.”
Leon handed the staff to Vulcanus.
“From what I can tell, the staff has the ability to absorb and store holy power, similar to the Lionheart.”
“It doesn’t seem like much of an artifact, sir.”
“Perhaps not, but it can absorb accumulated holy power. Offer it to the God of War.”
In short, Vulcanus was consuming too much power, so the power of the other gods would be stored in the staff, and Vulcanus would make a sacrifice to Petos to offset his power consumption.
Taking Gob’s staff from Leon, Vulcanus chuckled and raised it.
“Old man, here goes the staff.”
[This guy.]
Feeling like a crippled old man with a cane, Petos snatched it from Vulcanus’ hand.
[You blasphemous thing, you’re going to pay big time one day.]
“GRARARARARA…!!”
In any case, the matter was settled. There was the Man-At-Arms force sent to defend the lands of the Demera faithful abroad, but that too would come to an end.
“But this, something about this reeks of evil.”
Beatrice and the demons are the only ones who can use the gate at the moment, so this massive gate breach must have served some purpose.
“We are returning. First, I must serve a feast to Lord Spinner and his men.”
“Oh~, the mechanical Holy Knight your majesty has spoken so highly of, the successor to Lord Antoch, I would like to see his face once.”
“I’m sure you’ll like him.”
Autumn.
The gate crisis that had engulfed not only Korea, but the entire world, was coming to an end.
* * * *
Since arriving on Earth as a survivor, Beatrice had been steadily exposed to modern culture to familiarize herself with Earth’s civilization.
Smartphones and PCs are one thing, but newspapers are her favorite.
It’s something she used in her kingdom, and it’s easier to read about current events than sensationalized internet news.
“What a mess.”
She had been reading through the daily papers that had accumulated in her absence, but most of them were focused on the worldwide Gate crisis.
A red gate in the middle of Paris, France, or a small town hit by a dungeon break and a coastline polluted after a failed attempt to capture the Dragon Palace Gate.
The world is reeling from the gate invasion, not all countries, of course.
“Taiwan has managed to defend itself.”
Island nations, small land masses, and dense populations have been more successful in dealing with Gates.
“It’s the whole continent that’s the most problematic. There’s a growing number of Demera worshipers in this part of the Granary, and we’ll have to pay more attention.
Yappy had already dispatched a force of Man-At-Arms to control the damage but it wouldn’t be enough.
Moving the Burning Sword Knights would make things much easier, but that’s risky as it is.
‘The continent is full of orcs…….’
When two factions meet, they are bound to clash. Leon alone could tell.
There are still some orc survivors in Korea and seeing them, Leon didn’t go all out with his sword, but he did show his displeasure.
The beasts are staining his eyes.
If Sir Vulcanus and his knights encounter even an orc on the continent it’s very predictable how they will behave.
[Taiwanese cabinet suspected of orgy party.]
“Hmm?”
A single line of the article suddenly caught her eye. It was not a rare occurrence.
Drugs, sex, and parties. Promiscuous and decadent culture in high places is common in any country, in any world.
Beatrice was a queen who was beyond repulsed by such things, but if it were just a scandal, she would have let it slide, however the problem is the key players in the scandal.
The CEO of a big business, the minister in charge of defense, and the children of key cabinet members.
It was a scandal involving people who, while controversial, could use their power to sway public opinion.
It was all too familiar, when suddenly, she noticed a symbol at the party that a reporter had photographed.
“The coat of arms of……?”
It was the coat of arms of the fallen Archduke who turned the kingdom of Spero upside down.
Beatrice, who had casually uttered the name of the sinister demonic archduke who had tainted the royal family, corrupted the nobility, and ultimately brought the kingdom to its knees, suddenly realized that her surroundings had gone pitch black.
“You can’t be…!”
Names have power.
Calling a demon by its true name is a way to connect with them.
By spreading their name, demons gain contractors. Hence──
[There you are]
“You…!”
In the inky darkness, the demon connected to Beatrice greeted her.
[Magician Queen.]

chapters.title: Chapter 161: A Knight’s Training
chapters.content:
Chapter 161: A Knight’s Training
– Increased threat to critical production assets. Troops must be dispatched.
Yappy, who had commanded the Korean Hunters to efficiently capture the gates, declared the protection of the growing number of TTG Temple assets overseas.
-No, you’re actually sending some of your troops overseas at this point?
-Korean Hunters have been mobilized to protect their country, isn’t that irresponsible!
These voices were raised, but Yappy dismissed their arguments as if they were obvious.
-Get out of here, organism.
The Internet dictator was becoming more and more like a humane dictator in the real world, and his self-righteous, overbearing demeanor had them looking for the Lionheart King.
‘Damn it, Lionheart, come back!’
‘Someone take control of this killing machine!’
There was no compromise for the AI Holy Knight.
I’ll do it if I have to, and why would a stupid organism question the strategic plan of a wise mastermind? This attitude drives me crazy inside.
Of course, Yappy had good reason.
-It’s harvest time for the overseas farms. It was necessary to capture the gate for food security.
-But with only a handful of knights and Man-At-Arms, you’ll be limited.
-There are other ways.
It didn’t take long for the overseas TTG Temple raiders to figure it out.
“This is War Dog, calling from the Grave Arms PMC. Are you part of the TTG Temple contingent?”
“This is Tom, Black Mamba’s boss, and he’s a pretty thick one.”
Greeting the handful of knights and Man-At-Arms troops are two thousand Hunter mercenaries hired by Yappy. They were all B-class and above at the very least, including six S-class Hunters.
‘How much money did he spend?’
Koo Dae-Sung, a Knight who had volunteered for the overseas contingent, was aghast at the number of mercenaries Yappy had hired.
At the very least, there was an A-class raiding party and three S-class raiding parties. It must have cost trillions of dollars to hire this many people. Even if he had that kind of money, he wouldn’t be able to get a priority contract even if he wanted to hire them, as they would be sought after all over the world in the current times——.
“Ah—!
Koo Dae-sung looked at the items being unloaded from the transport they had come with and realized why they had been hired first.
Drones that could operate in the gate, and enough stellar armor to arm hundreds of people, that’s enough to make any mercenary hunter drool.
High-tech blessed weapons and stellar iron armor are not available, unless it’s a national defense contract and it’s not something a mercenary group can get.
“Lord Yappy.”
Koo Dae-sung, who was communicating with Yappy while reporting their arrival, asked cautiously.
-Mr. Koo Dae-sung.
“Are you sure it’s okay to leak these items without His Majesty’s permission?”
– No problem. These items are classified as low-grade among the Blessed Armaments. The technological gap between the outside world and the TTG Temple is vast.
In other words, it shouldn’t be a problem to smuggle them out.
-Our scouting assets will assist. Close the gates at this point quickly.
Yappy began to deploy his mercenaries and Man-At-Arms to defend the various granaries.
He sent troops to the Beidahuang Granary in the Heilongjiang People’s Republic, Chernozem in Ukraine, the Ganges River Plain in India, and Java in Indonesia, all in the name of protecting the worshippers of the TTG Temple in developing nations that had been neglecting land contaminated by miasma.
The countries welcomed the troops with open arms because they were already short on hunter power.
A week later Koo Dae-Sung successfully completed his sixth raid in the Heilong People’s Republic.
“Wow, we’re going to get some breathing room.”
Kim Do-han stretched out in the sunlight for the first time in two days.
“So, roughly speaking, isn’t this a safe zone around here?”
“I think so.”
Gudae Castle was a large-scale gate situation, but since most of the gates were yellow or green, the capture itself was not difficult.
The gates that were too difficult for the contingent to handle were taken care of by the mercenaries.
-Good effort.
“Ah, Lord Yappy.”
Yappy, who was communicating in real time via drone, praised the Man at Arms for finishing the gate.
“Any more gates to take?”
-No. All immediate threats have been eliminated. Gave them a vacation.
“Oooh, a vacation!”
Captain Kim Do-han is thrilled to hear the word vacation and the rest of the Men at Arms were equally excited.
-Deposited special bonuses into their bank accounts. In two days, a military transport plane would be sent to Heilong Airport to pick them up, and they could enjoy their vacation until then.
Kim Do-han, who immediately checked his smartphone to see how much money had been deposited, was ecstatic about the generous bonus and hugged Koo Dae-sung’s shoulder.
“Let’s drink, Mr. Koo!”
“Shall we?”
The two men, their faces fresh from their days as porters, headed into the city in high spirits.
The TTG Temple definitely trains soldiers and knights, but it’s a bit harsh on people.
Koo Dae-sung, a former knight cadet, was especially hard on himself, and he was glad for the vacation.
“It’s Mainland China after all, and the food is amazing!”
The Heilongjiang People’s Republic is one of more than 50 countries that have broken away from China since its collapse. Most of the country is grain land, so food was not a problem, since it was an agricultural, primary-industrialized country.
“I haven’t been here since China broke up. It’s still pretty backward. Is the capital any better than here?”
“I hear it’s not much different there.”
In Korea, even rural Naju has a few buildings standing tall. But here, despite the city’s reputation, there isn’t a single building taller than 10 stories.
“Well, it can’t be helped, can it? After the Shanghai incident, the country was torn into 50 parts.”
The Shanghai incident.
After the unleashing of the Archdemon Skazakari from the Black Gate in Shanghai, the once largest country in the world, Greater China, was completely shattered.
The country had been slowly dying after failing spectacularly to deal with the initial Gate outbreak and the Shanghai incident was just the final straw that drove the wedge.
“Well, we just need to protect our own land, right?”
At Kim Do-han’s words, Koo Dae-sung thought, “I don’t know,” but he didn’t say it out loud.
-The KMT decided to extend martial law.
At that moment, the restaurant’s TV flashed a state broadcast. With Yappy’s translator, they had no trouble understanding.
“Martial law has been extended.”
“An orc general.”
On the news, a decorated general was speaking about the gates, announcing that the mighty Hunter Legion was taking them down one by one.
“This neighborhood is just a bunch of propaganda.”
Koo Dae-sung and Kim Do-han looked around and saw no sign of the mighty Hunter Corps.
Each of the 53 countries torn from the continent generally claimed legitimacy, each claiming to be the continent’s heir, but all they’ve inherited is their own corrupt administrative systems.
In the end, it’s the innocent civilians who suffer.
Kim Do-han was about to clink his glass when
──────!!
a peculiar wave of magic power that awakened Hunters can feel was sensed. The two men jumped to their feet when they realized it was a dungeon break.
“What the fuck?!”
“Get your gear!”
Leaving the alcohol and food behind, the two grabbed their equipment and hurried to the alleyway where their senses led them.
From there, they heard a tearing scream.
-Caahhhhhhhh!!!
The two exchanged a glance and entered the alleyway with shields and swords in hand. What they found was a girl running away from something and quadrupedal monsters chasing her.
There were at least ten of them and they were so large that they lined the alleyway, tackling each other in an attempt to eat the girl.
“Come here!”
-Hick!
The girl spotted the two of them and rushed over, panting. At the same time, a monster pounced on her.
“Stop it!”
Koo Dae-sung blocked the charging monster with his shield. Despite its weight, it was a simple beastly lunge and he immediately counterattacked by plunging his sword into its throat.
-Quack!
The monster collapses in a single blow and it was a good thing for the old knight who can’t use the Holy Law.
“Captain Kim, call the kids!”
“No, I just called them! They’re all around here, so I told them to come except for the drunk one!”
It was a good thing this was the only city nearby with a nightlife.
The majority of the 200-odd deployed Men at Arms arrived in the slums one by one, and they formed a shield formation in the narrow alleyways, picking off the monsters one by one.
Along the way, Yappy’s hired local mercenaries arrived, and it was only an hour before the dungeon break was resolved. It would be another three hours before the city’s Heilong Hunters arrived.
“It’s a mess.”
“I know.”
There was a dungeon break in the middle of the city.
This was unthinkable in South Korea and when he asked how this happened, he was told that it was even worse.
“Our observation lenses have a failure rate of over half.”
The mercenary captain who came as backup shrugged his shoulders but it didn’t make sense to Koo Dae-sung.
“Is that so? Don’t we import them all from the US anyway?”
“Poor management, cheap or second-hand replacements, embezzlement–that’s the usual stuff. That’s why we don’t trust the satellites. We’ll get a citizen’s complaint and show up.”
The mercenary captain concludes by saying that dungeon breaks are not uncommon in this country.
Hunters and their equipment cost a fortune, and in a country where every aspect of society is rotten with corruption, the Hunter’s Association should be no exception.
“It’s a mess.”
“It sucks.”
At times like this, Kim Do-han is glad he was born in Korea while the mercenary captain speaks in a cynical voice.
“I’d rather they let the orcs in, like the neighboring Republic of Jilin. Sure, we’d get coup threats, but at least we wouldn’t have monsters on the road.”
“Monsters on the road?”
“There are monsters all over the country. Well, when we find them, we hunt them down and mine them for magic stones. That’s actually what we do more than gate raids.”
Does this mean that dungeon breaks are that common, and if you don’t trust the satellites, you’re effectively out of luck outside the city?
Hundreds of people have died in dungeon breaks in the middle of the slums, all because of a single blue gate.
Bodies are strewn everywhere, and the residents are already returning to their daily routines, unperturbed by the deaths.
The only ones crying in the middle of the Dungeon Break are the families of the dead.
This is purgatory.
“Well, they’ll be fine in two days, let’s not bother them, they’ll take care of themselves.”
Is it really okay? Koo Dae-sung suddenly remembered the virtues Leon had spoken of at the knight’s ordination ceremony at the TTG Temple.
[Be courageous and do good]
[Protect the weak, do not do injustice]
[Love with purity and good will]
Koo Dae-sung kept thinking about it and reported to Yappy that day.
“Sir Spinner.”
-Mr. Koo Dae-Sung.
“I– I would like to stay here.”
“”——!!””
Koo Dae-Sung decision drew the attention of the troops. All that was left to do was to return to the TTG Temple with their backs to the sun and their stomachs full, but what is he talking about now?
-Wait.
Yappy disappeared from the communication. Meanwhile, Captain Kim Do-han and the rest of the Man at Arms crew were asking Koo Dae-sung.
“What does that mean?”
“Knight Koo Dae-sung, what are you thinking?”
Everyone was puzzled by Koo’s decision.
He is a knight of the TTG Temple, whose power and position was incomparable to that of a mere soldier.
They secured the granary so there is no reason for them to remain here.
They’ll just have to hire mercenaries periodically to guard the granary and that’s it.
“No, Mr. Koo, is it because of what happened? It’s nothing new that this neighborhood is in shambles.”
Just as Kim Do-han was about to rebuke Koo Dae-sung, the communication was restored but it wasn’t Yappy on the other end.
[You said you were staying.]
“Your Majesty?!”
As soon as they heard the voice, they all knelt down and picked up the receiver. For the jade sound of the Lionheart King was not something they could hear in a comfortable position.
[Knight Koo Dae-sung, why did you say you would stay?]
“What? Ah, that’s——.”
Koo Dae-sung reported what had happened, and cautiously expressed his desire to stay and help the innocent citizens as a knight.
[What good will you do there if you stay?]
“That, that——.”
[Are you going to join another raid, what do you think a B-class hunter can do?]
“I’ve heard that there are monsters in this place, both on the roads and in the mountains, when you go outside the city.”
It would be helpful if he could ride around on horseback and hunt them down.
Koo Dae-sung is a man who speaks for himself, but is not very confident.
He’s a knight of the lowest rank, a lowly B-class at best.
Although he had improved greatly from his days as a D-rank, he was still weak and unconfident.
How much good would it do him to be alone?
[Do you want to prove yourself, to this king, to be judged by the gods?]
When Leon asked him if he was trying to make a name for himself by becoming a knight, Koo Dae-sung was left speechless.
In fact, isn’t this his own excuse? Isn’t he just blinded by his achievements and making up reasons?
Even he can’t answer that with confidence. He was an underdog, unable to prove anything, unsure of anything.
He has no great power like King Lionheart and no natural talent like the other knights.
He wondered if he wanted to be recognized by pretending to be a good person.
[Because you don’t need anyone’s approval for a challenge.]
The words came out of nowhere.
The knight who had failed endlessly, who had been frustrated, who had been told by the gods to give up, had rejected it all without a moment’s hesitation.
“Your Majesty——.”
[Speak]
“I don’t need your approval for my challenge.”
“”——!!””
Everyone was stunned by the imperiousness of Koo Dae-sung but beyond the phone, there was no fiery rebuke, no matter how much time passed, but rather──
[Cackle—!]
There was only an irrepressible chuckle, stifled between dignity and amusement.
[Is that so?
As if this reminded him of his great predecessor, the Lionheart King’s heart thumped with joy.
[Very well, if you choose to tread the path on your own, so be it, for not even the gods can discourage a journey of cultivation.]
[Strength, faith, and the care of the gods will guard your path, and this king will expect the best from you.]
That was the end of the communication, as if no more words were needed.
“Well, well, well, I see the king approves of this.”
“I’m sorry.”
Captain Kim Do-han apologized and followed Koo Dae-sung as he removed his luggage from the transport.
“Mr. Koo, as always, you’re too good to be true!”
He followed Koo Dae-sung to retrieve his own luggage.
“Captain Kim?”
“I’m staying too!”
“No, what’s wrong with you too, Captain?”
“Mr. Koo, we’ve been friends since we were both baggage carriers, and I owe you a favor for saving us from being overrun by monsters the raiding party missed, so I’m staying!”
“What kind of movie are you making? Why are you staying behind?”
He was a fellow who had completed the first Man at Arms training with Koo Dae-sung and Kim Do-han.
“If I go back, I’ll have to pay taxes, so I won’t be able to save any money~”
“If we catch a monster here, we’ll get paid as a personal allowance, right?”
One by one all the members of the first generation Man at Arms put down their luggage.
“No— If you all do that, it’ll be too much for me.
Koo Dae-sung, who hadn’t expected fifty of his classmates to follow him, was moved, and he couldn’t keep the corner of his mouth down.
“Forget it, we’re going to look for monsters floating around, and I’m sure Lord Yappy can give us some intelligence support, he’s got a very fearsome satellite up there!”
“Captain Kim, that’s classified.”
About fifty soldiers and one knight from the TTG Temple’s overseas contingent remained in the area and neither Yappy nor anyone else in Korea could predict what they would do.
Thus began the knight’s training.

chapters.title: Chapter 162: Journey
chapters.content:
Chapter 162: Journey
“Cckkkk——.”
“Uhm, Your Majesty, you look pleased, don’t you?”
Ha-ri tilted her head at Leon, who was looking quite pleased.
“Because he reminded me of an old friend.”
“An old friend of yours–Sir Antoine?”
“You have met him, too.”
“Yes, well–they are all honorable men.”
Leon shook his head in denial, though it felt good to say it.
“I met your brother, too.”
Leon’s mind wandered down memory lane, and he remembered a day not too far away.
His old friend, the one he’d never get to see ascend, the one he’d been forced to perform a rite of passage in a re-creation of the past.
Jordic Bertum’s second son, a member of the Knights of the Riona Sunset and a servant of dreams and death.
Jerea the Clueless, also known as Jerea the Twilight.
“Surprisingly, you’re pretty scrawny.”
[I don’t need your approval for my challenge]
The conversation with Koo Dae-Sung reminded Leon of him.
His incompetence, his uprightness—even his stupidity.
“But, don’t you know, it’s the stupid who shake up the world.”
“Is that so?”
Ha-ri knew that Leon might be an eccentric man, but he was never wrong.
“Well, since it is your Majesty who speaks, I suppose so.”
“Your tongue is sharp, and you have learned the ways of a loyal servant.”
“Am I a loyalist?”
“You shouldn’t be.”
“——.”
“——.”
“Just for a moment.”
“No.”
“——.”
Ha-ri looked down at Leon wordlessly, but he wasn’t even looking at her.
“I’m sorry, not once, but a second time is too much!”
You’re putting me on the podium again!
Ha-ri was on top, and Leon was on the bottom.
It was a reversed hierarchy, but she liked the symbolic meaning.
Ha-ri sobbed on the bow of a giant ferry on the rolling sea.
She is the goddess of the sea and the waves, and she is currently sacrificing herself because of a custom that says it is unclean to have a woman on board.
“Is this the sacrifice to the Poma I heard about?”
” Beatrice.”
Beatrice stared in disbelief at Ha-ri hanging from the pole.
“Is this really what you’re going to do?”
“Hehe, Beatrice.”
Leon said, glancing at the not inconsiderable number of women aboard the massive luxury liner.
“By nature, when there are women on board, uncleanness burns. However, the god Poma has mercifully granted a woman’s sacrifice to ward off uncleanness.”
“But the code. Isn’t it possible to substitute an object for a woman?”
“Yes. ——.”
Beatrice’s words left Leon speechless. There was indeed such a code.
There was a code on the ship that prohibited the use of statues of women as offerings.
“There are a lot of women on this ship,” he said, “and they’re not exactly the brightest——.”
“Well, we’re traveling, and it would be a shame to leave them hanging there. I’ll use my magic to make a statue of a woman to replace them.”
Beatrice repeated, and Leon agreed, as if he had no choice. So Ha-ri was able to climb down from the pinnacle just over three hours after the ship left.
“Wow, freedom!”
Ha-ri is more excited about the fact that she won’t be hanging on to the dock for a week until she reaches his destination than she is about the treatment.
“I’m going to change into my swimsuit!”
Leon shrugged and headed back with Beatrice.
“Your Majesty, this way!”
Leading the two of them through the gates was the Lord of the Hanbit Palace, Park Yong-shin, who greeted them with an extremely polite demeanor.
“Welcome aboard the Hanbit. How do you like it? Is there any inconvenience?”
“Well, it’s not bad, but it’s a bit too decorated. It’s the vanity of a thunder-rich man.”
“Alas— I can only apologize for offending your noble Majesty’s aesthetic.”
Park Yong-shin’s expression was one of sincere apology, not flattery, and he gestured to the Hanbit Palace followers to guide the two.
“I have the Royal Suite waiting for you, please make yourselves at home on the way to the ‘Republic of Taiwan’.”
* * * *
Leon’s sudden decision to set sail for the Taiwan Republic was due to a conjecture Beatrice had made.
“The place where the Demon Archduke lurks?”
“Yes, the Demon Archduke of Pleasure and Decadence, Quay, he is on Earth.”
The source was an Earth newspaper, scandals in the Republic of Taiwan and recent events in Taiwan.
The events there were similar to those of the former Kingdom of Spero, and that the coat of arms of the Demon Archduke Quai had been found. But most of all──
“When I pronounced his name, he responded to me, though he immediately closed the channel.”
“They say a demon’s name has magical significance.”
Beatrice’s speculations were not simply unfounded. Rather, coming from a specialist who had hunted demons countless times, it was quite possible.
“Very well. Then I’ll take my troops and head straight for the Republic of Taiwan.”
The problem is, Taiwan is an island, and there’s no reason to take an army on a whim.
Here’s the tricky part.
“As of today, the TTG Temple will be closed for the fall holiday.”
The trip to Taiwan was disguised as a vacation.
Four hours after they chartered Park Yong-shin’s luxury cruise ship and set sail for Taiwan, Leon changed into his swimsuit and stepped out into the private pool lounge of his suite on the luxury liner.
“Hmm.”
There were a few familiar faces in the lounge.
“Oh, Your Majesty!”
“Greetings!”
Soo-ho and Jae-hyuk, the representative knights of the Modern TTG Temple and their leader, Chen So-yeon.
“You’re here?”
The Knight Templar shyly hid her fit and healthy body, and her youthfulness could be overlooked as cute.
-Awww!
Yappy is also enjoying the vacation, floating on the water in a striped swimsuit woven specifically for the fuselage.
It looks more like someone forced him to wear it to make him feel better than because he wanted to.
“Make yourself comfortable.”
Leon said and waded into the pool. Due to the cool fall weather, the pool was filled with warm water, almost like a hot spring bath.
“Jae-hyuk and So-yeon were enjoying themselves first!”
At that moment, a red-haired girl appears in a fuss. Ha-ri was dressed in a fiery red bikini swimsuit and was running towards the pool.
“Whoa, big sister, wait!”
“Yay!”
Ha-ri, clinging to the diving board and shivering in the cold wind, threw herself into the pool without hesitation.
With a splash, water splashed everywhere.
“Gah!”
Ha-ri dived to the bottom of the pool, up to the tips of her legs and the crown of her head, and bounced up, feeling the warmth of the water on her body and calling out to the three of them.
“You guys should get in! It’s so warm in here!”
“Uhm—sis.”
“Huh?”
Soo-ho couldn’t help but point to a certain direction with his eyes, where──
“Humph, Your Majesty!”
Leon, who had turned into a waterlogged mouse, was staring at Ha-ri in disbelief.
“Uh, uh— Lung, Your Majesty ah——.”
Ha-ri is at a loss for words. She squeezed her eyes shut and cried out as Leon raised his hand, but instead of an angry slap, a large palm rested on the top of her head.
“Your Majesty?”
Ha-ri’s eyes snapped open, and she saw a smirking Leon.
“It’s good that you’re enjoying your vacation, but you’re also a lady, so be careful how you conduct yourself.”
“Ah— I, I was a noble, wasn’t I?”
By the standards of the TTG Temple, knights were treated as nobles, but Ha-ri was a noble who had been chosen by two gods.
“Hing— Your Majesty.”
Move over, woman— there was a time when a commoner would have been criticized for trying to humble herself with a king.
But now she’s a knight of the Ten Thousand Gods Temple, a goddess favored by the gods, and a noblewoman who’s been granted a title!
An unmistakable noble lady!
‘I am a woman with class?’
The fact that she was being patted on the head by the king himself, giggling, made her feel even more smug.
“Heehee, I see, you’re that Lady, aren’t you?”
“Hahaha, how can you be like a commoner, hahaha, you.”
“”——.””
-Bad luck.
She’s so arrogant as soon as she realizes she’s a nobleman. Is that a state official?
-Badass!
“Ouch! Your Majesty—“
Ha-ri said with a wry smile to Leon, who at one point gripped her head in an unnervingly tight grip. Leon, of course, is still smiling. But——.
“Then you’ll have to learn the basics of being a lady, and I’ll personally educate you on courtly manners and noble bearing.”
“Hah—?”
“You’ll be tested, and if you don’t get it right, I’ll crack that leg whip to pieces. Do you understand?”
“——Yes.”
Leon declared to Poma and Petos that he would personally teach this bratty new noble the Lionheart court etiquette.
“Heh——”
“Is sister okay?”
“No, I’m not fine—fire up the barbecue——”
Hearing his sister’s words, Soo-ho quickly walked over to the barbecue machine. Just then, a wire slapped Ha-ri across the face.
“Ow!”
With a stinging pain, she turns around to see Yappy dangling from the pool balcony.
Ha-ri’s dive had swept her off her feet, and she was barely holding on to the balcony.
-Come on, organism.
“Hey, Lord Yappy!”
Ha-ri gasped, rushing to Yappy’s rescue and she barely managed to catch him.
“Hey, are you okay?”
-No.
Yappy slapped Ha-ri on the cheek with his mechanical leg. The slap hurt.
“Hmph, that hurts.”
-Stupid organism. Where did all the nutrients go?
“Hing— ah, it hurts!”
Ha-ri felt like she had no cheeks left after taking slap after slap from Yappy.
“It hurts?!”
-Yuck!
Ha-ri can’t take it anymore and pulls Yappy into a tight hug.
Yappy struggled in her swollen, tight embrace, but he couldn’t escape Ha-ri’s vicious grip.
-Let go of me!
“If I let go, you’ll keep hitting me!”
Ha-ri is an S-class Hunter, a hunter of the caliber of a Knight Templar in terms of physical prowess alone and although Yappy’s total combat power surpasses Ha-ri’s, but that’s only in full battle mode.
That is, when equipped with a war platform.
Today’s Yappy is a hundredth the size of its predecessor and the power limitations of its size were far from enough to overcome the viciousness of an S-class Hunter.
-Let go. Warned.
The Yappy warned, unable to escape by force but Ha-ri, who was losing her strength due to Yappy’s warning, never let go.
Looking at the two of them, Jae-hyuk inadvertently spilled his true feelings.
“I envy Lord Yappy.”
“She’s my sister.”
Boom!
The punishment was unrelenting.
Eventually, after much negotiation, Ha-ri puts Yappy on the tube.
Ha-ri quickly changed the subject and fiddled with his swimsuit.
“By the way, this swimsuit was purchased by Lord Yappy, wasn’t it? It was delivered to my room.”
-Perfectly derived by math and big data.
“Really? When did they get my size?”
-Hacked.
“????”
-Easy.
“????”
He confessed to something very criminal and it would be like opening Pandora’s Box to find out how much criminal activity is going on behind the scenes.
-According to the machine’s observation and calculation before the database, it should be an easy matter.
“Ahhh~”
-Han Ha-ri. She usually prefers short pants that expose her abdomen and armpits, presumably due to active sweat glands.
“Now, wait——.
-Outside of work clothes, prefers hot pants, skinny jeans, and see-throughs. Even pajamas show a similar trend. An ape who doesn’t think much of nudity.
“What do you mean, an ape?”
-Kim Jae-hyuk prefers ripped pants that don’t make sense. Presumed to be a product of a distorted childhood. Post-traumatic stress disorder caused by traumatic memories──
“No, this is fashion!”
-Han Soo-ho purchased most of his clothes at the Dongdaemun pottery market, based on card payment patterns. Unable to let go of the beggar mentality of his orphanhood despite his wealth.
“You, you’re so—!”
This mechanical robot had a strange interpretation of a sinful subject to the point of uselessness!
-Chun So-yeon.
“——.”
Yappy’s gaze turned to Chun So-yeon. Staring at her top, a two-piece swimsuit with frills on the chest──
-Tending to be a male of the Gunnham family.
“????”
“”???””
It was an analysis that made even Leon tilt his head in disbelief.
“Gunnham? Is it a new species?”
-The tendency of males of the Gunnham’s bird family to exaggerate their chests to attract females. I almost bought a swimsuit based on this misleading information.
“”————.””
—.
“You—!”
Chen So-yeon’s face turned bright red as she searched for something. Covering her chest, she picked up the skewer that Soo-ho had been grilling meat on just a moment ago and pointed it like a sword in anger.
“Shut that mouth, you stupid robot!”
-Correction. The main body is correct, the exact facts──
The pool goes wild as Chun So-yeon lunges at Yappy with a skewer, and Yappy makes a run for it, using his steel wires like Spider-Man in a superhero movie.
In the midst of the chaos, Ha-ri wisely slips away and looks for someone who isn’t there.
“Where’s the queen?”
Beatrice, who was supposed to be sharing the same floor, was nowhere in sight.

chapters.title: Chapter 163: The Road to Taiwan
chapters.content:
Chapter 163: The Road to Taiwan
The Man-At-Arms and most of the Knights of the Ten Thousand Temple stay in standard rooms.
The more luxurious suites and royal suites were reserved for Leon, the HOly Knights, and some of the Knights of the Burning Sword.
The Royal Suite, of which there are only two, was easy to find. Ha-ri strode down the hall in her bathing suit and entered the room where Beatrice would be.
“Queen, are you there?”
She asked.
She knocked on the door, and there was no answer but she did hear a muffled voice.
“Queen?”
Wondering what was going on, Ha-ri cautiously opened the door. Beatrice hadn’t closed it properly and the door to her room was open.
“Uh, may I come in?”
Ha-ri peeked inside the room, but there was no sign of Beatrice. However she could definitely feel her presence.
“????”
She pushed open the bathroom door and something grabbed her.
“What?”
‘Why? Why did she stop me from opening the door? Did something happen to the Queen?’
“Queen! Are you okay!?”
-Boom!
The door slammed open and Ha-ri stepped into the bathroom, where she was greeted by a luxurious marble backdrop and Beatrice, who stepped back to avoid the door being forced open.
“Oh——.”
Seeing Beatrice, Ha-ri was mesmerized and let out a series of exclamations.
“Oooh, oooh——.”
“Ha-ri?”
She hadn’t covered her face with her usual cotton cloth. She was dressed in a monokini swimsuit that showed off her height and body curves.
From head to toe, there was nothing about her that wasn’t seductive, a natural aura that could mesmerize men–nay, even sane women–with just a glance.
Black rosebud tattoos on her eyes, chest, and thighs, inked with dots and fleur-de-lis, are reminiscent of mythical points of enchantment.
This is what a beauty who shakes up a nation must look like. Beatrice was indeed a woman of such power.
“Wow— Queen. Wow—— you are so beautiful.”
Ha-ri is resistant to magic and as a blessed priestess, she was quite resistant to this near-curse but she couldn’t help but feel her face flush and her cheeks heat up.
“Ugh——.”
Apart from that, Beatrice was busy covering her body with her fern-like arms, but how could she cover the sky with her palms?
“Queen, why are you here, even in a swimsuit?”
“Ugh— is this really a swimsuit?”
“What? Of course it is——.”
Beatrice stared at her reflection in the bathroom mirror with a blush.
She was dressed in a swimsuit that showed off her raunchy, tortured lines.
“Queen?”
“How could I be so brazen as to go out in public wearing something like this?”
Beatrice, who had lived her life as a noble royalty from birth until now, could not tolerate an outfit that revealed her bare skin to such an extent.
As she wondered if she should stand in front of the people in this ridiculous outfit or change again, even though this was modern Earth with a civilization completely different from her own, Ha-ri walked in.
“My queen, you look so beautiful!”
“Ugh— Miss Ha-ri, are you all right?”
Beatrice was appalled at Ha-ri’s swimsuit, which was just as revealing as her own.
“How can an over-aged maiden bare her belly button— so embarrassingly——.”
“My queen, you’re usually quite modest in your attire, and many of your dresses reveal your sternum and thighs.”
“It’s fashion.”
Ha-ri wondered at Beatrice’s standards, which were only strict in swimwear.
As if reading her gaze, Beatrice crossed her arms over her chest and spoke with dignity.
“I’ve been a socialite ever since my debutante ball, and as a fashion-forward first lady, I’ve worn many different styles of dresses──”
Ha-ri didn’t quite understand, but apparently there were different standards for dresses and swimsuits that showed off a socialite’s figure.
“His Majesty is expecting me, so I’ll have to see you later.”
“I’ll go to ——.”
“No, I thought you said you’re not so brazen to go in public in that swimsuit.”
“Well, apart from that, His Majesty has business to attend to, and there’s a lot to look forward to.”
Beatrice exits the restroom as if she has no choice in the matter when suddenly, a large shower towel catches her eye.
* * * *
After the commotion was over, they took a hot bath in the pool reserved for the royal suite.
“Ack, why are you hitting me, Lord Yappy!”
-Checking your reflexes.
Soo-ho was grilling meat on a barbecue machine while Yappy was floating on top of the pool, wielding a wire whip.
Jae-hyuk opened the refrigerator door, wishing His Majesty the Lionheart King a long reign.
“Your Majesty~ Are you drinking, oh, there’s some expensive looking wine!”
Jae-hyuk pulled out bottles from the wine cellar and refrigerator. The boy reads the French alphabet on the expensive-looking wine bottle in a language he doesn’t recognize.
“Hey, you’re underage.”
So-yeon gives him a one-word tackle.
Soo-ho, Jae-hyuk, and So-yeon are still third-year cadets at Hunter Academy. While most academies spend their third year as guild trainees, they are technically minors.
“Don’t be so hard on me, we’re graduating soon.”
Jae-hyuk is trying to gloss over the fact that he only has a few months left until his coming of age. Just then, Ha-ri’s voice rang out sharply.
“Ouch! Jae-hyuk, what are you holding in your hand?”
Ha-ri, who had been traveling somewhere, rushed over and snatched the beer bottle from Jae-hyuk’s hand.
“Ha, senior Ha-ri, this is a misunderstanding——.”
“Junior, you’re still underage, right? Han Soo-ho!”
“No, I’m not why——.”
“Were you going to drink too?!”
“No, no! I was grilling meat!”
“Good job, Soo-ho, it’s too early for you to drink!”
Ha-ri had been the big sister at the orphanage until she entered the academy. As such, she was sensitive to her younger siblings who were prone to delinquency.
“Anyway, this stuff is for grown-ups, okay?”
The eyes of the three minors–one year apart–subtly turned to Ha-ri, but she poured the beer into her glass anyway.
“By the way, sister, where have you been?”
“The queen isn’t here, so I went to the suite for a bit— Huh? Why hasn’t she come in yet?”
Ha-ri’s gaze fell on Beatrice, pacing at the pool’s entrance. Wrapped tightly in a towel, she still hesitated.
“Ummm——.”
It’s a sight to behold.
Men and women stripping down to their bare skin in a bathhouse-a pool?
Somehow, she didn’t think Leon would, and she felt betrayed by his nonchalant presence in the pool.
“Beatrice, what are you doing in there? The water is warm and pleasant, come in.”
“Ugh, Your Majesty——.”
Leon’s Lionheart Kingdom had the same glamorous social life and glorious culture as Beatrice’s Spero Kingdom, but with a slightly different twist.
Whereas the magician-centered Spero Kingdom celebrated the virtues of understated rigor amidst the glamor, the Lionheart Kingdom boasted a free-spirited and active love life centered on knights.
Whether it was a knight wooing a commoner or a knight battling an evil monster to save a princess, love stories were a popular genre of fiction and many were based on real life.
Leon alone had been a romantic of his time, sacrificing a temple of purity for the sake of love.
“Your Majesty–you don’t seem to mind.”
Beatrice wrapped her towel tightly around her like a suit of armor and dipped her feet into the pool.
She was used to drinking with Leon, but this situation, with her skin peeking out from beneath the towel, seemed to put her off.
“Well, it’s royal culture, and the kingdom’s banquet halls have quite a few rest rooms for men and women who have had their eyes struck that day.”
“Your Majesty—!”
“Haha, was that a little early for you, over-aged one?”
Beatrice glared at Leon with a rare pointed look. It was clear that this man was mocking her.
“That, by the way, Your Majesty, is a story for another time.”
Beatrice said, still covering herself with the towel. The buoyancy of the water was causing some of the towel to float, but she didn’t seem to notice.
“This time, in the Republic of Taiwan──”
At that moment, Leon’s index finger closed over Beatrice’s lips. Leon smirks at her wide-eyed expression.
“We can talk about work later. For now, let’s eat, drink, and be merry.”
Red paint began to smear across Beatrice’s white hydrangea skin.
“Isn’t it time to enjoy the scenery, and the ocean waves that greet us in this period?”
“Your Majesty–you are quite familiar with the customs of the planet, though not with its electronics, are you not?”
Leon flushed at Beatrice’s point. His true home was Earth, after all.
So even though he had lived for 300 years as a medieval Lionheart King, he had easily adapted to Earth’s customs.
“Alas, I’ll never get used to that damn smartphone thing.”
Leon shrugged and held up a bottle of wine.
“Here, the Lionheart King’s wine. Here’s one for each of you.”
“Sis——.”
Soo-ho glances at his sister, but Ha-ri is too distracted by Leon’s drink to notice.
“I’ll take it.”
Jae-hyuk smirks and takes the glass, seeing it as a chance to get some expensive alcohol. So-yeon doesn’t turn down Leon’s offer, either.
She casually accepts one drink after another. Beatrice was also a fan of alcohol, so she timidly drank the contents of her glass while covering herself with a towel.
“Hmm.”
Leon takes it and has a subtle look on his face. Apparently, he didn’t like the taste.
The queen is the only one who can discuss the flavor, so Leon slyly asks her opinion.
“How do you like the taste?”
“It’s an aperitif from your Majesty, so it’s bound to be sweet.”
“Eh——.”
Even humility is frustrating at this point. Leon stretches out his hand toward the subspace, and bottles of liquor are summoned from it.
“Made from grapes from the Lionheart province of Lebonia. It’s the most precious liquor I’ve ever seen.”
“Ohhhh!”
Beatrice accepted it with a wry smile. Her gaze was more expectant than before.
“Your Majesty has served it to me a few times. It is a very sweet wine.”
Beatrice’s approving words were met with anticipation as they slurped the wine down their throats. As they drank, they felt a sense of clarity, not dizziness or a faint sensation.
The intense pleasure on the tip of the tongue and the aroma that envelops the body make even beginners realize that this is no ordinary product.
“Wow, this is unbelievable.”
“I feel so energized just by drinking it.”
As a few more voices chimed in with their approval, Leon said proudly.
“Of course it does. It’s made from grapes that the Holy Knight of Life and Fertility grows once a year with great skill. It’s meant to be an aperitif to honor the knights.”
Leon says it’s a shame it’s not available in the modern era.
“Hehehe——.”
At that moment, Ha-ri staggered from the seat next to Leon.
“Sis, are you drunk?”
“No, I only had a few drinks.”
It was indeed a heavenly drink but the alcohol content wasn’t that high, just one beer and two glasses of wine, and Ha-ri staggered like an invalid.
” — give me a drink, please——.”
“You must be drunk.”
Leon looked down at Ha-ri with a rare compassionate gaze. He saw it many times in the kingdom, so it’s not a big deal.
-Can break down alcohol.
Yappy transformed his mechanical arm into a hideous drill, preparing to perform some unspeakable operation but Leon interrupted.
“Leave her alone, Lord Spinner. It’s a way of enjoying the drunkenness itself.”
-Hmm?
In any case, Ha-ri was so drunk she could hardly contain herself any longer so Soo-ho stood up.
“I’ll let her rest on the chair, she’s going to fall out.”
“Okay, put a quilt over her so she doesn’t get cold.”
That’s when Soo-ho picked Ha-ri up and carried her out of the pool. Ha-ri, who had a twinge in her foot, collapsed and fell to the bottom of the pool.
-Uh-oh! Uh-oh!
What a wretch. Leon shook his head and tried to pick Ha-ri up, but that’s when Ha-ri’s instinctive holy energy was transformed into a holy technique.
Holy Technique <Cutting Waves>
-Ka-ah!
The pool parted with a crack. Like the Red Sea of the Earth Bible, the split water instantly gushed over the pool.
“Aaah—”
Beatrice stared at the bath towel that floated up with the pool water.
“Ouch——.”
“Wow——.”
The two boys reacted in unison while Beatrice wordlessly blushed and squatted down.
Just as she was about to cringe in embarrassment at having exposed her navel, something fluttery enveloped her.
“Your Majesty?”
Covering Beatrice’s body was the cloak Leon had pulled out of subspace. It was the knight’s cloak that had protected her from the cold on the Demonic Glacier Continent.
This time, Leon spoke from inside the cloak that was spread out to cover Beatrice’s body.
“Well, let’s get used to it.”
Leon’s smile was the only thing that shone through the darkness that blocked out the sunlight.
[Good, good, good, she looks so good]
[Ha-ri, my bride, this is not the time to go to bed!]
[Quiet war, it’s not a good time.]
[Admit that the light has priority over my newborn!]
[Tsk, tsk, let’s just have it all.]
[I agree.]
[Silence the sea and the vengeance]
[Haven’t I got a daughter to fetch——.]
[What’s wrong with abundance——.]
The voices of the gods are not heard by the common people. Unless you are a high ranking knight or priest, close to the gods and fully endowed with their blessings.
It was unfortunate that there were no ordinary worshippers in attendance who could not hear the gods.

chapters.title: Chapter 164: I’m here for sightseeing. Of course…
chapters.content:
Chapter 164: I’m here for sightseeing. Of course…
The door to the office of the Secretary-General of the Taiwanese Presidential Office slams open but the human inside is nonchalant, despite the rudeness of the visit.
“Gee, Mr. President, you should have knocked.”
The President’s secretary-general is the center of power but they can’t outshine the President.
If the shadowy secretary-general were to greet the President in public like this, he would be fired immediately.
“Is it time!”
President Zhao is furious at the secretary-general’s demeanor. However, the nature of his anger is quite different from the situation.
“The Lionheart King is coming! He’s coming here now! He’s coming with his monstrous knights!”
The Lionheart King and his Knights are the most talked about figures in the world.
They are otherworldly survivors and overwhelmingly powerful. Their image is basically a positive one, with godly miracles cleansing the land of miasma.
However, when they decided to visit their country President Zhao panicked more than necessary.
“If that maniac goes on a rampage, we’re all doomed!”
“Well, why do you say that? Just because he’s an alien with common sense that differs from ours, should we ostracize him like that?”
“You asshole, you don’t understand the situation-”
──■■■■■■
The change was swift as a dark cloud loomed over the President office, filling it with inky blackness.
It was a creepy sense of space, as if floating vaguely in an endless universe.
In the midst of this sensation of being lost in space, President Zhao was only brought back to his senses by a dismal voice.
[Wretch, you seem to have forgotten your mortal identity after flattering yourself with my greatness]
“Ah, ah, ah—.”
President Zhao’s vocal cords quivered, but he couldn’t make a sound. Fear and submission were all he could muster.
The Archduke of Pleasure and Depravity said.
[Don’t flatter yourself with your lowly status. You are not the Lionheart King. You are not the Magician Queen. You’re not even a city guardian. Don’t think that a plaque with your name on it will elevate your status.]
President Zhao nodded desperately. It was only after some crude kowtowing and filthy submission that President Zhao was finally pulled out of the darkness.
“Hmph— hmph, hmph, hmph!”
Even before its existence was announced to the world, President Zhao had known of this demon.
He had immediately succumbed to the fact that a being of such terrifying power and might existed on Earth.
“Ha, but— uh, how——.”
And then came the monster that defeated even such a Demon Archduke.
The video of Akasha, the Slaughter Archduke, being defeated by the Lionheart King had the highest traffic in the world.
He was a monster that had overwhelmed even S-class Hunters and he was coming to Taiwan now.
It was a fact that even he had only realized a short time ago, hidden in the name of travel.
If he came, if they came, if those annihilationists landed on this land—–
“If the Lionheart King–if the Ten Thousand Gods Temple recognizes us—we’ll all die.”
“That can’t be——”
It was a desperate remark. That even this mighty Demon Archduke was so sure, it felt like hope was slipping away.
“Isn’t it obvious, the Magician Queen or the Holy Knight of the Flame, no matter what they are no match for the Lionheart King.”
Malus, Lord of Chaos and Destruction, or Caracael, Lord of Wisdom and Dothraddon, Lord of Pleasure and Decadence, could not defeat the Lionheart King in the end.
“Only the power of a Lord can stand against the Lionheart. He’s like a god of victory in human form.”
Even if the current Lionheart King was not as powerful as it once was, its power would not be at the level of the Archduke.
But as for the Fallen Archduke Quai — Yang Wei, the current Secretary-General of President Zhao, said nonchalantly.
“So welcome them, the President Zhao hasn’t received the ‘Demonization Blessing’, so you won’t be found out right away.”
“What’s the way?”
At that, Quai twisted the corner of his mouth wickedly.
“I’ll invite them to a banquet, a banquet of pleasure and depravity.”
Just as Rakshar had been waiting for the right time, he did the same.
* * * * *
-Bang, bang, bang, bang!
A loud crackle of fireworks echoed from the harbor as soldiers fired off cannons and red carpets lined the road.
“A hearty welcome to our country, Your Majesty.”
Greeting Leon and his entourage as they disembarked from the luxury liner Hanbit were President Zhao of the Republic of Taiwan and key members of his cabinet.
“Leon Dragonia Lionheart, King of the Lionheart.”
After shaking hands with Leon, President Zhao greeted Beatrice and Yappy in quick succession, even as he broke out in a cold sweat.
-Yikes!
He had to bend down quite a bit to shake hands with the minimalist mechanical spider.
-Thump! Thump!
Just then, a shadow fell over President Zhao. Clearing his throat, Zhao looked up at the shadow’s owner with a sore throat.
“Lord Vulcanus——.”
Vulcanus, Holy Knight of War and Flame. From what Zhao had heard, this Holy Knight was a demon’s worst nightmare.
Facing the massive hulk of armor, more than two meters tall, Zhao realized he could burn him to death with his breath.
“Are you the one who is the king of this country?”
“Eh?”
His hot breath that seemed to burn the air and overwhelmed by the searing gaze, Zhao didn’t understand the question.
“Ah, yes, yes, no, I am the democratically elected head of state, which is different from a king!”
It was a stammering answer, in more ways than one for a head of state, but Zhao stammered for a while before he suddenly realized that there was no specific group in the crowd.
“The Flaming Sword Knights are——.”
“The knights are waiting in Korea. All I brought with me is the Man-At-Arms and the porters to escort the cargo.”
Stepping off the luxury liner, the Hanbit, were the S-ranked and semi-S-ranked Hunters, Ha-ri, the Academy trio, the Man-At-Arms, and the serfs.
They were nervous that the Lionheart King himself was coming, but he’d left most of his troops in Korea?
Isn’t he here to invade?
Of course, there could be Templars and state troops hiding on that passenger ship, so I’ll have to give it a thorough inspection in the name of customs.
“By the way, Your Majesty, what brings you to our Republic?”
Leon replied to President Zhao’s question as if he were asking the obvious.
“Sightseeing.”
* * * *
Intelligence agents from Taiwan’s National Security Bureau had been watching them ever since they landed.
You might ask whether it’s an overreaction to have a national intelligence agency monitoring tourists, but it would be irresponsible not to, since those tourists could overthrow the country if they wanted to.
[That’s more modest than I thought.]
[Yeah. Not much movement here either.]
The favorite characters of the week are Leon and Beatrice.
Leon and Beatrice are being escorted around by the Taiwanese president himself, taking good pictures for the media, and Vulcanus is sightseeing with Ha-ri and his knights.
He wasn’t meant to be stealthy in the first place, but with his size and gleaming armor, he’s bound to be noticed wherever he goes.
-Taking a photo with Lord Vulcanus of the Temple of the Ten Thousand Gods!
-Lord Vulcanus and Han Ha-ri just finished eating our fried chicken wings!
Leon and Beatrice are so famous and Ha-ri is also a huge influencer.
He wondered if they needed to be monitored because they were so prominent. If you just look at their social media, you can see where they are.
[What about the other knights and Man at Arms?]
[Sightseeing. There were a lot of them, so I didn’t catch them all, but aren’t they really sightseeing?]
[I’m sure they’re planning something.]
[Didn’t you say that nothing happened when they went to Japan?]
After the survivor Leon’s name came out, the world’s intelligence agencies gathered their own information about the TTG Temple and the people around it.
The conclusion they came up with was a common one: medieval authoritarian king + staunch fundamentalist.
An anachronistic classist and religiously unforgiving fundamentalist.
It’s no secret that he hates democracy.
However, his respect for President Ahn and Prime Minister Fujisawa for their legitimacy proves that he is surprisingly communicative.
That’s why the NSS agents were puzzled by the higher-ups’ attitude of being more vigilant than necessary.
[They said there might be knights or extra troops waiting somewhere.]
[After all, they didn’t find anything inside the ferry, did they?]
[That’s right, we’re about to go to Shuangshijie, and we can’t even rest.]
October 10th is coming up. Taiwan celebrates the National Day of the Republic, also known as the Twelfth Day.
The day is marked by a feverish ceremony by the Taiwanese military and nationwide festivities, so some of the Secret Service agents were able to take the day off.
However, with the visit of the TTG Temple, an emergency decree was issued for the entire Bureau. In effect, no vacation for Shuangshijie.
[Uh, but I don’t see one person.]
[Who? We’ve got most of the major players under live surveillance]
The knights and the Men at Arms have even mobilized a police force to keep an eye on them, but they’re not professionals, so they’re bound to be flawed.
However, Han Ha-ri, Chun So-yeon, the other Knights and Vulcanus are closely monitored──
“Huh?”
The Safety Bureau agent who had inadvertently let out a stupid voice realized who he had been missing.
[Park Yong-shin and Yakt Spinner, where are they?! Who’s in charge, report to me now!]
[This is Cheong Tim! Cheong Tim, come in!]
Frantic radio chatter flows among the Safety Bureau agents. When they had followed Cheong Tim’s GPS, there was no sign of them.
They’d been attacked by something, a sign of battle. Blue Team surveillance, even veteran hunters, had been cut down before they could draw their swords.
“Damn it!”
I didn’t think they’d be so brazen as to dispose of the monitors like this! The agents of the Safety Bureau had a hunch that the TTG Temple wasn’t really here for tourism. Then——.
“Find them now! Search all the CCTVs to find out where they went, and double the number of people who are currently watching them!”
Something–something is going on.
Why two people?
Yakt Spinner, the mechanical Holy Knight of the TTG Temple, and Park Yong-shin, the former head of a cult, we’re planning something.
* * * *
The Hanbit Palace was a world-wide cult with quite a name.
While it had a significant presence in its home country of South Korea, it had also established branches in the U.S., Japan, and Europe, with significant numbers of adherents in Taiwan.
Months after Leon’s divine punishment of Hanbit Palace. All the members were purified and taught the true faith.
For a while, Hanbit Palace members from all over the world began to arrive in South Korea and visit TTG Temple, but surprisingly, it was done in secret.
Due to the nature of the cult, the members were thoroughly educated on how to remain invisible to the media.
Due to the nature of the religion’s propagation during the cult era, it does not operate a large cathedral. It is basically a point organization where members of the Hanbit Palace visit people’s homes to give testimonies and learn doctrine.
And today is a monumental day for the 138,000 members of the Taiwan branch of Hanbit Palace.
“Today is truly a glorious day.”
Park Yong-shin told the congregation in fluent Chinese. His passionate testimony and sermon alone brought tears to the eyes of the congregation in Taiwan.
But Park Yong-shin is not the main event of the day.
“Today, His Majesty the Lionheart King, who is our spiritual leader and has granted us the grace to awaken to the true faith, has personally sent a representative.
I present to you, the Holy Knight who represents Mr. Heto, the God of Iron and Blacksmithing! Sir Yakt Spinner!”
Yakt Spinner steps up to the dais on his eight steel legs and climbs onto the tall cushion that has been prepared for him.
His camera eye beams to the congregation in front of him, and through the heavily encrypted relay site.
-Good morning. I’m Yakt Spinner.
Yappy incited the crowd with a natural voice and powerful gestures that dazzled them in a way that a cold steel machine could not.
-The indulgence of the unbelievers has reached a fever pitch. The time has come for you to fulfill your duties as the chosen servants of the gods.
The Yakt Spinner projected something onto the screens that would be beamed to each branch. It was a large number of boxes of unknown origin.
Those with eyes to see realized at once what they were.
-Explosives?
Yappy continued his sermon to the murmuring congregation.
The strange voice that had started a world war some ninety years earlier convinced the congregation that they were doing the right thing. And when the heightened emotions reached a fever pitch, Yappy waved his mechanical arm powerfully and shouted.
-Deliver the punishment, for it is the will of the gods!
-Gods will!
-As the gods will!
One hundred and thirty-eight thousand terrorists were produced.

chapters.title: Chapter 165: Vulcanus’ Ambition
chapters.content:
Chapter 165: Vulcanus’ Ambition
Before landing in Taiwan, the orders from Leon were simple.
Enjoy yourself.
Spend some money, meet the locals, and relax.
The order caught everyone off guard since they hadn’t heard much about Leon’s trip to Taiwan in the first place.
Why was he going to Taiwan now, at this time of year? No one knew for sure, but it seemed clear that Leon was planning to do something here.
“Lord Vulcanus. Here’s some fried chicken wings— Yikes, did you break a chair again?!”
Ha-ri was horrified to see Vulcanus sitting on one of the chairs outside the shop and smashing it.
“How many are there, and you’re just standing there?”
“Hmph—, the chairs are weak!”
Vulcanus’ plea fell on deaf ears: his gigantic size alone barely exceeds standard weight, and his armor is made entirely of stardust, so there’s no way the chair could hold up.
“Why don’t you at least take off the armor, it’s intimidating to the citizens.”
“Hmm? No, I just took a selfie. I was quite popular.”
“Really?”
It was then that a tourist who had been hanging around Vulcanus approached him and asked for a photo.
“Mr. Vulcanus. Can I have a picture with you?”
Vulcanus responded to the French-looking woman’s request in a jovial tone.
“Of course, señorita!”
“Oh, that’s Italian.”
“That’s right, GRARARARA──!!”
Vulcanus took a picture with the woman with a boisterous laugh. Ha-ri was dumbfounded at the sight.
“What, what is it?”
Vulcanus flicked something from inside his armor and pulled out a smartphone.
In his hulking hands, the smartphone looks tiny, even though it’s clearly the largest smartphone of the current generation.
-Click, click, click!
Vulcanus skillfully taps his smartphone to access his social media accounts. At first glance, he has a lot of followers.
“What is this?”
