“It’s an account we created to extol the virtues and teachings of our Order. Here is the account of Her Majesty the Queen, High Priestess of Dreams and Death.”
It’s no secret that Beatrice is quite adept with modern technology.
In fact, she can get likes from all over the world for a selfie of herself wearing nothing but cotton wool all day, with just a hint of her eyes showing through.
Beatrice, the otherworldly queen of magicians and fearsome beauty, has put this to good use, promoting the TTG Temple.
“Oh, Lord Laihar man has arrived. Let’s see.”
But Beatrice was an intellectual everywhere she looked.
She was a woman of innate knowledge and intelligence. She debunked dozens of magical theories put forth by the high mages of the Tower.
But Vulcanus had never——
He was a very impressive human being.
First of all, the ferocity in his searing gaze alone made Ha-ri freeze like a frog in the presence of a snake.
The moment she made eye contact, she instinctively realized that this man was far more powerful than she was.
His overwhelmingly large presence filled her vision.
Beyond being a Holy Knight or the War God’s rider, Vulcanus would have accomplished something great even if he hadn’t become a member of the pantheon.
Ha-ri understood that he was a giant who would be at the center of history.
“Small, small, Mr. Petos, how fitting that you made such a poor little girl your priestess!”
She almost fell backwards at the sound of his boastful voice.
[She’s a sinful dwarf by your standards.]
Petos gives him a look, but Vulcanus doesn’t seem to mind, just chuckles.
“First of all, Lord Han Ha-ri, you need to grow some height, chest, and ass!”
“Sexually harassing me five minutes after we met?!”
Vulcanus makes a questioning gesture at the stunned Ha-ri.
He pounded his massive head and emphasized the pectorals of his chest, then turned around to show off the muscles of his back and his ungainly ass.
“Big height! Big boobs! Big ass!”
She wondered, was this really not sexual harassment?
Anyway, ever since that shocking first meeting, Ha-ri had perceived Vulcanus as a rather savage macho knight.
A big, burly knight who looked like he was about to dagger a huge, meaty steak, lift it up, and shout, “No one is going to stop me,” and then──
“I’m a social media star on a smartphone, and I’m better at it than even His Majesty!
Compared to the Lion King, who showed no signs of getting used to modern culture no matter how much he was educated, Vulcanus was skillfully utilizing modern advantages.
“Hmph— not enough fire. Lack of divinity.”
Vulcanus, who was in the midst of socializing and eating fried rice with chicken wings, expressed such a complaint.
“What?”
Lack of flavor is one thing, but lack of divinity? Before Ha-ri could say anything, Vulcanus was already in action.
-Kaaaaaah!
-Kaaaaaah!
-Fire!
The onlookers were stunned by the sudden burst of flame. Whether they realized it or not, Vulcanus’ fingers, the source of the fire, scorched the fried chicken wings Ha-ri had brought.
He used a flame of divinity that burns demons to the bone to heat up street food.
“Mmm! Just right!”
Vulcanus looked at the cooked chicken wing fried rice with satisfaction. He took off his helmet and ate it in one bite.
[That bastard, wasting his holy power again!]
Petos gritted his teeth at the wanton waste of holy power.
[Ha-ri, my nymph, have a word with that ignoramus!]
“What, me?”
Ha-ri glanced at Vulcanus, and immediately looked fed up.
He’s well over two meters tall, and he moves effortlessly in hundreds of kilograms of stardust armor that looks like it weighs a ton, and his bare neck and arms are covered in bundles of muscle that look like they’re made of steel.
He could strangle a giant with his bare hands, and his searing gaze was unrealistically intense.
Even if he had been a commoner, not a knight or hunter, he had a presence she wouldn’t have dared to contend with—what was she supposed to do against a Vulcanus who had forearms as thick as her waist?
“I can’t——.”
[Ha-ri—!]
Ha-ri spontaneously lowered her head, and Vulcanus laughed heartily and patted her on the shoulder.
“Ugh! Ugh! Ugh!”
Her shoulder blades feel like they’re being crushed by the palm of his hand.
“Lord Vulcanus—! More than that! Was it because of you— that Lord Petos’ holy power was cut off last time?!”
“Hmm?”
Ha-ri said, referring to the incident where Lord Petos’ holy power was suddenly depleted during the Great Gate Crisis.
Ha-ri had been able to utilize the power of Poma, but the other knights had had a hard time.
“Ah, that’s what happened. Hmm, it’s all because Petos wasn’t as good as he used to be. I can’t believe he’s so depleted after a divine descent.”
[Me, me, me—!]
Petos’ voice trembles as if he’s suffering from apoplexy. He’s probably grabbing the back of his head as well.
“Divine Descent ——.”
“You know that, too? I don’t think your lordship taught you that on purpose.”
“Yes–I have seen it.”
Antoine, Holy Knight of the Iron and Blacksmiths and Isabelle, High Priestess of the Moon and Purity,
Gillingham, Holy Knight of Sky and Thunder and Loxley, Holy Knight Sun and Judgment.
Each of them, in their final moments, became one with the Gods in the Divine Descent.
Vulcanus had no qualms about using the Divine Descent as a final self-destruct.
If there is a human being capable of such a thing——.
“I don’t think it’s possible for anyone but you’re his Majesty.”
“Certainly not, for even the Lionheart Kings of old could not contain more than three gods.”
The current Lionheart King, Leon Dragonia Lionheart, is the pinnacle of history, Vulcanus affirmed.
“This is the realm of pure talent. The miracle of ‘representing the gods’ cannot be contained in a human vessel, it overflows.”
Vulcanus used Jerea as an example.
“Sir Jerea left a legacy of noble spirit and feats as a Holy Knight, but he was not capable of the Descent.”
The other Holy Knights could barely last a dozen minutes after the Descent.
“So you’re saying that His Majesty is full of talent?”
“Yes! I, Vulcanus, am a freak of history, and he, my lord, is an even bigger freak than I am!”
If it weren’t for Ha-ri, who had witnessed Leon’s fighting prowess, she would have denied it in the face of Vulcanus’ overwhelming presence.
Ha-ri’s golden eyes widened as Vulcanus continued.
“And you also have talent.”
“Me?”
“As you may have vaguely guessed, Han Ha-ri, you are already capable of channeling the power of two gods, which is proof that you are a natural vessel of divinity.”
“Ah, no. I just happened to be lucky──”
Vulcanus pointed a thick thumb at Ha-ri’s sternum, her heart, to be exact.
“You said you had a Heart of Fire transplanted from Isabel, and this is proof.”
Ha-ri looked down at her heart.
In the Lionheart Kingdom, Ha-ri inherited two holy items from Isabelle.
One was a bracelet called the Heart of the Sea, left by Manon, the Holy Knight of the Sea and Waves, and the other was──
“The Orc Undertaker, Duke of Renault. The Heart of the First High Priest of War and Flame.”
A legendary saint who, along with the first King Lionheart and the first Grand Duke of Dragonia, laid the cornerstone of the kingdom.
They each left their power in the form of a “heart.”
“The Lionheart, the greatest and most all-powerful, was implanted in His Majesty, and the Dragonheart, the fiercest and most ferocious, belongs to His Majesty–nay, to Archduke Karina.”
And the one remaining, the Fire Heart of the Duke of Renault.
“Your Heart of Fire is the most intense founding flame of all. It is a holy relic, a symbol of the Knights Templar, worshiped and honored by the Order of the Burning Sword.”
“It’s that awesome——.”
Ha-ri looked bitter at the realization. Sure, the items taken from the Gate were perfect ‘reproductions’ of it, but they were just as much a part of it as the real thing, just another copy.
“But you are not using the Heart of Fire properly.”
“Is that so?”
This is why I was promoted to an S-class Hunter. And yet, it’s not enough?
“It is an artifact that produces its own holy power, just like the Lionheart. Even if I had squeezed out all of Mr. Petos’ meager holy power, you, with the Heart of Fire implanted, would have produced enough.”
“Is that so?”
Vulcanus chuckled. Apparently, it was up to him to raise this new girl to be the next Holy Knight.
“Well, since there can’t be two Holy Knights, I’ll try to become a Holy Archduke or something.”
[There is no such title!]
“Uh-huh, Mr. Petos. To be honest, I’m not quite the same as the other Holy Knights, so I’m sure there’s room for a new position for me. Mmm—! Yes!”
Vulcanus slapped his knee with a bang, the light gesture creating a gust of wind and causing the tourists around him to scream.
“A king! Yes, a king! I’ve always wanted to play king one day!”
[No, this guy?! Blasphemy!]
Ha-ri and Petos are horrified that Vulcanus would say the word king, which in an absolute monarchy is tantamount to treason.
Only Vulcanus nonchalantly blurts out his treasonous words.
“I am the Holy King, and His Majesty is the Lionheart King.”
“Uhhh——”
Ha-ri wanted to tell him that something was wrong, but Vulcanus quickly pulled out a tourist map and scanned the terrain across Taiwan.
“Lord Ha-ri, this country called Taiwan, how big is it in terms of the world?”
“About——”
The tourist map didn’t do it justice, so Ha-ri pulled up a world map on her smartphone and pointed to Taiwan’s location.
“This is the island of Taiwan, where we are now.”
“Mm—! And South Korea?”
“Uh-huh.”
Ha-ri pointed to the location of South Korea, and Vulcanus went──
“grararararara──!!”
He let out a booming roar that caused a ripple in the air with its volume alone.
“Small! Small! Small enough to contain the magnificent power of the Lionheart, when the world is so vast!”
The sound of the Vulcanus held a kind of endless anticipation, almost too much for the souls of mere mortals to bear.
Do Ha-ri and the other tourists realize that Vulcanus’ distinctive cackle is a downgrade ordered by the Lionhearted King to reduce the volume of his magnificent voice.
He was the one who had burned away the magic of the Archduke Glacier with the flames of his sexual power alone.
“Okay, okay, this is China first, we’ll take it and march westward, and once we’ve founded the Lionheart Empire, we’ll take the best of it and make it ours, but for now, let’s save this place called Taiwan for a vacation home!”
It was a crazy idea for a 21st century war of conquest, but Vulcanus was determined to put a statue of himself in the center of this Taiwanese land.
“Oh, no! War is—!”
Ha-ri protested at the horrible sound of world domination, but Vulcanus was determined.
“Ahem! The nations of the culprits are corrupt and self-indulgent in the first place, and look what happened when our Lionheart authorized the Empire instead of conquering the world, and the result is the decay of the Empire!”
In Vulcanus’ view, the Empire and the other kingdoms rose because the Lionheart did not conquer, because it did not seek to expand unnecessarily.
The Lionheart saw other nations as objects to be educated and taught, not conquered and dominated.
“Pe, Petos, stop him!”
Ha-ri desperately clutched at the threads of reason and called out to Petos. Vulcanus was the most godless Holy Knight she’d ever seen, but wouldn’t he listen to Petos?
[Good, you’re talking a good game for once, and you’re worth a throne when you’re done with the Great War’s task of conquering the world.]
“That’s right, a war god!”
Petos, the god of war and fire. In terms of loyalty, he’s the god most similar to Vulcanus!
“Lord Poma —!”
Ha-ri’s prayers were now directed to Poma, but he was also-──
[Speaking of the Global World, it would be easy to conquer it if I just blocked the sea routes, the Mediterranean Sea is so fine and good, I’ll set up my statue there].
‘These people, they were not only medieval people, they were medieval gods!’
There’s no such thing as love and peace!
Ha-ri changed the subject to stop this barbaric medieval worldview from progressing.
“Your Majesty, Your Majesty, what were you thinking letting us loose?”
Ha-ri had been warned beforehand that there would be a Demon Archduke of Pleasure and Decadence here.
Ha-ri had been warned that there would be a Demon Lord of Pleasure and Corruption here, so she expected to go straight to the demons, but Leon’s behavior was not at all what she expected.
“Well, I’m sure my lord has something in mind.”
“I’m sure he does, he’s got such an image——”
Ha-ri couldn’t say yes because the image of charging in and smashing everything was strongly implanted in her mind.
Looking at Ha-ri, Vulcanus smiles meaningfully.
“Well, well, well, Lord Ha-ri, have you not seen the other side of your master?”
“Another— side?”
“His Lordship is as honorable and just a knight as any knight has ever been, but He is also a cunning and cruel man— beyond the imagination of any knight.”
“What?”
Vulcanus recalled what was now a memory.
Once upon a time, when he was a berserker wielding the power of an evil god, there had been a ‘King of Terror’ who had struck him down and smashed him with his millions of barbarians thirteen times.
A war horseman of the highest order, favored by the God of War above all others.
That was the Lionheart King of the Age.
He became a symbol of victory, or in other words, he would do anything to win the war.

chapters.title: Chapter 166: President Zhao’s Nightmare
chapters.content:
Chapter 166: President Zhao’s Nightmare
In the years after the Cataclysm, when the first survivors were discovered, Earth was abuzz for a time.
The arrival of the survivors from the otherworld beyond the Gate is a singularity in human history. Humanity learned new world technologies from them, and realized that they could benefit from each other.
However, as survivors continued to cross the Gate, their scarcity diminished, and their treatment became problematic.
The survivors, former nobles, generals, and other high-ranking individuals, wanted to be treated similarly on Earth.
But in a democracy, nobility and royalty are only honorary titles; they have no taxing power, no territory, and no pardons.
“His Majesty Leon Dragonia Lionheart, Queen Beatrice Alighieri Spero, please enter!”
If it’s anything more than an S-class hunter, the treatment is bound to give a nation pause.
In Taiwan’s Presidential Palace there was a huge welcome ceremony with soldiers and service personnel on standby.
There were surprisingly few reporters, given the size of the event, because Leon didn’t like them.
[How dare you speak your mind in the presence of the King, will you stay away!]
Leon disliked the rudeness of reporters who pointed cameras and microphones at him, and the Lionheart King’s anger would send them to the hospital with low-frequency radiation, so they had no choice but to avoid him.
As a result, it became a national rule that only a handful of reporters were allowed to cover Leon, with carefully selected questions.
It was a rare occurrence for the media to bow down to a single individual, but those who witnessed the debilitation of senior reporters believed that the Lionheart King had the power to curse people.
In any case, the state’s treatment of this otherworldly king set a model guideline for the South Korean government.
Basically, you should expect to be treated with the same respect as modern monarchs, such as the British royal family, and feel comfortable giving in to any demands.
Japan alone has shown extreme caution in its treatment of South Korean President Ahn.
President Zhao was fully aware of this.
‘This is the king of an absolute monarchy.’
After the collapse of China, Zhao, who had dispatched diplomats with little fanfare and arranged annual visits by presidents and royalty from various countries, had never prepared a state dinner with such care.
‘I’ve got my jjambap, I’ll eat it anyway!’
He had even served the Pope so Zhao desperately tries to pass this off as casual.
“Haha, Your Majesty, how about our official residence, which is currently unused and operated as a museum?”
“Hmm, it was built over a hundred years ago?”
“Yes, after the Civil War, President Chiang Kai-shek built a new official residence and opened it to the public.”
President Zhao welcomes state guests to Taiwan with a VIP full-course meal when they first arrive.
And it’s clear that Leon liked the way he was treated.
‘Good! That’s a green light! He’ll return to Korea as it is!’
Above all, he had a reason to be extremely protective of Leon──
‘If this guy loses his temper and suddenly goes on a rampage, I’ll definitely die.’
He was a demon follower, well to be fair, President Zhao is not a demon follower.
Like any other politician, he pursued his own excesses, and in the process ran afoul of the Demon Archduke of Pleasure and Decadence.
‘Damn you, Shi Yan, I only got in because I was lured in by the promise of a great new recruit!’
A high ranking member of the council, promising to introduce him to a nice girl, was met by the Demon Duke of Fallen, who made him lose all will to resist.
[If you listen to me, I will give you immortality, when the Earth is ours]
President Zhao was a devout Christian. He wasn’t particularly interested in immortality, as he planned to go to heaven when he died, but he knew that if he refused on the spot, he would die.
The power of the Demon Archduke is so terrifying and powerful that no earthly entity can stand against it. Just one of these demons would be enough to devastate the planet.
Shouldn’t we be on the side of the victor?
President Zhao made a choice to survive, a choice he now regrets terribly.
If anyone were to ask him why he served the demons, he would say this.
‘Because I didn’t know! I didn’t know that there would be an Otherworldly survivor who could defeat the Demon Archduke! If I had known, I would not have done it!’
Quai tells him to bide his time until the twentieth, but Zhao is eager to send Leon back.
“I’d like to know how you liked your meals, hehehe!”
And just like that, the feast was over, with food going down their throats and up their nostrils, and they were about to move on to the next part of their schedule.
“I’m surprised.”
“What do you mean?”
“I’ve had a lot of meetings with people representing the government lately. They’re polite to this king, but they’ve got a secret agenda.”
“Yeah? What, what’s that——”
No way, he’s realized I’m a follower of the demons!
No way! I don’t want to be a demon follower, so I’ve been avoiding demonization blessings as much as possible!
“I’m just as guilty these days. They beg to sell my stuff because they’re dumb drones. All the while abandoning the source of their power, their faith.”
Leon grumbled, but it was only natural.
The star iron weapons, blessed crops, and high-tech equipment of the Temple of the Ten Thousand Gods are strategic equipment that countries around the world are eager to acquire.
Any other head of state would use Leon’s visit as an opportunity to make connections, but President Zhao just wants Leon to leave Taiwan as soon as possible.
“Ah~ Speaking of which, I have a gift for the president.”
“Ah, it’s my honor, Your Majesty.”
Leon smiled and handed the president a box.
“And this?”
Leon carefully opened the box, and inside was a necklace with an old-fashioned design. It was a necklace that even he, who had just turned sixty last year, felt comfortable wearing around his neck.
“It’s a necklace made of stellar iron. It doesn’t have much power, but it has the ability to preserve health and ward off evil.”
“I see.”
Ward off evil? Does it drive away demons?
“I have received a precious gift, Your Majesty.”
“Go ahead and try it on.”
Since he had been given something that he could use directly, President Zhao had to present a good picture while trying it on.
“It looks good on you.”
“Thank you, Your Majesty.”
Actually wearing the necklace made him feel refreshed and energized.
“Then thank you for the day. You and the queen may rest in your quarters for a while. It was an honor to have both of your majesties visit our republic.”
Finally, it’s over, and after a final photo op with a gesture of closeness to Leon, they’re on their way.
As they boarded the limousine to his official residence.
“Thank you for your work. The Chief of Staff is pleased──Kii-yin?!
The driver, a lowly demon wearing human skin, who was waiting in the limousine, suddenly screamed.
“What, what?”
“Off, off, off! Grrrrrr—!”
The demon disguised as a chauffeur scratched at the dull leather and spat out a stream of blood, its body bubbling as if it had been exposed to high levels of radiation.
‘It’s the necklace!’
It was easy to find the culprit. The necklace around his neck was generating a shaped light that was bombarding the driver demon.
“I gotta get out, I gotta get out—!”
Just as the demon was about to open the door and get out, President Zhao realized he was fucked and stopped him.
“Ah, no, there’s a bunch of reporters outside, if you go out—!”
Zhao unknowingly grabbed the driver’s hand.
He thought of the disaster that would happen if the people discovered that his driver was a demon and the end of his political life.
“Ah, no—, let go, let go, ah—!”
And to his surprise, the demon could not escape his old grasp and began to shudder, slowly turning to ash and disappearing.
“——”
Watching the scene, President Zhao was at a loss for words, his eyes filled with fear. The only people in the limousine were the ashen driver demon and himself.
Zhao brushed off the ash and moved to the driver’s seat.
‘I’m going to have nightmares tonight.’
* * * *
“Pour! Drink!”
“Gulp~! Opa, stop!”
Drinking with a woman younger than his daughter would not be too much of a denial for a politician.
“Heh, heh, heh, what do you think, President, isn’t the water good today?”
Smirking and wiggling his fat ass, was the head of the Iranian administration.
‘I used to hang out with him because we had similar hobbies.’
Today, he’s here to meet an idol trainee he’s going to introduce to him.
“Mr. Shi Yan, when is the idol trainee you’re going to introduce me to coming out?”
“Uhhhhh— Not in a hurry. I’ve got them waiting for you outside!”
With a wave of his hand, the door opened and a dazzling beauty walked in.
Hair like silver melted down and stretched into threads, eyes that sparkled like large amethysts. Her bewitching smile made his old heart flutter.
“Oh, she’s so beautiful, Shi Yan, you’ve done something great!”
Such a stunning beauty is an idol trainee, and if she took a selfie and posted it on SNS, she would be considered the most beautiful woman of the year.
He sighed to himself as he saw the aura of a woman he wanted to reach out and touch, but didn’t dare.
“Really, it’s the same thing in every world.”
It was a different world, a modern, unfamiliar culture, but Beatrice recognized it as a symbol of the pleasures of any world.
Alcohol, drugs, and sex appealed to the most primal of human pleasures, and Beatrice had burned too many handsome men, beauties, and slimy, floundering degenerates.
“Desire must be tempered.”
She couldn’t help but be offended by this excess of pleasure and the corruption it caused.
People sold their family, country and even world, because they couldn’t control their primal needs.
But apart from that, work is work. Beatrice had to extract the information she needed from this degenerate.
“So–shall we begin?”
“Hmph, your voice is heavenly~”
As Zhao drooled and looked at her with dirty eyes, Beatrice smirked.
“Rest assured, you will ‘never’ wake up until tomorrow morning. First—shall we start with your nails?”
It didn’t take long for the sweet dream to turn into a nightmare.
* * * *
The Demon of Pleasure and Decadence Archduke Quai was busy preparing for the ‘banquet’.
A demon from his secretary’s office approached him and reported.
“The demon who was the chauffeur of the president has been extinguished.”
Demons dressed in human skins have been assigned to key figures in the country, including President Zhao.
During Leon’s visit kept they tried to stay as far away from the TTG Temple as possible, but——
“Who did this?”
“The Present said it was the necklace he was given.”
“That——”
Of course, it’s true that demons are reluctant to wear items imbued with holy power. But to have even a lowly demon vanish in an instant when a mere necklace of stardust is placed in front of them?
“It wasn’t that bad even in Lionheart.”
There must be some other trick up his sleeve. At Quay’s nonchalance, the assistant demon, somewhat impatient, said.
“Do you want me to instruct him to remove the necklace?”
“No, it’s too late. He’s probably up to something.”
“Well, that means——”
“He’s already realized we’re here, so maybe he’s just waiting for us to make the first move.”
“——!”
The secretary demon purred in fear and Quai sighed as he watched the scene unfold.
Who could frighten immortal demons so much?
The Magician Queen was a formidable foe, but it was the Lionheart King who was truly terrifying.
A terror that neither the immortality of the demons, nor their great magic, nor their overwhelming numbers could subdue.
It would take more than strength to defeat him.
“Let us speed up the preparations for the banquet, for it must be ready by the twenty-first.”
“Will that— work? Even the Lord is dead——”
What Quai was preparing for was a power greater than any that could corrupt any being.
No mortal had ever stood before that terrible castle of corruption, symbolizing the Lord of Pleasure and Decadence.
Dothraddon, who had never imagined that he would be defeated by a single mortal in a mortal world that was all but destroyed, died without ever being able to use it.
“Well, I’m not Dothradon, so I can understand your anxiety.”
Besides, it’s not the Demon Lord who’s preparing the banquet now, but Archduke, Quay.
Without the new Lord of Pleasure, Beatrice, there was no one else to unleash its full power.
“But hey, even I can push just one person over the edge.”
The Lionheart King made a mistake.
A fatal mistake.

chapters.title: Chapter 167: Deus Ex Machina

Chapter 167: Deus Ex Machina
October 10th. Twelfth Day. This national holiday commemorates the revolution that led to the establishment of the Republic of China.
It’s a national holiday celebrated by most of the 53 countries on the mainland, with the exception of non-Han Chinese autonomous regions such as Uyghur and Tibet, and it’s also a big day of festivities in Taiwan.
“Wow, it’s crazy out there.”
“I’ve never seen such a large parade outside of an amusement park. It’s nothing compared to Disneyland.”
The city streets are closed to civilian traffic and filled with colorful kites, parade floats, and flag-waving citizens.
Sixty years after their independence from the mainland was threatened, Taiwanese pride in their newfound independence is immense.
So much so that they celebrate their biggest holiday, the Twelfth Day, by inviting international celebrities.
“Don’t be shy. A knight of the Lionheart King should be able to relax and enjoy a banquet of this magnitude.”
Leon turned his attention to Ha-ri and the other knights, who wanted to open the limo window. Beatrice smirked at the sight.
“It’s only natural for young knights to want to enjoy the festivities, isn’t it, Your Majesty?”
“This king used to go to jousting tournaments and serf festivals to earn his keep, not like these brats.”
“Your Majesty?”
“What?”
Ha-ri raised her hand, and Leon waved the question away.
“I think I know what a jousting tournament is, but what is a serf festival?”
“Hmm, good question. I’m planning on doing one with Lord Spinner someday.”
Ha-ri felt uneasy when Leon mentioned Yappy.
“To explain this festival, we must first consider its origins. Sir Gratas, the Holy Knight, a giant slayer and author of the book How to Slay Giants with Serfs…”
In the past, the Lionheart Kingdom launched a continent-wide Night War when there was no empire yet, barbarians and demonic followers flooded the chaotic continent, along with mounted peoples from the east.
Crushing so many enemies naturally led to a surplus of serfs, whose numbers approached the total population of the Lionheart Kingdom.
This was despite taking no prisoners on the battlefield.
“So Lord Gratas had an idea: instead of just killing them, let’s consume them as tribute to the gods.”
Thus began the hunt for the giants, a powerful fighting race that was growing in numbers on the continent at the time.
Lord Gratas led his serfs on a charge and hunted the giants to extinction, among other feats.
The result is Leon’s manual, How to Hunt Giants with Serfs.
“It was in honor of Lord Gratas’ exploits that the Serf Festival spread like wildfire throughout the kingdom.”
“Uh— Well, then?”
“Please tell me that’s not true.”
Ha-ri and Jae-hyuk deny reality but with a shaky voice, Soo-ho spoke the truth.
“Are you referring to the nationwide serf consumption festival, the—?”
“That’s right.”
God–no, Arianna, God.
The three of them remembered the Templar election, when they’d been given a single dagger and sent on a suicidal rampage against giants.
And they did that on a national scale?
Leon turned his gaze to Chun So-yeon, leaving the three in a daze.
“Chun So-yeon, do you have a good idea?”
He’d enlisted So-Yeon in this madness?
“Yes.”
She prepared that?!
“Ho-oh, this king should have organized the regional serf festivals for you, do you already have any new ideas outside of those?”
“I think a serf war would be a good idea.”
“A serf war?”
Leon sounded intrigued while the three knights stared at the leader of the Knight Order, who had just come up with a terrible idea.
Nevertheless, Chun So-yeon shyly pitched her idea.
“There’s a 500-year-old tradition in Korea called the Daejanggunjeon, where you hang a serf and use it as an aerial explosion with firecrackers──”
The three of them shuddered as they listened to the details.
‘What? Is Chun So-yeon crazy?’
‘So-yeon is scary these days——She’s a bit too eager to please——‘
‘It’s not eagerness, it’s craziness!’
Looking back, it was Chun So-yeon who was the most active and ruthless when it came to capturing giants with serfs. She wasn’t the head of the Knights of the Ten Thousand Gods for nothing!
“Uh, what do you think? It’s a unique way to combine local culture, and I’m going to ask the Japanese about it.”
‘Don’t combine local culture with this! Lionheart is enough!’
‘Do you have to be that broken to be a Knight Order Leader?’
If the serfs had heard them, they would have trembled, but Leon simply slapped his knee in satisfaction.
“Good, good, that’s easier to understand than Lord Spinner wanting to hold a maximum overclocking contest with his modified serf netrunner, ah~ Beatrice, what did you say you had in store for us?”
“I’m ashamed to say, but I’ve been enjoying zombie movies lately— I’ve decided to have the contestants go through zombie survival armed with stellar armor──”
“Hmph—! I guess I’ll have to do something about this, too. Lord Vulcanus will just throw the serfs far away like he does every year, and Lionheart’s pride will be on your shoulders!”
‘Please don’t cheer her up with that!’
‘You’re all crazy!’
I found myself wishing I could get out of this crazy place, but the limo just kept going along its set path.
“By the way, Your Majesty, we are not the only invited guests.”
“This is an important national holiday in this country. It’s not unusual to invite guests from all over the world——.”
“Maybe they’re trying to restrict our behavior.”
The guests are invited from all over the world to come together and enjoy a banquet. From what I hear, it’s quite different from what they’re used to.
“Hmph, this king won’t be held back by mere hostages.”
We’ve already confirmed that Zhao is a minion of the demons and extracted the information so the operation would proceed as planned.
“Lord Yappy and Park Yong-shin will be able to handle themselves, and the others are on standby.”
“The question is how they will react in the banquet hall.”
“You’ll have to be careful, the Demons of Pleasure and Corruption aren’t particularly combative demons——”
“They’re just as dirty, I know.”
Leon had been able to single-handedly defeat the Lord of Pleasure, Dothraddon, in part because the demons of their kind were weaker than the demons of Wisdom and Chaos.
But the demons of Pleasure and Decadence are more than capable of using all manner of ugly and vile tricks.
In some ways, they were the most dangerous demons of all, wearing human skin, carrying out sabotage behind closed doors, and corrupting the highest echelons of society.
“We’re going to have to meet this one head-on, and you know it, and yet you’ve come to this island in person.”
“Of course. How well does Your Majesty know the Corrupted Archduke Quai?”
“Not very well. After the fall of the Lord of Wisdom, they fled to the Demon Gate.”
Akasha, the Slaughter Archduke, is a prime example. He was marching toward the Eastern Sky Kingdom instead of Lionheart, and when the Lord fell, he fled through the Demon Gate.
In addition, Archduke Glacier fled to escape Vulcanus, and the Archdukes Lust and Wisdom died at the hands of Leon.
“So he is the only survivor of the Demon Archdukes who fought in that war.”
Archduke Corruption Quay had heard the rumors, and so had Leon. They were the ones who had corrupted the Empire through the Wisdom Palace and the Cult of Pleasure.
But he was not easily seen on the battlefield, and Lionheart’s knights continued their futile pursuit of the Fallen Archduke.
“He came to my world after he escaped from your world, and it took him less than fifty years to destroy ours.”
Beatrice was the most powerful magician in her world, but she was powerless to do anything against Quai.
By the time she was born, most of the kingdoms had fallen.
She had been fighting demons since she was old enough to attend elementary school on Earth.
“They prey on people’s weaknesses and deceive them. Countless generals, kings, and nobles have fallen at their hands. If I had more time, I would have done the same——.”
“With the artifact given by the Queen—is it irresistible?”
Chen So-yeon pointed to the earring on her ear. It was an artifact made with the power of dreams that had once trapped even the Slaughter Archduke Akasha.
Beatrice had distributed artifacts that protected this spirit, in the form of bracelets, necklaces, and earrings, to all the knights of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods.
When asked if the Fallen Archduke could be blocked in a similar fashion, Beatrice shook her head in denial.
“The artifact is a prototype that was distributed to key figures in a similar fashion, albeit at a lower power level. It worked against moderately high level demons, but even the Archdemons were highly resistant——”
It didn’t work on the Fallen Archduke Quai so Beatrice spoke again, this time with caution.
“He shows his targets what they want most and extends an irresistible hand, so beware of the Corruption Pact he offers.”
* * * *
The ballroom of a five-star hotel in the capital city of Taipei was filled with politicians, celebrities, and influencers from around the world.
Each person entering the ballroom was dressed in traditional attire, including hanfu and cheongsam, a colorful display of Taiwan’s centrality to Chinese culture.
“It’s easy to move around in, and I like the colorfulness.”
“I’ve never worn a Chinese dress before, but, um— I might be more embarrassed than I thought.”
Ha-ri spins around to look at the red silk cheongsam.
Ha-ri, Beatrice, and Leon are not the only ones who have changed into traditional Chinese clothing.
This was partly because the dress code for the banquet was traditional Han Chinese clothing, and partly because Taiwan has a similar tendency to dress its heads of state in hanbok for photos, as is customary in Korea.
“Though you have come to hunt demons, this is a show of state. You are the knights of the Lionheart, and you will behave accordingly.”
It was time for Leon to call the worshippers of the Temple of Ten Thousand Gods to attention while in the distance, President Zhao sought him out with his entourage.
“Your Majesty, are you here?”
President Zhao looked a little shaken. He should have been in good shape for a national holiday.
“President Zhao. You don’t look well, do you?”
“Oh, yeah— I haven’t gotten much sleep lately.”
Leon patted President Zhao on the shoulder with a smiling face.
Of course, the reason he was shaken was because of the nightmares he’d been having the past few days.
He had vomited up information through a medium planted by Beatrice, the High Priestess of Dreams and Death.
He was never able to find out if there was some sort of embargo on the identity of the Fallen Archduke Quay, but the information he knew of as president allowed him to place “martyrs” at key points.
He would not know that until the end since Beatrice’s visions manipulated even his memory.
“It’s a beautiful day, by the way.”
“Yeah? Oh, it is, isn’t it? This nice weather it’s a good sign.”
“Yeah, it’s definitely a good sign.”
For some reason, Zhao found that smile frightening.
“By the way, where is Lord Vulcanus-”
At that moment, a group of men burst through the doors of the banquet hall.
“What, what, you people!”
“Guards, what are the guards──!”
They entered the ballroom in a flash and took over the hotel. How did they take over the ballroom so quickly, which was supposed to be a huge place with tons of VIPs?
There wasn’t even a shot fired. Among the guards were hunters from a large Taiwanese hunter guild that had been hired for the occasion!
From the center of the ruffians a man hooded and cloaked stepped forward.
“Greetings, gentlemen. On this rare day, you’ll have to excuse me.”
The man’s demeanor was polite, like a gentleman, but who knows. Anyone who can be polite in a dramatic situation is probably a nutcase.
“You–! You know where you are!”
Just then, a group of men confronted the intruders. They were not from the Taiwanese military or police.
“Guild Leader Lan Fang!”
Lan Fang, one of Taiwan’s top S-class hunters, and his guild, hired by the Taiwanese administration to guard the banquet, were not to be intimidated by a few terrorists!
“I don’t know where these bastards came from, but they made a mistake!”
Guild Leader Lan Fang raised his greatsword and leapt at the first man who appeared to be the leader.
He realized that in order to prevent the guests from being injured, he had to take out the leader quickly.
“Die!”
Lan Fang’s greatsword was imbued with domineering magic. It slammed into the man’s body and──
-Bang!
A crashing sound like iron being struck was heard and at the same time, the robe was torn open, revealing a hidden figure.
“——!”
It was an item called ‘heavy armor’, which is quite alien to Hunters who value technology and speed.
Unless it was a drop item of exceptional performance, it was shunned for being heavy and blunt, but——.
‘He simply blocked my blow?’
What was even more surprising was how hard it was, even after blocking an S-class Hunter’s blow, it was not damaged in the slightest.
“Hoo hoo, I have the honor of testing the prototype of an item that will be dedicated to the Great Lord. The sword of an unbeliever will not be able to wound this armor.”
The man flashed a large mace and Lan Fang, who hadn’t expected the terrorist leader to possess Legendary armor, was dumbfounded and took the blow of the mace.
“Huh~ Good thing you’re strong.”
The man who had subdued the Guild Leader with a single blow shouted at the hesitant guild members.
“You’d better not move a finger, although I did give you a thumping once to set an example——”
Behind the man, the men stepped forward in unison, each turning their robes over to reveal their fearsome tools.
“Po, bombs!”
“Madmen!”
The terrorists were all wearing bomb vests.
-Bam! Banquet hall overrun. Moved on to the next phase.
And at the same time.
-Aaaah! Terrorists!
-What, what! Why are there terrorists here?
-Cosplay?
All over Taiwan over a thousand terrorists have appeared in major cities.
“”Because the gods willed it!””
Fanatics.

chapters.title: Chapter 168: Arianna and Akbar
chapters.content:
Chapter 168: Arianna and Akbar
Taipei’s beautiful Hua Hua Park.
With a huge shopping center and beautiful views of Taipei’s cityscape, this place was packed with customers for the Chinese New Year.
“Mom, I want that!”
Normally, the pricey items in department stores are a burden, but on this day, parents open their wallets to the expensive toys their children want.
Shopping malls held special events for such parents and offered gift certificates as lures to attract more people to their malls.
It’s the finale of a holiday season where spending is more intense than usual. While happily sipping tea after purchasing her child’s toys and luxury handbags, Ms. Shuery noticed some suspicious cosplayers in the crowd.
At first, she thought they were parading through the streets in cosplay to celebrate the Twelfth Festival, but as one of them gradually approached her teahouse, she was able to recognize their unusual coloring.
Neat white robes—only the abdomen is bulging.
It reminded him of someone from Central Asia.
No, no, no.
Her uneasy hunch was becoming more and more realized as the man stepped into the center of the teahouse.
“God.”
The muttered word was all she needed to hear.
‘Why? Why? Why are they in Taiwan?’
Why, over and over again. But when her eyes locked with the man’s, what came out of her lips was a pitiful plea.
“Please——.”
Please don’t do this. What have we done wrong? Children deserve better than——.
It was a “please” with a lot of desperation in it. But Mr. Shuery lost all hope with the one word the man with the bomb switch said with a smirk.
“Because the gods want it.”
No hesitation, no guilt, just a calm voice. The eyes of a fanatic convinced he was on a pilgrimage.
“Mommy?”
The daughter, playing with a new toy, looked up, sensing her mother’s strangeness.
“Meiling, Mommy loves you!”
All Shuery could do was hug her child and hope it would hurt a little less.
-Beep!
Kaaaaaaaaaah!
There were explosions everywhere.
-Bang! Boom! Quack!
And the sound echoed throughout Taiwan. Cheers turned to screams as explosions erupted from every direction in the crowded, festive city.
The whole of Taiwan was covered in a “white mist.”
“Hmph—!”
Ms. Shuery opened her tightly closed eyes while holding her daughter Meiling but the pain she was expecting didn’t come.
What she saw was a dense white mist.
“Poison gas?”
Bombs aren’t the only method of terrorism. Biological terrorism through poison gas was also rare, but it did happen.
“Mommy, you look beautiful!”
“Meiling, don’t breathe!”
Ms. Shuery hastily covered his daughter’s and his own mouths, but then she saw that they were unable to react to the sudden gas attack around them and could only inhale.
‘I’m going to die!’
In the midst of the chaos, Mr. Shuery pushed aside his frustration and searched for a gas mask. She had heard that gas masks were available in large facilities like shopping malls.
However, it was difficult for an ordinary person who was not familiar with emergency exits or the location of gas masks to find one, and eventually the child who couldn’t find his breath inhaled.
“Kolok—!”
“Meiling! No!”
That’s it! She inhaled!
And it was the same for Mr. Shuery, who shouted to stop his daughter.
“Huh?”
It’s weird.
It doesn’t hurt.
Mr. Shuery belonged to a generation that was taught basic evacuation procedures from childhood in case of air raids and chemical warfare by mainlanders.
In the case of chemical warfare, they were taught that the moment the gas is swallowed through the airway, there is an immediate reaction. But——
‘Didn’t anyone in the mall get hurt?’
“Krrrrrrrr!”
That was it. Ms. Shuery spotted a man lying on the ground in the middle of the mall and rushed over to him.
“Hey, are you okay?”
His condition was exactly like the poison gas victim in the video. She didn’t know why he was injured like this, but she had to hurry and take him to the hospital──
“Hic—!”
Suddenly, confronted with a person in distress, Shuery stepped back in horror, for he was—not in human form, no matter how she looked at it.
His face was melting into a hideous, almost ‘demonic’ face that was too hideous to be caused by a skin rash from the poisonous gas.
“Kyaaaaak—!”
“Kyaaah!”
The devilish, haggard monster was about to pounce on Ms. Shuery but something slammed into him.
“Step back.”
“Go, thanks—?”
Ms. Shuery realized that he was the terrorist she had made eye contact with before.
Undaunted in this white haze, armed with armor and cold weapons, he shouted at the ‘demon’.
“God help us.”
And he wasn’t the only one armed. As if waiting in the wings, white-armored terrorists swarmed in from all directions.
“Crrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!”
The instantly surrounded demon had a look on his face that said, “How the hell?”
“You must be quite a high-ranked demon to still be alive after being directly hit by the holy gas.”
“However, there is no need to fear brothers and sisters. They will be extinguished in the name of God.”
“Defeat evil with death! The gods will lead our martyred comrades to paradise!”
“As the gods will it!”
“”May the gods will it—!””
Fanatics from all sides pounded the weakened demon.
Shuery had never seen anything like it.
* * * *
Terrorists attacked the banquet hall where the dignitaries were gathered.
The S-class Hunter Lan Fang was instantly subdued, and even the remaining guild members stopped moving in front of the terrorists with bomb vests.
“Eek—cowards!”
The Hunters hired as guards could only hesitate. Not only were the terrorists militant, but they were also dangerous to the dignitaries if they detonated the bomb.
There were too many heads of state gathered here to risk a hostage or two.
“What do you want?”
“What do you want——?”
The terrorist leader said, his voice still calm.
“We’ll have to tie you all up first.”
The terrorists quickly tied up the hostages, many of whom were cardinals from the Vatican, vice prime ministers and ministers from European Union countries, and hunters from famous guilds.
“Ah, those Hunters, you’ll have to wear these shackles.”
“That, that’s——.”
It was the magic seals for criminal Hunters developed by the Tower. What kind of terrorist would prepare such expensive equipment in large quantities?
“Ugh—! It’s heavy!”
“Chit— is it new?”
What they didn’t know was that it was actually a god-blessed stellar iron shackle, a worse-than-real fake that merely recreated the magic seal.
They approached Leon and Beatrice at the Temple of the Ten Thousand Gods and tried to put the shackles on them.
“Well, well— I’ll put them on.”
“I’ll, I’ll put them on.”
The terrorist half-speaks and is immediately corrected by a stern stare. For a moment, people expect Leon to do something.
After all, he didn’t tolerate disrespect for royalty, and he possessed the raw power of an S-class Hunter.
“Hmph, cowardly of them to take hostages, I guess we have no choice but to comply.”
“That’s right, everyone, don’t be cowardly and do as you’re told.”
That was it. Even TTG Temple was unable to resist because of the hostages.
Having subdued all the dignitaries, the terrorists ordered the hostages.
“Lock everyone in their rooms! Move quickly!”
“His Majesty Lionheart and Queen Spero, please cooperate.”
In what seemed like a different temperature of hostage treatment, the hostages were grouped into hotel rooms in the ballroom.
“Please enter.”
In the room where the group is sequestered, the terrorist leader removes his helmet to reveal his bare face.
“Thank you for your service, Your Majesties, and the members of the TTG Temple.”
The leader of the terrorists was Park Yong-shin, who knelt down on one knee in front of Leon and bowed his head.
“You may have ordered it, but I cannot forgive my disrespect for your Jade Body.”
“It is done. Rise.”
The four knights, including Ha-ri, were dumbfounded as they watched.
“Uhm— Your Majesty, what’s going on here?”
“I noticed it halfway through, but——.”
The four couldn’t keep up with the situation so Park Yong-shin cheerfully began to explain.
Since arriving in Taiwan, he and Yappy have been organizing nationwide terrorism with the members of the Taiwan branch of the Hanbit Palace and giving them bomb vests.
The terrorism here is nothing compared to what’s going on outside, he said.
“Po, bomb vests?”
“Well, there’s nothing to be afraid of, Sister Ha-ri. It’s a gas bomb, to be precise.”
“It’s worse than that!”
Of course, it’s not really poison gas. More accurately, it’s holy gas.
“It’s a dilution of holy water, forged by Lord Yappy and bestowed by His Majesty, though the concentration has been thinned to ensure a large quantity.”
After testing it on the captured demons, not only were the lower-ranked demons greatly weakened, but even some of the higher-ranked demons had no choice but to reveal their faces.
“Ah—, so this was to deal with the demons in Taiwan!”
“Exactly.”
By now, the whole of Taiwan must be in an uproar. There are demons here and there whose identities have been discovered.
“But it’s just a way for them to show their true colors. There’s more to them.”
“Yes, because High Demons can withstand the Holy Gas.”
Beatrice smirked and checked her pad. Hidden camera footage of each room, sent by Yappy.
“Let’s get started, then.”
Leon stood up.
It was demon hunting time, albeit a bit radical.
* * * *
Doldorad, a high-level demon of pleasure and depravity, was locked in a cabin with a group of Taiwanese dignitaries who had been taken hostage.
“Chief Huang Yanfei, do something!”
“What do you want me to do?”
“Chief, don’t you have a riot police hotline, you can call them and let them know what’s going on over here—!”
Doldorad wanted to kill this fool right then and there, but for now, he had to play the part of the chief of Taiwan’s police department. It would be a shame to reveal his identity here.
“I’ve been calling them since earlier but I think there’s jamming in the area.”
The same was true for smartphones and other non-network dependent radios.
There must be equipment around here that neutralizes military frequencies.
“Damn it, where is the Fallen Archduke?
Wiping out those terrorists wouldn’t be difficult, but then came the problem. If he acted now and took them out, he’d have to kill everyone in this place.
It was too much to ask that the work of the Fallen Archduke should be judged by him, not even by the Archdemons.
‘We have to get in touch with the outside world somehow!’
As Doldorad searched high and low for a way out, a door burst open and a familiar face appeared.
“Your Majesty?”
It was Leon, who looked around the room and then stepped right into the middle of it.
‘He didn’t realize who I am?’
Doldorad swallowed hard in fear as the most prolific demon slayer stood before him but then he grasped the bracelet on his wrist like a lifeline.
‘It can’t be! I’m wearing a magic-hiding artifact crafted by the Archdemons of Wisdom and Exploration, and not even he can see through it!’
This was why there were so many demons in Leon’s presence.
Developed and distributed by the Wisdom Goblin Archdemon, these artifacts that suppress and conceal magical energy were supplied in large quantities by the American Demon Master Reynald Sherman.
They would be consumed in real time in front of Leon, a powerful divinity, but that meant they could escape Leon’s intuition until the artifacts were destroyed!
“Let’s start with this room.”
Leon summoned a grail from subspace and focused his power into it──
-Pow!
A wave of light spread through the room and struck Doldorad.
“Kuchek!”
The holy water from the Holy Grail, the raw material for the holy gas, the undiluted and intact wave literally killed Doldorad, a high-level demon.
“Chief Huang Yanfei?!”
“No way, the chief is a demon!”
The ministers were stunned that the high-ranking official sitting next to them was a demon while Leon pointed his holy sword at the trembling Doldorad.
“Time to go, you filthy thing.”
“————.”
As the holy sword struck, Doldorad thought to himself.
‘He’s such a fucking bastard.’

chapters.title: Chapter 169: Raid on Taiwan
chapters.content:
Chapter 169: Raid on Taiwan
“The banquet hall was attacked?”
Quai looked puzzled at the news that the banquet hall where President Zhao had gone to receive state guests had been attacked by terrorists.
“That’s a big one.”
The hostages had been taken to constrain Leon’s behavior, as he had invited a large number of heads of state for the National Day celebration.
‘I can’t believe they’re taking hostages.’
The question is, would the high-ranking demons we had infiltrating the ballroom have been seen by them——
‘They’d do it because they were confident.’
Can we leave the high-ranking demons inside as castaways?
“This is a problem, but what’s more annoying is——.”
Reports from across Taiwan of gas attacks and demons being gassed and unmasked.
Whatever the means, it’s a full-blown attack of the status quo.
It would not be out of place to declare emergency martial law at this point but the Commander-in-Chief, who has the authority to do this, is being held hostage in a ballroom.
“Who are the remaining senior officials?”
“The Ministry, the Deputy President, the General Staff, and the Gendarmerie Command are on the move.”
“The Naval Land Forces, made up of fallen, can be mobilized at a moment’s notice.”
A surprise attack on civilian targets had robbed them of their players, but this was their home turf.
The military units deployed across Taiwan would soon be at their beck and call, and there were plenty of demons in their midst.
And if they’re willing to give up everything you’ve worked for, there’s nothing stopping them from making a “last resort” move.
This island, Taiwan, is a swamp that will bury the Lionheart. From the moment they entered this place in small numbers and without much power, they had fallen into a trap.
“Archduke—!”
It was then that henchmen who had been in real-time contact with the State Security Bureau, military units, and even the police station reported urgently.
“Beheader—! The Butcher has appeared!”
Beheader of the War God. There is no demon who does not know of its prestige.
The Lionheart King, the Orc High King, and the Butcher were monsters in that world that even the Archdukes could not defeat.
“How could he have missed the timing of the demon’s appearance in the city?”
But he’s alone. No matter how much transcendent power he possesses, he is still an individual.
“Mobilize all the forces we can. We have to control the situation.”
They still have a point. No matter how much they regard the entire Taiwanese government as a den of demons, the demons hiding in this country are only a few.
Even the most fanatical of them won’t be able to get away with slaughtering all the innocent soldiers and police officers.
They are, after all, a people of high-minded legality.
Is this a Lionheart stereotype? Or is it prejudice?
It’s just that this stereotype doesn’t include the Holy Knights.
“grararararara──!!”
A great violence was coming.
* * * * *
The whole of Taiwan was reeling from the gas attack and the appearance of demons.
“It doesn’t look like there’s any harm in inhaling it——.”
Despite wearing the fire suits and masks provided by the army, the white gas did not harm the public, as evidenced by the citizens walking around unharmed.
“It seems like the only ones being harmed are the demons?”
“Demons were hiding in my country——”
The city was gassed and demons appeared, while the banquet hall for state guests at Honbi Bai Mountain was occupied by terrorists.
Has there been a state of emergency of this magnitude since the founding of Taiwan?
“A militant group is engaging the demons? Who are they? What, the gas attackers?”
“Deal with the terrorists—! No, the demons first! What? Deal with the terrorists first? What do you mean?”
It was pandemonium.
The Vice President’s declaration of a state of emergency set the entire 160,000-strong Taiwanese army into motion.
Not only the Taiwanese military, but also private hunters. In effect, the full power of the island was being mobilized.
With emergency sirens blaring, key generals huddled together to take command of the situation at the Taiwanese Army General Headquarters.
“Commander, the Navy says they’ve mobilized their land forces.”
“The Northern 6th Corps has also reported that they can send vehicle units first. With Lanyang’s 51st Division joining them, I don’t think we’ll have a problem stabilizing Taipei.”
“That’s right, but what about the guilds, what happened to the Lan Fang guild leader who was guarding the banquet hall?”
Liu Wei, a senior officer (colonel) in the Taiwanese Army, looked somewhat uneasy at the appearance of the commander-in-chief, Lu Xianzhu.
He had been breaking out in a cold sweat since he received the news from the President’s secretary and was wiping it off with a handkerchief.
‘What’s wrong with him?’
The general was normally a competent man. Usually, those connected to the political upper echelons rise through the ranks on merit, not ability, but Lu Xianzhu is a case of both ability and background.
Always cool and seemingly beyond humanity, it’s unnatural to see him fidgeting.
“Huh? What is he doing here?”
Liu Wei was puzzled when he spotted “Armor” arguing with a gendarme at the entrance to the General Headquarters.
At Liu Wei’s words, the assembled generals checked the CCTV footage.
“Lord Vulcanus?”
The Holy Knight of the TTG Temple who had arrived in Taiwan less than a week ago was entering the base, ignoring the gendarmes at the entrance to the General Headquarters.
“Is he looking this way?”
On one of the cameras Vulcanus’ gaze is eerie as he makes direct eye contact with the CCTV. He fidgeted as if searching for something, then strode forward.
Creepily, it was in the direction of the General Staff.
“Uh, don’t you think he’s coming this way?”
Someone said and Chief Lu Xianzhu ordered.
“Ma, stop him! Stop him!”
Mr. Lu Xianzhu freaks out as if the executioner is coming but in the next moment, Vulcanus disappeared from the camera.
“Uh, where did he go──!”
-Quang!
The outer wall of the command center collapsed with a loud crash. After smashing the missile-proof outer wall of the military base with his torso, he dusted himself off and stepped through the opening he had created.
The words “You’re a monster” didn’t come out of Liu Wei’s mouth. However, with a desperate soldier’s spirit, he blocked Vulcanus as he strode toward him.
“Lord Vulcanus, what the hell are you doing, this is a military base!”
“I know!”
Liu Wei and the other officers in the base tried desperately to stop the behemoth, but it was no use.
“Sir, Commander, the order is—!”
Liu Wei waited for orders from the top commander of the position, Senior General Lu Xianzhu.
Since they had already raided the military base, there would be no point in shooting them, but the status of the opponent and their terrible strength made it difficult to react.
But if he gave the order, everyone here would draw their pistols and turn against him.
“——Commander?”
Liu Wei and the other soldiers looked for the commander, who didn’t answer.
And they weren’t the only ones. Most of the generals and officers in the General Headquarters were gone!
‘They ran away?!’
These bastards, so-called soldiers, ran away?
He was about to curse at the absurdity of it all when a blast of heat came from Vulcanus, his fiery gaze, rumored to be the Inferno Eye, leaking out of his armor!
“Stop!”
“I do not take orders from those weaker than me!”
“What are you talking about?”
“I don’t listen to orders from someone weaker than me!”
Liu Wei pointed his pistol at him, but Vulcanus didn’t seem to mind in the slightest; he was the only one in the room with the will to resist.
“Damn it—!”
Liu Wei’s finger trembled as he pulled the trigger.
-Bang!
-Ting!
Only a hollow sound echoed, plunging everyone into silence.
‘Damn, am I going to die?’
If Vulcanus snapped his fingers, his head would explode like a tofu.
As a soldier, he expected this since he refused to give up resistance.
“GRARARARA──!”
But what came back was a roaring laugh.
“Yes! That’s what a warrior should do, even if it’s not the wisest thing to do under the circumstances!”
Vulcanus, who had been pounding Liu Wei’s shoulder, chased after the fleeing generals without inflicting any harm on him.
“——.”
With no one thinking to stop him, another transmission came into the dumbfounded General Command.
“Reports of ‘knights’ emerging from bases all over the place!”
“The Knights of the Burning Sword!”
“Three under Laihar Dever have appeared at the Tenth Legion Command! They have also appeared at the Air Specialties Command. Sir Galatan, leading four knights, raiding the Special Forces Command!”
“43rd Artillery Command neutralized! The Knights of the TTG Temple have appeared with the Man-At-Arms!”
That was it. The lights in the command center went out, along with all the other devices.
“What, the power’s out?”
“Why aren’t you running the auxiliary generators?”
“No comms! Jamming, strong jamming!”
The base was neutralized in an instant.
“Cyber warfare?”
The Taiwanese Commander-in-Chief–the country’s leading semiconductor industry–had its cyber warfare support units crippled?
The gas attack coincided with the hostage-taking of state dignitaries. Highly sophisticated hacking and raids across the country at that time.
Liu Wei assumed the worst.
“—against us——.”
All-out war.
* * * *
“Damn it, damn it, damn it!”
Liu Xianzhu, Balbazar, the High Demon of Pleasure and Decadence ran desperately through the corridors of the base.
‘He’s noticed me! How the hell?!’
Balbazar realized that Vulcanus had pinpointed him.
He didn’t know what he did, but he must have gotten information about him!
-grararararara──!
His doomed laughter rings out, and with every step he takes, he can almost hear the bell of his doom ringing.
“Damn it!”
He no longer kept his disguise on. I, revealing the hideous pleasure demon Balbazar.
“Ugh, ugh!”
“Ah, a demon?!”
The officers and soldiers at the base were stunned, but he didn’t care. This was the end of the matter. He must create an opening for himself to escape.
“Wake up—!”
At that moment, a certain officer he encountered blurted out something.
He was a member of the Pleasure Cult, a secret society within the Taiwanese military.
He was a member of a secret social organization within the Taiwanese army enslaved by the demons of pleasure and depravity, reveling in the endless pleasures they offered.
And there were more such degenerates.
“Oh, no.”
“Oh, Lord Balbazar, what have you done—!”
The human flesh melted away, revealing their hideous forms. They rejoiced that they had escaped mortality and gained immortality, but panicked when their true identities were revealed at this time.
“Stop him! Buy me a second!”
At the High Demon’s command, the Fallen rushed against their will toward the fiery knight across the hall.
One second for each of them. If I could stop him in his tracks, even for a moment-─
“Ah——.”
It was an ignorant thought.
Not even the magic of the Archduke of Glacier could stop that knight’s footsteps, let alone a bunch of fallen who had just become demons.
-Kaaaaaah!!!
With a terrible heat, the Fallen are devoured, they could not last a moment before his boundless fury.
“Aaah——.”
Here he comes.
Here comes the apostle of the War God.
The Lionheart’s right-hand man, a man who had survived the Lionheart King thirteen times.
His very existence is proof of his strength.
Vulcanus, a terror of the ages who tore through countless demons with no last name, no title, only the force of his two arms.
“No one can stop Death.”
He is Death.
* * * *
“The bait is gone.”
“It’s Quai’s fault. He must have known the information had already been compromised by the time Zhao was toyed with by the Queen.”
“A small price to pay, I suppose.”
At the entrance to the site of the hostage crisis, three elderly men stood looking out over the quarantined hotel.
“Do you think they’ll succeed?”
“I don’t know. He’s the Lionheart King.”
“But he’s still a human. It’s not impossible if he shows a little bit of vulnerability.”
Since the fall of Lord Dothraddon, the Lord of Pleasure, the demons of pleasure and corruption have been led by the current Archduke of Pleasure, Quai.
He could have succeeded to the throne, but he refused, saying he had better things to do.
That’s basically how he is, unchecked by the Lord.
“Ever since that war, we have been in decline.”
“If the Hundred Years’ Great Line failed, we must make progress here.”
“The last thing we need is to lose to ‘them’.”
The demons clad in the old man’s skin reveal themselves, their transformation different from that of the other demons.
Unlike other demons, whose hides are limited only by the total amount of flesh they possess, their hides are made from magic.
In an instant, they revealed their true form, each one a giant monster over several meters tall.
<Declaration of Territory – Temple of Pleasure>
[Prepare for them. Isolate this place from them.]
<Territory Declaration – Temple of Corruption>
[Come, my legions, it is time to work.]
<Summon Demon Gate>
In the center of Taipei City a giant gate has been created in the space where the parade used to be.
Countless demons poured out of it. It was a legion of powerful demons, with the most notable Old Archdemons, that began to fill the city.
-The discovery of the Asteroid Threat.
A stealthy strategic satellite observing Taiwan from geostationary orbit has revealed itself.
A large number of S-class enemies. A “legion-sized” demonic horde emerged, with certain individuals believed to be SS-class or higher.
The Yakt Spinner armed platform of the TTG Temple Strategic Space Force Satellite was sending real-time observations and Yappy noted the enemy’s increase.
-We need to scramble.
They’ll be exposing their power, but he had no choice. Leon has given him permission to do this, so his only concern should be the eradication of the enemy force.
-TTG Temple. Rally.
It was time to show the world the power of the TTG Temple.

chapters.title: Chapter 170: Rally the Troops
chapters.content:
Chapter 170: Rally the Troops
For a long time, Taiwan has been under threat from the mainland.
Under the banner of a united China, the island was constantly threatened with invasion, so it fortified the entire island, built an army, and maintained tensions.
But China was broken.
Not broken, but shattered.
As they watched the Chinese continent torn into 53 pieces, some of them lamented the horrors of dying by the hundreds of millions but Taiwan celebrated.
-Good!
There are economic issues, export markets, and refugees, but the country has been saved from the brink.
I don’t think it’s necessarily inhumane for the whole country to pop champagne and celebrate.
-The mainland failed because it was too big. Look at the rest of the world. Even the most advanced nations can’t defend their large territories.
-Unless you’re going to have a hunter air force like the U.S., it’s better to have a smaller land mass.
-Let’s just defend our own land and leave the restoration of the mainland for later.
In practice, the smaller the land area, the faster the response to the gate, and the less likely it is that the gate will go undiscovered and be left to dungeon break, let alone the number of Hunter Awakenings relative to the population.
The only problem was food self-sufficiency, which was solved by the economic cooperation of the fragmented mainland tributary states.
After all, Taiwan’s national strategy in the second millennium was to fortify the entire country.
Watching out for the Dragon Palace Gate and quickly dispatching a raiding force to capture it if it occurs within the narrow territory.
With only a few thousand state-owned hunters, most of the gate problems were solved, and in the 30 years since the Cataclysm, Taiwan’s gate defense rate has been over 98%.
In fact, it was the best defense rate in the world and was the envy of mainlanders as a safe land.
But then——
“What do you mean, the Sixth Army was annihilated?”
“Demons? Demons, a demon gate in the middle of the capital?”
Terrorism, the appearance of demons, the attack on the Taiwanese army by the Temple Ten Thousand Gods, the blocking of communications and the appearance of the Demon Gate.
Thanks to air strikes from the mainland and a Morse code communication network prepared for cyber-terrorist warfare, the main force had heard of the tragedy, but——
“What, what’s going on?”
Everything is a mess.
The gas attacks across the island are enough to warrant martial law, but demons are popping up everywhere, and the TTG Temple has raided military units.
Demon gates have even been set up in the middle of Taipei for some reason.
With the General Command neutralized, there wasn’t much they could do. In the midst of everyone’s panic, the communications were unblocked and a mechanical sound began to be heard.
-Yakt Spinner, Holy Knight of the Iron and Blacksmiths of TTG Temple.
The one-way communication brought shocking news.
The corruption of Taiwan’s highest echelons and the appearance of demons throughout the city along with the images of their slaughter forced a choice.
-Foe or ally, make your choice.
It was a choice that could only be made in this moment, with the corrupted upper echelons removed to enforce obedience, communications cut off, and judgment left to them alone.
The isolated troops had to judge with the information they had.
“We are now entering Taipei!”
“Brigadier General!”
Sending troops into the capital without permission from the General Headquarters was a matter of treason if done wrong but the brigade commander wasn’t ordering the march because Yappy forced him to.
Subjective judgment is not a virtue for a soldier, but he had seen the TTG Temple’s actions over the years.
“Whatever the legitimacy of those demon-haters, the fact remains that the demons are their enemy.”
Demons are the common enemy of mankind. That much is too clear. So why not——
“Only TTG Temple can deal with demons and without their power, there is no way to close the Demon Gate in Taipei.”
The proof is in the puddle, as the Great Demons swarm like bees in a hive.
The brigadier was convinced he was right.
* * * *
Off the coast of the Taiwan Strait.
There was a time when both sides had deployed fleets and naval bases in the face of mainland threats and invasions.
After the collapse and partition of the mainland, these had become obsolete, but warships still kept watch over the waters on sentry duty, and so it was even now.
The ‘ship’ was quietly slicing through the water, especially as sonar was actively searching for submarines.
-Boom!
(The order to scramble was given.)
-BEEP!
(Exiting submerged mode. Rising. Be careful not to be seen by the surrounding fleet.)
-BEEP!
(Their barbaric sonar systems will not be able to detect our stealthy submarine capabilities!)
The world’s most advanced nuclear-powered submarine, measuring a whopping two kilometers in length, slipped into the Tamsui River leading to the city of Taipei.
The Dominator-class submarine, a maritime armament platform built for TTG Temple global military operations and one of the decisive weapons created to defend the undersea city from the Demon Legion in the world of Yappy.
In its original form, it could single-handedly defeat the most powerful navy on Earth, the United States Navy.
That is, of course, when the Dominator is equipped with the Mobius-class plasma ballistic missiles or the GK8 Gauss cannon.
Earth’s materials technology would have made such a thing impossible to manufacture, and the demons would have been fiercely resistant to such advanced weaponry.
Instead, this Dominator-class submarine had something even more terrifying aboard.
-Kiruruk!
(This is commanded by my captain, Rudolph Cygraiman Pardo Nilpas!)
-Gurgle, gurgle, gurgle, gurgle, gurgle, gurgle!
(First Assault Landing Team, Second Assault Landing Team, and Third Amphibious Support Squadron!)
-Crackle──!
(1st Assault Landing Battalion, Graemeon Andrew Maxiphers Clygent!)
-Kiruuk──!
(2nd Assault Landing Team Afkirah Naras Rosewide Freymion departs!)
The Kikiruks were descendants of proud resisters.
After crossing over to Earth from the Eastern Dragon Palace Gate, they seemed to have adapted to life on Earth, conducting only small-scale land operations but their true calling is naval warfare.
A naturally maritime race, they were blessed by Poma, the God of the Sea and Waves, and had the technical support of Yappy.
They’ve trained to be thoroughly armed, and now the time has come for an all-out war.
Hundreds of small, 500-ton submersibles emerged in unison, followed by a landing support aircraft battalion rising from the sea.
The targets were armored vehicles of the Taiwanese Navy’s Army Ground Force, en route to Taipei City under the direction of the Fallen Archduke Quai.
It was confirmed by President Zhao that all of them were demonic followers raised by demons.
-Boom! Fire support from outer space.
Yappy, who had a perfect view of the entire Taiwanese territory, began attacking the land forces with charged particle artillery. The first to be exposed to the attack from space was the Army’s commander, Hsieh Ak-mada.
-This, this—!
Yappy wondered if the High Demons could withstand a charged particle cannon.
Dozens were blown away in the raid, but a few demons dismounted and used magic to block the attack from space.
And the moment they were distracted by space──
-Kiruuuuuuuk!
(We will open fire on the demons disguised as naval landing craft at the enemy landing zone!)
The first to arrive was the Landing Support Air Squadron. They flew through the sky in their jet engine booster suits, firing rocket cannons at the Naval Landing Force.
-Kiruuuuk!
(The gods will it!)
Hundreds of guided rockets rained down from the armored suits of the Kikiruks.
The army was on the move with tanks and armored vehicles, but they lost most of their armor to the hail of rockets.
“Shit, fire, fire, fire!”
The armored vehicles and infantry that had survived the initial assault poured fire on the targets in the sky. But——.
-Gods!
(Gods protect us!)
A protective holy law that nullified ranged weapons was used and the warriors who used it were knight-errant Kikiruk warriors who had even been sworn in by Leon.
“A strange force has landed by the river, how many are there!”
While the airborne battalion was mowing down the landing party, another landing party washed ashore.
But unlike the other landings, they didn’t get out of the submersibles, because the submersibles made a change on the spot.
-Clunk, clunk, clunk!
Like in a famous Hollywood robot movie, the landed submersibles transformed. Finally, they were equipped with wheeled wheels, making them excellent high-speed vehicles.
-Chirp!
-Chirp!
Hundreds of armored troops sprang up in an instant. The Kikiruks aimed their cannons through the open ceiling.
-Kiruk! (Fire!)
Thousands of shells flew through the air.
The naval landing force quickly crumbled before the massive firepower of the landing force.
But it wasn’t just the Naval Landing Force that was headed to support the Archdemons of Taipei City.
The number of fallen troops had been taken over by the demons and were gradually encroaching on the Taiwanese army was more than one could imagine.
-Bam!
(More enemy troops, even air force!)
Additional ground troops and a Taiwanese attack helicopter unit. The armored and aviation units, the mainstays of the war, were well under control.
-Kiruk (Can you support the ship?)
The landing party commander calls for backup. It was received by a minimalist mechanical robot watching their battlefield.
-Yes.
At the same time, Yappy, who had been hacking into Taiwan’s communications network, drawing in Taiwanese troops and Hunters untainted by the demons to provide combat support and direction across the country, activated a stealthy strategic satellite in space.
-Thump! Thump! Thump!
They shot out of space and entered the atmosphere with their heat-treated armor.
Despite the blistering heat, the descent equipment didn’t burn at all. The special alloy made of stellar iron had successfully protected the equipment inside and dropped dozens of objects as it separated.
At this moment, a radar station observing the skies above Taiwan saw something so large that it could have been mistaken for a small asteroid.
“What is that?”
“A star?”
“Not another Meteor!”
It’s no secret that the Lionheart King of the TTG Temple can call upon the stars. It’s no wonder he’s having a seizure, since they’re the kind of crazies who don’t mind dropping comets that could destroy the Earth.
“Huh?”
“Crack?”
Like an asteroid splitting as it burns its way into the atmosphere, they slowly dispersed, then fired up their own propulsion boosters and rushed toward a point.
There was no drop sequence, no slowing down for landing. It’s not like they’d be damaged by a mere ‘atmospheric descent’.
-Bang! Bam! Boom!
They shattered the highway leading to Taipei City with their sheer destructive force. But there’s more.
-Combined Third Battle Weapon for Yakt Spinner.
Clinging to the Yakt Spinner like a magnet, it looked like a cockpit, and one by one, the pieces of equipment began to join together.
At first they were about the size of a container, but soon they began to transform into something massive.
The Yakt Spinners, or more precisely, a hundred Yakt Spinner bodies that had been protecting the city for a thousand years, had merged into a massive battlecruiser——.
-The Marquis class of Main Battle Program land combat vehicles is now operational.
Massive weapons are pointed at the Fallen.
The Fallen lost their footing in the face of the massive weaponry, but the artificially intelligent muzzle didn’t take that into account.
-No one can stop me.
After completing their respective missions, the troops gathered in one place and the rallying point goes without saying.
Taipei City, the realm of malevolence where the three Old Archdemons and the Demon Legion gathered.
The Demon Legion and the Knights face off in the center of the battlefield as they begin to gather one by one.
[Hail, our nemesis]
[This is our territory. Our fortress.]
[This is the first battle in two hundred years]
Archdemons and the legions of evil they’ve summoned, plus the corrupted Taiwanese army.
“Grrr—! Evil servants— damned evil servants marching in front of me!”
“It’s terrible, it’s the end of the world, how dare those scum—!”
“I, Laihar Dever, will slaughter them before this night is over!”
The Knights of the Blazing Flame and the Kikiruks landing force rallying behind them along with the Taiwanese soldiers who had risked treason to enter the city.
“GRARARARARA──!!”
Vulcanus, who arrived like a blazing meteor from somewhere, and──
-Bam!
The Yakt Spinner watching the city aboard the Marquis class of a giant battlecruiser.
With the exception of the Lionheart King, the Magician Queen, and the Demon Archduke, the strongest forces on the island are gathered together.
“Burn them until their souls are consumed.”
[Stop them. This is a bridgehead for the invasion of Earth. We can’t afford to be left behind]
On a small island in modern Earth in the 21st century the most unlikely of battlefields is materializing.
“Forward with swords and spears. The knights lead the way.”
[Form up, enchant, and prepare for the knights’ shock]
Sword and spear, holy law and magic. Old-fashioned cold weapons and non-existent holy and magical powers.
“Rage! Rage without end! For the glory of Lionheart!”
[Damned knights, the ghosts of the dead still haunt us!]
In your hatred and rage against each other.
Kill the enemy.

chapters.title: Chapter 171: The Fallen Archduke Quai
chapters.content:
Chapter 171: The Fallen Archduke Quai
Apart from the duel going on outside, the ballroom with Leon and Beatrice was relatively quiet.
“Oh, no!”
“Yes!”
Compared to people like Beatrice and Vulcanus, the knights of the First Order of the TTG Temple were objectively powerful.
“Stand, Holy Grail—!”
The Thunderbolt Spear from the Holy Knight of Sky and Thunder and the Absolute Barrier from the Holy Knight of Light and Justice.
